Reviews.Title: “Heavenly”
Reviews.Author: stef9371
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful experience at the Marriott Ko'Olina. The service was spot on and our room was beautiful. So clean. We had such a view. Seventh floor overlooking the pools, the mountains and the ocean. You can't beat that! This hotel is away from the crowds and bustle of Waikikimwhich was perfect for us. We went snorkeling in one of the lagoons and saw three turtles. The market was reasonably priced too. It will be tough to top this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: Donna S
Reviews.Content: This is our family staycation of choice. We have been there about 5 times already staying 2 nites each. We take in our food and cook and eat in the room. There are outdoor grills for guest use. The kids love the lagoon where the sand is clean and the water is clear. Then we move to the pool where there is a slide and multiple areas to swim and relax in the jacuzzis. After two visits, we decided to be owners and can't wait to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Lance A
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently stayed here as part of an extended visit to Hawaii. My wife and I stayed at the adjacent JW Marriott previously, which made me familiar with the area. Ko Olina is a great spot on Oahu. 20 miles or so from extremely crowded Honolulu/Waikiki Beach. This property feels isolated in a good way. Far less crowds, plenty of space, etc. It sits on one of several identical lagoons. These lagoons offer ideal swimming, even for young kids, protected from the surf. You can snorkel, etc. without worry about currents or other boats. The hotel itself has several large pools and a number of hot tubs. They are cleverly designed to look natural, with rock "grottos" and other landscaping features. The rooms are perfect for a family. We stayed in a two bedroom suite. The bedrooms are separated by a large living area and full kitchen. The kitchen was handy for afternoon snacks and breakfast. Overall, the property is kept in excellent condition. Very clean rooms and public spaces, with the usual Hawaiian hospitatlity. We enjoyed it so much that we may return and stay there for our entire trip. Easy access to other areas of the island.

Reviews.Title: “Ko Olina Experience Alright!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: timeshare2012
Reviews.Content: This is an old hotel and we were very disappointed. Unless you are a regular guest or a Marriott vacation owner, you better think twice! If you are a time share exchange owner, I suggest that you go elsewhere or you will be treated like a second class citizen! We were transferred 3 times within 2 days...the first room smelled like fish and when we opened the balcony door to let some air in, there was nothing but loud screams because we were located on the floor right smack by the lagoon. We asked for another room and they transferred us to another room which smelled like a musty old person and the location was where everybody meets to go somewhere, to socialize or just to play some type of ball game. On top of that, we had to request for an iron and a change of ironing board because the one we had had stains all over it and it was disgusting. The next day, they finally decided to transfer us at a higher level (thanks to John) away from all the noise and disgusting smells! We thought this was the end of our vacation from hell but no!!!! We had a rental car that was parked in front of our hotel and guess what happened? For some reason, our tires were flat - such a co-incidence! Private parking with an attendant 24-7 and we were parked right by the parking attendant!!!!! Hmmmm! We were supposed to have went back to Hawaii for our anniversary and just for nostalgic reason and what happened? We had a vacation from hell instead!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: NP27
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is perfect: the rooms, the property, the staff and the location. The only drawback is that it has spoiled my family and I - very few hotels can match it. Yes it is pricy but you get what you pay for. I did find that the Internet connection is sporatic but that forced me to forget about work and enjoy Oahu.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pools, Super Clean, Great Service. Only one bad.”
Reviews.Author: Itsmehollyd
Reviews.Content: While researching places to stay I ran across a number to call to get a room here at a discount. It required us to listen to a 90 min time share presentation, but 998 for 5 days here was very cheap, so we couldn't pass it up. First the Bad... Double check what the room type is before you pay. I was sold on a 2 bedroom description, but when I arrived, I was in a one bed room with one less bed. I was told the roll away was included, but when I checked in they said it would be 20 a night. When I requested another roll away (since the room only had 2 beds) they said they would accommodate us, after the women went into a long speech of how dangerous it was and how would I feel if my family was caught in an accident and the roll away kept them from escaping. Seriously I am not making this up. I told her maybe I shouldn't stay here if it was so dangerous. She said nothing has happened in all the time she has worked her. SO....why go into the "your family will die in a blazing inferno if I let you use this roll away" speech? They charged me ANOTHER 20 a night, so a total of 200 extra and I still didn't have the room I paid for. BUT the GOOD out weighted this because everyone else was amazingly nice. The resort was beautiful. The pools (there are a bunch, I think 4, including waterfalls and a water slide). are amazing. TIP: BUY YOUR OWN FOOD AND COOK IT. The restaurants are not worth it. Pricey and not good food. ALSO if you are Vegan, there is a Down to Earth Store 2 exits down that has amazing organic vegan food. There is also a target that has a HUGE food section. Lagoons are amazing, tons of things going on. Wife and I had a massage while we were there and it was great. Most relaxing part of our vacation was here. Next time we come, we won't go anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, fun and super relaxing”
Reviews.Author: MsWobbi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are currently staying here for a week. We traded our time share in Maui to stay here. First off know that we are at least a 45 minutes ( with no traffic) from Honolulu and Waikiki. That is best case scenario for driving. Usually you should allow at least an hour to get into Honolulu. The Ko Olina area is away from all the chaos and touristy places. There is a free shuttle that will take you to the golf club, Disney Aulani Hotel and the JW Marriott Hotel. There is an ABC store, ice cream parlour and taco restaurant right here too. Having said all that, we love it. The studio that we are in is very comfortable. The bed is a really wonderful. I don't always acclimate to new beds, this one was just a dream away :-) There is a small refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker and everything else needed for our comfort and convenience. The staff here, and I mean every person we have come in contact with here has been amazing. I love the Aloha given to us here in Hawaii. There is a very nice walkway along the beach that connects all the hotels and the 4 swim lagoons. We ate two meals at Long boards, one of the onsite restaurants. Both times the food was very tasty. I will say that their happy hour prices are nothng to write home abou I don't consider $8.75 for a Mai Tai a "happy hour" price. Although that is a $3 discount! All in all we are having a great time. Don't forget to stop in at the Aloha Stadium Swap Meet. Sat./Sun. and Wed. The vendors are completely around the entire stadium! I think that and snorkeling on the North Shore at Sharks Cove have been my favorite things to do.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: jkellyphotography
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Ko'Olina was better than expected. We aquired our two bedroom suite through a timeshare broker (I never could have afforded the nightly rates through the resort) and were thrilled to see our ocean view when we first walked into the room. As we walked through, there were ohs and ahs from my kids as they ran around claiming beds. The rooms were very comfortable in size and the two bedroom easily could have slept eight with the two king beds and two queen sofa sleepers. The full size kitchen was great and they even had a BBQ area outside near the lagoon. My three kids had a great time hanging out at the pool with their new found friends and I felt very safe letting them explore (they're 15, 13 and 12) without us by their sides. First thing when we arrived was to get a drink and food at the little bar in the pool area. Drinks were good. Food was expensive, but only okay. Not what I expected, however I forgot all about it as I watched the sun set over the lagoon. It took us a little while to figure out the food situation. A family of five is expensive and I was fully going to take advantage of the kitchen. I would avoid the market at the resort if you'd like to conserve your budget. Instead, there's a small little market in the shopping center across the street from the Disney tower...their items were very reasonable given that it's Hawaii. Of course we also hit Costco and Safeway during our stay, which were only a few miles away. We opted to go to the timeshare presentation in exchange for one of their free rewards. I was actually curious how everything worked. What I expected to be a presentation was more of a one on one with a sales person, which turned out to be long and tedious. The presentation wasn't a requirement, but we thought we'd give it a shot. I loved the location of this resort. It was easy to explore the island without having to sit in the traffic I've experienced during previous stays in Waikiki. The weather was always beautiful in this area even when it was raining elsewhere, although I'm sure that may not always be so. All in all, we had a wonderful time and I'm very satified with our accomodations. I would stay here again, especially if I were to bring children.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic trip to Hawaii!”
Reviews.Author: Balt0Traveler
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a fantastic stay at Marriott’s Ko Olina Beach Club. We stayed 7 nights in a 2BR condo in Hale Naia, the most southern building which is the closest to the beach and the “big kids” pool (waterfalls, caves). I believe it’s also the newest building since it’s number “3”. We then went to Kailua for the weekend and returned for 2 nights to a 1Br unit in Hale Moana, the most northern building which is building number “2”. That is closest to the “little kids” pool with the beach entry. It is the farthest from the beach unless you leave Marriott’s property through the gate and walk through the public parking lot to the lagoon. In Hale Naia, we were on the 15th floor in the closest unit to the ocean. The unit and view were fantastic. We are not Marriott timeshare owners, but rented this unit from an owner on redweek.com. In Hale Moana we were on the 2nd floor that walked out to ground level about 50 yards from the pool. We did not have a view. We booked this room through Marriott directly. The units were comparable with Naia having nicer, newer stainless appliances and nice GE HE washer/dryer. Moana had a small room/office area next to the master bedroom that I really liked because I was able to set-up the pack n play in there. Ko Olina has 4 lagoons. All of them are open to the public. Starting from the north and working south is Lagoon 1, which is shared by the Mariott Ihilani and the new Disney Aulani. Lagoon 2 is used by the Ko Olina Beach Villas. Lagoon 3 is used by the Marriott Beach Club. Lagoon 4 has no resorts on it, is by the Marina, and has the largest public parking lot. It seems to get a lot of action on the weekends. Ihilani and the Beach Villas seem more geared toward adults while Aulani and the Beach Club cater to families. I did go and check out Aulani to see how it compares to the Beach Club. It seems very nice, but the grounds were not as large as the Beach Club’s (which are not unmanageable at all). They had lifeguards, a lazy river and a big pirate-ship themed spray park. They also have a snorkel tank with lots of fish and lots of people. The overall quality seemed comparable to the Beach Club. I certainly wouldn’t spend a lot more money to stay there, but if they were comparably priced (which they currently are not) I would definitely consider it. We went grocery shopping at the Safeway about 10 minutes away and mostly ate in our unit. We also used the grills outside. We did regularly go and get breakfast (donuts, muffins, etc, until they run out around 9am) at the Marketplace. We ate dinner at Longboards twice. The tuna melt is phenomenal. We ate at Roy’s once, it is extremely expensive. We also considered eating at the local Mexican restaurant across the street from Aulani, but heard from other travelers that it was terrible. The only other non-resort restaurant option is a Hawaiian place by the Mexican place, but we didn’t have a chance to try it. I heard you could get good ready-made meals at the ABC store behind the Mexican place to take back to your unit. Overall our trip to the Beach Club was fantastic and I would not hesitate to return. Service was excellent and the resort was beautiful. If I had to be picky, these are the changes I would make: enforce the no-kids pool (1 out of the 3) and hot tubs (2 or 3). Although I have kids, I can appreciate some adults would like to get away. I think it’s great they have the “quiet” pool and the adult-only hot tubs, but the rules are not enforced. Also, add some picnic tables by the grills so people can eat outside. Finally, an airport shuttle would be fantastic since parking at $30/day is outrageous and a taxi runs $80. Finally, understand that Ko Olina is the dry side of the island. It’s not the lush “Jurassic park” Hawaii that you see in the movies. If that’s what you want, take a trip to the east side of the island. Kailua is amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay, Beautiful Resort.”
Reviews.Author: sportsfan2494
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Ko'Olina, and our first trip to the Beach Club. We stayed here as a trial run to determine whether or not to buy into the Marriott Vacation Club, which we ultimately chose to do. The room we had was a standard ocean-view studio, which was spacious and well appointed. The resort itself has several large pools, and is situated on a small man-made lagoon. We had occasion to use the concierge to book a few outings, they were VERY helpful. The restaurants on site are overpriced with average food, but this is not exclusive to this resort. All in all we had a great stay, and we can't wait to return next year as owners!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful timeshare resort”
Reviews.Author: mv68
Reviews.Content: We are a family of three , 2 adults and 10 yo . We stayed at Marriott Ko Olina in a studio unit which we obtained through an exchange on Interval International.We stayed in a Hale Kona building which is the main building, on the 12th floor with a partial ocean view and a view of the nearby marina. When we first arrived we were taken away by the beautiful open reception area and the view of the ocean. THE PROPERTY : Immaculate, beautiful landscaping, felt like I was in a a botanical garden.Three pools. We enjoyed the Reflection pool at our building, it was not crowded at all, the beach was just steps away.The other two pools more croweded, one has a slide, the other has like a sandy zero entrance an a volleyball net.The path that runs along the resort is great for early morning walks or jogging. Main building has a Market place with small food items, coffee, souvenirs. THE ROOM: Though nothing impressive and a little dim due to the outside division between the 1 Br and lock off, it was enough for us. As I mentioned it had a nice view; we had a microwave, small fridge / coffee maker, and with Costco and Target 10 min away, we did not have to worry about breakfast. Laundy facilities on the 10 th floor in our buliding/ self parking was free . THE RESTAURANTS: We tried Longboards for dinner one night and it was OK. We ate at nearby Roy's twice, great food, try their fishes. There are not many restaurants in the area, so selection is somewhat limited compared with Waikiki, but is a great place for families. THE BEACH: man made, feels like a large pool with salt water, no shade on the beach, but great for swimming and snorkeling, especially early in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Family friendly hotel w/ laundry and nice pools”
Reviews.Author: penguinorama1
Reviews.Content: If you are traveling with small kids, having laundry in your room, or even on the floor means at least 25% less packing & luggage. And having a lot of kid friendly pools on the property with lagunas within 5 min walk from the property means snorkeling & beach fun without the hassle of driving, parking, finding places to eat, bathroom, kids nap time that accompanies driving to a beach from the hotel. Our family of 4 (2 kids 5 & 7 yrs old) have been to this property 2wice in the last 2 years, and have loved each time. We've been to every other island in Hawaii, and we came back here twice because of this property. The first time we were on a top floor one bedroom suite with great ocean views. The second time it was in a small studio with garden views. We had a great time on both. The staff put on family games like bingo & hula hoop contests which little kids love, and its overall a very low key family friendly resort. The drive from Waikiki is fine if you avoid the rush hour - and a trip to North Shore, or even the Polynesian cultural center on the other side of the island is not a problem if you plan your day wisely. We sat thru the marketing pitch for the timeshare, which was totally no pressure. We like the Aulani as well, so you can see my review there.

Reviews.Title: “Love Western Oahu”
Reviews.Author: gksandiego
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were in need of a relaxing vacation. In need of escape of the hustle and bustle of work, choosing the much quieter and less touristy western side of Oahu with the amenities of a Marriott was a great choice. We spent the majority of our vacation on the west side (Although we did venture to the north shore for Matsumoto's Shave Ice a few times !) The lagoons, coastal walking/jogging path, the convenience of kitchenette, mini fridge and microwave were some of the highlights. Full kitchen/ living room in larger units available. The staff were excellent, especially those assisting with cabana rentals. Friendly, attentive but not intrusive. There are many great restaurants on the various Ko Olina resorts, Marketplace on site had a little of everything, ABC store a few minutes away had small deli, frozen section, small produce area, hot "bento box" options and souvenirs. 2 miles down the road were Cost Co, Target, Safeway and other eating places so Ko Olina is a great get a way area, but still close to conveniences. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but other good options in Ko'Olina.”
Reviews.Author: Adam M
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at all three resorts in Ko'Olina so wanted to share my perspective. Here is what I think: if you are a family with young children and money is less of a concern (i.e. you are willing to pay for quality/experience), I would stay at the Aulani Resort. If you are on Oahu on business and need convenience from a business perspective, I would stay at the Ihilani. If you want lots of pools, lower prices and don't mind crowds, then stay at this property. Personally, I liked Aulani best for family vacations and Ihilani for business. This property offers nice grounds and larger units if necessary (it is a timeshare property), and is on one of Ko'Olina's less crowded, beautiful lagoons. It is also within a short walk of an even less crowded lagoon, and a Roy's restaurant. Specific complaints I have about the property are that the AC in my unit appeared to have some sort of motion sensor attached to it (i.e. turned off in the middle of the night, even though I set it to stay on) and the fact that the valets at the front lobby didn't suggest that I wait to unpack my car before checking in. I took everything out, stood around waiting for someone to attend to me, asked if they had valet parking, then they took my car. When I checked in, they told me I needed to take my car to a completely different valet area, so I had to put everything back, etc. The main breakfast location at the resort was also buffet only (no ala carte), which I only learned after being seated. Overall, I "liked" this property but I didn't "love" it.

Reviews.Title: “Deceptive Room Categories, Pool Water Bacteria and Caution to Non-Owners”
Reviews.Author: kcalcan
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a stay at the Marriot Ko Olina Beach Club in mid-August 2012. We had three major concerns with this property: 1) The room categories are highly deceptive – our ‘ocean view’ had NO ocean in sight; 2) If you are not an ‘owner’ you will get ‘bumped’ by owners on everything – I strongly caution against renting here; and 3) Our children got very sick following a full day playing alone in the pool. ROOM CATEGORIES – we booked our Ocean View room via the Marriot’s central reservation telephone call center. We received several emails between booking and staying that confirmed our Ocean View 1 bedroom. At check in we were ushered to Room 20230 – on the 2nd floor, which is GROUND LEVEL, in the furthest tower back from the ocean (I think it was called the Hale Moana tower). We opened the curtains and saw our view of the barbecue area, as well as the fitness center. There was literally not a speck of ocean to be seen, and we tried. The bellman was there, and told us that in the many years he’d been working there, he’d seen many ‘questionable room categories’. So he dialed a supervisor for us, and handed me the phone. The woman explained that this IS an ocean view room. When I asked WHY it’s an ocean view category she said that it USED to have an ocean view before the fitness center and BBQ areas were built. Huh? I was given a 'view categories' leaflet (which I can't attach because of copyright concerns). On it, every room that even remotely faces the water – even those on bottom floors, on the sides and directly behind other buildings where you would never get more than a little slice of ocean in your view - are categorized as Ocean View. There is no way any room below the 5th floor would be able to see any ocean over the buildings and trees. This practice of calling an ocean view room with no ocean view is unethical, and there is no excuse for it. It needs to be changed. Management needs to go into each room and LOOK and if they cannot see a full ocean view, change the category. Until then, I strongly encourage you call and ask for a 'View Category' brochure and ask exactly where you are located. To make up for the lack of ocean view, they reduced our rate from $441 to $400 – which they said is a ‘garden view’, even though there is no such view on the View Categories brochure. I suspect this rate exists solely for those who complain that their Ocean View room is missing the ocean. Sorry – 10% off is not enough. If we had any idea we wouldn’t have an ocean view, we wouldn’t have stayed here. CAUTION TO NON-OWNERS – When we called to complain about our view, we were also informed that because this is a Vacation Club property, we should have known we would get ‘bumped’ by owners who were literally placed above us. And they were ‘at capacity’, so even if we moved rooms the next day the best we’d get would be a Marina View (which is very ugly – this marina is not picturesque). The woman on the phone said we should have known this would happen because the confirmation emails said it was a Marriot Vacation Club. (Hmmm… they also said Ocean View room). You want to park in that lot right beside your building? Oh, sorry. That tower is for owners, but you are not an owner, so you have to park in the next building over. You were told you would get a roll away bed? Sorry, you’re not an owner so that will cost $20 a night. Bottom line – if you are not an owner or are not renting directly from an owner, if it’s even a bit busy, you’re probably going to get screwed. POOL BACTERIA – As this is a ‘vacation ownership property’, the amenities are spartan. There are no lifeguards, lousy towels, flat pillows, etc. No-one seems to be monitoring the pool water for chemicals and bacteria, even though there are hundreds of kids and toddlers in diapers. We spent one full day at the property ocean side and poolside, with our kids in the pool. The kids used their underwater camera to take pictures of each other. In the pictures the kids are smiling with their mouths open. The next morning both kids woke up with a violent stomach illness. It passed in a few hours, but was very unpleasant. And because we had to check out that day at 10:00, our only option was to have the kids lie down in their little lounge on the third floor. When I brought this issue to the attention of the male ‘manager’ at the front desk, he didn’t seem surprised or alarmed. I insisted they check the pool bacteria levels so other guests would not get sick. He nodded and said he’d bring this and the room category issue (which also did not seem to surprise him – he’s the one who gave me the View Category leaflet and said this is the way it is) to the attention of senior management. He didn’t write anything down, didn’t offer to help or to compensate (a later check out or a room where the kids could rest 'til they felt better would have been appreciated, for example), and I seriously doubt that anything will be escalated. I would have expected an immediate call to someone in Recreation to have the water tested, but I’m pretty sure that didn’t happen. If you stay here, PLEASE caution your children (and adults) to be very careful not to drink any pool water, and to be careful to keep their mouths closed in the pool. And maybe ask them how often they check the water for bacteria. Obviously these issues tainted my view, but I just didn’t like this property. It is charmless – not the least bit Hawaiian, and looks no different than any timeshare property in Palm Springs or Phoenix. Even though it’s quite new, it smelled bad, at least on our floor, and things were starting to fall apart. The layout is odd – one bathroom door opens to block the entryway to the other bathroom door, the shower door opens right onto the toilet, the desk is on a lanai that has no plug ins, etc., etc. The restaurant food was very average. If you are a Marriott Vacation Club owner and really want to cook your own meals, you can do that here, but I urge you to consider these cautions and to encourage management to make some changes.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: barnesrules
Reviews.Content: The Marriott was amazing. The property is extremely well kept. The only drawback for me was the beach- but whatever, the pools more than made up for it. We had a nice 1 bedroom villa. We had a parking lot view, again, whatever- the point is not to stay in the room the whole time. Having a washer/ dryer and full kitchen were quite convenient. The staff were helpful and professional, the car valets were extremely pleasant. I would definitely recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Great for families”
Reviews.Author: travelforsix6
Reviews.Content: We just returned for spending 10 days on Oahu, staying at the Ko Olina Beach Club by Marriott. It was the second time we've stayed there. Both experiences have been wonderful. The resort is beautiful; quite striking when you first arrive. They work at maintaining the resort...as we saw them sanding and staining the wook railings throughout the park-like grounds. We stayed in a two bedroom villa. It has a full kitchen, a full-sized dining table (seats 6 adults comfortably), and also has a sleeper sofa in the living room so if you need to sleep up to 8 people, you can easily. The pools are a tremendous amount of fun (unless they've been closed due to potty accidents....happened twice during our stay). If you go, make a trip to costco to stock up. The restaurants on site are expensive for "just okay" food. I could have had better food cooking it myself...and cheaper! But we'll definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: BobL779
Reviews.Content: Ok This was our first hotel we stayed at in Hawaii and our favorite. We had 2 balconies and a gigantic ocean view room. The place was gorgeous and location was good. Beach was nice and Pool was good as well. Went to Pearl Harbor and North Shore while we were here. One of the best hotels we have been to, loved the room!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for families away from the crowds at Waikiki”
Reviews.Author: RoadWearyWoman
Reviews.Content: If you are going to Hawaii with your kids, this is the place to stay on Oahu. They have studio, one-, two- and three-bedroom units - all of which are really, really soundproof (yay!). The larger units have complete kitchens and large dining rooms. Studios have a fridge, toaster and microwave. The resort also has BBQs for use by guests, so you don't have to spend a fortune eating resort food. They have great family and kid activities (from little to teens), wonderful pools, and quiet, uncrowded beaches. We have an only child, and he made all kinds of friends and was never bored. The biggest plus is that you don't have the noise, hassle and crowds of Waikiki. If you are looking for quiet romance, stay at the JW next door. Otherwise, this is a great way to see Oahu in a top rate facility that allows you to save money by eating in. For my son, the highlight was making his own race car and racing it with their kid's club. The place is a timeshare, so if you take the tour and consider buying (we decided not to, since it wasn't in our budget), they have nice incentives and a very low-pressure sales staff. Plus, since most of the guests were "owners", they tended to be a little more outgoing and nicer than your normal hotel crowd. The service was friendly and we had no problems at all. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very beautiful location.”
Reviews.Author: Petdankay
Reviews.Content: A nice resort with wonderful sunsets. Very nice pools and restaurants. Walking boulevard is a must. Beautiful beach and very nice staff. You can Barbeque your own meat, hamburgers. Market place for little meals, lunch or breakfast and snacks.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing property”
Reviews.Author: DeanfromSeattle
Reviews.Content: Marriott has done it right at the Ko Olina Beach Club. Very nice room, great setting on the West shore, away from the hustle of Honolulu but with its own alure with Kaena Point, local finds in Waipahu, Waianae, diving on the west coast (try off of the power plant - hot water discharge brings in cool fish to see off the park beach!). Some of the best local grinds close by in the area, like Hannara Restaurant in Waianae. Great places to walk around the resorts and man made lagoons. Pools are beautiful, check in is easy and parking plentiful. I will keep going back!

Reviews.Title: “Great condo and resort”
Reviews.Author: RedPalmSprings
Reviews.Content: Rented here for a week from the 7th of July to the 14th and could not have been more pleased with the accommodaions, the friendly staff, Chuck's Steak House and our great bartender, Seth. We ate sitting at the bar in Chuck's three nights, fun to visit with everyone and had good food and a great salad bar. Ate at Roy's one night, perfect food and friendly, it is at the Ko Olina Golf Course across the street. We ate at the Italian Restaurant at JW Marriott and had the worst meal of the trip at the highest price. Save your money and do not go there. Found a recommended Sushi place another night and that was fun, conveyor Sushi listed on my iphone as a great Sushi place. Ate up in Turtle Bay another night. It was all great. Then left and went to the Sheraton in Waikiki and wished I was back in Ko Olina.

Reviews.Title: “Nice pools and lagoon”
Reviews.Author: Juztin T
Reviews.Content: They have 3 pools all together. Among these 3, there's a reflection pool whereby you have to be quiet at all times. Good to relax, sunbath or read a book. The other pools are big and fun to play in, but abit too crowded with kids. So if anyone of you are bringing kids along it will be good. The lagoon had crystal clear water, but again too packed with families and guests. As for the room, it's pretty good. Nice bed and spacious. They provide an oven to heat up food too. The only minus point is they actually charged for room services/cleaning. So if you are planning to stay here for long you may need to take this into consideration. Location wise is actually quite far away from all other areas like etc Wakiki if you do not drive/rent a car. As such, dining out can be an issue too. There are only 2 restaurants in the hotel ( however you can take a slow walk or a shuttle bus ride to nearby hotels, but of couse they will not be cheap) Free wifi throughout the hotel, so that's an added bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, will stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Michael T
Reviews.Content: Great place, right on the beach with breathtaking views. Stayed on 4th floor overlooking the pool area toward the lagoon. Overall a wonderful experience and would do it again any day. Only advice, don't say next to the stairs if you can avoid it. The stairs are made from thin sheets of steel which makes it sound like someone's moving funiture when people are traveling up/down them. Other than that, make sure to hit the local store or you'll pay the price at the local shop.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort..but security an issue”
Reviews.Author: Com B
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a total of 10 days. The resort was very crowded with guests, owners and many locals. We were given colored "pool pass" wristbands which allowed us access to the pools and other amenities. We were told that security would be checking often...unfortunately this wasn't the case. One night my kids and I went swimming in one of the pools when we saw a bunch of local teenagers mulling around the grounds. They took a dip in one of the two jacuzzis as well as in one of the pools. There was no security guard present which made us feel somewhat uncomfortable. Only once during our stay were we asked to show our wristbands...no other time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: Fernando F
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Hawaii and we loved it. We stayed at the Marriott for 1 week and it was a great experience . The only downside since this is mainly a family resort is you need to rent a car to travel to Waikiki or any other side of the island if you want to dine out or hit some club after 9 PM.

Reviews.Title: “Third visit there!”
Reviews.Author: CandyCaneCA
Reviews.Content: My slice of heaven..this was our third visit there. We love everything about it!! We became Owners this year! Lagoon is awesome, pools are the best. Numerous jacuzzis throughout..some adult only which is nice.. Lots is activities for the kids..we could see the Fia Fia luau from our balcony. No Ka Oi!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome pools, tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: TNTBAMA
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed staying here primarily because of the pools. Several different pools to choose from to fit everyone's taste. Our kids loved the pool with the slide and waterfalls. There were hot tubs and a shave ice stand next to it as well (FYI, shave ice stand only takes cash or room charges). We ordered lunch from a pool waitress, and we were pleased with the quantity, quality, and service. TIP: We ordered 4 kids meals, and it was plenty of food for 2 adults and 2 kids. Better be on your best behavior at the pool however, because the pool staff will mark your name down on their guest list if your child runs or jumps where/when they're not supposed to...just a warning to parents out there. The other pools were not as crowded for those without school-age children. The fitness center was nice but extremely cramped. The locker room was very handy on our last day there. We had to check out at 11am but our flight wasn't until late that night, so we enjoyed a long afternoon of sun and play before freshening up before heading to the airport. TIP: Reserve a locker room key to store your stuff on your last day and shower/change before heading out on the trip back home. My wife and I each got a facility swipe card and a locker key from the pool hut beside the fitness center after checking out of our room...very easy. We ate at Chuck's Steakhouse for dinner at the resort one night. Good food, OK service, but overpriced. We were misinformed on the kids' drinks there...they are NOT included if you let them talk you into the flavored drinks like cherry pepsi. Apparently stirring some cherry syrup into their pepsi costs $4.50 per glass. Just a heads-up. The market on the property has a wide selection of food/drinks/snacks. We got some breakfast items and drinks for a very reasonable price. I would recommend this property primarily for the pools and amenities, but the rooms are so small for families that I wouldn't want to stay here for more than a couple of days.

Reviews.Title: “Great for kids - poor houskeeping”
Reviews.Author: J R
Reviews.Content: I travel - a lot. I spent over 100 nights in hotels last year and spent about 4 weeks at the Marriott Ko Olina Vacation Beach Club. First, the good. It is a great resort for small kids. They have several nice pools and a seawater lagoon with a breakwater. It is safe for kids. They also have a good fitness center. They also have some nice BBQ grills that are great, but crowded during dinner hours. And it is close to the Disney Aluani (if that is a plus). Now the bad. The resort is located way out from the other attractions on Oahu. And traffic is bad. Really bad. It can take an hour or longer to get to Waikiki. Housekeeping here is among the worst I have ever seen at a hotel. The room is filthy and housekeeping rarely vacuums or cleans the floor. I will see the same crumbs on the floor all week. Bath tub had a ring around it from the previous guest. They do change the towels daily and make the bed. But I have to ask them to replace the shampoo and soap when I run out. You have to stand in line to "check out" pool towels. Presumably you are charged for them if you don't turn them back in. The hotel has two mediocre restaurants - overpriced. It is certainly not a good hotel for people here on business. There is not desk or work area in the room; Free internet, but you have to frequently log in to get access. Internet performance was good. Last complaint - mandatory valet parking. They charge you $30 per day for valet. The problem is that during peak hours, you may not be able to get your car when you want it. I have waited up to 30 minutes for my car. No room service. Limited spa services. It is a good hotel for kids on vacation; but not for an extended stay or a business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I Have Ever Stayed At!!!”
Reviews.Author: Calferman1
Reviews.Content: This Marriot was absoulutley 110% awesome,it was super clean,all the appliances were up to date, the service was great, the pool and beach was phenomenal,and the entite area was wonderfully lanscaped I would recomend this hotel to anyone :)

Reviews.Title: “Forget paying for an ocean view”
Reviews.Author: DBUKGirl
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms, but very overpriced resort Check in sucks waited until 4.30 and only then got a room by complaining I've stayed at 30+ Marriotts this year and the service / staff attitude at check in was the worst

Reviews.Title: “Views and property are great. The amenities are average.”
Reviews.Author: merice107
Reviews.Content: The views and location are great. It's nice and relaxing to not be on Waikiki beach. Much more family friendly. Not as romantic for couples because there are so many families with kids running around. Rooms are ok. Our balcony was barely big enough for us to go on to it. The lagoons are great for kids to swim in and the path is perfect for an early morning run. The restaurant on the beach sucks.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Crabzilla
Reviews.Content: This is a a great resort. We stayed with a family of four in a large two bedroom suite. The room was very spacious and clean and came with a fully equiped kitchen. You definitely want to pay extra for the ocean view. It is gorgeous with views on the property, beaches and lagoon. The property is about 30 minutes to the west from Honolulu airport. So you are well away from crowded downtown and Waikiki. However, the hotel is at an easy drive from major sights such as Pearl Harbor and the North Shore. Less than a 10 minute drive from the hotel you have a strip mall in Kapolei (exit 1a/b) with restaurants and shops including a large Target and Safeway. The resort area contains three other hotels and four man-made lagoons. The beach club is at lagoon number 3, which was not very crowded. It has a great sandy beach and safe swimming and snorkeling. We saw many fish and a sea turtle. The snorkeling is nice but not great because of the sand which reduces the view. Nevertheless, it is a great place to have the kids practice the snorkeling. Then drive out to one of the great snorkeling spots on Oahu. When you drive back to the airport to catch a flight in the morning remember to take the carpool lane on H1 (three people in the car required). It delivers you directly to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: FirstHandTraveler
Reviews.Content: It is a great resort and you really don't have to leave the resort. They do everything for you. The resort is a drive to downtown, but I would recommend this resort. Family loved it.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best”
Reviews.Author: NebraskaFan71
Reviews.Content: This is an outstanding property in the Marriott timeshare family. The rooms are spacious and well maintained. The location is great and we always have a great time. We especially enjoy the walking trail along the coast, the lagoons, and the three pools. One pool is more of am adult pool but we enjoyed them all. We will be back, soon I hope.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Relaxing Hawaiian Vacation”
Reviews.Author: HeCouldGoAllTheWay
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our family of 5 at Koolina for one week in June. Koolina is located about 30 minutes north of the Honolulu airport, in a relaxed atmosphere far from the hustle and bustle of Honolulu. It is centrally located for a quick get-away to the North Shore, the hiking/tourist spots north of Honolulu, or any other spots on the leeward side. Having said this, you could happily spend all your time at the resort. There are 4 beautiful lagoons that are perfect for kids or just to laze around on the lounge chairs or a quick cooling off in the ocean. There are also quite a few swimming pools available for a change of pace. The rooms are very spacious and completely stocked with everything you need to live comfortably for a week and barbeques for outdoor cooking. If you are looking for a beautiful Hawaiian resort to relax at, this is the place. The only downside of the resort are the expensive restaurants and small convenience store. I understand that the resort needs to make a profit, but these are somewhat excessive. I would definitely recommend stocking up at the nearby Costco or grocery stores or eating out at the area restaurants (about a 5 minute drive from the resort).

Reviews.Title: “Misled”
Reviews.Author: Rich P
Reviews.Content: Purchased an ocean view villa suite and requested high floor for a 25th anniversary. Booked 5 months in advance and received a 2nd floor room (ground level) with a view of shrubs and the pool. They had no options available to improve the room due to a high level of timeshare check ins.

Reviews.Title: “Nice But a Few Complaints”
Reviews.Author: Kingsfan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ko Olina Beach Club from 7-8-12 - 7-15-12. The grounds and the rooms are nice. We had a one bedroom suite with an adjoining second bedroom - lockout (even though we were supposed to have a two bedroom suite). We had requested (months in advance) a room above the 7th floor so that we could have a view of the ocean above the palm trees. When we arrived we were told that nothing was available above the 7th floor so we were assigned a room on the 6th floor. The view was just ok. We were also told that we would have an ocean view two bedroom suite. Although we had an ocean view (when you could see above the palm trees) we were given a one bedroom suite and an adjoining room-lockout. We purchased the week from an owner. As a result, we only received maid service twice- once upon our arrival and then again in the middle of the week. Like most of HI, food at the resort was very expensive and it wasn't great. We ate at Longboards several times and it was just ok. Our room was in the Moana Tower which was fine but we were at the end of the Tower closest to the lobby. As a result, it was VERY noisy because of all of the garbage trucks, delivery vehicles, and other trucks coming and going. It was also somewhat noisy because of all of the kids at the pool. One disadvantage of staying in Ko Olina is that you have to drive everywhere if you want to leave the resort area (which we did). That can be a pain. There is a great Japanese restaurant about 15 minutes away- it's called Kunio restaurant. It's located in a strip mall and doesn't look like much but it is really good. We went there for dinner twice. The prices are reasonable (for HI) and it is frequented by locals so you can expect to wait 15 - 30 minutes for a table (it's worth the wait). I don't know that I would return to this resort in the future. I think that I would rather go to Maui or Kauai.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: kglack
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful property. We stayed in the new rooms and they are absolutely gorgeous (and I am picky). Granite counters, stainless steel appliances, modern washer and dryer - front loader...everything is new! The property itself was great. If you are staying in the new building ask for a 5th floor or higher. We were on the 4th floor and the view is somewhat obstructed. Staff are all friendly. Drinks and food on property are expensive (as expected). We ate at Roy's and it was fabulous. Get a car and drive to find better options for dining. There's also a Target less than 10 minutes from the property with GREAT food prices. We stocked up for snacks and lunches, but I refuse to cook dinner on vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Everything We Could Have Asked For ...”
Reviews.Author: WSJS_Noxin
Reviews.Content: We stayed in two different 2-bedroom suites in Tower 3 (2 kids, 2 couples - us and my parents) first was an ocean view above the pools/entrance and the 2nd had parking deck view. Immaculate rooms, great kitchen/laundry accomodations, comfortable beds - even the kids slept well on the pull out sofas ... made our stay enjoyable. The pools were a big hit with our kids ... they could have just stayed in any of those our entire 10-day vacation. Lots of activities around the property to be involved in ... and the manmade lagoons were very swimmable (unlike some of the cean beaches around the island due to rip-currents). HIGHLY recommend. Staff was very friendly and willing to make recommendations & talk story. We arrived early, as we had notified them upon booking, they assured us we'd have a room for 2:30, but when we arrived at 3:00 pm ... we had to wait until nearly 5 pm. They did make the pool and locker room available to us ... but after a long day of travel, we wanted to be in our room. We also got to use the pool/locker room on our last day before we headed to airport for our 5 pm flight back to the mainland.

Reviews.Title: “Bring Supplies & Car”
Reviews.Author: VA_USA_traveler
Reviews.Content: Very nice resort with two good restaurants, a market, a couple of wonderful lagoon pools/hottubs, and beachfront ripe for wading and snorkeling. I would strongly suggest renting a car at the airport so you can go out to eat, purchase groceries, and have a means of traveling around the area. A taxi from HNL will cost roughly $70 and the hotel will do all they can to persuade you to take VIP transportation back to the airport. The resort charges $30/day to park your vehicle.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Codypooh
Reviews.Content: My family and I have stayed here a couple times and both times have been just perfect! The first time was in 2009 and second one was last summer. The property is just well maintained and perfect for kids and adults. The rooms are kept up and always clean when we checked in. Front desk and all employees we've talked to are always helpful and friendly. The property is only about 20-30 min away from Waikiki so no problem if you want to go for a few hours and hang out in Waikiki and enjoy their beaches. Also about 30 minutes away from North Shore if you want to enjoy that side of the island. It's also a couple of exits away from the Waikele OUtlets if you'd like to shop. This is also a perfect place if you have little kids. The beach has little or close to no wave as it is a logoon and there rocks that blocks the waves from coming in. You also have a couple of choices of restaurants and if you don't feel like eating at a restaurant, they have a mini mart downstairs where you can buy almost anything plus they sell sandwiches, bagels and even a whole pizza which I think is a good deal if you are on a budget. They do cost a bit more than normal sandwich or pizza places but I expected that since we are at a resort but at least you won't spend an easy $60-100 which you would spend if you eat at a restaurant on the island. As for us, we like local food and we know where to go around the island so we know where to go for cheap food. But this is a great place to buy food if my kids are just tired and want to relax at the resort. Overall stay was just awesome and I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Tropical Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Lu E
Reviews.Content: What a splendour place to stay. Rooms are huge and clean. Staff are friendly. We stayed in room with a view of the ocean. Every morning and night we walked from end to end of their property. Very secured and lighted. It is away from the city but there are a few grocery stores that you can go to. Restaurants are kind of expensive. They do have a convenience store to get your everyday needs. They also have a lot of outside grill that you can do BBQ. Where we stayed they have 2 huge pools. It was like you are in paradise. I highly recommend this hotel. Excellent place to stay for a tropical vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Resort”
Reviews.Author: gldnby
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the first week of July with my wife and two children ages 11 and 8. We aren't timeshare owners so we paid for a rental room. Check in took 1/2 hour but they were very busy around 4:00 so not really their fault. The room was nice with a full kitchen and partial ocean view. The hotel is in front of one of 4 lagoons all in a row. Good snorkeling in each one. We saw lots of fish and an Octopus. The pools are great, there are 3 total. One has a volleyball net and basketball hoop that got alot of use every time we were there. The second is a "quiet" pool. We didn't use it, but did see a few kids there. I don't get the concept of this as it's not really quiet and smack in the middle of all the activities/noise. The third is a multi level pool with caves and waterfalls, as well as a fun waterslide. My kids loved these pools. You have to get out of the water and climb the stairs to get to each one. Not a big deal but if the wind is blowing it's a bit chilly. The water in all the pools was warm and there are many hot tubs around and they're very hot which we like. My only complaint with the pools is that you get a wristband for the pools to identify you as an owner or guest. At least half the people at the pools didn't have one. I only saw an employee checking wristbands twice in 8 days and they didn't ask anyone to leave. This is kind of irritating considering the amount of money we were paying to stay at the resort and use the pools. The Disney resort next door doesn't allow this kind of nonsense and have employees ensuring only guests can use the pools. The resort always has something going on like a movie on the lawn (free), and fitness and crafts. There is a pretty good fitness room with cardio machines, strength machines, and dumbbells up to 50 lbs. Good enought to get a decent workout. There is also a market with essentials and drinks/snacks. Pricey but convenient if you forget something. We didn't eat at the resort so I can't comment on the food. We drove to the Walmart about 15 minutes away and stocked up. There are a number of free grills to use througout the propertly that got alot of use. I used them once and cooked early in the afternoon so I wouldn't have to wait. I like this feature of the resort. Drinks at the resort are pricey but that's expected. Parking is $30 a day whether you use valet or not! That's stunning but I will say the valet service is very good and fast. All the employees are very friendly and welcoming. We sat through the timshare presentation for 90 minutes and they gave us 4 free dolphin cruise tickets. They have a number of choices for activities if you listen to the presentation. Some are highy discounted and you pay a bit extra ($20 per person) and some are totally free like the dolphin cruise, which included roundtrip bus pickup. Food and snorkeling on the cruise were extra. We thought it was a good deal and they even gave us the tickets the day before we went to the presentation. We didn't buy into the timeshare but was interested to learn more about it. Not high pressure, but was 90 minutes.They have a kids club you can drop the kids at for no charge. Overall we loved the resort and would recommend it for families or anyone wanting a relaxing vacation.

Reviews.Title: “The Hawaii Lagoon area”
Reviews.Author: GailF441
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ko Olina Beach Club for 5 days, it was nice and quiet, it is very family oriented. The beach side restaurant is very good, and fun.We stayed in a 1 bedroom suite, it was nice and spacious. We had a large lanai also.

Reviews.Title: “surprised”
Reviews.Author: lannie1999
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was extremly clean,the rooms very large, bright with a great view. We were very impressed with the pools of stingray,sharks and othe types of fish meandering around the property. The lagoon was great for swimming if your not a great swimmer( nice and safe).The hotel is aprx. 18 miles from Honolulu, so if you want to be close to town you would be out of luck. I would still recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Great Time Here”
Reviews.Author: srich1980
Reviews.Content: My favorite part about staying in Ko Olina is that you are away from the touristy commercialized areas like Waikiki. We stayed in the Villas (2 bedroom 2 bath wtih kitchen & living room) we had 6 people so 2 slept on the pull out sofa in the living room. The tower we were in was brand new and really nice. The resort is beautiful with many pools and lagoons that are wave-free. There is a marketplace to buy necessities which was nice and it connects via beachside walking paths to the other Marriott (and Disney) resorts in Ko Olina. I would reccomend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Huh. No Hawaii magic for me, but a great family resort.”
Reviews.Author: fun_city_gal
Reviews.Content: Just came home June 24th, after a week long stay here. I have been to Hawaii many times but never to a timeshare resort. My parents invited my BF and me along, and we had a large 2 bedroom, 2 bath unit facing the Ko Olina Golf Course (and hotel parking lot), with a large living room and kitchen in the center. They traded their points for a stay here, so we couldn't get the ocean view b/c they are not Marriott owners. The view was fine, and we waived to my parents from the golf course while playing one day. It was great having the kitchen and washer and dryer, as we cooked most every night. The Safeway is about 10 minutes back toward the airport - very convenient. We knew about the high cost of the food there from other reviewers. You are indeed a captive audience once in the resort. The little store is very expensive, as are the restaurants. Our initial late lunch/early dinner on our day of arrival cost $118 at the Longboard Grill, and wasn't much to write home about. Salads and sandwiches and two beers. The place was like a perfectly manufactured group of 6 or 7 large hotel buildings, making up the Ko Olina development area, including 4 man-made lagoons, a new Disney Resort timeshare, and a JW Marriott Hotel up at the other end. Kind of like Stepford Wife Hawaii. (The interior pools with hammerhead shark and many stingrays at the JW were fun to see.) There were several pools, and they did a good job of keeping kids and noisy people away from the one pool nearest the Longboard Grill designated for quiet. We would have loved more drink service at the pool; the girls rarely came around. The lagoons were wonderful for kids...they were roped off so the kids couldn't easily swim out past the ropes and rocks into the open ocean. It was a nice long walk about 4 miles (?) from one end of the development to the other and back. Walk past the last lagoon by the JW to a little dirt trail to a small REAL lagoon and hope to see the large sea turtle that lives there! We did! There was a small shopping center with an ABC market across the street from the JW Marriott entrance with an expensive Mexican restaurant (we didn't try it, as we have plenty of good Mex food in San Diego), and a delicious HI BBQ place across the parking lot. We ate lunch there twice. The ABC market was fantastic for reasonably priced souvenirs. There are about a million ABC stores on Waikiki. We golfed twice at the Ko Olina Golf Course across the street from our hotel. Excellent and difficult and beautiful, and about $150 per round. We are avid golfers, so we will spend money on golf and cook dinners at home to save a little money. I don't mind spending on an excellent meal; hate feeling ripped off. The shuttle around the Ko Olina development was great for taking us to golf....stops across from the JW Marriott (cross street to the ABC market) and other places too. The staff at our timeshare resort was extremely helpful. A couple of minor things were broken and they came to our room within minutes to fix them. The room key cards are a JOKE. Oh my gosh....they worked about a quarter of the time! Even with 4 key cards between us, none of them worked on two occasions. Usually just 1 worked. What a stupid hassle. (Keeping them separate from your credit cards doesn't work, either, like they say it will.) The AC doesn't work unless the sliding glass doors are closed....of course it says this on the glass doors themselves, but we were lazy and didn't read it. We called and the nice lady ansewered that question for I'm sure the 1000th time! We most enjoyed the Happy Hour at the expensive steak house - $4 Mai Tais and other drinks from 445 to 6, and 930 to whenever each night. Beautiful bar....it felt the most like HI to me in that bar. Hawaiian music and nice breeze blowing through, w/lovely ocean view. There were activities for families to watch on the lawn area, like a fire dance one night and hula dancing and a luau. We skipped those. We are not big on crowded touristy events, but people were really enjoying them, especially the kids. The BBQs were very popular (there were 2 groupings of about 5 BBQs each at either side of the hotel entrance) but the heat was very low and it took quite some time to grill our corn. There was a little wait each night but the guests (mostly men sent down to BBQ) seemed to have fun visiting. Not sure we would do this place again, as I'd like a more true Hawaiian ambiance, but it was nice to be guests of my parents. We picked up the flights, so it all evened out. Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Great for a quieter vacation - family friendly”
Reviews.Author: adlibjane
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel in June 2012: 2 adults and 3 girls (19, 18 and 12). We had traded our Marriott Timberlodge 2 bedroom for this one. The room was identical to our Tahoe timeshare. We had a master bedroom with lots of closet space, separate tub and sink PLUS a bathroom with shower and sink & toilet. It adjoined with a livingroom, kitchen and dining area. The next adjoining room is a King bed and small kitchenette and sofa area with a full bathroom. Perfect for families. Free internet too. Parking was $5 per day. There is a full kitchen and laundry in the suite. With the high prices of food and drink in Hawaii it saved us money. We were only a few minutes from Target, Costco, a "whole foods" type of grocery store. The hotel is very clean and quiet. There are outdoor BBQ areas on the grounds and several pools. Overall it was very quiet. Too quiet for our kids though. Ko olina is far from Waikiki and other sites on the island so having a car was mandatory. We did drive out to Waikiki several times so the kids could shop, sight see, etc. A lot more action in those areas. We also went to the Polynesian Cultural Center and other tourist places for the kids' benefit. While at the hotel my sister and her kids stayed at the Disney Aulani hotel near our hotel. That hotel was very nice and kid oriented but a lot more noisy. There were lots of small children there and many lifeguards. One night we ate at Roy's, located in the gated community where our hotel was located. Very pricey. There is also a great Mexican restaurant with an impressive selection of tequilas nearby. On Tuesday nights at the hotel there is a Luau. The food looked really good. There is another Luau located in walking distance which my sister said was absolutely horrible and a waste of money. Overall we had a relaxing time and the hotel amenities were very nice. For a quiet vacation in Hawaii I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ko olina nailed it”
Reviews.Author: toodrastic4
Reviews.Content: I love short and sweet. We stayed in a two bedroom and we had 4 people. Plenty of space and very clean. There is a really nice kitchen and a upright washer and dryer just right for vacation. (I got away with a backpack, 2 trunks, 2 shorts, and like 5 shirts). The pool was great and the fact that there is a Costco 10 minutes out was awesome. Having the kids would normally be pricey for lunch and breakfast so a quick trip to Costco on the way in made those meals super affordable. We ate dinner out all but two nights and those nights we cooked in. Also there are multiple BBQs on the grounds that are cleaned daily so you will have no problem using them. As for the staff.....great. Beach.....great.... I am getting wordy so in short great place, family frienduly and ooops fantastic luau.

Reviews.Title: “Great for familys”
Reviews.Author: carolCa_
Reviews.Content: We had a 2 bedroom and a living room and kitchen with ocean view and love it!Saw fish and a turtle in the bay !

Reviews.Title: “great vacation condo for families (especially small children)”
Reviews.Author: lmc1970
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 days at the Ko Olina Beach Club October of 2011, the condo was 2 bedrooms and had tons of space: 2 kings in each room, and one room with a pullout sofabed, and an additional sofa bed in the living room. Very spacious, clean and modern. Washer and dryer in unit was wonderful for cleaning up after a long day in the sun. Kitchen had everything you need to make all your meals, they even have nice professional grills for barbeque meals. Best of all, Costco and Target were near buy to get groceries and essentials. Home away from home! Pools were nice and the lagoon was perfect! Far from downtown Waikiki, and not in the greenest part of Oahu, but if you are looking for a getaway with family (especially small children) this was perfect. Wish we stayed longer. Only thing that may not be for some people is that they are persistent in giving the "time share" presentation.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Funmom123
Reviews.Content: We had an enjoyable stay at Ko Olina. We started our stay here after spending a few days in San Francisco, and a week in Maui. Area is isolated and fairly exclusive with guardsman checking cars entering into the area. Stayed in regular guest room/studio which was enough room for us. The balcony only sits two and was small. Family oriented and the lagoons offer safer swimming for younger children. Property is well maintained and we enjoyed the peaceway walks along the paved walkway. The entire property is considered "oceanfront" so when selecting ocean view, don't be disappointed when not really being able to see the ocean. It really means ocean facing and offers more of a garden view of pools/scenery. Lots of daily activities. Little shading around Lagoons. Was a 40 minute drive from Waikiki and seems far from other Oahu attractions. Somewhat closer to North Shore. Food is expensive. Prefer Maui Ocean Club but enjoyable stay overall.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great place to stay away from the Noise of Waikiki”
Reviews.Author: Four_Star_Traveller
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay away from the Noise of Waikiki! We were "slightly" concerned due to some negative reviews we saw earlier but they are unwarranted. Keep in mind that this is a 3.5* property and it is a time share and not a regular Marriott Property. They will give room preferences to the timeshare OWNERS over Marriott Members so Platinum Members be warned as you won't get an automatic upgrade. Since this is a time share there is no distinction between Beach-front, Ocean View or Ocean-Front as in normal hotels. There are only 2 categories here: Island View and Ocean View (and not all Ocean Views "face" the ocean) Everyone was very helpful and friendly here. I can pretty well guarantee that this is going to be one of the nicest 3.5* stays you will ever have. Don't confuse this with a 4 or 5* Property BUT the service is GREAT for 3.5* (missing rooms service and better toiletries for 4*, 5* needs page service, 1hr laundry, car service etc). As for time share, they'll tell you about it at the Welcome Centre but they are not pushy about it. Definitely stop by and grab the Welcome Package for maps, discount cards etc and sign up for the presentation (and go to one if you have the time for some more freebies). If you have kids, this is an awesome place. They have a different pools that cater to babies all they way up to adults. There is a Kids Club and kid activities planned almost everyday. There are lots of families here so if you are planning a Romantic getaway, I would suggest the JW Marriott Up the road. If you want to be in the centre of all the action, stay in Waikiki. It's not as quiet as Maui here but it's very close AND you have the option to drive into town for better city life (food, shopping, etc - good luck finding Dim Sum or Louis Vuitton in Maui). We definitely like the options that are presented by staying here. Pros: Many Pool Choices Own Lagoon (don't have to share with Disney) Free internet Close to Kapolei for food, groceries etc (see my restaurant reviews) Great Staff Cons: $30 Valet Parking Walls are a bit thin No Automatic Upgrades for Platinum Members 10AM Check Out ($50 more for noon, $100 for 2PM or full price for after 2PM) They have a linger later program where they will hold your luggage and you can use the locker room to shower and change. Tips: Definitely rent a car (the cab ride here is $100+) Ask nicely for a room upgrade on high floor facing water (pay a few extra $$ for it too) Awesome Shaved Ice at Lagoon Pool Eat at some restaurants in Kapolei Get a 1 bedroom over a studio if you can for double the space and full kitchen Take kids to the Ocean Fish Feeding in AM at JW as well as Shark Feeding in their pools

Reviews.Title: “If you need a break from Waikiki...”
Reviews.Author: palmer101
Reviews.Content: I try not to like it here, but this stay was as good as the first a couple years ago. Yes, we are already planning our next stay! This time my husband and I stayed his Marriott points, reserving a king ocean view guest room (a studio), and actually had an ocean/marina view! The room fit the two of us, and we both slept great every night. Being on daily rates, we had some housekeeping everyday. Enjoyed the view, and had a thoroughly relaxing stay. Did notice a few oddities about the room: With a sleeper-sofa, the room is obviously intended to fit 4 people but the kitchen service was only for 2 (2 spoons, 2 forks, 2 plates, etc). There are dishwashing supplies but no plug for the sink drain and no rack to dry the dishes in. But since there was only two of anything, we had to wash dishes... The refrigerator is in an unventilated cabinet. Unless you leave the cabinet door open, the heat builds up until the only cold spot is the bottom shelf of the refrigerator. There is no luggage rack, so my husband used the floor and my suitcase rested on an odd, big square piece of furniture. There is no table and chairs other than that on the tiny balcony, which could make an unpleasant dining experience on windy or rainy days. (Maybe there would be room for an inside table if they got rid of that odd piece of furniture?) The cute vanity in bathroom is not enough counter space, and the drawers below are too tiny to fit a medium size cosmetic bag. TimeShare Presentation: We decided to attend this time, and it really wasn't painful for the number of Marriott reward points we got.:) I expected to not like their Vacation Club system, but their new points plan was more affordable than I had imagined. Just not us. The downstairs market is convenient. Ate at the restaurant downstairs and it was fine, but dined at Roy's twice and loved Azul at the JW Marriott, both just a nice evening stroll away. Also walking distance is an ice cream shop, taco shop, Hawaiian BarBQ and an "upscale" version of an ABC for supplies and food. Ko'olina is out from Honolulu so you definitely need a car for day trips. (If you stay in Waikiki, and we usually do for a few nights, you are walking distance to the zoo and aquarium, and can hop a bus to museums and Pearl Harbor.) The lagoons are nice and safe for swimming but no natural surf, and the shoreline itself is all rock; you will have to drive to find surfing, windsurfing, etc. As others have said, getting to the North Shore is easy from here, and we had an amazing dinner at the Hale'iwa Cafe one night with island friends. The highlight of this location is the long paved walkway along the lagoons and marina! Quiet nights! Comfortable bed! Relax!

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Always Gets It Right -- Great Time in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: WIS64
Reviews.Content: We are Marriott timeshare owners at Lake Tahoe, and decided to trade one of our weeks for a one bedroom unit at the Ko Olina Beach Club from June 9-16th. We travel frequently, even more so since we became empty nesters. When I read reviews here I always start with the one stars and work my way up. From our experience, I cannot understand why this property would get less than a 4 star review. Granted, construction on the new building was over, which I know led to a number of complaints here. Our 9th floor view was a partial marina, industrial, and parking lot view -- no big deal to us. We were enjoying the grounds 90% of the time anyway. The property is kept immaculate. No sounds from neighboring units and hallways, and the place was sold out. Complete cross section of people and ages. Our experience was nothing short of wonderful, and we've been to Hawaii a number of times....friendly, knowledgeable staff, check-in line was no more than 10 minutes (we arrived at the property approximately 1 PM in the afternoon to start our stay), great floor plan (I can understand complaints about staying in the "lock-out" rooms which are like hotel rooms with a mini-kitchen. We would be unhappy in one of those for a week). Our room wasn't ready, but we were given free run of the place. We merely changed into swim wear in the fitness center locker rooms and enjoyed the property's many amenities. During our stay nothing ever seemed crowded. Restaurants there were pretty good but nothing to rave about. Typical resort prices. We BBQed twice, after grocery shopping a few miles away (you do need a car if you don't plan to stay on the property 100% of the time). BBQ grills and tools are all deluxe stainless, and the work areas very clean. We never had to wait in line to use a BBQ. The man-made lagoons were very nicely done and the landscaping rates a 10 on my scale. The Beach Club and the Nearby JW Marriott hotel anchor a 3/4 mile walking path along the shore, with the new Disney Aulina resort between the two. We ate sushi at the JW and one breakfast at Disney. Both were good food and reasonable prices for what you got and where you were. Went to Roy's Hawaiian accross the street in the Ko Olina golf complex. Food was good but in my opinion overpriced for what we got (we dine out a lot and frequently spend $150-200 at a time for two, so my comment isn't due to sticker shock). There is an off-property mexican restaurant and Hawaiian BBQ within walking distance. In summary, our week there felt like we were gone for two weeks, which is the highest compliment I can pay a vacation experience.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel for families”
Reviews.Author: durangoduo
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week's stay at the Marriott Ko Olina Beach Club. This was our third stay at the property, and each visit reinforces the unique qualities of the resort for our family: peaceful yet family-friendly, modern with updated units, a variety of services/amenities on site and a gorgeous set of grounds set in front of a serene and calm ocean lagoon. We stayed in the new wing of the Nai'a tower and had a 12th floor ocean view 2 bedroom unit. This wing just opened about 2 weeks ago. The views, especially the evening sunsets, from our balcony were breathtaking. The appliances in the new units are stainless steel and are of nice quality. This is not to say that the older units are outdated. that's not the case; rather, the property seems to be ensuring that the new wing is current and modern. We were impressed with the service--we checked in around 3:30 along with just about every other guest. I waited in the open-air lobby for about 20 minutes. Yet, the staff was handing our free fresh fruit (papaya and pineapple), had chilled clothes to cool off with and fruit-infused water in the lobby for those checking it. Nice touch. We aren't timeshare owners and just booked the room through Marriott. We were only asked once (when we picked up our welcome packet) if we wanted to tour the timeshare units. We said no, and we didn't hear from them again. I didn't get the sense of hard-pressure sales tactics. If you are thinking of other properties in the Ko Olina area, both the JW and the Disney Aulani are right there and are good ones to consider. The JW has a smallish pool and is more geared for adult couples. Either the Ko Olina Beach Club or the Disney property is more suited for families. That said, we walked through the Aulani property and I had the feeling of sensationj overload. My 10 year-old daughter discribed it as "chaotic." I think the Ko Olina Beach Club has struck the right balance--Kids activities galore, family-friendly pools but without the constant blaring of music and scripted activities that we observed at the Aulani. That said, it's worth walking through both the Aulani and JW properties. At the JW, check out the salt-water ornamental pools on their property--rife with manta ray, tropical fish and even some hammer-head sharks. It's a well appointed property. A free shuttle service which runs every 30 minutes gos from the Ko Olina Beach Club, to the Marina, to the golf course, to the Aulani and to the JW. All of the Ko Olina properties are about 40 minutes fron Honolulu and the Waikiki scene. It's set amidst the arid southwestern coast, but the grounds immediately around the Ko Olina properties have been manicured, landscaped, and watered to help you overlook the natural aridness of the surrounding environs. Nearby are a Safeway and Target; a Walmart recently opened up as well but we didn't make it there so I don't know if it carries groceries. More adjacent to Ko Olina is an mexican sit-down taco restaurant, a Hawaiian BBQ joint, and an upscale ABC market. The free shuttle used to go to this complex but the driver told us that they no longer stop there. Other recommendations while on Oahu--sea kayak at Lanakai/Kailua Beach Park (the water there is turqoise and absolutely stunning); eat at Boots and Kimo's; snorkel at Electric Beach (near Ko Olina); attend Ko Olina's Monday night Torch Lighting ceremony (the chief is great!) and try some lychees. It's pricey to stay here, but I think it's worth it. Adults will come back rejuvenated and kids will have losts of great memories. We've stayed at a variety of properties on Kauai, Oahu and the Big Island, and this is our favorite.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent alternative to Waikiki”
Reviews.Author: Archi-Traveler72
Reviews.Content: As a resident of Oahu, sometimes we need a stay-cation away from the congestion of Honolulu and Ko`Olina is as close to what the doctor ordered without going to the North Shore. Ko`Olina feels more like South or West Maui than Oahu if you can block out the fact that the power plant and oil refineries are nearby. Ko'Olina is a resort unto itself now with the JW Marriott, DIsney Aulani and the Marriott Vacation Club but still lacks alternative dining and shopping options outside of the hotels. We've stayed at the JW a number of times and while very nice, it's not as perfect for families. The vacation club on the otherhand is exactly built for families large and small. There are 3 towers, none of which are far from the ocean or pool's edge. The lobby has a modern Hawaiian flair to it but the rest of the buildings and rooms are pretty generic for the Vacation Club family of properties. Rooms are comfortably appointed including full kitchen, 42" TV and decent sized lanai. My suggestion would be to not spend money for the ocean view upgrades unless that's really important to you. Mountain views are fine on floors 5 and above and you'll likely be spending more time awake outside of the room than in! The pools really shine here - even better in my opinion than at the Maui Marriott. A tunnel water slide and cave/waterfall pool on one end, an adult pool for a more quieter atmosphere and a young keiki pool that has a terrific faux-sand beach and bottom with 18" deep water. Absolutely perfect for the littlest kids and babies. For dining, there's a decent but expensive steak/seafood restaurant and the more casual "Longboards". The food is not worthy of the price tags at either. The pool-side keiki menu options are $11 but at least they include a drink and fruit. Poolside service can be sketchy with only 1 waitress per pool. Happy Hour from 3-6 daily offers best deals. As usual, there's plenty of grills which opens up dinner and drink options. The onsite marketplace stocks some grocery items but I'd suggest going to Safeway in Kapolei or the ABC Market wihtin the Ko`Oline Station for best value.
