Staff are very friendly and always say aloha in passing. The valet even remembered my name! This is a very do-it-yourself type of resort which can be nice. They're not pushing you to spend money like hotels but it's still expensive all told - but hey, it's Hawaii! This is a very enjoyable resort for all ages except perhaps for the honeymoon crowd. Aloha.

Reviews.Title: “The best way to relax and see Hawaii for all its beauty”
Reviews.Author: gjscraftygirl
Reviews.Content: A true Hawaiian oasis! Ko'Olina is so serene, quiet, amazing and overall just magestic. You'll find this area to be quite unlike anything that the hustle of bustle Waikiki has to offer. This property is part of the Marriott Vacation Club line of properties that includes at least a kitchenette in each room. While you're here, you can truly be at home. Many of the rooms have full sized kitchens, separate bedrooms, and even living rooms and balconies. For this stay we used Marriott points for one of the smaller rooms. For the two of us it was still comfortable. Several restaurants are on or near the property and include casusal fair (outside along the beach at Longboards - perfect for watching a Hawaiian sunset and enjoying a cold beverage) or you can dine in one of the upscale restaurants for a fine dining experience. You'll find several stores and restaurants outside of the Marriott property in the Ko'Olina resort area including a small grocery store. At the property you'll find 3 wonderful pools and 2 or 3 hot tub lagoons. One large pool has a tunnel waterslide, waterfalls and shallow areas perfect for kids. There is an adult-only pool and jacuzzi, but during our stay, we found that the staff didn't enforce this policy. (One suggestion I would make for the staff is to strictly enforce this. Many adult guests were either annoyed or left the pool areas a couple of times because of kids being present at the adult-only pool.) The property sits on 3 amazing lagoons a perfect area for snorkeling! While you may not see as many fish as other parts of the island while snorkeling, it's great calm water areas to enjoy. If water sports aren't your thing, be sure to grab a seat at one of the many family-friendly Hawaiian activities daily on the property. One night before our dinner at Longboards, we watched a Hawaiian ceremony that took place on the lawn. Great opportunity to bring the family and learn a bit about the culture too. We can't say enough about this resort without writing a book! We absolutely loved this property and all it had to offer. While you're here, be sure to walk around the resort to enjoy all of the beautfiul ammenities of the area. Come and enjoy, but be sure to give yourself plenty of days to relax and get rejuvinated - which this resort will do for you!

Reviews.Title: “a place worthy of praise!”
Reviews.Author: hazel s
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this resort. The location was just perfect. The kids loved the beach and the pool. We had a 2 bedroom villa and it was very spacious. Would definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful and family friendly”
Reviews.Author: made2worship
Reviews.Content: We just came back from Oahu and this hotel/condo had impressed us. We have been to many other hotels in Hawaii. Nice calm beach, fun pool for kids and everyone. The rooms we stayed were 1 bedroom with full kitchen. Very nice size and we felt really relaxed. They provide beach chairs with no additional charge. The area which the hotel located was peaceful, compared to Waikiki. Within the community you can find a small supermarket by ABC Stores. Will recommend and will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking”
Reviews.Author: Traveler95340
Reviews.Content: I'm so glad I stayed here. Got a 2 bedroom villa overlooking the ocean. I love that it's away from the crowd. It was quietly secluded from everything else. I love that it's near the beach and I can walk down to it. It also has 4 kid friendly lagoons. The only downer is that we had to drive at least 30 mins to get to any destination. We spent a lot of time on the road. However, because of it's beautiful scenery and quietness away from the tourist area, I'd come back and stay here. Make sure you rent a car otherwise you're stuck at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay was too short”
Reviews.Author: readytogoJapan
Reviews.Content: We were here as guests of a friend who had traded for a week..but could not use some of the days. So we broke up our Waikiki stay with a couple days here. It is a nice place. Room was fine..although you do have to clean up after yourselves if you are on the timeshare. Had a nice sunset view from our mini-balcony. Lots of pools and jacuzzis. On one evening, the people at one jacuzzi were quite noisy and while I was looking unhappy at the prospect, an employee came over, and guided us to the jacuzzi right next to the Longboard bar/restaurant. So we sat in that..listened to the live music and watched the sun set. Nice..and those noisy people over at that other jacuzzi didn't know what they were missing. (Note: I think there are at least half a dozen jacuzzis) Lots of pools-- we tended to stay where there were no children. The kids seemed to be having a great time in other pools though..nice for families. The lagoon beach was hot..no shade. You can pay for a cabana type seat..but the whole beach was otherwise uncovered. In the lagoon, my husband was snorkeling, and he came to inform me that there were turtles there.. So I had to go take a look..this was pretty exciting--- to see them right up close. Used the washing machine to catch up on laundry (free). Very convenient. We used the gas grill to grill steak..and lots of other people were out there as well, but we didn't wait long and everyone was friendly. The restaurants looked busy but we did not eat there. We did get juice and yogurt at the supermarket 10 minutes away..As another person mentioned, food prices are high compared to the mainland, oh well. Got our steak at Costco which was really busy but we got out pretty quickly. The grounds are so immaculate it left me wondering when they take care of them. I never saw a gardener or anyone doing anything..do they garden at 3 a.m.? Maybe they do not do that on weekends.. Someone is working hard, because there is barely a leaf out of place. Pretty much everyone appears to be relaxed and enjoying themselves. There was a ceremony in the evening..something like "torch lighting" .. with a plug for the next night's luau. It was fun, the guy was humorous..I recommend you take your family to the grassy area for that.. Husband used the gym..which was top class. He gave it a thumbs up--and he is a gym rat. Employees around the property seemed friendly and everyone works to make sure the guests are enjoying themselves. We did not use the "visit our desk" coupon --avoided the timeshare sales people. They do need to improve the parking lot. Too close between cars, difficult to get in with a large car, and I can see dented doors would be a problem often. Parking lot needs a re-design. Add a foot between parking spaces. Overall, I think just about everyone will enjoy themselves..but we did not pay for this stay, so I cannot comment on value/prices. So nice to have friends who offered us this place.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Sherry L
Reviews.Content: Everything about this resort is amazing....rooms, view, the staff. If I ever come to Hawaii again I won't leave the resort, Felt ripped off everywhere but here.

Reviews.Title: “We love Ko Olina!”
Reviews.Author: Valerie E
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Ko Olina on a timeshare exchange during the month of September 2011. We have been dreaming about it ever since! In fact, we are going to have a hard time staying at any other hotel while in Hawaii, and we have stayed at some wonderful places in the past. We traded our 2 bedroom villa in Palm Springs for a single hotel room overlooking the pool/ocean and it was well worth it! The room was spacious and clean and we didn't find there was much noise (at least, not to the point of disruptive) coming from the pool area. We enjoyed many of the restaurants on the property, in particular Longboards, where we never had a problem getting a table with a beautiful view of the lagoon. Even though we knew the hotel was likely at max capacity, we never felt that it was overcrowded and often enjoyed sitting on the beach feeling like we were the only ones there. Our favorite thing to do was get up early, grab a coffee at the on-site Starbucks, and walk the path between the three resort hotels. The resort area was only about a 20 minute drive north of Honolulu, and we felt it was reasonably located to anything we wanted to do on the island while giving us the relaxing experience we wouldn't get if staying in Waikiki. We still easily visited Diamond Head and North Shore, although we were always happy to get back to our little paradise at Ko Olina. While I have to admit that Oahu used to be my least favorite island (being from San Diego, Honolulu reminded me a little too much of the hustle and bustle of home), we can now say that we will likely stay at Ko Olina for every future trip to Hawaii. I have a feeling we will be disappointed if we end up anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Ko Olina means "Place of Joy" and it really is!”
Reviews.Author: PSUmama
Reviews.Content: Just spent 6 amazing days at the Ko Olina Beach Club on Oahu. We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite in the last and newest of 3 the buildings (Hale Nai'i)with a mountain view using Marriott points (opted for the mountain view to have 2 BR vs ocean view for 1 BR for similar amount of points). Our suite was beautiful! It was a single entry 2BR with a full kitchen, King beds in each BR with 2 additional pull-out sofas (which we didn't use), which afforded our family of 4 plenty of room. We looked at the Ko Olina marina with the mountains beyond and the ocean was visible to our right. There is an industrial complex in the view line, but we spent very little time in the room, so for us the extra space was well worth the minimal sacrifice of the mountain view. The grounds of the hotel were gorgeous! There was never a problem getting a lounger at the pool or beach and the lagoons were great for swimming and snorkeling.The full kitchen allowed us to stock up on beverages, snacks and breakfast and lunch foods and we even made dinner one night using the abundant gas grills on the property! We ate at Longboards and Chuck's on the property and both were wonderful. The staff was so friendly and accommodating and everyone we met: staff, local people enjoying the lagoons, and other visitors shared their "aloha"! Although time share representatives were available if you were so inclined, we recieved one message on our phone from them and were never bothered again (we did not opt to return the call) and we never saw them on the resort grounds or in the buildings during our stay. We also at Roy's located at he adjacent golf course and it too was terrific! The Ko Olina area is so relaxed and serene but it is only a short drive to waikiki. There is a walkway along the four lagoons and each resort basically has their own lagoon. Next to the beach club is the Ko Olina Beach Villas which looked very nice but seemed pretty empty, the Aulani (Disneys new resort) which is huge and I actually preferred the grounds of the Beach, and finally the JW Marriott which is a more full service, hotel room style resort. I highly recommend Ko Olina Beach Club! We also stayed at the Marriott ocean club in maui the following week, and it too was beautiful but I missed Ko Olina! I hope to return very very soon! The also resort hosts a luau called Fia Fia, which we did not attend, but we did watch the preview they had prior to the actual show and it looked wonderful! Just remember it is a cross between a full service resort and a time share property so some full service resort features may not be readily available (for example we self parked our car, brought our own luggage to room) but we actually prefer calling our own shots and coming and going as we please so for us, this is a plus!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable place on Oahu”
Reviews.Author: SCSweendaddy
Reviews.Content: This is one of three hotels we stayed in during our week in Oahu and we liked it the best. Brought my wife and 8 yr.old son and they stayed at resort while I worked for a few days. Hotel is away from congestion of Honolulu but convenient to all highways. I was working in Waipau and found it very convenient. Ko Olina is a new area and the area inbetween here and city is growing rapidly. The Place: Facility and grounds are beautiful. Pools are fun with a slide, caves and waterfalls. Our son had a great time and missed this place when we moved on. There wern't a lot of kids during our stay but we were there mid-week before school let out for the summer so maybe that changes. However, there were several kid friendly activities scheduled during the day so there was lots to do. Nice walking path between the group of coves that connect Ko Olina hotels and coves. The Food: We only at at Longboards down by the beach but the breakfast buffet and dinners were very good. Once we got past the sticker shock (everything in Hawaii is expensive) we really enjoyed it. Breakfast buffet was hot and had a good selection. Lunch/Dinner had good selection and the fish sandwich was outstanding. Good variety of beer on tap as well. Room: Very nice. We did the one bedroom suite which has plenty of room for the three of us. Sinks in two seperate rooms were great but having the toilet and shower so close was a little crowding. Full kitchen was nice. Rom was quiet and had a nice marina/cove view. Grounds etc.: Excellent landscaping. Open lobby design was interesting and daily market downstairs was fine. Gym area was great and locker rooms were first rate. Very clean. Staff: Always friendly and very helpful. Decided to stick with valet parking ($30 per day either way) and it was handy to have them get the car. They always had it there by the time I got down from the room. Concierge was very helpful as we moved on to the North Shore - recommending the more scenic route and giving us a few tips for our time up there. So, all in all I would certainly recommend this resort. If you are staying for a full week, then a run to the market for food and drinks would be recommended - but groceries are expensive so don't expect too much savings. We comparred this to the Aulani (Disney resort) and were glad we saved the money by choosing this resort. My wife and son went into Aulani and said there really wasn't that much of a difference and actually preferred the Marriott in a couple of areas.

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful stay at Ko Olina”
Reviews.Author: lithper
Reviews.Content: We are Owners at this timeshare property. My wife and I just got back from a wonderful week in the O'ahu paradise of Marriott's Ko Olina Beach Club, We have stayed there 3 times before and have always found it to be a delight. The lagoons are terrific for swimming and easy snokeling, and this timeframe (May) does not have many children at the resort. The Fia Fia luau was awonderful show, the food was decent, and the Chief was the best! On our first days there, we were sick, from some bad food on the plane, and the folks at the resort took great care of us. Tina, at the concierge desk, found us medical help, and checked with us during the week to see how we were doing. We walked up to the new Disney Aulani resort to see what impact it might be having on the traffic and other resort resources, and I'm glad to say that it looks like it is being handled well. It's very different from the Ko Olina Beach Club. The Ko Olina Beach club is not as "busy" architechurally and is much more nicely landscaped. After two days of dark room illness, we were able to get out and make up for lost time. We visited a number of the acheologically significant sites on the island, and took in a lot of musical events. We also went up Tantalus Drive to see the scenic overlook of Honolulu, and that is well worth the drive up the mountainside. Northcoast is still great for snorkeling, and the Romy's Shrimp Truck is still a delicious place to stop for lunch. We took some friends with us this time, and they loved it. They were looking forward to a nice relaxing time, and they found everything they needed. Hope to return to Ko Olina Beach Club again in a couple of years.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful escape from Waikiki”
Reviews.Author: Sonja M
Reviews.Content: We started in Waikiki, and stumbled across this hotel while at a luau at Paradise Cove. We moved to this side of the island the very next morning. Our room was spacious and comfortable. I wish we had had a better view, but we could hear and smell the ocean, so that was nice. The grounds were impeccable and I found myself taking a lot of quiet walks at sunrise just soaking it all in. The beach area & pool was nice, and the poolside/beachside service was a nice added touch. It actually made me wish my kids were with us! This is definantly a family atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort!”
Reviews.Author: TiffanyGIlkey
Reviews.Content: The landscape and resort grounds are breathtaking! There is a beach/ poolside restaurant and bar open for breakfast, lunch & dinner. There is a steak & seafood restaurant that serves only dinner and an additional poolside bar. The kitchens in the villa are smaller than most 3 bedroom villas that we've stayed in but it worked fine for us. We had a stunning view of the ocean and overlooking the pool. There is no kids club to leave the little ones with but there are some kids activities available. The resort is in a nice resort community which is near the marina too. I overall enjoyed our stay here and would recommend it to anyone considering vacationing on this side of Oahu!

Reviews.Title: “Ask if there is construction or if they value platinum members!”
Reviews.Author: Pjnickle
Reviews.Content: Just checked in to Marriott ko olani vacation club on Oahu. Would not recommend so far. Here at 3 and no room available. We are reminded check-in is at 4 and though hubby's a platinum member ('cause he lives in their hotels practically),  no upgrade and no early check in. Okay, so we eat while we wait. Phone call on cell notifying room is ready at 3:58 . K so rick stands in line 20 minutes for check in. Elevator up displays a sign saying construction from 8am till 5 pm. We call from our room and are told this is all they have. Guess we will enjoy our view of the parking lot and road and we don't need a wakeup call either.  Marriott is slipping, my daughter and I were treated vey rudely at Marriott in Maui too at front desk  Ricks decided to switch to Sheraton much better experience with them on this vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Time in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Dennis J
Reviews.Content: I've owned a unit here in Ko'Olina for 8 years. This destination continues to be awe inspiring for those coming to Hawaii. The resort is beautiful, away for the congestion of Honolulu with a 20 minute drive to anywhere on the island. Quality of the units are top level as you would expect in a Marriott property. The only issue that remains and has been since we bought is the food availability on site. Having only a top of the line Steak House and a small restaurant on the water is frustrating. At Longboards, (medium priced)On any given night, you can expect a 1-2 hour wait to be seated. Granted, within a 10 minute drive there is another 1/2 dozen eateries available. It just seems like no consideration has been given to improving the situation here. Otherwise, you'll enjoy a piece of paradise

Reviews.Title: “One week in paradise”
Reviews.Author: Tigs33Calgary
Reviews.Content: My husband and I rented a one bedroom villa ocean view for a week in may 2012. The room was clean and fully equipped with everything we needed. It was just like being at home but in paradise. The pools were great, we loved the reflection pool as it was quiet and very relaxing. This resort is away from the Waikiki craziness. We will definitely be going back again! I would recommend this resort to anyone who wants to relax and have a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise at its best on Oahu”
Reviews.Author: Cats-Eyes5cats
Reviews.Content: If you want to get away from the hustle bustle of downtown Honolulu and Waikiki then this is the escape for you and your family. My husband and I were very impressed with the amenities, location, and ambience that this resort has to offer for families or just a romantic getaway. Great private beach, great pools, great service. From the moment we walked into the lobby until the time we left we felt welcomed. We recommend this resort to everyone, whether it be a hotel-type room or a villa. On-site parking is a little pricey and check out time is a little early (10am) but overall very very good.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott's Ko Olina, JW Marriott, Disney Aulani...”
Reviews.Author: realworldtraveler09
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from a great vacation at the Marriott Ko Olina Beach Club. This is a wonderful resort. We stayed in a 2 bedroom in the new Hale Nai Tower. This really is a fantastic resort if you are looking for a beautiful setting with fantastic sunsets and a more quite environment away from hustle and bustle of Waikiki. When I first looked at the online pictures of the man made lagoons along the coast of Ko Olina I wondered if they would be very nice. Take my word for it the online pictures do not do this beach justice. These quaint lagoons are fantastic for swimming and even a little snorkeling. While the fish are not that colorful in the lagoons it is good calm place for beginners to snorkel and see some fish and even a few turtles if you are lucky. There are plenty of other places on the Island for better snorkeling and more colorful fish. One of the things that I really liked about this location was the sidewalks that ran along the beach from the harbor in the south to the JW Marriott in the north. This is a great walk any time of the day but especially in the early morning and the late evening. The Ko Olina is far superior to the JW Marriott. The pool at the JW is tiny I think that the JW needs a serious makeover. The Ko Olina on the other hand is absolutely beautiful. the lush grounds with waterfalls, ponds filed with koi fish and many swimming pools are stunning. I really enjoyed the hot tub near our tower. I could sit in the hot tub and see the beautiful cove for hours. I miss that view. The rooms are very nice and the service was superb at this resort. Many guests will leave their boogie boards or swim items that they purchased at the first of their week for others to use when they depart. Check the bins near the towel booths before buying any items for free items. The beaches that you can easily walk to near the resort are on the rocky side and not suitable for surfing or boogie boarding but the lagoons are perfect for swimming. The closest beach for surfing and boogie boarding is only about 15 to 20 minutes away called White Plains Beach. Many locals at this beach. You can even take surf lessons at this beach. There is a nice Luau offered at this resort. Kind of pricy. We have seen many luaus so we passed on this one. If you have a room that overlooks the pools you can watch the Luau from your room balcony. You can also watch if from many of the public balconies in the main lobby or even by walking along the beach. Of course you won't get any dinner :(. But if you have never seen a Luau and don't want to pay the price you can see much of it for free if desired. The walk to the Disney's Aulani resort is worth your time. The Aulani grounds look like a Disney theme park. While it is very nice I think that the Ko Olina grounds are more beautiful. One thing that I did like about the Aulani was their man made snorkeling reef called Rainbow Reef. They only allow guests staying at Aulani to use this and they charge their own guests an additional fee. There is a viewing area where you can see under the water and the many colorful fish in the south end of Rainbow Reef. There are a couple of chairs there and a nice place to take some pictures without getting wet. It is like looking into a very large salt water aquarium. The water is crystal clear. The JW Marriot is the right next door to Aulani and they share the same lagoon. The JW was very disappointing. I thought it would have been much nicer. I kept looking for the REAL swimming pool but they only have the one very small pool for a resort that size it needs a serious makeover. Staying at the Ko Olina is a MUCH better choice. Here is link to the resorts in Ko Olina. http://www.koolina.com/explore/interactive-map There is a nice water park only five minutes away called Wet and Wild. While this water park is fairly small it is very nice and has some very good variety of rides. If you like water parks this is worth your time. If you plan to go there do so your FIRST day and the rest of the week and the next 51 weeks are free. It is the same price for one day or the year. Wish I would have known that the first day. This place is a bit pricy about $45 per person for adults so if you go two days it cuts your price in half. This place is so close the resort you can get there in about 5 minutes. The lines are small and the variety of rides makes this a very nice water park. They don't allow you to bring in your own food but you can easily walk to your car and eat lunch or drive back to the resort eat and return it is so close. One other option is just drive two minutes to Costco for a cheap lunch it is only 3 minutes away. If you are planning on going more than one day pay the extra $10 for a parking pass for the year. Parking is $7.00 per day. Costco is at the same exit as the Water park in Kapolie. There you can find a nice movie theater, fast food, restaurants, Wal Mart, Safeway etc... This is all only about 5 to 7 minutes from Ko Olina. Ko Olina is located on the dry side of the Island but the lush grounds beautiful sunsets make this an ideal setting. When you travel on the Island to the North Shore or Waikiki be sure and avoid rush hour times. The traffic can be very congested at those times. You can easily see much of the Island in only a week. Pearl Harbor is best visited early morning be there by 7:30 am. The USS Arizona memorial is free. The submarine and the USS Missouri are worth the added costs. The Dole Pineapple plantation is a nice place to visit and get some pineapple ice cream. Sharks reef on the North Shore is a great place to snorkel without the crowds. We really loved snorkeling here. The Polynesian Cultural Center is a very nice place to visit near the North Shore. While there drive to see the Mormon Temple it is a beautiful building. The mountains north of Honolulu have some impressive vistas of the city. There is nice waterfall called Manoa Falls not far from Honolulu well worth the hike. The cost for parking is $5.00 the hike is moderate through tropical jungle like conditions. Over all I have to say we loved our stay on this Island and at this resort. The Ko Olina area also has a beautiful Golf Course. Mahalo.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Resort with Pathetic Service”
Reviews.Author: teethfortravel
Reviews.Content: I am a Marriott Gold Elite Member and choose to stay at Marriott Hotels and Resorts because they are consistently great hotels with great service. I stay at various Marriott properties throughout the world 20-30 nights/ year. This Marriott experience was the worst I have had. The resort location and presentation are amazing. The lagoon is meticulously clean, the pools are perfectly heated and clean, and the grounds are gorgeous. The rooms are beautiful and the furniture is very nice. I have been all over the world and have never seen such beautiful sunsets as I did from the balcony of this resort! Longboards restaurant has some good food and is conveniently located at the edge of the lagoon which makes for some beautiful, romantic moments while eating. The Exercise facility is very nice and the small store on site is expensive, but very convenient. The service had this hotel was pathetic. I was extremely disappointed with the Marriott Ko Olina Beach Club for several reasons. When we checked in it was obvious that they had given our room away to another guest. I booked my 2 bedroom suite with 1 King Bed and 2 Double beds 4 months prior to our arrival. When we arrived, we were told that our room had 2 King beds. With the number of people in our party, that was not sufficient. The Front Desk Attendant showed very little concern for our circumstance and said that the only option was to purchase another room at $600/night or to have people sleep on the floor. She explained that the additional room was the last room available due to the hotel being sold out. Upon having our luggage and personal things taken to our room by the bellman, my wife's expensive jacket was lost. When we called the Front Desk to report it missing, very little concern was shown...No apology, No reassurance that they would attempt to locate it. We filled out a report and were never notified of it being found until WE made a call 3 days later to ask about it! We woke up the first morning and took off to discover the north side of the island. When we came back, we were disappointed to find that our room hadn't been cleaned. When I called to inquire, the Front Desk person asked "Oh! Do you want your room cleaned every day?". Once againg, there was NO apology or explanation given. When you are spending several hundreds of dollars per night you have expectations. Having a clean room is a very minimum expectation that is even met at cheap hotels like a Super 8. Another really frustrating aspect of this hotel is that you have to deal with the pool towel nazis. You have to check out pool towels every day from a towel hut. My kids love to swim all day. The towel hut closes at 6pm, but the pool stays open much later. Therefore, if you would like to continue to swim past the early hour of 6pm, then you get to dry off with a wet towel. Then you have to take your wet towels back to your room and then back down to the towel hut the next morning. If you don't return your towels, then they charge you $25 per towel. Once again the towel attendants were rude and unhelpful. I wondered if I was the only one that noticed the poor service, but in discussions with other guests I discovered that many others felt the same without any solicitation on my part. In conclusion, this resort is amazingly beautiful with very nice rooms, lobby and facilities, but the service is one of the worst experiences I have ever had. The management of this resort does not deserve to work for Marriott. Their vision is not in line with what is expected of the Marriott brand.

Reviews.Title: “Wow - a real family paradise ...”
Reviews.Author: MekkTekk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 5 nights and were travelling with our 2 young children (2 and 6). We had plans to visit various attractions on the island but skipped several of them because after we got here - we thought “what could be better than relaxing here?” Service was good overall – we did not really need a lot of service since the place is more of a self serve / time share owner type resort. The folks we did encounter were almost always friendly and helpful. At these resorts, there always seem to be a few pool staff that are “too cool” to be friendly. Room – we had a 1 bedroom suite with the full kitchen. Room was very clean, very spacious and very well appointed. It was as good or better than the pictures. We were assigned a 3rd floor room (lowest) facing the parking lot. The front desk said they were full and this was the best room they could give us. The staff at kid’s club confirmed they were definitely were not full – she said it was really quiet relative to spring break 2 weeks earlier. So I would agree with other reviewers that they put non-owners in the worst rooms. Minor issue for us – was still a great room. Resort Common Areas – there are so many nice areas in this resort. The lobby, the pool areas, the walkways, the gardens, the beach – you could just plop down and enjoy your surroundings just about anywhere. Pool – there were 3 great pools at the resort. Two pools fronted buildings 1 and 2. A family pool with a huge shallow area and a beach entrance using fake sand (easy clean). And a “quiet” pool – I suppose for adults only. And third pool fronted building 3. This one was family and young adult friendly with a water slide, waterfall tunnel, music playing and a swim up bar. Water temperature in all the pools was perfect (I sometimes find the pools too cold). There were 1 or more hot tubs at each pool. Beach – the man made lagoon was the highlight of the resort for us. Calm waves was perfect for the kids. You could do some snorkeling near the rocks but not too many fish to see. Setting is just awesome – especially at sunset. Activities – these were pretty limited. Some fish feeding, lei making, yoga, etc. A few were free, many had fees that were reasonable. Welcome event on Monday was fun (also with Chief Seilu from the luau). They do not have half day long camps for kids. Location – resorts is in an isolated gated community. Only three other resorts here – Disney, JW Marriot and Beach Villas. There is a golf course with lots of luxury townhomes surrounding the area as well. The suburban town of Kapolei is 5 minutes drive down the highway where you can find lots of strip malls with Target, Safeway, Costco, Walmart and the usual host of shops and restaurants. You may want to plan your outings to Honolulu or the east side of the island (e.g. Hanauma Bay) around rush hour. Traffic around Honolulu can be terrible. No problems getting to the north shore. Dining - We only ate at Longboards once - was OK. Did not eat at Chucks. We cooked and ate in our rooms frequently since we had young kids or ate outside the resort when we ventured out to attractions. Fia Fia Luau – I highly recommend this luau. It’s so convenient being right in the resort. The host, Chief Seilu, and his team are very funny and entertaining. Chief did a great job balancing culture, stand up comedy and his own personal experiences to make the show truly memorable. Buffet was good and they even had some children’s food like spaghetti and meatballs, chicken strips, etc. Tip: The seating is first come first serve based in when you make the reservation! Call a week before to get a front row seat. You can cancel 24 hours before if you change your mind. Check out time was 10am but our flight did not leave until evening. No problem – we put our bags in the car and front desk gave us a key to the locker rooms near the family pool. The locker rooms were clean, had private showers and fresh towels. So we enjoyed a full day at the beach, showered up and caught our flight fully refreshed. We definitely want to come back to the Ko Olina area and to this resort. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly suprised”
Reviews.Author: bitbuster
Reviews.Content: My best experience in Oahu has been staying at the Kahala Hotel. This trip I stayed at the Ko Olina Beach club, which is less expensive than Kahala, but like everything in Hawaii, it still expensive. The good news is that I was pleasantly surprised! The staff was very friendly and let me chek into m room early. The grounds were beautiful with a lovely beach cove and several pools to include a family and adult area (more quiet). Food is average, but the service was excellent with great tropical drinks. The bar restaurant is a great place to watch the sunset. The room was clean with a kitchenette. The only complaint I have is the Internet access is horrific, which may seem insignificant for vacationers, but I was on business. Overall, when I travel through Hawaii again, I will return to Ko Olina Beach Club.

Reviews.Title: “Ko Olina comfort”
Reviews.Author: Vettman860
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in a beautiful two bedroom unit with some good friends in early May. This is a top notch resort with some great views of the coast if you have that type of a room. Since this is a volcanic area of Oahu the developer cut in 4 large lagons with beautiful sandy beaches, which were great for swiming. No surfing at these beaches however there are plenty of surfing beaches just a few miles up the coast. We ate at the beachside cafe a couple of nights, but found a varity of other restuarants at all prices nearby that we enjoyed. This is a great place for families with children as the pools and beach are geared for them.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Property”
Reviews.Author: jaynic_09
Reviews.Content: Words cannot describe how gorgeous the property is. We reserved a room with an ocean view knowing very well that “mountain view” often equals “parking lot view”. We were very happy with our decision as any room with a mountain view would have cheapened the overall experience. We stayed here for a week. The hotel itself was about 1/3 full which made it perfect. However, we couldn’t help but notice that even at the low occupancy, the pools felt cramped. Although beautiful, the layout of the pool area was not made for those that like to tan or read a book. Unless, you like to get wet by kids in the pool or bumped by people walking. We couldn’t imagine staying here during the busy time of the year. It would be an absolute zoo. We stayed in the newest building. They were still completing some of the building so not all the rooms were open. Construction on the final building just started when we arrived. We could hear some noise but nothing that bothered us. However, it was very early in the construction. The area is still in development so in 5 or so years we expect this to be a wonderful vacation spot. For example, don’t expect to see much when you snorkel in the lagoon. The coral is still growing so the fish is minimal at best. You MUST have a rental car to get around unless you are willing to pay for mediocre yet expensive food. Overall, we loved our stay and would come again but only doing the slower seasons. We are going to give the location a few more years to grow before we head back but it is definitely a place to treasure.

Reviews.Title: “GORGEOUS!”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan F
Reviews.Content: Quite, private and absolutely beautiful! This is the perfect location to unwind and catch up on some well needed R & R. Whether you're at one of the pools or the private lagoon, the resort is straight out of paradise!

Reviews.Title: “Not the Hawaii experience we hoped for”
Reviews.Author: hawaiihome
Reviews.Content: Echoling other reviews, guest reception was not friendly or helpful; prices at property are too high, room was smelly and very poorly laid out. Like others, we traded a high end property, assured that Ko'Olina would be comparable--it is NOT. Examples-bathroom shower door opens onto the toilet...meaning you have to straddle the toilet to close the shower door to dry and dress. Kitchen has NO storage for pantry items. Guest bathroom is a joke (I almost felt like we should offer to reimburse our guests for coming with us, I was so embarrassed). View--if you like parking lots, it's great. I personally feel cheated and lied to. We will NOT participate in the sales pitch--thank you other reviewers--I don't need yet another reason to despise this place. Safe to say--will NOT be back. It's also a loud property--too many people (and more towers are under construction), not enough pool chairs around the pools, and noisy cars/radios. A luxury property it is not.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Lifejeep
Reviews.Content: Reserved Ocean View room with before lunch check in. Checked in at 8 am and were told they would call when the room was ready. No call. Came back at 4 pm to find we had been assigned a room with pool view and wheel chair accessible shower. We have small children and needed a bathtub. Randy the manager informed us because of the way the land has been deeded all rooms are considered ocean view. Dishonesty is a deal breaker for us. We chose to change hotels. Consider staying at the JW Marriott. The rooms are much larger, up to date and the staff helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location other than thhe at.......”
Reviews.Author: vrrooom
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a 1 BR unit (overlooking the parking lot ie no view) for a large number of points. As a lifetime platinum level member, I was very disappointed by the staffs reception of a high level quest. The Beach is great, and the ability to wander around the area paths was great. Theasales pitch for the timeshares was hard, but the financial deal was terrible. The timeshares were reselling at a 50% discount at the same time they were pushing full price.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Joanne Q
Reviews.Content: We travelled from Australia and we just loved this resort.We did stay in Waikiki but wished we had know about Ko Olina before our stay in Waikiki .It was just beautiful the ocean cove to swim in won us{ sandy bottom no rocks} the pools great to.We had no problem with service .very accommodating and our condo was good and very clean.And its an easy 15min drive to the outlet shops also good size food shopping market about 7 min down the road .We will be back .

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort, but prices and time share sales pitches make it hard to give it 5 stars.”
Reviews.Author: Stan1541
Reviews.Content: The location is great. Off the beaten path, but to be honest, you spend as much time driving from this resort to attractions on the Island as you do dealing with Waikiki traffic so its really not a draw back. The pools are very nice. They have a kids pool with a sandy beach. The ocean coves are also very nice, though the "man-made" aspect did detract from the snorkeling and wave riding. Service was okay, not as good as other Marriott properties. Additionally, the time share pitches come from EVERY person you talk to. Having stayed at many Marriott Vacation Clubs, this was the most I've ever gotten. Even the concerige's recommendations were biased. I asked for information on a dive boat and all i got was a time share sales pitch on how my dive boat could be free.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious, Divine Experience”
Reviews.Author: Jordanskills134
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Marriot Ko Olina Beach Club was nothing below amazing. The hotel is a complete get-away from all of the hustle / bustle of Waikiki. Activities are endless at the resort and are sure to keep anyone content. The main amenity that we had used at the resort was the pool area, and let me tell you there are three different pool areas, and a total of seven hot tubs. Children are sure to have a great time at this resort because one of the pools had a huge cave with numerous waterfalls. One even had a water slide, which was exhilarating, but closed early (5pm). Our short stay started on Friday, May 4th and ended on Sunday May 6th. Other amenities that came in handy was the 24 hour fitness center and the Sauna / Steam rooms. The family pool area had locker rooms, where you can rent your own locker for twenty five dollars a day. We stayed in the two bedroom suite that had three bathrooms, one kitchen, a living room, and a dining table. The room was a little outdated, but we were barely there so it wasn't much of a bother. One thing that was a bit of a con was food options that were available at the resort. Food is extremely expensive, so if you are not the one to spend over $20+ on an entree, then this isn't the place to partake in restaurants. Employees were extremely kind for the most part and surprisingly during our stay, the pool did not close, so we were there until about 1am. All in all this was a very short stay, but it was an amazing experience and we will be sure to be back in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Could be 5 star but missed the boat!”
Reviews.Author: IrieCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Beautiful setting. Exactly the picture you would have of Hawaii! However, the people at the desk are very unaccommodating...even if you are an owner. When we arrived we were disappointed that our condo looked nothing like what we bought and also had an awful smell. Instead of moving us, they came and changed the air filters. Yuck! The food on the premises is overpriced and not very tasty. Would I come again? Possibly because I know in advance what to ask for.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing resort away from the hustle of Waikiki”
Reviews.Author: John_and_Seth
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Marriott Ko Olina Beach Club after spending one night at the Marriott Waikiki Beach. We were supposed to stay in Waikiki the entire 4 nights but this was my partner's first trip to Oahu and we realized that the Marriott in Waikiki wasn't really a resort and we didn't want to be in the middle of the Waikiki scene. I have probably been to Oahu 8 times over the past 15 years but have never been to the Ko Olina area so was a little nervous about moving to the Marriott Beach Club. However, once we took the Ko Olina exit off the H1 I could immediately tell that we made a good decision. Ko Olina is a master planned community. There are 4 resorts (including the JW Marriott and the new Disney hotel). The grounds are perfect and it seems like it's a world away from the buzz off Waikiki. Just note that rush hour traffic on Oahu is from 530am to 9am and from 330pm to 6pm. I would highly advise that you stay off the highways at that time unless you enjoy bumper to bumper traffic. We were debating on staying at the Marriott Beach Club or the JW Marriott. I typically prefer JW Marriott as they are nicer but am glad that we chose the Beach Club. Note, the Beach Club is a Marriott Vacation (aka Time Share) destination. So most of the guests are owners but they still rent rooms and villas when the units are not occupied. This was not like any time share I have ever seen. Not once did they even mention the time shares to us. I went to Mexico last year and was approached 4 times during a 5 night stay at a nice resort to attend their sales presentation. Not once did that happen at the Marriott Beach Club. We rented a 1 bedroom villa which was huge. I wasn't a big fan of the decor, it reminded me of a retirement community but it was still very nice and spacious. We had a mountain view room which was actually nicer than I expected (ever other view I had on our 12 day Hawaii vacation was ocean so it was nice to see the mountains). The hotel has a lot of great pools, including an adults only / quiet pool. We only ate on property once at Chuck's and I would not recommend it. In fact, it was the worst food we had on our entire trip. Roy's is right across the street and is amazing for about the same price. So skip Chuck's and go to Roy's if you want to eat out. We also walked around the JW Marriott and Disney hotel and actually preferred the Marriott Beach Club. Ko Olina has 4 man made lagoons which are probably nice for children to swim in but I would have preferred swimming in the ocean. We tried to snorkel in lagood 2 but the visibility was very poor. Overall, we enjoyed our stay at the Marriott Beach Club and I would recommend it if you are looking for an extended stay resort on Oahu but don't want to be in Waikiki.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation Club”
Reviews.Author: Bassnote1
Reviews.Content: We booked this trip on a special rate as they wanted us to join their Vacation Club. The property is beautiful, clean and well kept up. The beaches on the "lagoons" were easily the cleanest and least crowded on the island. The resort area is very clean and easy to walk around with some amenities close by. There is an ABC store (think C-store on steroids), ice cream shoppe, Asian BBQ and Mexican restaurant in the shopping center just down the road. Many more shops are being built and planned so this will be an nice area in the near future. It's located just over an hour north of the airport (map services all say 20-30 min, HA! more on that in a bit) and out of the way. If you have a car you are about 10 min from Kapolei and all the major brand names: Walmart (brand new!), Safeway, et al. As we were potential clients for the MVC they put us up in a King Studio room on the 15th floor with an ocean view. These are basically a Standard Marriott Room you'd find in a Courtyard or Springhill Suites. The balcony is tiny and you can see, and will be seen by, many others around you so no shenanigans. You'll fall off and/or end up with potentially embarrassing pictures of you on the internet. There is a tent card saying they would only freshen up the room once during the stay and it would cost you extra if you wanted additional freshening or actual cleanings. We learned that this is solely for the MVC members staying there as we got clean towels and freshening daily. A car is almost a necessity at this location as it is a long way to anywhere else on the island. Parking is $30 a day (plus taxes and fees) unless you are a member of the MVC. There are a few things you can do at the near by marina (sunset cruise type things), and the resort does have "daily activities" mostly geared to families and kids. So, unless you are content to sit on the beach and stare at the sun, get a car and see the sights. But! Plan a LOT of extra time to drive anywhere. The traffic on Oahu is horrendous. Waikiki to Ko Olina is a 75 minute drive (one way) the two times we did it and parking is a nightmare! Taxi? $100 - one way. Rent the car. I'll just get up early and jet down there! No, you won't. The "Base Traffic" starts at 4:30 and is bumper to bumper. The people at this resort are typical Marriott quality customer service with a smile types. Friendly, efficient, helpful and fun. A+ on the service. There are two restaurants and a bar on site. All are "resort priced" (lunch was $45 for two of us - burgers and beer) , but the food is really good and in ample supply. You also have a "welcome gift" that will get you 10% off at these and other restaurants in the area like at the JW Marriott just a 10 min stroll down the beach. The pools, beaches, and spa are not that crowded for the time of year we went (mid-April) and we expected a ton of kids (Disney resort next door) but other than a few kids with Grandparents it was a nice, uncrowded stay. We used the hot tubs (made from lava stone! way cool) and they are HOT tubs. Feel around with your hands for the inlets as the water coming out of these is really, really hot and could burn you if you parked your butt in front of it. There is a "all ages" hot tub in one pool, a 16+ in the spa area and two adult only hot tubs. We didn't use the gym, steam rooms or other spa treatments available, but they did look very nice. There are multiple swimming pools with various themes ( the "contemplation pool - shhhhhhh" was intriguing) and were all well kept up. Over all this was a positive experience aside from the traffic flow on the island. The MVC is not for My Bride or meownself, but we can see the sense in it for people who travel on a regular basis or several times year and don't mind being at the center of things. We are "off the beaten path" people and they don't grow Marriott Hotels in most of the places we go: yet.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing property in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: spokanecougar
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel, the property is beautiful and very well maintained with lots of flowers and palm trees and beautiful big pools. We arrived at 2am after United Airlines showed us why they are the worst airline on the planet and got us into Hawaii 18 hours late and the people at the desk were FANTASTIC and seeing how tired we obviously were quickly got us checked in and on our way. We had a great view of the ocean, although I asked for a room on the top floor we were only on the 6th floor of a 16 floor building, but that was about the only drawback I had with this place. The rooms were nice and it looked like Marriott is undergoing a re-model of the rooms as half the tower we stayed in was closed (and we never once heard any noise from the workers). As for the parking situation and the price for it, if these people who are complaining about this did just little research before coming to Hawaii they would have seen that EVERY SINGLE HOTEL ON OHAU will charge you one of the two: a $30 parking fee or a $30 resort fee (although some greedy stupid hotels will try and charge you both). At this hotel the $30 parking is the same for either valet or self park. If you are so bitter and rude against tipping the valet a few bucks for getting and parking your car, then self park it yourself, I myself have no problem tipping a valet...if I (or anyone) can afford to travel to Hawaii for vacation, I think I can afford $2-$5 to tip a valet.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing property - kid friendly and more”
Reviews.Author: LadgoestoFR
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Marriott Ko Olina for a second time this March. We rented a 2 bedroom condo with friends. Ocean view, 10th floor. The property is 5*. It is gorgeous, has 3 amazing pools and numerous hot tubs spread out throughout the property. There are 2 restaurants on site (we love Happy Hour at Longboards) and tons of activities for the kids. The town of Kapolei is near by. There is a Costco there and a Target. Lots of food options too. On our last trip we also visited the new Aulani resort. We loved that there is a shuttle in the resort area that would bring us right to the Aulani. We went there several times to take pictures with the characters. We also had breakfast there one morning and an amazing buffet dinner. If you are looking for a laid back family holiday and don't want to deal with the hustle and bustle of Waikiki check out Ko Olina and stay at the Marriott Ko Olina Beach club. You will not regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Bait and Switch but okay”
Reviews.Author: jagwire858
Reviews.Content: Beautiful location but do not chose it if you have any business back over by Honolulu, it's like sitting in LA traffic. The bait and switch was that the picture for the penthouse one bedroom suite were very different from the penthouse studio that I stayed in. And yes, if it is a Luau night it will be loud.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed review...”
Reviews.Author: Hawaiiantraveler66
Reviews.Content: You can only make one first impression. Unfortunately the Marriott's Ko Olina Beach Clubs first impression sucked. Sorry to be so blunt but I am going to break my own ruled regarding writing my reviews. First I have to say this is a beatiful hotel terrific pool and a great scenic view (if you get an ocean facing room not like ours view of the garage and factories). Now here is my review of the service. I had the unfortunate pleasure of having Nanae check us in. She saw us walk in and looked like she was irritated we showed up. I asked a simple question, "I'm a platinum member. Would you have an upgrade available?". In a very condescending voice here was her response {{{Laugh}}} "Ah no!" then she was just plain rude. We took our key and left. And was even more shocked when i saw the lack of view we got. I travel for a living and have experienced bad service before but not like this. I even witnessed her being condescending to other guests. Besides writing this review I am also sending an email to the new CEO of Marriott. If this is the type of service they are going to offer ill be selling my stock.

Reviews.Title: “If You Want A Quiet Vacation This Is NOT Your Place”
Reviews.Author: c18solis
Reviews.Content: I don't even know where to begin..... My husband and I came here on our honeymoon. Thinking this was the place to be. We had an early flight and went to the hotel to see if we could do an early check-in and they said our room was not available and they would call us when it was ready. So, ok, we can handle that. Keep in mind normal check-in is at 4pm. We went driving around not very far away because we thought the room was going to become available soon. We get a call 20 mins from 4pm saying our room was ready! Really? 20 minutes away from normal check-in and they call??? Don't understand why the front desk just didn't tell us that right now early check-in is not possible and that we should come back at 4pm. We would have respected that and went driving to the other side of the island knowing that there is no chance for our room to be available., instead we hung around the area which had industrial stuff down the beach from us. Once we got our room the front desk told us that we had to valet every time because our tower didn't allow self parking which is ridiculous. We are not going to pay the price for parking which was approximately 30 dollars a day and have to tip for someone to go get the car also? We can park and walk perfectly fine ourselves and save the money. So, after a few times of valeting we asked if we could just park on our own which they allowed. They should have gave us the option of self parking to begin with. In the room the AC was broke. Did not work at all!! I would think housekeeping would catch this or the people prior to us staying there would have notified the front desk that the AC was broke. First night we suffered through the stuffiness, thought we could just open up the windows and let the breeze in but out of control drunk adults kept us awake. I understand if you want to entertain but we are not 17 here and having high school drunken parties. This happened on more than one occasion of hearing grown adults yelling cause they were drunk. We could also hear through the walls.NOT impressed at all. I felt as if they kept trying to sell us a timeshare here also. No, we don't want to buy anything we just want to be left alone. Do NOT waste your money here. Go somewhere else. I thought after reading some positive reviews on here let's give it a try because we didn't want the hustle and bustle of Waikiki but this area is part industrialized. If you don't want to stay in Waikiki go stay on the other side of the island or in the North Shore area.

Reviews.Title: “Single Room Ocean View”
Reviews.Author: Drew H
Reviews.Content: This room was a waste of my Marriott rewards points. The room description was off. Not to mention no ocean view.. I am a long time Marriott customer. You would think they would treat me better... Drew

Reviews.Title: “Just Lovely”
Reviews.Author: susandiane
Reviews.Content: Beautiful condos set on lagoon beaches. Units are tastefully decorated and we found the furniture and beds comfortable. The Ko'Olina is set away from everything so you definitely need a car to get out and about to do grocery shopping at nearby Kapolei and to see the island. The grounds are impeccable and the lagoon beaches are lovely though my teens lament the lack of any waves to ride. We usually spend a week at Ko'Olina and a week in Waikiki so we can have the best of both worlds.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: bgmiles
Reviews.Content: Wife and I spent 8 nights here from April 6th to 14th. The resort is awesome very nice and clean.Workers very friendly. If you can get a 1 bedroom I would highly recommend getting one. We had a Studio and it was just a regular hotel room with a kitchenette. It was nice but didn't compare to how nice the 1 bedroom was. The location is pretty secluded. A few restaurants on site and down the street but for the most part you need a car. You are a few miles from a grocery store and some restaurants . Takes about 45 minutes to an hour to get to Waikiki. Loved Waikiki for the shops, the beach and some of the dining options. We ended up going there 4 days. I would much rather drive there and have the nicer resort then to stay down in Waikiki. Marriott had 3 differant pools. All very nice. Only complaint their is one that is supposed to be a quiet pool but unfortunately some guest don't believe that the signs apply to them and they let there kids play in it. It wasn't horrible put i think that should have been inforced for the people who wanted quiet. They had two other large pools for the kids. I would definately stay here again if I go back to Oahu.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent chill out location”
Reviews.Author: JillandJohnBath
Reviews.Content: We exchanged a Marriott (Spain) week to stay here for our first week in Oahu. We have been coming to Hawaii for 29 years and this area has been developed during this time. Great for getting away from the madness of Waikiki, huge units with typical Marriott luxury, especially the beds. Plenty choices of pool or lagoon beach, plentiful towels and great staff. The only disadvantage is the relative isolation if you don't have a car. There is a shuttle between hotels but hard to get to any "off resort" restaurants. Worth it on balance for a good old chill out!

Reviews.Title: “Could be perfect”
Reviews.Author: raaagp
Reviews.Content: This place is super kid friendly my kids had a ball ,but the kids activities could be better they charge for almost all there activities is not expensive but kind of lame and they need to hire some women to help ut on the kids stuff not that the guys are bad but women usually put more effort in kids games.The place is beautiful great pools and the lagoon is a nice touch,the rooms are very nice and have the most comfortable pull out beds i ever came across.Hit the walmart, costco or any of the stores a 5 minute drive down the road and stock up because this place is over the top with there prices for everything a drink at Happy Hour $9 really,i think if they make the prices for food and drinks a little cheaper they would make more money,cause like myself and others we hit the cvs (longs drug store) they sell liquor go figure and decent prices.All in all this place is nice and the mostly calafornians are very nice people made a few friends.This was a II exchange so i really lucked up for spring break with my kids.

Reviews.Title: “Initially disappointed by our room location, but the resort was beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Langbaum
Reviews.Content: We were initially very disappointed about our room assignment. We were told we would have an ocean view, but upon checking in, we're told ocean views are reserved "for owners" (we were renters).. So it seems virtually impossible to get an ocean view unless you're a timeshare owner..we got a ground floor rm infront of a grassy area in the moana tower, which is farthest from the waterslide pool. Turns out the room was actually convenient for bbq'ing, as a set of them were right infront of our room. The resort was beautiful however, beach & pools were great, etc.. Seems like that part of the island is always windy, which c/b a draw back.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Family Vacation Resort”
Reviews.Author: Gaetano_007
Reviews.Content: Spring Beak Trip with family was terrific at this all inclusive resort on the quiet and sunny Westside of Oahu. We were looking for a beach resort with multiple pools and a suite with a kitchen. This resort had all three, and then some. Now I need to find a way to come back. Our visit was priced as a time share preview. Otherwise it would have been much more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Pricy but worth it....”
Reviews.Author: RWluis
Reviews.Content: We spend six days at this resort (03/20/2012-03/26/2012) The Hotel itself is elegant and first class with a private beach and lots of swimming pools and a few jaccuzzis. We were traveling with our 2 kids. I would recommend this hotel if you want to be away from the City. It is quiet here, But only 30 minutes to Waikiki. We stay at a guest room, it had a small refrigerator, coffee maker and microwave. I understand they also have 2 bedroom villas and those would have a full kitchen.... Worth very penny and we had a good time but it will cost you some $$$$. Have fun...

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: The4Monkeys
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our two nights here to kick off our Hawaiian vacation. Stayed in a one bedroom and the kids had a big pull out sofa bed. Very comfortable. Full kitchen with stacked washer and dryer in the room. Primarily stayed here to enjoy the pools. The water slide was fun and well supervised. The pool is really great. One nice feature is that when you want to escape the sun, you can go into a cave that has waterfalls on each end. They have a round opening in the top that dumps a waterfall into the middle of the area. Great fun. Several spas, some adults only. The bar by the pool had friendly staff as did the staff passing out the shave ice and the towels. We didn't have any trouble finding lounge chairs. Ate at Longboards restaurant. Nice location and decent food. I liked the sweet potato fries. They had their Wednesday barbecue that the kids liked. Bread pudding had no sauce which I found unusual. Wifi is free and connection, even out by the pool was decent. I didn't use it a lot, but others were and I didn't see anyone throwing their computers into the pool, so they must have been satisfied. There is a small market with limited food items, but we used it to buy a coffee in the morning and some milk for the kid's breakfast cereal. Valet parking was prompt and friendly. This hotel is right on the beach. They have a protected lagoon right there. It was not busy. Easy access that is about 10 minutes away from major warehouse stores like Costco. If I stayed here for more than a couple days I would have stocked up on the way from the airport. Maybe that will reduce the ridiculous complaints about high food prices in Hawai'i. Of course it costs a lot here. Be prepared so you aren't disappointed. Took us 30 minutes to drive up to Matsumoto's shave ice last night. Yummy! I would definitely stay here again. This is a very nice property and the pool areas are fabulous. I'm sure they compare favorably with the Aulani! Although I do not understand the allure of the Time Share, I like coming to these places, buying the nights I want and moving on. What if some day I cannot afford it anymore? What if something happens that significantly impacts value, like a massive Disney monstrosity moving in next door? Nope, I like going where I want, when I want, and most importantly, outlay the money when I can afford it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Michael C
Reviews.Content: This is really a nice place to stay but I do not believe it is worth the money. When you start to add incidentals like parking, it gets quite pricy. We faced over the pool and over the little bay. Maybe not true ocen view, but better! The staff did their job well, although a bit like they were really elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing property”
Reviews.Author: Peacher
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights with family in a 3 bedroom villa. Rooms were spacious, beautifully decorated and every room had a fantastic ocean view. The lagoons were especially nice for us since some of my family are not "swimmers'. They enjoyed being in the ocean without getting swamped by waves. You could swim laps, it was that calm and yet we also enjoyed snorkeling. Only negative was getting there to/from the airport, try not to travel during rush hour it takes twice the time to get there.

Reviews.Title: “Worthy Waikiki alternative”
Reviews.Author: traveldan21
Reviews.Content: Reserved an "ocean view" King + sofabed and got a good deal with a special Marriott Rewards promo. But when we checked in, we were given a room on one of the lowest floors (despite requesting a "high floor" in the comments section of the reservation, specifically confirming with the desk clerk that this room had an ocean view, and asking whether any upgrades were available, given my Silver Reward status). That meant that while the room faced the ocean (as opposed to the mountain side of the hotel), I could not see the ocean at all from the room. One had to go to the far end of the lanai/balcony and stretch over, in order to catch a glipse of the ocean through the trees and buildings. I went back down to the front desk and got a different clerk. She explained that all of the rooms were rentals of time share properties and that when that particular unit was built, it was deeded as ocean view. I told her I understood that, but since I paid extra for an ocean view and the room currently does NOT provide such a view, I was requesting for her to look to see whether a genuine ocean view room was available. It helps to be both polite, logical and persistent. She found me a room on a much higher floor in a different building (there are three different buildings). I had to move my car as well as the luggage, but it was well worth it. This time, I had a beautiful view of the gorgeous man-made bay (what is called a "lagoon" at all of the Ko Olina properties). I am attaching some photos to this review. The room itself was not fancy or huge, but it was fine. The sofa bed was unusually nice, with a good foam mattress rather than uncomfortable springs. Daughter appreciated that. Several very nice features of this resort: no resort fee, although there is a nightly parking charge, which seems to be standard for Oahu and probably most of Hawaii. I had free Internet; not sure whether that was due to the Silver Reward status or just comes with all rooms. There are several pools and multiple hot tubs to enjoy. My room only had a microwave, fridge and plates/silverwear. But other larger units probably have a small kitchen one could cook in. There are several areas with nice barbecue grills and one apparently can check out clean barbecue utensils from the pool stands. I saw a few people saving money by grilling their own steaks, etc. The lagoon #3 right out front is beautiful and has water breaks for calm water, great for swimming and young families. The lagoons all have wonderful palm trees and grass areas as well. The other lagoons in the area are an easy walk away. Lagoon #2 is supposed to have the best snorkeling. I found it just o.k. and did not see any turtles although there are supposed to be some in there. Also an easy walk away are the Aulani/Disney resort and the JW Marriott hotel. One cannot use the pool facilities at the other resorts but one certainly can frequent their shops and restaurants. Disney's water features look like a blast for families with small kids -- a lazy river with rafts and an aquarium like feature where you can snorkel among hundreds of colorful fish. The latter seems absolutely perfect for first time snorkelers. Also, check out the man-made reef feature at the JW -- lots of hammerhead sharks and manta rays swimming there. There is a smallish shopping center a long walk or short drive away where you can grab a lunch or snack at lower prices than at the resort. Also, a huge tip -- the small market in the shopping center is part of the ABC Store chain and has the same decent prices and selection, AND a terrific deli that can make you great sandwiches, cooked to order breakfast, etc. They even have some spam musubi if you know what that is. Ko Olina has a relaxed vibe, nothing like Waikiki. Yet it is only about 30 minutes away so you can drive into a bigger town if you wish. (about 10 minutes or less away there is a small town with a real supermarket, a Costco, Longs Drugs, etc.) You also are better situated to explore the North Shore from Ko Olina than from Waikiki. North Shore has amazing beaches, including huge surf during the winter to watch daredevil surfers or fantastic snorkeling at Shark's Cove during the calmer summer water. And, of course, Shave Ice! Overall, very pleased with our stay at Ko Olina, once we got our ocean view room.

Reviews.Title: “beach and pool areas are exceptional”
Reviews.Author: rslocum
Reviews.Content: Property is beautiful. Like the Marriott timeshare on Maui, there are many grass areas by the pools and the beach where you can place beach chairs. The grass feels sooooo soft on ones feet. A very unique experience at a large resort/timeshare.Because there is so much sand/beach space around the lagoons, neither the pools or the beaches felt crowded. The restaurant options are somewhat limited nearby, but a drive of 20 minutes gives you numerous options. A visit to Waikiki provides a stark contrast of experiences to the quiet, uncrowded Ko Olina area. Great shopping and many restaurants to choose from. Driving can be challenging because of the number of cars and the many narrow, one way streets. Finally, the weather in March is consistently 79 to 84 degrees and sunny.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Jim S
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best stays we have had in years! Strongly recommended if you want to get away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. We aren't members of Marriott, but rather purchased a week through Redweek from an owner that couldn't use their week. All the benefits of an owner, and on a a stay at only $150 a night. This was our first time using Redweek.com, and we will probably use it again. We went in December (a week before Christmas) and it wasn't busy at all. We had the pool and beaches mostly to ourselves. We rented a jeep and toured much of the island during some of the days, and surprisingly enough, it was rainy and wet everywhere else, but almost always sunny and warm at the hotel. We also now know why they call it the rainbow state. We saw at least 20 rainbows during our stay & road trips. There are three pools (two kids and one adult), One cool water slide (short but fun run) numerous spas, and anything from a service standpoint that you could want. They have a wait staff that is second to none. We stayed in a one bedroom suite. Our daughter stayed on the sleeper sofa in the main room while my wife and I stayed in the bedroom (built for a king and queen). There was a full kitchen (oven stove microwave) & full sized refrigerator. We purchased most of our supplies and meals from Target & Safeway which are less than 10 minutes away. There is also a local convenience store within walking distance. Please note that I'm rating this from a "purchased someone else's" week. I have no idea what it cost to be a member, but from a service standpoint, even if you purchase someone else's week, they don't care (I don't think they even know), they still take care of you! I rated "Kids activies" as excellent only because they offered something every day. Although, my daughter never partook in any of them. She likes to hang out with Mom and Dad. :-) A quick note: We walked to cove 1 to the new Disney hotel. It was JAM PACKED with people. Not a lounge chair or bar stool available. They were very strict about entrance although we snuck in and walked around the pool grounds. really cool layout, but way to packed for us. We were very happy to be at the Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “The best ever”
Reviews.Author: Pastajohn1
Reviews.Content: I cannot speak more highly of this property. The layout, the palm trees, the view, the pools, the relaxed laid back spirit. Nothing compares. This is Hawaii at its best!

Reviews.Title: “Ko Olina”
Reviews.Author: TSP1234
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for a week and it was absolutely wonderful! Lots of things to do with both teenagers and little ones. The daily activities were great! I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Away From Crowded Waikiki”
Reviews.Author: stevetanyaTexas
Reviews.Content: If you've stayed in Waikiki in the past and want to be away from the crowds...and away from the crowded beaches...or your hotel never had enough places to sit at the pool...this is the place to stay! The west coast of Oahu is known as the least rainy and most sunny. Great, what else? Ko Olina is a gated community and there are just 4 resorts inside. Nice! What else? All 4 of the properties in Ko Olina have man-made lagoons that allow you to enjoy the ocean with almost no waves or undertow. Very safe for the kids to swim! (no surfing possible) In 6 days on Spring break, there was never a time when we couldn't find enough free chairs at the beach or at the pool! No kidding! Fantastic. What else? The Ko Olina Marriott has Villas available with full kitchens...and just 10 minutes away is a supermarket and a Costco. We bought all supplies on day 1 and never spent 1 dime at a restaurant on location. (Yes, I'm too cheap to spend $40 per person on breakfast, sorry) I cannot comment on any of the restaurants or food choices as we never frequented them. We even brought our own collapsible cooler and brought our own drinks to the pool. There was no sign saying we could not, and nobody ever said anything or gave us a dirty look. I'm too cheap to pay $10 for a beer or watery Mai Tai. (the supermarket sells all alcohol including spirits...a very small bottle of rum at the resort is 5X the price) There are multiple pools including one without kids. There are great gas (stainless steel) BBQ grills. We used them almost every day. Self parking or valet was the same price at $35/day. We did use the valet and gave the guy a tip each time we picked up our car...but it was very nice to just call down and have the car ready for you when you got downstairs. Overall, this place is awesome. I would only stay there again if I could get the full kitchen. The JW does not have that option and they had signs on their pool that "outside drinks were not allowed". We used points...I believe 200,000 or maybe 210,000 for 6 nights in a 2 bedroom villa with full kitchen. There is a great walking path that connects all 4 properties and the marina...so if you want to take a nice stroll, it's right there. The workout facility was great. It got a little crowded between 7-8...but you should be able to find an open treadmill or eliptical. Get there before 7 to be 100% or after 8. The Fia Fia show is expensive and our kids were able to see the whole thing from the lobby's balcony. The Polynesian Culture Center is a great experience with a great show at the end of the day. It is about 90 minutes away...so be warned. It looks close on a map...but it's 90 minutes. However, my kids loved it and thought it was the best experience. Pearl Harbor is close by. You are on the other side of the bad traffic...so going to the airport was easy. ***We were maybe 30 minutes from the Aloha Bowl...which every Wednesday has hundreds of vendors selling all the souvenirs for a fraction of the price found in hotels and stores. You cannot miss this. Trust me...you will save a ton of money buying your sovenirs here. I think they do it on Saturdays, too.

Reviews.Title: “A great place for a family”
Reviews.Author: 50309_Family_of_4
Reviews.Content: We stayed in March of 2012 with a family of 4 (2 boys 17&13) for 7 days. Room was in excellent shape and in great repair. The room we had was 1 bedroom with an ocean view on the 5th floor. We were in the Mauna bldg (outer most bldg). Like everyone, we would like to have been higher and closer but this is an owner resort and we were not owners. Room was definitely big enough for the 4 of us and we had a roll-away bed so the boys had their own bed. Staff was excellent. The grounds were well kept, 3 swimming pools were available and the lagoon was right on the property as well. Kitchen was complete with everything you need. One thing that could need some help were the grills, only 6 of them and a couple of them needed some work. Marina is a short walk down the way if you plan any excursions. Costco, Target, Safeway and other stores are less than 4 miles away. 15 miles from the airport and 25 miles from Waikiki beach.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite Oahu hotel - we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: clovebs
