Reviews.Content: Having lived in Hawaii for several years, this is our favorite hotel and favorite location. If you're looking for a quiet area away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki, this is it! The beach is great (not ideal for surfing - but perfect for our taste). The food at the hotel is a little pricey - but there are plenty of other places to eat (either in Ko Olina or in nearby Kapolei). Internet was free - no issues. We also had to fax a few things; reception desk was very helpful; it was also free. We reserved 6 total nights - but as three separate reservations. We tried but still had to change rooms three separate times for each of the reservations (since this is a timeshare property, you are reserving someone's specific room that they've added to the hotel bank). I'm not faulting the hotel - just letting you know so you're not surprised. Rooms were clean. Beds were comfy. Parking is expensive - but you just have to suck it up. Also, all rooms FACING the ocean are considered ocean view - even it all you see if palm trees. Best you can do is ask for a higher floor (anything above 5 or 6 should be ok). I love this location and the hotel. I'll be back next time I'm in town!

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: Contenders
Reviews.Content: The best place to stay for families. 1 and 2 bedroom villas with the full kitchen,washer/dryer and large lanai's are awesome. Three pools (1 is a quiet pool), 6 spas (3 all ages, 1 10+ and 2 18+) and the beach is right there. Been going here for 8 years and the property gets better every year. Quality of the resort is always A+.

Reviews.Title: “Sooooo nice.”
Reviews.Author: ViennaLover
Reviews.Content: Went to Oahu for some R and R with the family. This beach club is excellent. It is as if you are staying at a top beach resort in Hawaii. The grounds are beautitful and very large. The beach is private and expansive - it is actually a lagoon so no rough waves. The pools are plentiful and fun for the entire family. One pool as a area just for kids of all ages. There are lots of BBQs on the premises for those wishing to cook. There are restaurants on the grounds and they are quite good. There is even a luau that is at the beach club that is one of the best on Oahu. For those wanting to venture out, the JW and new Disney resort are all within walking distance. Even Roy's, an internationally reknown Hawaiian restaurant, is also within walking distance. Honolulu is about 20 minutes away by car. Therefore, you can leave the beach club, go to the "city" and be back in paradise in a jiffy. We stayed in a two bedroom suite. It was very large and fully modern (wifi, flat screens, etc.). There is a full kitchen as well. A room like this in any other hotel would be well over $1000. We had a wonderful time at this beach club and look forward to coming back real soon.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Customer Service-Never again”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTravel4us
Reviews.Content: Booked a ocean view penthouse this weekend and when I arrived they said they noted it but didn't haven't availability. Received a first floor, no view, small, smelly room. Definitely not worth the money. The hotel manager, Steven, didn't do much to help us out. Just said we are at 98 percent occupancy. I went on Marriot.com and they are sitll selling ocean view balcony rooms for the weekend but in reality they don't have these rooms. Seems like they are over booked. I don't think I will ever stay at Marriott again. They lost a customer. From now on I will stick with Sheraton and Westin (Starwood) they offer better customer service and don't treat there customers so poorly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort, but if you are not a time share holder you don't get treated like Marriott platinum should.”
Reviews.Author: OnTheGoGirlie
Reviews.Content: We checked in about 2 Hours before check in which is 4 pm and we paid for our rooms for an ocean front king . Most people here are time share owners, we are simply platinum members (guess that isn't good enough). We were put in the 6th floor in a corner room that you could see the ocean through the tress . The balcony is tiny and because it is in a corner, you get no breeze. The room was very nice with a kitchenette which was a nice plus. The market on site is SO expensive so shop off site for any food or drinks. They only have 1 restaurant , LongBoards that is open for breakfast/lunch, but one day it rained so they closed. So there was no place to eat unless you went to their market and a premade sandwich was $10. So we went across the way to Just Tacos(it was ok). We ate at Chucks Steakhouse on site, def skip it. Of all the seafood we have had on the island, it was horrible. Go to Roys across the street with the free shuttle or walk if it is nice out. Parking is $30/day and valet only. The beach and lagoons are beautiful especially with the path that leads you to each hotel. There are no rentals from this hotel, so you have to walk to the JW which is about 10 minutes to rent long boards and such . This is a very family oriented location, and the older population as well (we ate mid 30's) , so if you are looking for anything past 11pm, stay in Waikiki. We didn't mind it at all. We had plenty of alcohol and packed a cooler for the beach and just ate a late dinner. It is relaxing. If you stay for a long trip, stock up at Costco and make use of the grills. This is a beautiful location. Only thing that is odd is check out is 10 am! They do not offer a later check out but have a linger lounge so you can still use facilities and then shower . But still 10am ? That is unheard of .

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Alternative to Waikiki”
Reviews.Author: Robin F
Reviews.Content: My husband, my parents, and I stayed here for one night 2/9/12. We flew into Honolulu arriving in the evening and were flying to Molokai the next day. I own at another Marriott Vacation Club and was able to get a good rate. The rate compared very favorably to two rooms at Waikiki. We had an oceanview 2 bedroom villa. We had room 639 in the Hale Nai'a Tower. We were very pleased with the room. It had everything we needed. The arrangement, with a bedroom and bath on each side of the kitchen/dining room/living room was perfect for privacy for 2 couples. My husband and I bought salads and sandwiches at the Marketplace for a late dinner. This was an excellent alternative for us as we wanted some time to exercise and wind down. My parents ate at Chuck's Steak and Seafood as my mother is a diebetic and had to eat right away. They said the food was excellent. We rented a car as the rental and parking was way less than a cab or other transportation. The view from the room was great! We could see the ocean through beautiful landscaping. I had my morning coffee on the lanai. The grounds are immaculate and the walking/running path is superb. I felt like I was in paradise. We got fresh rolls from the Marketplace for breafast. They are baked every morning. mmmmm! The most impressive thing was the service. From checkin to bell service, everyone was helpful and friendly. I felt totally pampered. My father has some mobility problems and I had not mentioned this when I reserved the room or checked in. The room was a long way from the elevator and the resort is large making it necessary to walk a ways to get to some things. I would suggest calling ahead if this is a problem. But, there was plenty of help always available for luggage and carrying packages. I generally prefer staying at the more rural islands in Hawaii, but I would return here for a longer stay. This is one of the Vacation Clubs, not a regular hotel. It is perfect for me and my husband as we like cooking many of our own meals and having breakfast in privacy on a lanai. We expecially enjoy having a larger area to relax in, with privacy, rather than just a room. It is not for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful stay but a terrible timeshare sales job”
Reviews.Author: Robert W
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ko Olina from 18-25 Feb 2012 and had a wonderful stay with family. Really enjoyed the privacy on the beach and the activities in the area. However, we had a very bad experience with the Marriott timeshare sales representative, Dwight [--], who refused to listen to our questions, interrupted us constantly and finally got rude and mad as we strived to understand the new title property ownership progam Marriott has roled out. The bottom line as I understand it is current owners are forced to buy new title property points to have the same priority as new title proprety points owners at new properties. A slap in the face to loyal owners as I see it.

Reviews.Title: “By far our family's favorite vacation spot!”
Reviews.Author: jcsheath
Reviews.Content: Nothing beats Marriotts KoOlina Beach Club for our family. They have something for everyone there. Kids love the water-slide, pools and beach. Parents love the safe lagoons and great snorkeling. Nice break from the crowded beach in Waikiki. We hope to continue to go back there every year!

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Review”
Reviews.Author: alfredobama
Reviews.Content: Rooms and grounds are as shown in the pictures and otherwise described. The unit we were given for our 1 week stay was a "mountain view". It should be described as a "parking structure view". The pictures of the parking structure are as others have posted. They have left out the squeal of tires driving up and down the ramps and car noise while trying to enjoy the balcony. Maybe they save these special rooms for Marriott Platinum elites as a previous reviewer that posted pictures was and I am.

Reviews.Title: “Could be GREAT or HORRIBLE depending on what you get lucky or savvy enough to book!”
Reviews.Author: A3Queen
Reviews.Content: When we first booked, we grabbed a "penthouse mountain view" for a good price hoping for an ocean view upgrade (turns out marriott status doesnt help with beach club.. No upgrades). When we checked in at 1pm, the penthouse wasn't even ready (check in is 4pm!) and my husband was very sick and needed to get Into a bed ASAP! It took 40 min to wait in line and check in. They moved me to the ONLY room available at 1pm which was a little room with an air conditioner on a roof for a view. YUCK! Then I found an amazing deal on marriotts own website for a 2 bedroom oceanview villa! Front desk could not even find this amazing rate in their system. We grabbed it and amazingly helpful Randy at front desk worked VERY hard to make sure we got a high floor! Thank you Randy for our excellent customer service! NOTE- any rooms under floors 7 can have blocked ciews by palm trees EVEN THOUGH they are considered "ocean view"! So BE AWARE. Our new villa was stunning! (31523). Beach was great, although no beach service bummed us out! No pool service either and a bit too crowded for my taste, but pools and waterfalls were beautiful!. $30 to park valet and self park was absurd. Wireless was free. Food just ok. Better to shop someone in advance and cook! Overall we would go back again for more time with kids if we could get that rockin villa again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location away from the hustle and bustle”
Reviews.Author: amzpet
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a couple in March of 2011 for a week. The room was a standard ocean view with a small wet bar, fridge and microwave. We also had a rental car in which parking was free since it was booked through a time share. The staff was great and there were barbeques in the common areas which people seemed to grill on every night. They did seem busy but there always seemed to be some available. The location was great since it was only 10 mins away from Target or Safeway. Also there is a company which delivers groceries for a small fee and then you don't need a car! Groceries are more expensive in Hawaii but there is some amazing premade sushi at the markets. The beach is a private lagoon among several similar lagoons in the Ko Olina area and it's perfect for wading and building sandcastles with kids. There is a bit of snorkeling and paddleboarding but no major waves because there is a breakwater. Across the street there's a small market with groceries and a few restaurants, including Just Tacos which was cheap and yummy. The pool is really nice and has a fun slide. It's also near the new Aulani resort which is beyond fantastic (just stayed there a week ago) but the Marriott is a lot more subdued and calm. You still get Marriott reward points even though it's a time share!

Reviews.Title: “A great getaway, quiet, well maintained.”
Reviews.Author: NJ2Mom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Marriott's Ko Olina Beach Club from 2/15 to 2/24. 12th floor ocean view 2BR lockout, see photo. Room was nice and well kept, agree with prior reviews that the appliances could use updating. I hate electric stoves! Not sure if gas is possible in this locale though. Beds were pretty comfortable, even the pullouts my kids used. We were in the Hale Moana tower, which is the farthest from the beach. Not a problem, just a little more walking. And a beautiful view from this angle. The newest tower, Hale Naia, is a great location. Right now there are 2 1/2 towers open, I understand that the Hale Naia tower will be fully open in a few months. I also heard that they are planning on building a 4th tower? Not sure if this was true. One of the things we liked about the resort is that it didn't seem crowded at all, although we understood it was full... with another 1 1/2 towers this may change. We are Marriott owners in Aruba and were pleased that , unlike Aruba, there was no problem getting pool chairs at any time of day! Sure, there were a few prime spots that were hard to get, but plenty of spots with both sun and shade. They also rent "cabanas' (dual chairs with a movable shade) for $20 a day with the early bird special - before 10am - which I though wasn't bad. We ate at Longboard's once and Chuck's once and otherwise did a lot of cooking and grilling. The grills are good quality gas grills and very clean. As others have mentioned, Ko Olina is quite secluded. We stocked up at Costco and Safeway in Kapolei, about a 10 minute drive. Getting in and out of Honolulu/Waikiki was sometimes a pain... traffic is not good. Try to plan around rush hours and make your trips to the city on weekend days instead of weekends. The Ko Olina area is a planned community and includes the JW Marriott and new Disney Aulani resorts, as well as private condos and homes. There is a security gate, although the public is allowed to use the lagoons we really didn't see this. The place had a very exclusive feel. I would recommend this place most for families, especially with younger children.. the pools and lagoon are great for kids.

Reviews.Title: “Ko Olina beach club not up to reputation”
Reviews.Author: HarrisBH
Reviews.Content: Stayed for six nights in vacation villa. Amenities were on short supply. Extra $$$$ for everything. Pool service almost nil and prices way to high. Drinks at $12 are pretty steep and virgin drinks for kids 8.50. Villa appliances are not good. Dishwasher so noisy you can't be in the same room. The property did not live up to Marriott standards in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Meh”
Reviews.Author: Smoked_Sausage
Reviews.Content: Made the reservation 3 months prior to stay. Was supposed to be an ocean view suite. Upon arrival placed in a 2nd floor room, given the keys, and was completed with the check in process. When I then asked for a higher floor, the desk person conferred with the manager and said that the hotel was full but because I woudn't have an ocean view I would only be charged the garden view rate. First of all, isn't the point of a reservation to actually reserve a room? I made the ocean view reservation months ago. Also, had I not asked for a higher floor room I think they were going to charge me my original ocean view rate...crooks. I think good customer service would have said that if my original reservation wasn't available they should upgrade me rather than downgrade, and if having to downgrade they should then further discount. In the building we were in, only valet allowed, not self park. While the same price at $30 a day, it was a little annoying to have to tip with every use of my car, especially since we went out multiple times a day. Not sure why self park not allowed, supposedly they only allow timeshare owners to self park but there were plenty of open spars. Also the bell desk was understaffed so many times no one was there and you'd have to wait a while for your car, Room was ok, layout useful, but decor was dated, housekeeping did a good job. Decor definitely not on par with the room price. Staff on more than one occasion was rude and unpolished. Since this is primarily a time share I think it lags behind in customer service in comparison to a hotel, after all, most residents/owner money is locked in so there is less incentive to provide the best service. I think their staff needs more training. Just go over to the Aulani to notice an immediate difference. Every staff person there immediately greets you and tries to help. At the Marriott when I needed just some replacement pool wristbands the front desk was very busy. I asked the concierge to help and she was rude, reluctantly helped and interrogated me beyond reason to ensure i was actually a resort guest. Setting of the hotel on the lagoon was nice, the pool was nice too. Didn't try the restaurants, drove into kapolei for meals and ate at the Aulani buffet once (not very good). Overall, if you need a suite setup because of kids the room layout works but the customer service is not very polished and prevents me from fully recommending this place. Would also echo prior comments that there is a larger geriatric population here that generally seems grumpy. I though old people liked kids, but apparently not here.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Stay!”
Reviews.Author: jkesn228
Reviews.Content: We are Marriott owners in Aruba and Las Vegas so we wanted to see Hawaii and traded. We got a lockout at the Ko Olina resort and were very happy with it. Before we arrived we thought we would be far from everthing, but only a hour drive to most of the island. The beach cove at the resort was wonderfull. We even liked it better than Maui. A short ride to the North Shore, Dole plantation, Pearl Harbor and Waikiki beach area. The Marriott is next to the new Disney Hotel and J W Marriott Hotel. A beautifull golf coarse is right there. This will be our home in Hawaii our next stay. Jerry The K in Ct.

Reviews.Title: “Family Friendly Vacation”
Reviews.Author: CarrieB63
Reviews.Content: As new owners of Marriott Vacation Club, we spent two weeks at Marriott Ko Olina Beach Club in February 2012. We stayed in one of the Ocean View rooms with lockoff and full kitchen on the 12th floor. Kids had the lockoff and they enjoyed it. Room was large, kitchen was clean and well equipped. The view from our room was beautiful especially at sunset. Despite being on the 12th floor we never had to wait for elevators. The staff was friendly and attentive. They have pools appropriate for kids and a bit of loud noise is not a problem here. They also have quiet pools for those without children. They also have a small waterslide pool where kids are encouraged to have fun. The beach is a large manmade lagoon with sandy bottom and gentle waves excellent for kids. Their are other lagoons along the oceanfront connected by walking paths that you can use, but there is no natural beachfront, no natural waves. The beach is large with lots of chairs but if you head down after 11am all chairs might be taken. As in all of Hawaii the public has easy access to the beach lagoons but Ko Olina has cleverly installed the outlying lagoons close to the public parking and this seems to steer the public toward those outer areas and away from the main resort beach. A free resort shuttle operates between nearby resorts and restaurants, ice cream and the ABC grocery in the resort area. These are also walkable day and night if you prefer the exercise. There is a Safeway Supermarket about 10 minutes away right off the H1 easy to find but check out the ABC Markets you will find them affordable and with lots of choices.

Reviews.Title: “Ko Olina means 'place of joy'!”
Reviews.Author: The_Travelnwrite
Reviews.Content: For the last five years we've spent time at this Marriott property each January; since having become owners here after one of those 'preview package stays'. While we thoroughly enjoy a few days in the hustling, bustling Waikiki prior to Ko Olina, we are always happy to arrive at this quiet destination resort area on Ko Olina's west coast. The Marriott property is one of several tourist accommodation options available at Ko Olina, which is also the site of a marina and 18-hole golf course and several residential developments. A small - yet to be completely occupied - market place, Ko Olina Station, has a convenience store with deli (mentioned by other reviewers), a Mexican restaurant, ice cream shop, Hawaiian restaurant and soon, a sushi place as well. We stay in the small 'efficiency' unit side (king bed, couch, chair, kitchenette with micro-wave, refrigerator and coffee pot) and small balcony as part of our stay, then move to the larger, full-size condo unit for the remainder of our time. We own an ocean view unit but the property has ocean front, ocean view and mountain view rooms so those renting should be clear on what they have rented. (Some 'mountain view' rooms have partial views of the ocean and others look out over the parking lot and golf course with no water view). The kitchens in the large unit are very well appointed with all you would need for cooking meals in the room. Salt and pepper, dish soap, paper towels and a coffee starter kit are provided. Shampoo and soap for the bath. Cooking in the smaller side can be done using creativity and thinking of it as a 'glamping' (glamour camping) type experience. The grounds: as others have written, Ko Olina features four lagoons and the Marriott property fronts one of them making it feel as though it were the private lagoon of that property. In reality the lagoons are open to all guests and residents. Local families often head to the beaches to make a day of sunning and picnicing at Ko Olina. Three large pools serve the property - one with a water slide that delights kids and another with a zero-edge sandy-beach type entry that toddlers love. Grocery shopping is a treat when staying at Ko Olina. For those who are Costco members, there is a large store about three miles away in the city of Kapolei (also a Target, Safeway, and soon, a Walmart). A bit further down the road in Waipahu, though, there's a large locally owned store, Don Quijote, where we head for packaged Hawaiian favorites of Lomi Lomi, Kailua Pork, and Lomi salmon as well as more than a dozen types of poke (fresh marinated fish and seafood). It is an ethnic food lovers paradise. Prices are reasonable and the selection is large. Another favorite is to head to Waianae, the town just up the road from Ko Olina for its Saturday morning Farmers' Market held at the local school. Fresh fruits and vegetables, eggs, baked goods, fish are among the items available in this small, but interesting market. As one other reviewer noted, there are banks of gas barbeques for guests to use and it is a treat to gather at them and visit with other guests trying out their culinary skills. You can bring adult beverages from your room to sip while cooking. Restaurants: Chuck's Steakhouse in the Marriott is one of our favorite Mai Tain Happy Hour destinations and their food is good. A beachfront restaurant, Longboard's, is also on the Marriott property. In addition to the places mentioned above, there is a Roy's Restaurant at the golf course (it was being repaired as result of a kitchen fire and not open while we were there this year but was scheduled to open soon after our departure). There are many restaurants in Kapolei, one of our favorites is Thai Lao in the Halekaui Center (across from the Safeway shopping center) Activities: In addition to golf, there are several boat/snorkeling tours that leave from the marina. The resort also offers a number of fitness and craft classes. One of the few free activities is the plant tour of the grounds offered once a week. Just walking the grounds is good exercise and during our time exploring the lagoons this year we saw our first Hawaiian Monk Seal sunning herself on the beach and also Hawaiian sea turtles. Our stay was during Chinese New Year so we were treated to a special performance by the Honolulu Lion Dance group. Ko Olina provides us the feel of an outer island stay without the cost of flying to an outer island. It is also close enough to Honolulu that you could drive back into town for any number of performing arts events or tourist attractions there. There is a shuttle bus service to get you back and forth in the resort, but not too and from the resort. A rental car - especially for getting off the property to buy groceries - is a must. Parking charges apply for those who rent here. We've already booked our January 2013 stay!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome vacation”
Reviews.Author: TacticalMedic2722
Reviews.Content: Loved to resort. Nice walking path between hotels/lagoons. Nice clean hotel rooms. Food was good. Will be back again. Pools were clean, plenty of lawn chairs.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, good service, just a few drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: rd35nm
Reviews.Content: Stayed in 1 bedroom Villa on the 4th floor, room #10420 in the Kona Tower. Room was huge, with three patio doors going out to a wrap around deck that offered a partial mountain view and a view of the cove/ ocean that is partially blocked by some palm trees. I'm a Marriott Rewards member, but I figured we would get stuck on a lower floor since were just "renters", not owners or Vacation Club members. Still the room was large, clean, and the full kitchen was great. We only ate out twice (Chucks, and Longboards, see separate reviews), the rest of the time we prepared meals in our kitchen. Safeway grocery in Kapolei is open 24hrs and is only a short drive from the Ko Olina resort area. Sign up for their "Safeway Club" card to save some money, it's worth it. The resort is beautiful overall, but it's not without some minor flaws that would be easier to overlook if it didn't cost so much to stay here. Most were very minor issues with service and/or maintenance. I think the more we pay, the more we expect things to be perfect (just to give you an idea...this is the most per night that we've ever paid to stay anywhere, and we've been to Ireland, Vegas, Sonoma, and Germany, just to name a few). A few of the minor issues: there was some garbage in the hall outside the door of a room adjacent to ours, it sat there all week! They have several hot tubs on the property, none of which seemed to be working 100%, the problem was with the jets, some work well, some work a little, and some don't work hardly at all. There is a sewage/ garbage smell in the parking garage that's a little overwhelming at times. I suppose this could have been avoided if we used valet, but we chose to self park so that we could come and go at a moments notice without having to arrange for our car to be brought out. And yes...as with most places that you stay in Oahu, there is a parking fee at this resort of $30/ day, but you can come and go as often as you like, no extra charges. We took several walks and there was always some garbage laying around somewhere (never a lot), and definately not the resorts fault, garbage is from lazy/ sloppy people, but I would think they would have maintenance workers out at all times picking that stuff up during the day. We sat through the "Vacation Club" sales presentation (about 1 to 1.5 hours) and received a couple of tickets for a Sunset Cruise (see other review) that turned out to be pretty cool. The only drawback was that we had to drive down to Waikiki and park at the Hilton Hawiian Village to board the boat, but it didn't cost us a thing, they even comped the parking at the Hilton (which would have been $24). The sales presentation was relatively painless, and definately not high pressure, we opted not to participate at this time, and walked away with a much better understanding of the Vacation Club,how it works, and the costs associated with it. My wife and I went on this trip by ourselves and enjoyed our stay, we took several walks around the resort area which include the Disney resort, the other Marriotts, and some shops/ restaurants, the whole area is just awesome. The coves/ beaches at the resorts are beautiful and offer (what seems to be) a more relaxed/ laid back setting than the Waikiki area. We never heard anything late at night with our doors open except the ocean and the wind. This was our first time to Oahu and here are a few of the things that we did that I would definately recommend: Pearl Harbor (Arizona Memorial). Aloha Stadium Flea Market. Drove up H2 to North shore area (saw Sea Turtles basking on the beach), then down the east coast. Dole plantation (just visited the gift shop). Drove out to east coast (H3) and down around south east coast to Diamond Head/ Waikiki area, stopped at several scenic overlooks to take pictures, Haunama Bay, climbed Diamond Head (tough climb, but well worth it if you can do it). Traffic around Waikiki/ Honolulu is bad during rush hour times, avoid it if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not great...”
Reviews.Author: YI_IVY
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent one week with our one year old boy at Marriott’s Ko Olina Beach Club during the week of New Year. To begin with, the resort has nice swimming pools and wonderful beach. Although the weather is nice and warm in 1st week of Jan, the sea water is a bit chilly for swimming. The location is OK given the size of Oahu, by which I mean it is about 25 miles from city center / the Waikiki beach, 20 miles from the HNL airport, and you pretty much can drive to any place on the island within 1.5 hour. To our disappointment, the studio unit we got is much smaller than a typical hotel efficiency room. In the past, we have stayed at studio unit of other Marriott timeshare resorts including Marriott’s Maui Ocean Club, comparatively speaking, this one is surprisingly small. Our unit does have a balcony, but too bad the space is not enough for two persons move around. What bothers me most is the noise coming from the highway nearby; you would not have a problem if you have your glass door shut. However if you wish to enjoy natural sea breeze and warm sunlight, it's just too noisy to leave the door of balcony open. Overall we had a good time in Oahu; the island has everything a family looks for on a vacation: beautiful sea, shopping, variety of food, etc. To summarize my opinion for Marriott's Ko Olina Beach Club: it’s good, but not great, I definitely would not use “luxury” to describe this resort. If you are trying to decide between Marriott’s Maui Ocean Club VS this one, my vote goes to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Hmmm, $300 plus a day, really?”
Reviews.Author: betsysayer
Reviews.Content: We did enjoy our stay, Because of the pools, but I was expecting a five star experience and it was an average hotel. Iron didn't work, a cabinet doorbell off in our "kitchenette" if you can call it that. I guess we paid the high prices for the pools and beaches, and they were great! The "spa" rooms were not acceptable at all! The women's steam room reeked and I actually warn against going in there. To top it off, we were surprised with a $210 dollar parking fee at the end of our stay! Oh well, live and learn. Won't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort! Fun for the whole family.”
Reviews.Author: woohoo1144
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ko Olina for 7 days and 6 nights and we had a blast! They have activities everyday for people of all ages, a private beach for guests only, the best smoothies you have ever tasted, and plenty of pools and hot tubs.

Reviews.Title: “Beach focused and quiet”
Reviews.Author: FunOnly
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in a two bedroom beachfront unit with another couple. This was the perfect way to de-stress and relax after 4 hectic days in Waikiki. We had no problems with the check in and received a 5th floor unit, it was clean and well appointed. The only criticism is the 5th floor is at the same elevation as the canopy of the coconut tress so they partially blocked the view. Be aware that this a timeshare mot a full service hotel however the common areas and restaurant areas are much superior to most timeshares. The master suite has a king size bed with full ensuite including a jetted tub. The second bedroom has 2 double beds with full bathroom across the hall. The bedrooms are private as the common kitchen living/dining room separates them. Internet is free but quite slow however there is wireless as well as ethernet (both free) and the lattter improves the speed some however downloading large files was still very slow. The grounds are well maintained with extensive pools and beaches. The beach was not crowed and it was easy to get beach chairs. We particularly enjoyed the hot tub at the south end of the resort that had a wonderful view of the beach. The beaches are engineered half moons with cuts in the reef that allows good water circulation but very little wave action. The water was also warmer than the open pacific and very pleasant. Beaches were spotless with hardly any weed in the water, perfect for swimming, not good if you want to surf or use a boogie board. We did not try the onsite restaurant as we went off property for 2 dinners and used the excellent gas BBQ's provided onsite for the other 2 nights. There is a JW Marriott hotel 15 mins walk down the beach walk that offers several dining options There was adequate parking on site with choice of surface parking or parking garage. We chose self parking (free with our package) but valet parking was also available for a fee. I would highly recommend having a rental car because of limited activities within walking distance. Very nice golf course available within walking distance but a free shuttle pickup is offered. ABC food store, coffee shop, ice cream 15 min walk / 5min drive away. In summary, this is an ideal vacation for couples or family that wish a beach centered vacation nice setting that is relatively remote from Honolulu. There was good highway connections to off site attractions at Pearl Harbour and the Polynesian Cultural center for day trips.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Family Resort”
Reviews.Author: utahfamilytravellers
Reviews.Content: In full disclosure, our family lived in Hawaii and actually lived in some condos in the Ko Olina resort. We love this amazing little spot on this planet. That said, our family has vacationed at Marriott's Ko Olina Beach club both prior to and after having lived there. The resort is on this perfect little lagoon for families with small children. There are also great swimming pools to keep everyone entertained. The fact that this hotel is a timeshare means that the rooms are spacious and have a kitchen and washer/dryer. There is a lot to do in the area. I wrote more about it on our family travel blog: www.worldfamilytravellers.blogspot.com

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy the peace and quite”
Reviews.Author: jjretiredtraveler
Reviews.Content: Great accomidations with excelent service. All the people were friendly andhelpful. Only had 2 resturants on the grounds but enjoyed both. The prices were competitive with local eateries and the food was very good. When on vacation in popular areas, the prices are always higher but worth it. In buying everyday items best to drive into town and buy at Safeway, the small store on site is very expensive. Location was within an hour of all sights thus made the stay more enjoyable. Room wise try to get a room overlooking the pools. Only draw back to pools they were overly shaded for those who like sunbathing. Great pools for kids.

Reviews.Title: “A great resort - all about the amazing pools and grounds”
Reviews.Author: fil-a-go
Reviews.Content: This Marriott has amazing pools. There are lots of programs (most of them cost to participate in) and is on a nice and safe swimming lagoon (not worth snorkeling at). The grounds are beautiful and we really enjoy our time there. We don't mind staying out of town for part of our holiday, but we move into town to do our sightseeing. The traffic on the highway in and out of town is terrible (you really have to make sure you aren't driving during rush hour). After driving to and from the hotel a few times you really begin to feel far away from everything. This is our second time at the resort and although I would love to stay there again, we might not bother to go back - too many other places to see. Most of the guest are great, but on both of our visits here we noticed the crouchy older travelers who really let you know that they don't like kids around - one of them went right out of her way to bully my child who was being quite and still can't figure out what she did to deserve it. The only thing to miss about the hotel is the pools, Chief Avea's welcome show on Monday night and his Fia Fia show on Tuesday is excellent - the food at it is so so. The hotel is expensive for everything. We bought someone timeshare week off them when they couldn't use it last year and we got a week for an amazing price. This Beach Club is a couple of properties from the new Disney hotel which might make the Marriott have to do something to be more competitive to attract clients, because it looks like many of their rooms even at high season aren't booked.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful property...but terrible value!”
Reviews.Author: charlesodonnell
Reviews.Content: Although this is a beautiful property, it is 25 miles from Honolulu. This is a combination hotel and timeshare resort. restaurant choices at the hotel were limited to two; Longboards, which charges 16.00 for a mediocre hamburger and 3.50 for a 10 ounce coke. The other is a steak house which again was overpriced and of mediocre food and slow service. The rooms consist of nice 1 and 2 bedroom units,but if you ask for a one bedroom, be advised that you may be booked into a lock-off unit. The nearest restuarants are in Kapolei about 6 miles away, where after a few days, everyone chose to drive into town rather than be gouged repeatedly for average food and generally poor service. Given the cost and distant location, I found this to be a very poor value for my vacation. One final note: The JW Marriot is about 1/4 mile walk north along the beach. That hotel restaurants were about 18% cheaper and had excellent food and service. If I am ever crazy enough to stay this far out of town again, I would choose the JW Marriot, as the staff, food and pricing were more in line with a 4 star property. I felt the Marriot Ko'Olina was way over-rated.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Bit Of Heaven In Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Mfmonroe
Reviews.Content: If you like staying in a beautiful secure place where you are treated like royalty, this is the place for you. It's away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki butclse enough to go there for day trips. There are two great restaurants on-site, Longhorns and Chucks. The have a beautiful cove where you enjoy a dip in the pacific. The pools are fantastic. Best of all,the place is kid-friendly. Once you visit you'll want to return again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Probably a Good Family Resort!”
Reviews.Author: Babzkk
Reviews.Content: I was here on business and had room that did not have a view of the water from the room, but did from the balcony, (I was on the 3rd floor) . The room was spacious and pretty stylish. The lagoon was wonderful for safe swimming, and I adored the walking trail from this resort along all the lagoons to the harbor. The birds were neato, and each lagoon has its own appeal... I think the coolest thing at this resort was the outdoor shark pools--lots of hammerheads and rays...and there was an on-site marine biologist who was feeding the big 'rays and was able to answer all kinds of questions about the marine life in the pools. While I didn't have the time to take advantage of the tours offered, there was an astronomy talk/viewing on the roof that sounded great--the sky is so amazing in Hawaii! I think this would be a good place to bring your family. The flowers were lovely. There was a store nearby that you could walk to to get salads or drinks.. My room did have a mini ant problem when I checked in, but as soon as I mentioned it, it was taken care of, immediately. The few computers in the business center were not free, and were rather expensive. I decided to go to Best Buy and buy my own...but Hawaii isn't the place to buy a computer, if you're picky...Bring your own. The food (room service & restaurants) was average...and more expensive than some of the wonderful places we enjoyed in Waikiki...but if you want an easy place to enjoy a safe place to sun and swim, this is it!

Reviews.Title: “First Class Resort”
Reviews.Author: Mike L
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 days to get away from the crowds at Waikiki beach & our stay was fabulous! We had a studio apartment style room & it had everything you would need while on vacation. Our room was furnished with a microwave, small refrigerator, utensils, cups, plates...just to name a few. The staff was very friendly & everyone seemed to enjoy their jobs. We ate at Longboards & the food was very good & reasonably priced. We enjoyed the lagoon area & didn't use the pools, but they looked very nice. I would highly recommend this resort to anyone that likes to be pampered & also likes beautiful scenery!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Location; Missing 'Resort' Service, Amenities!”
Reviews.Author: LasVegasLaura69
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this resort is the location! Four lagoons, beautiful walking trail, and very well-kept landscaping. Other than that, our trip was a huge disappointment. We tried to book at the nearby JW Marriott, but the NFL bought the entire hotel for the Pro Bowl (we didn't even know this when we booked our stay). So we settled on the Ko Olina Beach Club; one of the selling points was that we could use the restaurants, spa, and amenities at the JW Marriott. We made dinner reservations at Azul Restaurant at the JW Marriott our first full night there, and then were made to wait outside the hotel on the lawn until 10 minutes before our reservation by hotel security. We had arrived early to enjoy a drink in the restaurant bar, and instead were made to feel like criminals waiting on the lawn with a bunch of security guards! Other downsides to this resort: An astonishing lack of restaurants; very small room with a bed and bed linens that weren't anything close to "resort standards"; extremely limited poolside food and beverage service; high-priced buffet breakfast at Longboards is really your only option for a sit-down breakfast, and certainly NOT worth the $18 per person! The temperature in the lagoons was warmer than the pool water temperature, which they kept around 75 degrees. You really couldn't enjoy the pools, but rather used them to "cool off." Most of the clientele was over 60 years old and time-share owners. They were unfriendly and didn't seem happy; there was certainly no "vacation" vibe that we typically see at other resorts. Grumpy, grumpy old people worried about the price of a Pepsi and planning their next time-share destination. If you stay here and do not rent a car, you'll find that your dining options are extremely limited. Longboard's $18 breakfast buffet; Chuck's Steakhouse for dinner with its salad bar and mediocre food; and a few high-priced, not worthy restaurants at the nearby JW Marriott and Disney resorts. We walked to Just Tacos and the Hawaiian Barbecue restaurants for a couple meals; huge disappointment. We have better Mexican food and Hawaiian food in the city where we reside. Just Tacos "famous" tacos were awful; salty and hard to tell what kind of meat you were eating! Although the location was incredible and the grounds kept impecable, I'm not sure we will come back. My husband and I are used to first-class resorts, with beautiful rooms, expensive bedding, and outstanding service. This "resort" had much more of an "apartment" or "condo" feel, with most of the clientele being time-share owners who cooked their own food and washed their own clothes. No one should plan on coming during the Pro Bowl; they close off part of the walking path and make you feel like criminals for wanting to visit the JW Marriott and pay full price to use their higher-quality amenities! And speaking of amenities, we also had spa appointments at the JW Marriott's spa, but canceled after they made us wait on the lawn until 10 minutes before our dinner reservation. So we booked massages at Ko Olina Beach Club, in little makeshift "tents" that they had erected poolside. The price of those 50-minute massages ($100+) wasn't much less than the JW prices, but what a huge disappointment! I requested a therapeutic massage, aka "deep tissue", and my therapist, Pi, was a tiny little woman who didn't have the strength nor the skill to do a decent massage. Her light touch made me ticklish, and I left the massage more stressed out than relaxed!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional grounds and employees!”
Reviews.Author: BarbB2000
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to this resort, and a stunning view of the sunset was the setting that greeted us at check in. The hotel and grounds are impeccably maintained, and any contact with all hotel personnel yielded a greeting and a smile! A free hourly local shuttle operates between other hotel properties in the Ko Olina area, and the golf course, ABC store and marina. The design of the beach area, with breaks in the reefs to create lagoons, provides for more protected swimming and ocean access. We stayed with friends in Honolulu, so only spent two days/nights here, but would definitely stay here again !

Reviews.Title: “Hawaii Beach Resort Experience that's Budget Friendly”
Reviews.Author: TravelFamilyFour
Reviews.Content: We are a family of six adult travelers and knew from a prior trip that we wanted to the quiet and beauty of Ko Olina. We decided on the Marriott Ko Olina Beach Club because it offered suites with full kitchen, laundry, grills, and beach view as well as resort-type amenities. We couldn't have been happier with our stay. The pools and grounds are beautiful as are the lagoon and beach. If you're a joiner, there are planned activities all day long for every member of the family. We dined out just once at Chuck's, the onsite restaurant, and it was delicious. The Marketplace was a disappointment; we have stayed at Marriott Vacation Clubs in the past and found that the Marketplace was like a grocery store--full of items that could be used to prepare a dinner or breakfast. Not so in this case. We shopped at a Target and organic grocery about 15 minutes from the hotel. Valet and self-park are the same cost ($30) so choose valet; they are very fast, efficient and can give you preprinted maps to most of your desired destinations. One hint: if you are on a budget, not an owner, and have time for a low-pressure time-share presentation (90 minutes) you can get some terrific incentives including Luau, whale-watching or sunset cruise tickets or resort credit. We (two couples) negotiated for two $159 value Ko’Olina golf passes (18 holes after noon). The golf course is amazing and would be worth it at full price but free made it even better!

Reviews.Title: “Back again”
Reviews.Author: mommyspice
Reviews.Content: We couldn't resist taking advantage of the "bounceback weekend" special- basically: this is a time share property. If you book a room without the timeshare and you do NOT attend the time share pitch, they invite you back at a ridiculous rate with the idea that you MUST attend the time share pitch the next time. Totally worth 90 minutes out of our day in exchange for what turned out to basically be a free vacation. The area has seen a lot of construction since our visit a year ago. So, rent a car, book a room at the Marriott, go to Costco and Safeway for your provisions and cook everything in your well equipped kitchen. Don't go expecting big waves. Expect to be charged every time you turn around for any activities- the hard sell for the exercise classes was ridiculous- and whatever you do don't go to any of the outdoor bbq or events ( the food looked like spaghetti-os). But do enjoy the quiet ( despite all of the kids) and the gym. Don't go for the view cause this is not the place. Pros included the rooms themselves- pull out couch worked fine for a set of kids- and the one bedroom was very shareable. The one downer was the sound system that blared a talent show the afternoon that we arrived. Speakers everywhere. Once that died down, we enjoyed a wonderful ( and inexpensive) few days.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation Start”
Reviews.Author: CCFri
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights as our Hawaiian vacation took us first to Oahu and then Kauai. First we were going to stay in Waikiki at Courtyard Marriott but then found a good deal at this one and changed. I am so glad we did! Honolulu is so busy and while it was about a 20 minute drive to Ko'Olina it was worth being out there and feeling more secluded from the business of Waikiki. We were two couples who shared a two bedroom villa and it was great - we were able to buy some food to eat breakfast and use the kitchen and we loved all the pools and the beach lagoon. If I come back to Hawaii with kids, this would be a great place to stay. Since I'm a Marriott Associate I stayed on a discounted rate and we did not receive maid service but that didn't matter much since we were only there 3 days. We just tidied up after ourselves and alled the desk if we needed towels or any other necessities. I think the only improvement could have been a better selection for breakfast - there was only a bar/grill type place and a steakhouse on property but like I said we went shopping and bought food for breakfast to save a bit of time & money.

Reviews.Title: “If you have a family and are self sufficient-this is the way to go in a one bedroom suite!”
Reviews.Author: BotRoad
Reviews.Content: Ko'Olina is the quiet but not remote part of Honolulu. If you have young kids, love Hawaii, want to have space and access to a full kitchen and w/d this Marriott is the way to go! Lots of space, everything functioning.....exceptions are this is not a service oriented hotel/beach club at all-no one goes out of their way and you barely get welcomed even at front desk-beware Sundays they don't clean your room til 430p but don't tell you-don't get a room near the roof-we had ants ruin brand new food-spa double booked me so I had to cancel-mermaid event for young girls/toddlers was not good/boring-Pools are not heated either. As I said if you're organized, self sufficient, get around to Costco etc you'll love it bc of the space and weather. If not, don't come here! We love this part of Honolulu but you have to know what wOrks for you and what doesn't. This hotel is close to everything you need-target walmart restaurants etc!

Reviews.Title: “Good but much room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: cincypix
Reviews.Content: Pluses: Good value for a studio room at a newer property (free Internet) and a change of pace from Waikiki. Popular with locals; our shuttle driver there said he’s stayed there three times. I liked the lobby and public spaces better than the “five star” JW Marriott. Full spectrum of activities available at the resort, including weekly on-site luau and local artists sale. Shuttle to other Ko’Olina properties; while it doesn’t stop at the Country Markets (ABC convenience store affiliate), the stores are an easy walk from the JW Marriott stop. Chuck’s $4 happy hour mai-tais are just the right strength. Full size coffee maker helped shake off the jet lag. In room microwave was weak but got the job done. Minuses: Parking is expensive and transportation is limited. The front desk clerk did not recognize my civilian government ID for my qualifying rate (she was upset that it wasn’t a military one) and had to take it to her manager. Limited choices, hours and stock in the Country Marketplace; sandwiches and pizza offerings a mystery to Asian and Western guests alike. The pool bar’s latest incarnation (Longboard’s) has a limited, unimpressive selection at lunch; only burgers and seared/raw ahi tuna (spouse doesn’t eat beef or raw fish). No room service was a problem when my spouse felt unwell. While you can pick up meals to go from the on-site restaurants, you can’t get beverages to go from Chuck’s because its license is different from the hotel. Bottom line: If I stay in Ko’Olina again, I will choose the Vacation Club over the other resorts. I will get a limo and schedule an ABC store stop en route from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Would see what else is out there before I return...”
Reviews.Author: 2PrincessesandaFrog
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that we stayed on points, and basically at times it felt like we were treated that way. We knew going in that we probably would not receive an upgrade(even though my husband is a Platinum Premier) as it is a vacation club, and after reading reviews. We had reserved an ocean view room...well it was a poor excuse for an ocean view. We overlooked the pool and stared right at the tree tops, as we were on the 5th floor. The room is rather small, but it does have a decent size fridge, a sink and microwave. BUT in our room the fridge kept our goods just above lukewarm warm, so I had to call down and have it fixed. As well, our shower was not working properly, so they came up to fix them both. Well, let me tell you that I ended up fixing the knob on the fridge AND we had to call a second time to have the shower fixed. Definitely not great service. Oh, but they did leave a magnet as an apology! My husband called down and spoke with several different people (including two managers) and even they neglected to call us back. They did then offer us another room 2 days later...but we still would need to check out of our room by 10 and then weren't guaranteed when we would get into the next one...so needless to say we said forget it. They kept telling us that they were 99% full, but the pool beaches or restaurants were NEVER busy, and we stayed there the week before Xmas. Something didn't quite add up. There are miniclub activities for the kids, but you have to pay for them. I didn't mind except the leader DID not interact with the 3 kids that were there. She sat at her "desk" and never moved. There are lots of chairs available at the beach and pool. Both are great areas for children. Restaurants are few and far between (hotels are pricey, there are a couple in the strip mall down the street...Mexican was good). If you want to drive 2 miles back to the shopping area, there are a couple of others that are decent. There is a Kmart, Target, and Costco also in this area, so you may want to take advantage of the BBQ's available at the resort or if you are staying in a condo. Parking is ridiculously expensive...but NOTE: self park and valet are the SAME PRICE for non-club members. So take advantage of valeting it!! Staff members do not seem to communicate with each other...we had a parcel that was to be denied and sent back to the shipper. Needless to say they received it (while we were still at the hotel!), accepted it...and called us 24 hours later, after we had arrived at home. So, eventually the noted it was there error and forwarded it to us. And this was also indicated by the lack of return phone calls to my husband after his discussions with the front desk. It is a nice quiet area of Hawaii...if you are looking for a relaxing vacation, this would be a place to stay. There are no hotels on either side of it, and is only one of four in the area. Nice lagoons for children, but no waves if that is what you are looking for in a beach. NOTE: The Disney hotel is two doors down...it just opened and is a beautiful property. If you have children, take them to the character breakfast...a little pricier than the hotel breakfast, but not by much!! It is a buffet, and was VERY well done. The characters were EXCELLENT with our child...would not hesitate to do this again!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Marriott Timeshare”
Reviews.Author: panter
Reviews.Content: This timeshare is gorgeous. We own in Aruba and Newport Coast (both first-class Marriott properties) and this property is nicer. The rooms are large, clean and beds very comfortable. We had what was called a "mountain view", but we overlooked the marina and had a corner room with lovely views of the ocean. Anything else I could say would just mimic what's already been said. Things to consider: this timeshare is more suited for families with young children who want to stay around the hotel. It's far from Waikiki and with traffic , it can be a long trip. If you are someone that likes to be in the mist of things, have older kids, or likes to try different places for dinner, you may want to consider something closer to Waikiki. If, like us, you are using a timeshare trade, you can't beat it and you'll put up with the inconvenience of traveling into Waikiki for entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “Nice things to know about Marriott Ko Olinda”
Reviews.Author: Don F
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned last night froma great week there. Some nice surprises: There is no parking charge if you're using a timeshare exchange. If not, it's $30/day. Wireless internet is free in the rooms and it worked well. We had room 20719 which is on the 2nd floor of building 2. We were right above the tree line with overviews into the pool and ocean. A perfect room. Below that and trees will block you're room. The service from everyone was 1st rate and as nice and happy as they could be. The all you can eat BBQ on Wed night for $29/person is high but considering the high cost of food there, it was worth it. Although check-out is 10 am, the front desk will give you a visitor key that gets you into the locker room to change so you can use the whole place until you're ready to leave--you just need to remove bags from your room into storage or your car. The one bedroom room was great with 2 high def flat screens and a large lanai. Very comfortable for 2 people, probably not good for more since only one bath although a separate dressing area with a sink is nice. ou don't have to park in the garage--there are about 30 spots next to building 2 which are very convenient to the elevator. Disappointments: There were very limited food choices in Ko Olinda, Disney's Aulani is quite expensive and the JW Marriott is all high end Asian food. You do need a car and even then there aren't many choices. so stop at Costco just 2 miles away to stock up. The ocean water in early January was 70 degrees which was too cold for us to snorkle although some people saw fish and turtles. In summer, I'm sure the water is very nice. All in all, it was a great exhange. We switched from Westin Timeshares.

Reviews.Title: “So much to do..Your Own Piece of Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: Evan E
Reviews.Content: This was such a great experience! Multiple Hottubs, multiple pools, a great Spa, wonderful property and extremely helpful service. I was staying at the Ko Olina in the time shares and had one of the most extravagant times on the grounds. The property includes man made lagoons that are fantastic to swim in and they really don't get over crowded at all..most families still stick to the pools. The property is expansive, and connects to other properties nearby via an easy to navigate path. Every time I stay at Marriott I notice the quality difference. This was no exception. Another great JW Marriott experience I highly recommend this site! And there are excellent perks if you sit through a reasonable time share shtick!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice for our family”
Reviews.Author: SJWD
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a great Hawai'i resort experience for our family of four (boy 15 and girl 11) and we found it at Marriott's Ko Olina Beach Club. While it certainly wasn't budget at $330++/night, it was good value and significantly less than the neighbouring Disney Aulani property that we also considered. We had a one bedroom ocean view villa that was an excellent size - our daughter slept on a rollaway (complimentary!) in the den off the bedroom and our son on the living room pull-out. The pull-out was actually pretty comfortable - much better than the usual coil-in-the-back models. The sliding doors that separated the den from the master bed was great for added privacy. The kids enjoyed the pools, especially the waterfall/slide one that was farthest from the Hale Moana tower. They didn't find it overly cold as some other reviewers have stated, even though it was early January. The grounds were beautiful and we particularly enjoyed the wildlife - a den of feral (but quite tame) cats that lived in the shrubbery by the beach and a mongoose sighting. I scoped out the other resorts along the strip (Marriott Villas - essentially condos without resort services/pools; Disney Aulani - awesome kid-friendly pools/water features but packed and expensive; JW Marriott Ihilani - dated, adult-oriented, seemed to only have 1 pool but a rather cool stingray pond) and was satisfied that we picked the best choice for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation Getaway”
Reviews.Author: maddy456
Reviews.Content: We stayed there from January 3-8th. Wanted to get this review out for everyone. First of all, we got the 2 bedroom ocean view room that looked over the pool. The view was really incredible!!! I really think that I will never again do a garden view, we were definetly spoiled with this room!!! We are not time share owners but have quite a few points on Marriott, so we were able to get the 2 bedroom ocean view for 170K points for 5 nights, But here is one thing we would change....if you want a more quiet room then I would choose a room that was over by the adult pool. It seemed like the noise coming from the pool kinda echoed up, we were on the 9th floor. I read another one of the reviews about pillows at the resort, yes, the pillows kinda suck!!! But the beds are great and super shower and soaking tub. A must try is the shaved ice by the towel bar. Black Raspberry is to die for!!!! One other thing that was kinda of a bummer is that your checkout time is at 10am, okay so this is what we did....the line to checkout was super long, so my husband waited another 30 minutes before checking out and I finished packing up. It was crazy because at 9:55 there was a knock on our door and I said "I'm just trying to finish packing" the cleaning team was so great they said "no worries, just take your time". When we originally asked for a late checkout at the desk they said NO, because all the owners were checking in on Sunday and needed to get the room cleaned, they said they were 99% booked. HMMMM....I think they are supposed to say that to everyone. Anyhow, we finally checked out of our room around 11:15 or so. They also give you a key that allows you to use their facilites after you checkout, our flight wasen't until 10 pm so we really had the whole day to hang out, they have some lockers and showers. This was really nice except for they need to expand their showers, only 2 showers are available, there was a waiting line to get into the shower. This is a great place for family and couples and would love to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but you don't get your money's worth”
Reviews.Author: AviatorTim
Reviews.Content: Let me quickly give you my credintials to write this review. I have been to 44 cities in 35 countries on personal travel plus I travel for work so I have stayed in literally hundreds of hotels. This property is a beauitful resort with gorgeous landscaping, a very elaborate pool that includes lava rock and beach, koy fish ponds, as well as it's own private beach. The rooms are excellent and clean. Why did I rate the property poor, you may wonder? Because a property charging in excess of $350/night should be excellent so I'm not judging it verses a Holiday Inn but by other resorts at that price point. That said, you don't get you pay for at this property. For example, the mattress was average but the pillows were cheap, flat pillows that you have to stack multiple pillows for any support. I've stayed in sub $100 hotels that had much nicer bedding. Customer Services was lacking. The front desk was helpful but every time I called whether it was from an outside line or dialing 0 to reach the valet, I always got placed on lengthy holds. The maid didn't leave any coffee the second day. When I called room service, I was told coffee is only offered the first day. Really?! At almost $400 a night? Hotel 6 gives you daily coffee at $35/night. The parking charges were egregious. At $30/night it was more expensive to park our car than it was to rent it. Finally, I have never seen a 4 pm checkin and they made us wait till the very last minute of that. Something to think about if you're coming off a long flight and want to shower or nap in your room. Couple that with a quite early 10 am checkout time and you really get shorted on both ends during a short stay. Perhaps not so critical on a longer stay but it significantly cut into our vacation time on our breif two night stay. Last thing, they offer a Lauau on Tuesday nights for $90 that was decent. However, you can see a much larger and better Luaua at the Polynesian Cultural Center for $65 so, like most things at this Marriott, it is highly overpriced. In sum, a beauitful property but, if you're going to spend this much on your stay, you can probably do a lot better.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Isolated Place”
Reviews.Author: 22explorer22
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed four days at this resort in November, 2011. It has a beautiful setting, with access to four lagoons and several pools; we were surprised, however, at the water being uncomfortably cold. The grounds are immaculate, and the staff is very friendly. Except for one great restaurant (Roys) at the golf course, dining and entertainment options are fairly limited. We did enjoy the Wednesday night BBQ at the resort, and the Mexican restaurant was good (shuttle to other Marriott and then walk across the street--also the site of 7-11 type store). Since we have to Honolulu several times, we chose to take Star Taxi from the airport ($50) and wait until the last full day to rent a car for touring around the island (Hertz at the Marriott) and then used it the next morning to return to the airport. Parking at $30 per day seems extreme? Overall, a good quiet place for adults to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Unparalleled Elegance”
Reviews.Author: mauiwedpalmdale
Reviews.Content: A year ago at this time, we were here celebrating a late Christmas. It was a wonderful place to go with our family. My daughter and her family invited us along with her sister for a week. It was the most luxurious place I have ever stayed in Hawaii, anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great pools and lagoon is fun”
Reviews.Author: ChrisMac17
Reviews.Content: We were there from 12/24/11 - 12/31/11 We traded our MVC week for here. You should rent a car if you stay here because it will make grocery shopping easier. There is a Marketplace on site and just down and across the road another market that is pretty good. The Taco place down the road is great too but call ahead and make reservations due to lack of dining in area it gets really busy. The next town over has a Safeway and several restaurants. The kids loved the pools. We never went to the quiet pool and the best hot tub if you are without kids are the adult only ones. The others are not as hot and the jets are pretty weak. The lagoon out front is great for swimming. We rented a cabana for the day and it was $20 that is the early bird special. You can come and go as you wish for the day. There was always a place to sit and we had 7 people so that was great at the pools and beach. They also have pool toys that kids can borrow from a bin by the kids pool. Although it was often empty. The shaved ice places closed at 4 which was pretty early. It was very windy and sometimes gusty. My 2 year old was blown over once. The restaurants on site often had long waits so we never ate there. We did attend the Tuesday night show. The food and show were good. The crafts end a few minutes after dinner starts so if you kids want to do something do it early. The rooms are spacious. There were only enough dishes for one meal then we needed to wash them. It was a 2 bedroom but a lock off. So the kitchen was equipped for about 4-6 and we had 7. The lock off unit had a small fridge, sink and coffee maker. It was nice because that is where my in laws slept and our 6 year old slept on the fold out couch there. Our nanny slept in the main unit on the pull out couch in the living room and then our 2 year old slept in a little room off the master in a pack and play. It was separated with sliding doors. It had a small desk in it. It worked out really well. The kids activities were almost all age restricted either 4+ or 7+. And there were not many of them. Also the staff running the kids activities were not that friendly. I also tried to attend a jewelry making class but no one every showed up to location. It would of been nice to know if it was canceled or moved. I was there 10 minutes early and waited for 15 minutes after the start time. We are hoping to be able to return here next year for a couple weeks.

Reviews.Title: “Ko Olina Christmas”
Reviews.Author: gosmom
Reviews.Content: We are MVC owners at another location and were fortunate enough to trade into Ko Olina. Merry Christmas to us! Spent 5 days here.....would definitely return! Beautiful 2 bedroom place fully equipped. The sunsets over the lagoon were incredible....nice sandy beach. Three pools, two pool bars. Did the Tuesday night luau.....impressive show at end (but it is long!) Walking path along ocean takes you down past the new Disney resort Aulani (not theme park!) and to JW Marriott, in case you want to check out other restaurants. Across the big street that runs in front of KOBC, is a new taco shop and ice cream shop as well as Island Market (upscale ABC) with deli (great build your own salads that they prepare for you), groceries, liquor, gifts, etc. Cheaper and more variety than the Marketplace in KOBC. Resort can also arrange lots of boating excursions, etc....but we had golfers in the group and the course across street fabulous. Is one on Ladies Pro tour.... Very easy to get to.....probably 20 freeway miles to airport....but feel so far removed from Waikiki... The only negative I could say about this fab place is that the "Reflection (Quiet/adult)" pool could have better signage. There were three kids screaming for what seemed like forever, and their clueless parents did nothing. When I could not take it any longer and complained to a Marriott employee, they promptly got security down and dealt with parents--and then hung around awhile to make sure the kids piped down. Geez, one of the other pools has a fun slide and waterfall, the other has a portion with a sand bottom, volley ball net and basket ball hoop in pool. Yet the clueless parents brought their kids to the Quiet pool--which, according to my adult kids, was much colder than the kid friendly pool. The west side of island does have better weather....we had 5 minutes of sprinkles in 5 days! One of the nicest MVC properties we've ever been to....we will return....

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing lagoons”
Reviews.Author: BettyKR
Reviews.Content: The man-made lagoons are what attracted us to this hotel. I love a place that I could pull my beach lounger into the water and just relax and watch the waves. My kids can play in the sand, watch the little silver fish that are playing in the surf. It's a totally relaxing vacation. The food options are not great. However, a short walk up the beach is the JW Marriott and there are more restaurant options there. The sand entry pool is very kid friendly. The rooms are very nice. I especially like the little "sitting room" by the window. I also like all the sliding doors so every member of the family can have privacy to do what we want to do.

Reviews.Title: “All The Luxuries of Home w/an Ocean View!”
Reviews.Author: romadaro
Reviews.Content: We are Marriott Vacation Club owners at this property and it's one of the best investments we've ever made. We come every Christmas and we absolutely love it. The upkeep and maintenance is spot on and it seems that Marriott has thought of everything to afford families a memorable and comfortable vacation experience. There are daily activities, ranging from exercise classes to lei making to keep you busy and engaged throughout your stay or you can just lay on the beach or lounge at poolside and do nothing (which we did quite often). Tuesday nights is Fia Fia, an exotic luau and Polynesian show that attempts to educate the audience on the Polynesian and Hawaiian culture, which is really popular. Be warned, however, that it's a L-O-N-G show-running about 4 hours with dinner. If you're looking to save money and eat in, there are several barbeque pits throughout the property for guest use. There's a convenience store, ice cream parlor and a couple fast food restaurants within a few blocks of the property and a Costco, Target, Safeway, Ross and several other stores within a mile by car. Fortunately, since the property is on the Leeward side of the island, you don't get the frequent showers of Honolulu and Waikiki, which are on the Windward side. If you are a Marriott owner someplace else and happen to be able to exchange for this property you won't be disappointed. You find an excellent property with all the amenities and luxuries of home. If you're renting this property in lieu of a hotel, you may come to realize that this is the only way to vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: Danielle H
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went here on our honeymoon and had a fantastic time! The side of the island this resort occupies seems to miss most of the rain or drizzle the other side of the island experiences. It had a beautiful lagoon and three well appointed pools. We stayed in a two bedroom suite and love the room. Beds are very comfortable. We did try to stay an additional night but the front desk insisted there was only one 3 bedroom suite available even though we saw plenty of availability online. Outside of that we loved our stay at this time share.

Reviews.Title: “Great getaway for the family”
Reviews.Author: Gwen88
Reviews.Content: Although this is a Marriott Vacation property, you can also rent it as if it were a hotel. The property is several buildings on a private lagoon - one of three in a row. The one next door belongs to the new Disney Resort and the other is a JW Marriott. The Ko Olina seemed the superior property to me with more extensive grounds and three very nice pools. Although full in the holiday period, it didn't seem crowded at all. The apartments are really nice with very comfortable beds and bedding, a master bedroom that could be fully darkened with the closing of two sets of blinds and a spacious living room with free wifi. The kitchen was well stocked with equipment and one trip to Costco provided all the food we needed to save money by making most of our own meals in the apartment. They have gas barbeques and they provide the utensils so you can make a nice dinner. They have a small luau on Tuesdays that was pretty good and one of the biggest luaus, Paradise Cove, is just down the street. The only negative was the hard sell to buy a unit on the property. I own at another Marriott and used my points to stay here, and even I got the squeeze to buy at this property. Still, I would happily come back.

Reviews.Title: “Where you want to stay when going to Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: marriottlovertx
Reviews.Content: This was the best vacation ever! The front desk area is open air with beautiful decorations and the agents are nice and fast. The room we stayed in was a 2 bedroom suite. It has full size refrigerator, dishwasher, long table with all table settings and washer and dryer. They give you products (salt/pepper, laundry detergent, dishwasher soap, etc) to get you started and more are available for purchase. There is a costco really close-like 15 min away driving as well as a Safeway, Target, and fast food like Pizza Hut, Jack in the Box, Taco Bell. Each bedroom has its own bathroom and the main bedroom had a separate bath tub. There were 2 patios- one large one for the living room area and a smaller one for one of the bedrooms. There are 2 pullout sofa beds. The hotel has free wifi, an amazing workout area (the treadmills have a tv) right in front of one of the 3 pools and next to the locker/bathroom with a sauna and steam room. The grounds are beautiful and very,very well taken care of. We would wake up early every morning and workers would be inside the koi pond or inside the pools to clean and scrubbing the rocks in the water. Just so much work put in to make it look beautiful. Also if you want to do a luau while in the island stay away from Germaines Luau and do Fia Fia offered at the hotel- it is beautiful and small/intimate. IF u do a timeshare presentation they give you a $70 credit and you can just pay the difference. I am extremely picky about cleanliness as I run my own cleaning service and it was up to par. The hotel is 30 min from waikiki but we would drive there or past it all the time. Not a big deal. We have stayed in waikiki before but have never enjoyed staying in Oahu as much as we did this time by staying in Ko Olina. Really a beautiful hotel with amazing grounds.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxation at its Best”
Reviews.Author: aandmrun
Reviews.Content: A week at this resort during this hectic holiday season was just what we needed. Our one bedroom with full kitchen and balcony unit was excellent and had all the comforts of home with the luxury of a first class hotel. It was just me and my husband this time, but had we brought the grandkids, there were plenty of activities at the resorts. We chose to make this a more relaxing vaca with long stays at the beautiful pools and jacuzzis. We also got in the ocean water. There are several lagoons for swimming and enjoying the ocean. Happy hour at Chuck's on site was the place to be in the evening for sunset watching. We arranged a sunset cruise through the concierge that was very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Secluded paradise.”
Reviews.Author: JBR888
Reviews.Content: A friend let me use their time share here for a week. This property is very clean and well maintained. I had a studio room on the ground floor. It had a small refridgerator/freezer, microwave, coffee maker and toaster. The room was large with a king sized bed, a sofa bed large closet and full bath. The room was very clean with tidy up service once a week or more often with a fee. The grounds had three swimming pools with lovely landscaping. You could lounge there but I preferred the beach at the lagoon which is just a three minute walk from the rooms. The Ko Olina area is about 20-25 minutes away from the airport. I had a rental car and was prepared to be in a remote area. If you're looking for the hustle and bustle of Wakiki, do not not stay here.
