I would take day trips all over Oahu and bring back food and supplies for when I wanted to stay at the resort and enjoy the beach. The breakfast buffet at the resort was great because you've got a view of the lagoon and the food and coffee was tasty, worth the $18. I tried the buffet breakfast at the nearby JW Marriott and it was horrible with cold food, not worth it. You can snorkel, book excursions at the nearby marina and really unplug here in Ko Olina. There are a few restaurants in the generak resort area that is shared by four other resorts/Timeshares. The ice cream shop is divine.

Reviews.Title: “Great Timeshare Vacation”
Reviews.Author: cordpar
Reviews.Content: When we belonged to RCI we found every time we traded what we got was far less luxury than what we had traded. A year ago we converted to points with our Marriott Vacation Villas in Phoenix so we could get Marriott vacation villas. We just recently returned from Ko Olina Beach Club. We enjoyed our stay very much. We liked the location and the facilities were fabulous. It includes one of the best workout facilities I have seen on the road. The beach and swimming pool are nice. The grills to cook out were clean and well maintained. Our one bedroom villa was spacious and well furnished. We bought food at Cosco which is close by. We were surprised that Cosco had better seafood and meat selection than the nearby Safeway. I feel I can trust Marriott Vacation Club to meet our standards and this was no exception. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place.”
Reviews.Author: easyrider11
Reviews.Content: Marriott Ko Olina Beach Club The accommodations of our recent visit to Oahu in December 2011 was a two bedroom unit on the 12th floor in the Hale Nai’a Tower at the Ko Olina Beach Club. This room has a perfect view of the ocean, lagoon , resort pool and western coast line. The resort grounds are beautiful with perfect landscaping, nice pools, waterfalls, restaurants and an ocean front lagoon. The resort has 3 towers open now with a new tower to open by the end of 2011. The newest tower is the Hale Nai’a. All rooms facing west from the 4th floor up have an ocean view. All rooms facing east have a view of the harbor and parking areas. The main building called the Hale Kona Tower is in the center of the resort and hosts the main entrance, Chuck’s Steak and Seafood, mini market, concierge, check in counter, Marriott Vacation Club membership presentations and guest rooms with partial views of the ocean. Most ocean views are side views off the balcony. The 3rd building is called the Hale Moana Tower. This building has views of the ocean on the west side and mountain- parking lot views on the east side. There are many pools and hot tubs with plenty of chairs for every one. There is a no saving chairs policy at this resort. Smoking is only allowed in a few areas of the resort. No smoking is allowed in the guest rooms or balconies. There are multiple gas bar-b-que stations on the grounds with cooking tools near each building. The two restaurants on site are Chuck’s in the main building and Longboards next to the Ko Olina path way. The prices are in line with upscale restaurants. A glass of wine and a cocktail cost $18.00 + tip. Hamburgers are $17.00. Steak dinners start at around $35.00. The fitness center has everything you would expect in a fitness center. The wellness spa offers various types of treatments including massages. The two bedroom unit we enjoyed had a full kitchen that included everything but enough cabinet space . The counter top is granite. The range / stove has a microwave fan over the top of it. The fridge is full size. There is a washer/dryer in the closet next to the fridge. The master bedroom has a comfortable king bed, flat screen tv with dvd player, alarm clock and chairs. Thee view is fantastic from the bedroom. There are two bathrooms in the master bedroom. One has a soaking tub with sinks and the other has a shower, sink with toilet. The living/dining room has a comfortable queen size hideaway bed, two chairs, large dining room table, 42 inch flat screen tv, dvd player and empty storage drawers in the entertainment stand. There is free wifi internet we used for our laptops and iPods in the room and around the resort. The second bedroom has two queen size beds, tv with dvd player and a chair. The main bathroom is a toilet, sink and tub/shower set up. The balcony is small, maybe 80 sq. ft. There is a reclining chair and table with 2 chairs. Parking fee’s depend on your reservation type. Owners and their guest do not pay for parking. The resort is walking distance to Ko Olina Marina, TW Marriott Ihilane and Disney Aulani via the ocean front pathway. TW Marriott has a good restaurant. Disney Aulani allows you to bring the young ones in for a character meet and greet or to use the restaurants. Golfing is available in Ko Olina. Fishing, snorkeling and cruises are available in Ko Olina. The Paradise Cove Luau is ok but the Fia Fia event at the Marriott Beach Club is far better food and entertainment. A car makes it easy to go shopping in Kapolei where there are many mainland stores and restaurants such as Costco, Safeway, Target ect ect . Generally, Ko Olina is a very safe and beautiful place. You would have a hard time not to enjoy this place.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!!”
Reviews.Author: lmullins2047
Reviews.Content: Marriott's Ko Olina Beach Club is an amazing place to stay. My family preferred to stay outside of the hustle and bustle of Honolulu and it was an excellent decision. The APEC Conference and President Obama did put a damper on the ability to move about freely, but the facilities are so amazing, hanging in the lagoon for the day was fine by us. The drive from Ko Olina to Waikiki/Pearl Harbor/Diamond Head areas are really not bad. It's also worth taking a drive up the coast of Highway 93/Farrington Hwy (about an hour round trip). You'll see a lot of homeless on the way but the beach at the end of the road is probably the most picturesque part of Hawaii that we saw, including an endangered monk seal sunning itself on the beach. My family shared a 2 bedroom villa with a full kitchen. The prices of food on the property are high, as anyone could expect, so we made a trip to Target (about 2 miles away) to stock up on breakfast, lunch and snack foods to fix in the room. Our villa was amazing, plenty of room and extremely clean. The exterior is also kept in impeccable shape. The lagoons, pools, and hot tubs were all spectacular. The service and attentiveness of the staff is also a two thumbs up!! And the "Island Girl" mixed drink at Longboards deserves some recognition, even if it was $11.

Reviews.Title: “True Meaning of Paradise”
Reviews.Author: TravelinYuppies
Reviews.Content: We stayed for Thanksgiving week at the Ko Olina Beach Club. The foliage is lush and beautiful, the koi in the ponds are amazing to watch, the three pools are fabulous, with one set aside for adults -- quiet time. The water temperature is kept at 72 degrees so swimming at 7:00 in the morning was refreshing. Walking on the path along the four lagoons was great exercise. The sunset view from the lagoons were beautiful. The room was immaculately clean and all of the staff - from the gardeners, the "towel" people, the front desk personnel, the waitresses -- were all so friendly (and they were sincere) and helpful. We used one of the many BBQ grills for cooking our rib eye steaks and salmon (bought from the nearby Costco) and saved $$$ on dinners. When you stay at the resort, look for Crystal (she sets up activities) and Luu McCarty, Sales Exec for timeshares -- they are awesome! You can't beat this resort with its three gorgeous pools, a lagoon, and a golf course on site. We will go back again and again to the Marriott Ko Olina Beach Club - we think it's much more beautiful and modern than any of the resorts on Waikiki and by far, it's less crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful stay at the Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Girlstar128
Reviews.Content: This is a very peaceful and relaxing (low key) resort. Our 1-bedroom villa was very nicely furnished and CLEAN. I was very impressed by how clean everything was. I am pretty picky, and normally I would run the dishes and glasses through the dishwasher before using them, but everything was sparkling clean, so I didn't have to. Even the pots and pans and tupperware were clean. Yes, the dishwasher was loud, and the washing machine in our unit was not working perfectly (had to run the spin cycle twice or the clothes would be soaking wet), but at least we had a dishwasher and washer/dryer. Very convenient. There are 3 pools at this property, and the one right outside our building had a very nice kids area with a sandy beach and a family jacuzzi. The lagoon was beautiful. Soft sand, beautiful blue water, and you can see small silver fish just a few feet from shore. Plenty of lounge chairs on the beach, and it was never that crowded. Plenty of seating, both by the pool and on the beach. The location is very convenient, as it's a short drive to Waikiki and the North Shore. Also, there is a Costco, Target, Safeway and Kmart less than 5 minutes away, so it's very easy to shop for the essentials. Lots of restaurant options close to the hotel, i.e. Roy's at the golf course, a couple of restaurants across from the Aulani, and tons of restaurants at the strip malls in Kapolei. We passed by an Outback Steakhouse, a couple of sushi places, a noodles place and a Zippy's. I would say the property is similar to other Marriott timeshare properties, but the service was a bit lacking at the Marriott Beach Club. The lady at the front desk who checked us in was abrupt and not very friendly. Also, it took over 2 hours (and 3 phone calls) to get a crib for our room, even though we requested one when we made our reservation and reconfirmed this during check-in. When the guy finally delivered the pack and play to our room, it was not assembled and the guy asked me if I wanted to assemble it myself. I described this resort as "low key" because hotel employees leave you alone here. Staff members do not greet you or say hello when they pass by. When you are at the pool, nobody will come around to see if you are okay or to ask if they can get you anything. There is no drinking water by the pools. It's more of a timeshare feel than a resort feel, which works for us because we like low key, but we've also stayed at other timeshare properties which have the excellent service you expect from 4 star properties. So we know that it's missing from the Marriott Beach Club. This was evident when we walked through the Aulani one morning and noticed that every staff member who passed by had a friendly smile and hello. Not a big deal, just an observation. Overall, we had a very pleasant stay here. It's nice to be away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki, and the Marriott is definitely more luxurious than most Waikiki hotels. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort, Beware Terrible Villa Allocation”
Reviews.Author: Andy C
Reviews.Content: First time I've ever written one of these, but I felt compelled to do so based on our experience. We rented (through Marriott) a 2 bed "villa" (condo) using Marriott Points. We were checked into a 2 bedroom villa with a "Mountain View" on the third floor of the N'aia Tower. Posted is a photo of our "Mountain View" from the deck and from the main living room and master bedroom - it was actually UP into a multi-storey parking garage. I could have lived with a view overlooking the garage, but this was actually inside the garage!!!! At eye level cars would pull up on I guess the second storey, about 4 foot from the deck, headlamps shining into the living room and bedrooms. We were actually looking up at the 3rd storey!!! Seriously, the most bizarre architectural set up I've ever seen. I can't believe Marriott actually rent these villas. Whatever you do, make sure they guarantee you are on the 5th floor or above. It would have ruined our vacation if they hadn't been able to find us another condo. In fact I had decided that if they couldn't I was going to go somewhere else and sue Marriott for cost of the room and the inconvenience. Fortunately after much back and forth and them telling us they had nothing else (and me threatening everything under the sun), they found one for us on the 7th floor. And it was perfect!!!! We had a fantastic vacation, the kids (6 and 4) had a wondeful time in the pools and on the beach (snorkelling from the beach and swimming with Sea Turtles - awesome!!!!), it really was an outstanding trip. However, I had to blog this advice to anyone staying here - UNDER NO CIRCUMSTANCES ACCEPT A VILLA / CONDO ON ANYTHING LOWER THAN THE 5TH FLOOR IN THE N'AIA TOWER!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Escape”
Reviews.Author: xbreadboyx
Reviews.Content: Located on the west side of the island of Oahu, this resort is away from the hustle and bustle of Honolulu. You don't need to leave the resort for anything. They pretty much have everything you need there. The weather on this side of the island is almost always sunny with light breezes. The skies are usually clear. The sun sets on this side of the island, and you get a great picturesque sunset. They have beautiful beaches with man-made lagoons that are great for children. They also have a big swimming pool that is surrounded by rocks, plants, and sand. The pool also has a large jacuzzi. Servers circle the pool area and serve you cocktails, beer, and food. If you forgot anything, they have a convenience store and also a store that sells beach and swim items. The resort has a steak house, an outdoor lu'au, and a bar and grill that fronts the beach. If you'd like to cook your own food, the rooms come with full kitchens with full-size refrigerators and stoves. There are also barbecue grills throughout the resort that you can grill outdoors. The entire resort is very clean and well maintained. This also includes their rooms. The bathrooms and kitchen were very clean. The rooms had large flat screen tv's and wireless internet. I also think they had bluray players. I would recommend this hotel to anyone that wants to get away from the crowds and traffic of Honolulu. It is also great for residents to get away for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location and amenites, average accomadations”
Reviews.Author: wantsbmwin08
Reviews.Content: The location on Ko Olina is spectacular. It is about 20 miles from Honolulu which we found perfect. We referenced this thread before we chose this location and read 20 entries, then came up with a composite picture that was incredibly accurate. The only problem with this resort is that the accommadations are a 3 to a 3 1/2. There is nothing wrong with them--the units are immaculately clean, but everything looks a bit dated which could be due to its contemporary decorations. The sinks in the main tower, Kona, were rusting and showed wear. However, the beds were modern and sleeping on them was a dream. The other issue another reviewer addressed on this thread was the view of the room. After reading this column, a reviewer mentioned that the front desk regards a view of the pool as "a water view." I called ahead and requested a high floor (as per a reviewer, the 2nd floor is really the first floor). They told me "no problem." When we arrived the woman at the desk gave us floor 2 near the pool and told us that it was a water view. Armed with what I read, I asked her if we could have a higher floor. She was inflexible and firm but polite and told us that "it is a beautiful view of the lawn." I'll keep my own personal thoughts to myself here. We pleaded for another room but she told us that there was absolutely nothing open. We couldn't see a pool, just a lawn and people walking. When we got to the room, and opened the patio, smoke from the grills was wafting in our room and my husband called the manager and we were switched to the 6th floor of another tower which had a partially obstructed view of the water. We were absolutely THRILLED. After this, everything went smoothly. Since we were there in November, there were very few kids. The staff was incredibly attentive, but conspicuously absent when you didn't want to see them. We opted to take a snorkel class via marriott for $10 per person which gives you mask, fins and snorkel for an hour. Best money we spent. The instructor will answer all of your questions and explain what to stay away from, and what the ropes inside the lagoons mean. My husband and I snorkeled all the lagoons. They even gave us a laminated fish card so we could identify what we were seeing. and...yes we saw sea turtles. One in lagoon #2 (not Lucky--he's the sea turtle with the flipper missing). There is one lagoon off property if you go through Paradise lual--ask the concierge---the turtles hang out in 8 inches of water (see picture). There were three pools and they were delightful. The reflection pool was quiet and the pool with the slide is suspiciously warm. It has a killer waterslide, and this 41 year old couldn't get enough of it. Hawaii is expensive and a hamburger at Longboards was $21 with the $5 sharing charge. Longboards has a million dollar view, but the food's quality is on par with a pool snackbar. We ate breakfast every morning on our patio listening to the rustling of coconut leaves. We purchased cereal from Target or Walmart (Target is two miles away). Also, we went to the "Down to Earth" health store in the Target shopping mall for organic fruits and veggies which surprisingly were cheaper in some instances than the Times supermarket. We also bought liquid laundry detergent which they sell in bulk--we filled a small water bottle which was about $1.00 and lasted us the week and environmentally friendly. Drinks at the bar are upwards of $13 unless you get a drink at happy hour for $8. I highly recommend the "Lava Flow" if you like sweet drinks. Our plane didn't take off until 10pm and check-out was 10am, so we took advantage of the program they have at the Marriott which lets you use the facilities. The locker room was nicer than the room---with cherry cabinets beautiful fluffy white towels, showers, sauna and steam room with blow dryers. There were also sparkling clean restrooms every 20 ft. We fully enjoyed our last day there. Also, many are complaining about the $30 fee for parking. If you are an Interval international owner or an owner at the Ko Olina the fee is waived for one car. The reason is that they want to keep the beach as private and safe as possible and this cuts down on masses of people.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: debphill
Reviews.Content: Stayed 7 nights in a 2 bedroom on the 14th floor, wonderful views of the Pacific from balcony. Rooms were beautiful as well as the grounds. Longboards was ok, a little pricey, but that's Hawaii. Service 1 morning at breakfast was unacceptable. Chuck's a bit pricey also and our meal was not that great. Had a wonderful dinner at Roy's and was just a little more $ than the meal at Chucks, with better quality. The dishwasher in our unit must have been there since the property was built. VERY LOUD! Had to turn it on as we were walking out the door, as you could not hear anything while it was on. Very relaxing just what we were looking for. Only other downside was the area, not a lot of things to do, you need a car as the drive is about 30 miniutes from airport depending on the time of day. North Shore about 45 minutes or so.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Renee A
Reviews.Content: This was my husband and my first trip to Hi and we found the most outstanding place to stay. There is NOT one bad thing I can say about Marriott Ko Olina. I have travel to some outstanding place and stay at some fine hotels. But none can touch this place. The groundings and the people are so nice. From the time we check in and check out we were treat like Kings and Queens. We are planning to come back to Hi in 2013 and you know where I will be staying! Marriott Ko Olina!

Reviews.Title: “calm waters and quiet in Ko Olina”
Reviews.Author: kareng2008
Reviews.Content: Beautiful new resort in Ko Olina. Guarded community - a ways from the Disney Property. You have to rent a car if staying here or plan to not leave the resort. Pool area is very comfortable. Beach is very calm - there are about four lagoons side by side. Nice pathway between all properties link them and is a pleasant walk. Excellent golf coarse on the grounds. Very clean - beds comfy. Parking is either self drive or valet - take the valet as it's the same price. Do not self park once you have selected valet as your car will be towed ! Worth the drive to the ABC store a couple of blocks away -- coffee is 0.99 there but at the resort the same store sells a cup of coffee for $2.50. No local restaurants in Ko Olina - you have to drive to dine out - nothing original though -- just Pizza Hut - Outback -- etc. Okay but not a great unique dining experience.

Reviews.Title: “A nice alternative to Waikiki”
Reviews.Author: HGreenSpeaks
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for a 3 night getaway using Marriott Reward Points. This is a timeshare property located about 25 minutes from Honolulu airport and about 50 minutes from Waikiki. In the past we have stayed in Waikiki, but wanted something more relaxing. This property was certainly more relaxing. It seems to be fairly new (I'm not sure when it was built) and is right next to the new Disney Resort. The grounds were beautiful, and the beach front was very nicely manicured. Despite the hotel being fairly full while we were there, the pools had pretty decent seating around them; they weren't as competitive as some other resorts sometimes can be with poolside seating. The attendants seem sparse, so service, while very friendly, is sporadic. Our room was a 1 bedroom studio. The room was very nice and new, albeit a bit small. We were using points so I really thought it was fine, but I saw their published rates and would have been a bit disappointed with the room size were I paying money for it. The real bummer was the balcony though. It was way too small, and even though I had an "ocean view" room, you had to squeeze into a corner of the balcony to see just a peek of the sunset. I don't know what they were thinking when they built the balconies... There are larger rooms which have larger balconies. The other negative is that it is a timeshare and therefore, they are very persistent with the sales pitch. Don't get me wrong, they were friendly, but it was also just a bit annoying to have to get the pitch when you are on vacation. The restaurants are good, although a bit more expensive than what they should be. There are other restaurants in the area at other hotels, and nearby shopping centers as well. It is also convenient to drive to the North Shore as you don't have to fight the Waikiki traffic. All in all, it really is very nice, and the grounds are beautiful. If you like Oahu, but really don't like Waikiki, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Ko Olina is lovely and quiet!”
Reviews.Author: angoango
Reviews.Content: I like this part of Oahu because it's far from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki! The rooms are beautiful, as well as the grounds. They have one pool designated "quiet," but only one guy ever said anything when loud kids would get in and he wasn't around all the time. The steakhouse is very good, bars are fun and everyone there was pleasant, friendly and very helpful. Golf is good, it's a nice drive up to the north shore...this resort is all-around great!

Reviews.Title: “Private beach was a kid favorite”
Reviews.Author: lib88
Reviews.Content: The resort was a great experience. My family has been to 4 of the Hawaiian islands and we go to relax and experience the nature the islands have to offer. This resort fit the bill perfectly. It is away from the hustle of the big city, but close enough to many of the island attractions. It is about a 30 minute drive from the airport, 45 to the Dole Plantation, 60 to the North Shore. These travel times may seem to be high, but if you account for the traffic from a hotel inside Waikiki, the travel times are the same, maybe quicker. The resort is great. The hotel is modern and the 3 pools was great. The kids loved the water slide, and we loved the adult only pool. The private beach was never a disappointment and the sunsets from the beach could not be beat. My only complaint about the hotel was the lack of opening windows. The Hawaiian air is second to none and we love to sleep with the windows open as opposed to the air conditioning. The 2 bedroom suite had sliding doors for the living room and 2 windows that only cracked open for the master.

Reviews.Title: “5 Time Visitor”
Reviews.Author: Rex V
Reviews.Content: We visited the MVC property at Ko Olina with some friends who were owners 5 years ago. While we were there, we bought our own unit with the intent of trading it for stays at other resorts and someday returning to Ko Olina. Well to make a long story short, we return to Ko Olina every year. We love the views. The resort is busy, but not crowded and the staff is always the best. Every year we take some other friends and/or family with us, and they always love the experience. We now have a waiting list of people wanting to do another trip with us. I agree with the other reviewers..... both Longboards and Chucks serve excellent food and the prices are reasonable for the location. The addition of the ABC store a short walk down the street last year is also a plus. If you visit this resort, make sure to walk down to the JW Marriott and walk around. The fish/shark ponds and gardens are worth the short walk.

Reviews.Title: “Ahhh the quiet side of the island”
Reviews.Author: adventurer26
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at the beach club.. idyllic surroundings and awesome people especially the bellman.. those guys rock!!

Reviews.Title: “Looking Forward to Coming Back”
Reviews.Author: The_CGY_Gs
Reviews.Content: Love this great resort on the west coast of Oahu. The facilities are fabulous and the lagoon is good for the kids to swim safely. We love this area of the Island, away from the hustle and bustle of Honolulu. Make sure you take the trip up to Makaha Beach - a very quiet public beach with great waves.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise within a Paradise !”
Reviews.Author: Ocnarf4
Reviews.Content: My family recently visited the Ko Olina Marriott in Oahu Hawaii, the resort was excellent ! The staff was curteuos, the compound itself was breathtaking, with a waterfall, lagoons full of koi fish, sandy pools, jacuzzis and nightly entertainment. There were activities scheduled on a daily basis for the whole family, like introduction to snorkeling, craft making and fish feeding, yoga classes, and on and on. It has its own private bay/beach, where the water is warm and there are no waves! Oh and contrary to wahts online, there is NO fee for self parking, wich is really easy to do.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but..”
Reviews.Author: Steve H
Reviews.Content: Parking is a rip-off. $27 a day at this location? I understand Waikiki, but Ko Olina??? Event at that price, if you go out & come back later after 7 PM, it's impossible to find a parking space. This hotel is nice for young kids, but my teenage kids hate it.

Reviews.Title: “One Word Sums this Resort - WOW”
Reviews.Author: FLTMGT
Reviews.Content: Whoever designed this resort hopefully got a huge raise. Here's the key facets of Marriott's Ko Olina resort: Beautifully laid out, the resort is easy to navigate. With three pools, it provides numerous opportunities for fun and relaxation. The Naia pool has waterfalls and a really cool slide. The two hot tubs have a waterfall that provides a steady stream to relax your back. The rooms are simply outstanding - make sure you ask for ocean view - the sunset, at least in October, is directly outside your window; relax an enjoy on your balcony which includes a relaxing chair with a footrest. The lagoon is peaceful with ample lounge chairs to soak up the sun. Cabanas are available @ $30 / day and yes it's possible to get a freebie for one day by commenting how expensive the rate is. There are a host of activities each day including exercise and yoga sessions. The workout room is second to none with a diverse group of both strength training and cardio equipment. Take advantage of the free snorkling sessions each morning. There's quite a variety of tropical fish near the rocks the separate the lagoon from the ocean waves. If you snorkle take advantage of going to the nearby lagoons, particulary lagoon 2 which often has sea turtles, including one named Lucky. The rooms are quite comfortable with a large HD tv in the living room. The conceirage desk personnel are extremely helpful - it's a shame that Stacy has no enthusiam(just kidding of course). Parking is available on-site either outside your property or in one of the garages - in addition, there's valet parking available. MVC owners park for free - valet is also available around $5 a day. Longboards, restuarant near the lagoon, has a traditional fare with perfect views of the ocean. Staff is extremely friendly - no surprise if you'd stayed at other MVC resorts. Take advantage of the MVC sales pitch - the 90 minute presentation goes quickly and there's the opportunity to receive a valuable gift. We used ours as a credit for the Fia Fia luau show. We only paid $30 for my wife and I. Normal price would have been $180. Great show - highly recommended. Resort is on the western side of Oahu - I recommend renting a car ............taxi is quite expensive........unless you want to stay on the property for your entire time. Bottom line - outstanding resort - if your used to visiting MVC properties - you won't be disappointed. If you've never visited a MVC property - definitely try this one out - you'll want tot experience Marriott again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect resort”
Reviews.Author: SLC-MLBF
Reviews.Content: We only stayed 3 nights but would have loved more at this resort. There is so much to do on site. We had great service during our stay. We eat a Longboards and the food was good. The Ko Olina lagoons are great for all types of actiivites. Even though we had a island view room on the 4th floor, if I went out on the balcony, I could still see the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, kid friendly hotel ideal for family vacations”
Reviews.Author: Logistika
Reviews.Content: For those that want an alternative to busy Waikiki, Mariott Ko Olina Beach Clu and the J W Mariott offer good beaches, snorkeling in a beautiful environment. We stayed there in October and absolutely love the place. Will go back again on our next trip to Hawaii.

Reviews.Title: “Another great visit!”
Reviews.Author: lululouise
Reviews.Content: Lucky me! I got an opportunity to go again with my friends and two kids. We spent most our time at the pool by the newest tower. It's great for the bigger kids who don't want to be at the pool with the sand. It has a water slide and grotto. It's not too deep and there are two hot tubs for the parents to relax in. It's also shaded, which a great way to cool off. there's also a poolside bar, so you don't have to go far to get a Lava Flow! We had a couple of pool side services and I would recommend the turkey, avocado, and bacon sandwich from Longboards. Also, make sure to attend the welcome ceremony on the main lawn on Monday or Tuesday (I can't remember the day) evening, the kids will enjoy it and you'll get a laugh or two! Oh, if you're looking for a good hot dog, stop by the Island Market (ABC store) - its only $2.99. Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “A bit far from downtown however close to excursions and the JW & new Disney resort”
Reviews.Author: FicoUCF
Reviews.Content: The rooms are clean and service is top of the line. Traditional Marriott top notch service. We enjoyed the lagoons as well as dinning accommodations nearby at the JW Marriott resort and spa. Try getting up early at 7 am to feed the Tarpon.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: Susan C
Reviews.Content: Everything I had dreamed Hawaii would be was delivered perfectly by the Ko Olina Beach Club. We were visiting for an extended family holiday & had booked 3 2bed apartments with a Deluxe Ocean View. The rooms could not have been any more perfect! The views from the balcony were breathtaking & the rooms themselves were large, clean & well equipped. All of the staff, from those on front desk to the car valets, were incredibly warm & friendly. Chucks restaurant was fantastic & the grocery shop was more than adequately stocked. That said, cheaper alternatives are just a short car journey away. The swimming pool with the pool bar, was quite possibly one of the nicest I have seen & not as busy as I had anticipated. This was one holiday location that no one wanted to leave & which everyone is desperate to return to!

Reviews.Title: “Consistently Wonderful...or better!”
Reviews.Author: Ritaalleyne
Reviews.Content: This past week was my sixth visit to this property. The property is remote compared to other beautiful Hawaiian Hotels on Oahu however, this is so worth it! Great fun for family and friends. The staff is so attentive, the building is spotless - the food...even at the Beach Bar is fresh and tasty. We has the full 2 bdrm unit with the kitchen so were able to dine out or in - just the best. Marriott quality is evident everywhere - and NO I am not a Marriott employee or related to one!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property”
Reviews.Author: MissMoorea
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our second stay at Ko Olina - our first stay was at the JW Marriott Ihilani Resort (superb in every way) and this stay was at the Marriott Ko Olina Beach Club Villas (sister timeshare property). The Beach Club villas are lovely, spacious and very well appointed. We stayed in an oceanview studio with kitchenette for three nights, which was perfect for the two of us. The balcony was teeny tiny but this didn't bother us since most of our days were spent on the lagoon beach. However, we were still able to enjoy coffee each morning on the balcony. The staff was friendly and professional and very accommodating. Our only complaint is lack of security - while our building was supposed to be cardkey access only, it was never in effect during our stay. This bothered us since there was a public beach and marina parking lot for locals adjacent to our building, Hale Naia. Anyone could've entered our building and accessed guest room floors. And the Marriott welcome desk table in our lobby was only manned once in four days. We also discovered locals enjoying one of the pools another day, they had walked right into the pool area with their own cooler and towels and had even purchased drinks at the bar. One of them complained about the high bar costs to my husband and then laughed "they let just about anyone in here." They weren't wearing guest wristbands or using striped resort pool towels. The whole encounter turned us off so we took off for another poolside location. During our entire stay there wasn't a single security guard in sight. This really bothered us.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place away from the Waikiki bustle”
Reviews.Author: yes2travel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights at the end of a 2 week Hawaii stay utilizing Marriott points. The primary reason to come to Oahu was to a catch a non-stop flight back to the east coast. I've been to Oahu 4 times and wanted to avoid the Waikiki scene. Was put in a studio room on the top floor (16th) and had fantastic view of the ocean. The room was similar to a good size hotel room, but included a microwave, small sink and fridge. A complimentary washer & dryer were on the 14th floor (bring your own soap). The bed was absolutely fantastic. At home I sleep on a Tempurpedic and this one was almost as good. The one major downside was the lanai, which was the size of a postage stamp! In order for two people to be out on it required each of us to go single-file....and if the first person out had to go back into the room it required that both people had to get up and move. Regardless of this situation we still enjoyed sitting out on our last evening with a glass of wine while the piano music from the bar below drifted up. The accommodations were pretty much your typical Marriott style room and nothing felt particularly Hawaiian, but the room served it's purpose for just a 2 night stay. I personally would not stay here for a long term visit to Hawaii. I perfer a more natural setting nestled in with local people and resturants, but that being said the property is nice for what it provides. Anyone considering staying here for more than 2 nights should definitely secure a larger condo style unit so that you have room to move around. The pool and grounds were pretty. I quite enjoyed the paved beach walk. The man made beach lagoons were attractive, but I missed the natural beaches with ocean waves that I found while exploring other islands.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort, with beach and several pools”
Reviews.Author: CurlyLagunaHills_CA
Reviews.Content: We were here for 4 nights and loved this place! Variety of pools and falls on the property, plus the ocean lagoon. There are an ample number of chaise lounges on the sand at the lagoon; those were our favorite, during day time, sunset, and even after dark. Highly recommend the Paradise Cove luau; book it on line yourself using a discount website and save about 25% over price that the concierge will get for you. Also, we really enjoyed the sunset cruise that leaves from Barber Point; just wish it was longer than 90 minutes. The drinks and food served on the boat make this a pretty good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort, wonderfully family vacation!”
Reviews.Author: drkcc
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we stayed at Marriott's Ko Olina Beach Club. In fact, we enjoyed so much on the first stay last year. We decided to stay with them once again. This is a time sharing property, and the rooms has full kitchen with washer and dryer. Great for family with small kids. One of the best part of the resort is the lagoon and wonderfully ocean view at high rise buildings. We stayed at the top floor this year on floor 16 and facing lagoon/ocean where we enjoy sunrise and sunset daily. There are around 6 different pools with a water slide. In additional there are around 5 jacuzzi and 1 whirlpool just for the kids. In additional, there are also 10+ gas grill for all your BBQ need during your stay. Resort also has one free Hawaii native dance show every Monday at 5pm on the lawn.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Brian C
Reviews.Content: This property is a great location on the west side of the island on Ko Olina. There are only a handful of resorts her and the people are much more upscale over the Waikiki crowd. The hotel has amazing pools and access to a lagoon off the water. Great value for a 2 room villa in the 3rd tower. The only downfall the room seems to have an older feel and isn't very modern. Does has a mini kitchen, washer/dryer and fridge which is good is you plan to go shopping and do some laundry. Overall the beach on this side is very nice and you can check out the other properties on the beach without paying their higher prices.

Reviews.Title: “Away from the hustle and bustle...”
Reviews.Author: sjray78
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the resort a couple of hours before check in and was fortunate enough to get a room immediately. The grounds were beautiful. There were a number of pools, and I especially enjoyed the lagoon and waterfall hot tubs. My room was nice. I cannot say I was overly impressed by their food, but all in all it is a great place to stay. Note 1: This area is perfect for families and those who like to be removed from the hustle and bustle. I would not recommend this location if you are looking for an authentic Hawaiian experience. Note 2: I highly recommend renting a car from the airport. I took a cab to Ko'Olina thinking it would be comparable to other cities and ended up paying $120 (cash only / one way), which was ridiculous. I thought I was getting ripped off, but the concierge told me it could have been $160 if there would have been traffic. I just about fell over. You can rent a car for an entire week for less than that.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Ko Olina - Just barely good enough”
Reviews.Author: TravSSanDiego
Reviews.Content: I get the sense staying at this property that Marriott spends a lot of time thinking about how to make their time share properties just good enough so that people will actually stay there so Marriott can make a lot of money, without spending one more penny than they need to spend. Overall we were very disappointed with this property. The staff is just barely good enough, the food barely good enough, the rooms barely good enough, etc....well you get the idea. We reserved an Ocean View one bedroom suite for a family of 4. When we checked in at 10PM the front desk clerk warned us that the room we were in had no ocean view, but told us "anything above the 4th floor is considered ocean view". Well we had a beautiful view of a rooftop and some trees, but not an ocean anywhere to be seen. When we checked out I complained that we paid more for an ocean view but our room had no view and the front desk clerk after 10 minutes did revise our rate to the non-ocan view category, but why make us even ask? Why take a room that even the front desk acknowledges has no view and try to pass it off as a view room? We only stayed here for one night on our way to Molokai - and the only reason we stayed here was to use their water slide. We needed to leave the hotel at 10;30am and the slide opened at 9AM - said so on the web site and i called to double-check before making my reservation - plenty of time to use the slide and get back to the room and change for our flight. But no - when we went down to use the slide the sign had a handwritten "10AM" written over the 9am for the opening time for the slide. Guess the slide staff doesn't want to wake up very early. My kids were disappointed, I was disappointed, but we managed to get over it and then changed our plans a little and thought we could still get in 15 minutes on the slide before leaving the pool. We were there at the slide right at 10AM waiting, but the slide was not open - finally after 10 minutes I went over to the pool shack to ask the staffers what time the slide would open, and the woman folding towels said she would be right over to open it! So, the person staffing the slide was standing roughly 20' away from the slide folding pool towels instead walking over and unlocking the door on time. So disappointing!

Reviews.Title: “Everything we have come to expect from a Marriott time share property.”
Reviews.Author: Carl M
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ko Olina Beach Club on the first leg of our two week stay. We did a timeshare swap with a friend. Our week in St. kitts for hers in Hawaii. CHECK IN AND ROOM: The check in process went smoothly. Our room was not ready, but we waited by the pool bar and had a drink. It didn't take too long for the room to be ready. My wife went up to see if the room was satisfactory since we were told it was a penthouse villa, but a mountain view, not ocean view. When she arrived at the room, it was indeed mountain view, but the ocean was also easily in view if you simply turn to the right. We were in the tower that faces the marina and industrial area. I know from other reviews that this view has bothered some people, but we were fine with it. The Black Pearl from Pirates of the Carribean was dry docked at the marina, which was pretty cool to see. The room was standard fare for a Marriott timeshare property. Very clean and all the amenities of home. Nicely furnished and plenty big for the three of us. SERVICE: The service was great as usual, but unfortunately we experienced one glitch that we have NEVER experienced before at any other Marriott timeshare. The dreaded towel police. We woke up one morning and went to the pool. Then we took a walk out to Ko Olina Beach Park to see the Black Pearl a little closer. We came back to the pool for about 15 mins and then went up to get changed into our suits. When my wife went back down, our stuff was gone and somebody else was in our seats. She went to the activities hut and confronted the girl. They told her they took our stuff off the seats because we were not there for over a half an hour. This was not true and we told them so. We reported this incident to guest relations. We are fully aware of the seat saving policy and we know we did nit violate it. I hope that the guest relations manager spoke with the staff. Other than that the service by the staff was impeccable. Everyone we met greeted us with an "Aloha". The pool service staff was very attentive when we used them. We didn't use the concierge much. Security also was very good. We had an issue with our safe right after we checked in. I called the front desk and security showed up shortly thereafter and fixed the problem quickly. RESTAURANTS: We typically only eat at the restaurants for dinner, but on this trip we opted to use the grills they had on property. We went to Safeway in Kapolei to buy groceries. The grills on property were immaculate. They have a person that services them daily. You borrow the cooking utensils from the towel hut. We did eat a couple of things from the pool bar. The Parmesan garlic fries were awesome! Also had the Kula pork quesadillas which were very good as well. One night after a full day of sightseeing we went to Longboards for dinner. It was better than expected. ACTIVITIES: The pools are very nice. The one closest to our tower had the water slide and the waterfalls. The beach and lagoon was great for swimming. Other lagoons a short walk away were better for snorkeling. Most kids activities have a fee associated with them. We skipped those. There is a luau on property, but we opted to do one on Maui instead. Ko Olina Golf Course is nearby. We didn't use the spa facilities. OVERALL: The location of the resort is great. It is away from the city atmosphere of Honolulu. The grounds are really well kept, the staff is friendly and the rooms are beautiful. I would certainly recommend this resort to others.

Reviews.Title: “Totally awesome hotel / time share villa”
Reviews.Author: BeyondFLL
Reviews.Content: We booked two 2 bedroom villas for our vacation Sept 9-16th and Marriott was able to give us each villa across the hall from each other in the Hale Moana building as we requested. We regularly stay with Marriott and this was again another perfect vacation. The staff was so friendly and courteous,especially Lisa at the concierge desk who will instantly have you smiling and feeling great. Lunch at Longboards was standard fare with a great ocean and lagoon view. Dinner at Chuck's steakhouse was first class although we grilled out several times at one of the several grilling stations on the property. Gas grills thoroughly cleaned each day and always lit. Got steaks and groceries at nearby Saveway and Costco located a few miles away. Several water feature pools and a lagoon on the ocean suited just about everyone's needs from children's pools and slides to a quiet pool for adults only. The grounds are meticulously maintained and the rooms were spotless. Our furniture was brand new and the Marriott beds were heavenly. None of us could think of a single complaint during the stay. The hotel is at the end of the H1 highway and you can get to just about anywhere on the island in about 45 minutes. The JW Marriott is a 15 minute board walk away and you can use their pool and restaurants and charge them to your Beach Club room for points. Their restaurant Azul was 5 star. Would recommend highly.

Reviews.Title: “5 Stars...A+.... Wonderful Vacation!!”
Reviews.Author: LoveToTravelAndRelax
Reviews.Content: We (my husband and two 4 yr old boys) stayed at the Marriott's Ko Olina in mid April and had a fabulous time. We met up with other family members; some brought their kids and some did not. This is a totally family friendly resort, but also has an Adults Only pool as well. I think it has 3 really large pools altogether and several (as in 5-7) Hot Tubs around too! They offer kids activities throughout the day, but sadly no Kids Camp (really would have liked to drop off the kids for a few hours one day and just chill). We ate at LongBoards near the lagoon several times for breakfast and lunch - pricey but good - and service was friendly and great! Our large group went for dinner at Chuck's one night, food notsogood; don't recommend. Take the free shuttle and treat yourself to an awesome dinner at Roy's; they also have a kids' menu. Bought little groceries on property at the small market, but then also took the free shuttle down to the little grocery store which offers a little of everything. You can also walk there, it's about 1mile or a little more. The rooms (we had a 2 bdr) were so nicely appointed, clean and very spacious. Had nice appliances, TVs, etc. We didn't have an ocean view, but there is not a bad view a this place - we looked at the golf course and marina. (See attached picture; ate out on the private little balcony for lunch & breakfast a few times) Almost forgot to mention the best thing - the on property Luau!! It was a blast! Good food and good entertainment, don't miss it. They have grills (about 6 or so) for anyone to cookout on, a nice workout area/room, and a playground right next to the "beach" pool. It's close to a nice marina; I went snorkeling one day and my husband went deep sea fishing one day. We grilled his fish for dinner! I'd go back in a heartbeat with or without my kids. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Prefection all the way”
Reviews.Author: Eileen 202
Reviews.Content: We have been to Hawaii many times but after staying at the Marriott's Ko Olina we are forever spoiled. First of all, there is a big difference between staying in a hotel and staying at this timeshare resort. We have stayed at many Marriott properties and their level of quality is always dependable. It's the attitude of the guests that makes this timeshare stand out. They are just more out going and friendly, as are the few locals you will meet strolling the paved walkways along Ko Olina's beautiful lagoons early in the morning. It's a great family place but you will also see a lot of couples. It sounds crazy, but our experience has been that even the children staying there are so well behaved! Our daughter was married there a few years back and the staff went above and beyond to make it so special! At the suggestion of a key employee they were married on a Tuesday afternoon then proceeded to the Ko Olina's Polynesian show and luau as a sort of reception. To our surprise they had saved a special table up front for us. All week long the bride and groom were met with hugs and well wishes from countless guests which seemed like extended family by the end of the week. Quick hint: Wherever you decide to stay, if you have a kitchen don't be discouraged by the higher prices at the grocery stores. Join a Sams' Club before leaving home. The prices at Sam's were almost the same as our stores in the midwest. Also, for the typical souvenirs visit a local Walmart. Believe it or not, they have many of the exact same items as the shops but at a much lower cost. They even beat the flea market prices. (but don't miss the flea market!) Walmart is also the best choice for drug store items. (no, I don't work for Walmart) You will appreciate the fact that this property is away from the horrible traffic in Honolulu and the lagoons are a safe from strong tides. The pictures don't do it justice. 5 stars aren't enough!

Reviews.Title: “Family heaven”
Reviews.Author: cjheuvel
Reviews.Content: We went last year in May and are leaving again in October for another 2 weeks. First things first, Hawaii is in the middle of the S.Pacific so be prepared everything is more expensive. However the Marriotts KoOlina Beach Club was wonderful, lots of open space and grass for kids to run and play, pools for all ages along with areas grumpy singles can go to be left alone. There are 4 man made cove type beaches for you to enjoy along the coastline protecting you from the rough seas and the big predators rarely come near. Our room came with a full serviced kitchen and there is a BBQ area by the pools with minimal wait times so you can keep your costs down by not eating out every meal. There are a couple more resorts along the beach and a JW Marriott that you can walk to for a more romantic dining experience. Be sure to set aside a day fro the Polonesian Cultural Center, we had alot of fun and laughed alot, beautifully put on shows and there is a Luau feast/show in the evening. You can take the group bus or go on your own, it was a pleasent drive and very easy to find, we left early enough to hit the Dole Plantation on our way. We went to Kauai and Oahu on a 23 day trip, both places had there pleasures but I can honestly say, I'd go back in a heartbeat. Oh and yes this is a Timeshare place and they will try to sell it to you, If you want to go ahead but it will burn up at least 1/2 of a day that you could be sight seeing or basking in the sun.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite place!”
Reviews.Author: Caliwen
Reviews.Content: I'm so sad I'm home! I loved every minute. We were fortunate to get an ocean view room. Absolutely breathe taking! My only complaint is the pricing on food and drinks. $80 just for lunch. $16 for pork sandwich! At least it was yummy and I had to have it again! The food was great! Just expensive. Can't wait to go back. I'm missing the shaved ice.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this property.”
Reviews.Author: pophi
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed our time here. The staff was very helpful. The property is located near Kapolei mall which has a costco, whole foods, Kmart, and, coming soon, walmart.

Reviews.Title: “An awesome resort can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: bookhappy58
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived till the last day at Marriott Ko Olina our vacation was awesome. The staff is welcoming, friendly, and very helpful. The spacious two bedroom unit is simply beautiful from the decor to the amenities! The resort's location has the feel of Maui with the convenience of Waikiki only a 30 minute drive away.

Reviews.Title: “The Best.”
Reviews.Author: Family0fTravelers_5
Reviews.Content: Marriott Vacation Club is just the best. This Ko Olina location is no different. We have stayed here multiple times, and are always extremely happy. The villas are outstanding, like a home away from home. We stay in the 2 BD villa with comes equipped with a full kitchen, laundry, living room, 2 BDs, 2BRs, dining area, and 2 balconies. You cannot beat it with a family. It is so nice to be able to cook & eat a few meals and not eat everything out. The villas are so comfortable for our family. As far as the resort goes, it is gorgeous! One of our favorite parts of this location is the lagoons. When we stay at other Hawaii MVC locations (Maui), the beach is hard to use with kids since the waves and undercurrent tend to be strong. With the lagoons, the water is calm, and so easy for kids to play in. Our kids love it! The swimming pools are great as well. We are always happy with our stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great People”
Reviews.Author: attarfamily1
Reviews.Content: We went back to Hawaii after 22 year, since our honeymoon. This time with our children. This is great location. The ground are well kept. Its next to a lagoon which is very peacful. I went and bought my own snorkelling gear from near by Target. I enjoyed the snorkling in the lagon. The third lagon which is about 10 minute walking distant from this location and its in front of the JW Marriott and the new Disney resort, was the best snorkelling location. The water is more clear and I saw a turtle there. Costco, Target, Sport Authurity is near (2 miles). We ate in our place mostly. There gas Bar-b-que downstair is well kept and they are cleaned everyday. I exchanged this through interval international and it was a hell of a deal. The unit we got was facing the island. Not much of view since this side of the island is pretty dry. We went to the Fia Fia Luna. The food was not worth the price, but my kids learned and enjoyed the show and the chief performance was unbelieveable. I will go again just to support the locals attempt to educate us with their rich culture. The Hawaiian people were suprising very nice and friendly. My daughter had a skin rash which we ended up at a pediatric office and later at a dermatologist office. They were super nice and understanding. I say this because most places that I have been ie Europe and the people know you are a touist, their behavior changes. It just makes me believe there is no place better than our own USA!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Olga F
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Marriott's Ko Olina Beach Club during our honeymoon. I love how Beach Club was close to Paradise Cove Luau. Beach Resort is also walking distance to one of Ko'Olina's beautiful lagoons. Ko'Olina is a great place to stay if you want a more relaxing environment and to get away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki.

Reviews.Title: “Always a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Tina Q
Reviews.Content: 5th time staying here. Love the resort, everyone is always friendly. The rooms are clean, 1 and 2 BR's have full kitchen, with DW and washer/dryer. Full shower and separate tubs. The interior is well maintained, and everything is always in perfect working order. New flat screen tv's with DVD players. Location is near Costco, and every other convenience store. Would definitely recommend. The beach in front of the hotel is beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Unless you love Wakiki crowds, it doesn't get better than this on Oahu”
Reviews.Author: akbear
Reviews.Content: If you want the crowds, stay in Wakiki. IBut if you're looking to really relax on Oahu, make the drive west past Kapolei to Ko Olina. This is a Marriott time share resort and one of their premium locations worldwide. That being said, it's not a full service hotel, but it has all you'll want or need for a fantastic couples or family vacation. There's a wide variety of room/villa sizes. If your're getting a lock-off room, it's more like a large hotel room. If you get a villa suite, theres a full bedroom, monster bath and separate shower, kitchen, living room and lanai. Read the other reviews and do your homework at Marriott.com to get all the detailed resort amenities. It's all true. Super attentive staff. The grounds are georgeous and immaculately kept. There's a type and size pool for all tastes. I'm not sure how anyone can rate this property anything other than a 5. We've been there four years in a row and it just gets better and better. The four lagoons provide ample space for all and a quiet beach setting day and night. The lighted walks that connect the lagoons make evening and night walks extra special. Can't wait to go back again. Our favorite place.

Reviews.Title: “Out of the way location plus they need better service on their watersports activities”
Reviews.Author: SDworldtraveller
Reviews.Content: Nice place but have to drive to everything and restaurant selection is limited. We had a nice visit to Oahu, who wouldn't, but may think again about staying here. It's a nice facility but they need to have more activities at their hotel. We tried to go paddleboarding 3 times and all 3 times they were out of boards or they closed at 3:00 pm. Wouldn't be so bad if there were other facilities close by but seemed all the paddleboard, surf, kayak, etc are either on the East side or Kailua, an hour's drive if you're lucky. Marriott needs to be more thoughtful of their guests and make note of things that are in "high" demand, maybe there's a reason!!

Reviews.Title: “nice place for a quiet vacation”
Reviews.Author: BigMac26
Reviews.Content: Arrived the middle of August. The resort is a 25 minute drive from the aiport.. Within the complex there is the Marriott Beach Club, the Marriott Iliani Hotel , private condo towers, and the new Disney Alani Resort which was going to open at the end of August. You need a car as this place is not near anything. Parking however is over $30/day. I complained of course but they said it was a goverment imposed rate - really? We were supposed to have a studio with an ocean view but got a view of another tower. If you stood in one corner of the small balcony you could see the ocean, however if you stood in the other corner you could see the refinery. Yes that's right there is barbers Point refinery, and a power plant, and a garbage burner all within a mile of the resort. But who spends much time in their rooms. The property itself is excellant. several pools and swimming lagoons. Our studio was reasonably appointed and could accomodate 2 adults and 2 kids comfortably. The food at the resort was way overpriced - $18 for a hamburger. This is typical for these kinds of resorts but I don't get it. They overprice themselves so much that the majority of the guests don't eat there. Problem is there is not much in the way of decent restaurants other than an Outback which is about 5 mlies away in Kapolei. Within the complex there is an ABC store, a hawaiian barbque fast food joint, and a mexican restaurant. The ABC store is well stocked and reasonably priced as is the barbeque. Hopefully with Disney opening and bringing another 2,000 people to the area, additional amenities will be added. We went to the Fia Fia Luau held in the beach club on tuesday nights. Very expensive at $90 pp. The buffett was disgusting. Dried up fish and chicken, fatty stringy steaks and some salads. No seafood. If this was your hometown buffet the place would go out of business in a month. They start seating you at 4:30pm, Feed you at 5:15pm, have a really hoaky audience participation with one of the samoans that seems to go on for hours (it did) and the real show doesn't begin until 7:00pm The Samoan performers however were very good. They put their hearts into it. my advice to them would be to go find another hotel for their show. When the show started people tried to sneak in to watch but the were mostly chased out of the immediate area. Maybe Marriott could offer a non dinner packge, a couple of drinks and the show for $40. That I would take but never again the buffet. So why 4 stars? As I said the resort itself is beautiful and the rooms perfectly adequate. They can't do much about the location.. Just know what to expect.

Reviews.Title: “Gets better and better”
Reviews.Author: drdavecinci
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from a one week stay at Marriott KoOlina Beach Club. This is our sixth visit to this property over the past four years. Each time seems to get better & better. Two restaurants on site. The more formal (remember in Hawaii nothing is formal) restaurant is Chuck's Steakhouse: good steaks and excellent soup/salad bar (business casual attire and shorts OK). The other restaurant has changed its name to Longboards. It is beachfront and serves lunch and dinner with essentially the same menu: burgers, fries, wraps, fish sand. etc. Awesome view at sunset! Remember that these are studio (with kitchenettes), 1 & 2 bedroom condos with full kitchen units. This is NOT a full service hotel with room service or daily housekeeping service. This is a timeshare condo property that is used primarily by returning owners. Marriott rents out unused units and in my opinion what they charge is well worth what you get. KoOlina is a planned residential community along the southwest corner of Oahu. It is about 20 miles west of Honolulu airport and 30 miles west of Waikiki. You definetly need a rental car to explore the area. There is a golf course on site and several other restaurants within walking distance of the Beach Club. A J.W. Marriott hotel with 3 restaurants is also only 1 mile away (also on property). A new Disney Vacation Club property is soon to open close-by. If you're a night-life individual this may be too quiet and remote for you. Ideal for families who want a quiet beach(4 lagoons/no waves),& 3 pools with a very relaxed elegant atmosphere. Property is very well maintained, units I have found very clean and staff very pleasant and helpful. Highly recommend and can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Beautiful Surroundings”
Reviews.Author: LEADerPhilly
Reviews.Content: We arrived right on time as I'm a vacation owner at a different location. I was very surprised the line was sooooo long to check in. After flying from the east coast to Hawaii, this was the last thing you want, well we got it. My family of 5 is assigned my room only to discover later that the parking deck view with the oil refinery domes in the immediate horizon was graciously given to us because I'm not a vacation renter from THAT location. Take note. However, the room was Excellent on the inside. VERY CLEAN and large for my family of 5. We had a suite plus a connecting room. Internet worked flawlessly, so we kept the curtains drawn and everything from that point on was GREAT! The staff at this hotel are FANTASTIC!! I have 3 daughters 17, 14, 12 and they all loved the activities and the action. It was not very crowded and by the 3rd day all the staff recognized me by face and some by name. The only down side is the food and drinks are VERY, VERY Expensive. Bring your Costco card so you can feed your family. I would highly recommend this location in Oahu if you have a family and you're not into the crowds. Ask for Tina in Concierge. Her infectious smile will force you to laugh your way through the beautifully manicured landscapes. A real winner, this place is.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the lush green setting. Will go again!”
Reviews.Author: GeorgiaOhioTraveler
Reviews.Content: Great setting to relax. Property is very well cared for and the staff seems to cater to visitors. Can be expensive if you eat in the on site restaurants, but I do recommend the breakfast buffet at Longboards. Not far from local stores so you can buy food and even grill outside at the Beach Club. You will need a car! You are at a distance from Honolulu and Waikiki (about 30-45 min.) Traveling during rush hour can be a daunting experience because of the sheer volume and construction, but we got through it with patience. Wonderful place to go for couples and families. Many children but separate areas for adults keeps noise under control. Great Place! HIghly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic family resort”
Reviews.Author: yogimomma
Reviews.Content: This resort had EVERYTHING going for it, except for location. That is why I gave it four instead of 5 stars. We had a car the whole time and from here, traveled to the North Shore (Waimea Bay, Shark's Cove, Turtle beach) which took about 25-30 minutes. We drove to Waikiki for Duke's on Sunday, canoe rides and a Bon Dance: that drive took us 30 minutes. Our scenic commute on H3 of the Ko'olau range to the Byodo temple took us about 45 minutes. As long as you don't go during rush hour, you should be fine! Now. About the resort. We stayed in a 2 bedroom ocean front with views of the pool with the slide and lagoons. It had two balconies, a well equipped kitchen with granite counter tops, comfortable beds and pillows, and two bathrooms. I LOVED the master bathroom. There was a glass shower and toilet room and a separate room for the garden tub. The tub had a french door window that gives you views of the ocean when soaking in the tub. Heaven! Our towels were replenished and room cleaned every day. You can check out beach towels and rent toys at one of the cabanas. There are three gyms, several pools, and beautiful grounds. There were lots of activities going on every day: One day there was a summer bash with activities, games, a bouncy castle and food on the lawn. There are koi fish feedings, there was a free torch ceremony and hula show on the lawn, starring Chief Sielo. Very nice!! You can pick up a daily itinerary of resort activities at one of the huts by the pools. What's nearby: Target (cheaper than Safeway) organic grocery store Leonard's truck pretty close for yummy malsadas!!! water park Within the gated community, there's an ABC store along with a cute ice cream parlor. The food on property is not very good and overpriced. We did eat our overpriced, mediocre food at Longboards and had a great time listening to the live music and enjoying the view of the gorgeous sunset. In Lagoon #2, I swam with two sea turtles and some colorful fish. Lagoon #3 is cloudy and has poor visibility. Despite not loving the remote location at first, I got used to coming to this quiet respite after a hectic day of touring. It's a beautiful resort and has a lot going for it!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay away from the Honolulu and Waikiki crowds”
Reviews.Author: pamalam
Reviews.Content: Don't get me wrong, I love Waikiki and usually stay there for part of my trip. But after a couple days, I need a little more relaxation. This is the second time staying at Ko Olina and we liked it just as much this time. If you're looking for a full-service hotel, this is not for you. But if you like the idea of a big condo, with very nice rooms and lots of space you will be happy here. The pools and grounds are beautiful, lots of lush Hawaiian foliage. It's very laid back, no need to save chairs at the pool or beach. We usually have breakfast and lunch in the room, then venture out for dinner. Not a huge amount of choices in the area, but that could change with the Disney timeshare property opening soon. It's about 30 mins from Honolulu without traffic, so you have to factor that in. We had some good meals at the JW Marriott restaurants close by and the beach bar at our place. Also a Roy's very close by at the golf course. Beautiful place and we'll definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a full resort hotel, it is a time share and family oriented”
Reviews.Author: pickyreno
Reviews.Content: I have never stayed at a vacation club before. We got a studio room for $177/night. My marriott platinum status did not get me any room upgrades here, no such thing. The room said kitchenette, that was a joke. It was a microwave oven and toaster in a the cabinet. There was a coffee maker. I could not get late checkout, no such thing, but I did get a stay and linger in their lounge with use of their pool and lockers/showers. The best part was their sand bottom pool and the 3 pools appropriate for kids. The bad part was the pool, I could not order food and drinks by the pool - there was no one taking orders or an in pool resturant. I'm used to full service with turn down, room service, ordering a Mojito poolside... well, none of that here. Sadly. We had to ask the maid to make up our room and when we did, she said, sorry this is not a full service hotel so we only do this by special request. Parking is $30 a day. We are not owners of the time share. It's great to get away from the hustle of waikiki, but still be close enough to drive there. With that being said, we drove there and to Ala moana every night. The Disney hotel will be openning next door and that should make it a lot more lively. There are nice beach lagoons, but water is cooler than carribean - remember, this is subtropic and not tropic. There is a target nearby to get items. The golf course here is amazing, but no view of the ocean. They do offer a lot of activities daily for the kids that include arts and crafts. The place is very appropriate for families. Breakfast at Longboards is a buffet and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Loved my Hawaiian adventure”
Reviews.Author: flclsax
Reviews.Content: My anticipation to return to the islands of Hawaii began last year when I decided to trade in my Hyatt property in Florida for two rooms at a resort in Hawaii. In November I received the much anticipated call that I had successfully executed a trade and was staying at the Ko Olina on Oahu. I immediately began researching the property and reading many reviews on Tripadvisor and other sights. The vast majority of reviews praised the property and justifiably so. I cannot understand the reviews of the 'nay sayers" but to each their own. The property was absolutely beautiful from start to finish. Upon arriving, we were warmly welcomed by a genuine and helpful staff member who directed us to the front desk for check-in. The staff at reception was extremely kind and helpful in getting us quickly started on our vacation adventure. Due to our early arrival, our rooms were not available but they were more than willing to store our luggage and give us temporary passes to begin enjoying the property. In addition, they offered to call my cell phone when the rooms were ready, which they did! The resort was full that week but we had no problem navigating the area, enjoying the ammenities or finding a space at one of the three pools. The only concern I have regarding the pools is with the Reflection pool, also known as the "quiet pool". Unfortunately, not listed as an adults only pool lead to many young families setting up camp and allowing their children to run amoke in this quiet area. We, along with others, made several phone calls to the front desk asking them to deal with the situation. They made some attempts at dealing with the problem but unfortunately, when you come up against mommies who feel their children can do anything they want witout regard for others, there isn't much they could do. We talked with one security guard who told us that some parents just give him a hard time when he asks them is control their children. Not surprising as this seems to me the "MO" of some young parents today. I digress... Dining and drink options were expensive but expected for a resort like this. There were a few properties within walking distance to try which offered variety. In addition, within 5 miles is a shopping plaza that contains many chain restaurant options. Generally, we don't eat at chain restaurants on vacation so we enjoyed trying the local fare at the properties within the Ko Olina area. The activities offered at the resort and the surrounding areas were wonderful. Snorkling in the lagoon's, walking trails, swimming, etc. The best night of the week was walking to the ABC store and picking up food to have a sunset picnic on the lagoon. What a moving moment and a great experience to share with friends or family. In addition to these we wanted to attend a luau and chose to go off property to Germaines instead of the Fia, Fia offered at the property. It was a wonderful experience (not good for young children) and from talking with other guests who did attend the luau at the resort, we had a much better experience! Overall, the experience at Ko Olina was a wonderful, relaxing and enjoyable time. They truly captured the idea of "paradise".

Reviews.Title: “Another Fantastic Trip to Ko Olina!”
Reviews.Author: bellson88
Reviews.Content: This place is fantastic. Whether you are traveling with adults or children, there is certainly something for everyone here. The pools are great and the ocean view rooms are gorgeous! If you want to escape the hustle of Waikiki and enjoy a few days of relaxation on Oahu, this is the place for you. Tip, If you get down to the new pool early enough you can move your chairs towards the ocean and have a direct view of the water all day :) No need to rent a cabana!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for a Time Share Holiday”
Reviews.Author: jmcneur
Reviews.Content: We spent a wonderful week at this time-share property in April. The suite rooms were spacious and clean with beautiful ocean views from the Lanai balcony. Swimming and other activities great for kids although we did not travel this time with kids. There is Marriott hotel on the same property in which we have also stayed which is great. The location is great as it is close to Honolulu if you want to go and isolated enough to be extremely relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “A great family destination”
Reviews.Author: mvsteve
Reviews.Content: We got a one bedroom penthouse suite for our family of four. We have 2 girls 7 & 9. The room was amazing. It had a full kitchen, spacious living / dining area and a huge bathroom with separate tub and shower. The beds were great. King size in the bedroom and an incredible sleeper sofa that had a solid plywood base when you pulled it out. It was very comfortable - really. They provided us with a rollaway and our niece came and stayed with us too. The grounds are spectacular. They have several different pools for all different age groups - from little kids to adults - and they are all incredible in their own way. One is shallow with a sand bottom like a lagoon leading into the pool, and another has a great water slide and tunnels. There is a great ocean lagoon right there too. Boredom was never a problem. The part I liked the most was that they didn't over charge us at the little store they have. I needed flip flops and they were $10. Big bottled waters were $2.50. They had fresh fruit and great salads for sale all very reasonably priced. This place was a winner!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it, can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: DaLumZ
Reviews.Content: We had our first "staycation" here for 3 nights. There were 4 adults & twin 1 year olds & we stayed in a 1 bedroom villa. There was more than enough room for all of us. We had a full kitchen with dishwasher, and a washer/dryer in our unit. We took advantage of all the amenities in our room, as well as used the gas grill right outside our building. The pools, kids playground & lagoon offered several options for us to keep our twins content. We will definitely be enjoying another staycation there one day!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better.”
Reviews.Author: LACubsfan
Reviews.Content: My husband, two kids ages 2 and 11, along with my friend as our babysitter stayed here at the end of July in a 2 bedroom villa. It was a fantastic place to stay and the villa was plenty big for all of us. The hotel provided a nice clean pack n play and high chair which was very helpful. The kitchen supplied pretty much everything you need for cooking quick meals. My kids were happy to have a "home cooked" meal every other night or so. I did wish a few basic items were included such as salt and pepper, cooking oil, foil, etc. Otherwise, it really was such a great convenience to have. The Safeway, Target, Costco and Longs Drugs, and many other stores are just a short drive away and the bell hops are great for helping you bring up all your groceries. I was always glad to tip because they were so nice. The beachs and pools were fabulous. The lagoon was always clean and not very crowded, but we spent the most time at the pools simply because there was so much to do. The water slide, volleyball net, basketball hoop, and lagoon pool were great fun. My 2 year old loved the shallow water in the lagoon pool. We only ate once at Chuck's and Longboards. The food at both were just decent, but the service was very friendly and nice. I regret not being able to try Roy's, but I suggest leaving the property for food, especially if you're looking for good local cuisine. The Fia Fia show was unfortunately canceled shortly after dinner due to rain, which I was really sad about. The chief was so funny and entertaining and we were really looking forward to a great show.
