The food was good, so at least we were able to enjoy that. My family will definitely return to the Beach Club in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: GilroyGal
Reviews.Content: The new tower has the best views of all. Had a great time with our 10 year old sun at the new pool which has a water slide. Clean property with great amenities. It just keeps getting better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: mfgreps
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here several times and the experience is always the same. The staff is very attentive to your needs. The villa we stayed had a great view of the ocean and the lagoons. Great restuarants to choose from as there are several other hotels to dine at as well including Roy's at the golf course. I would not recommend the Paradise Cove Luau. We tried it several years ago and thought it might be better, but was very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “A large but great resort”
Reviews.Author: fizzyDorking
Reviews.Content: As a Marriott owner this was our first trip after 7 years of ownership and we weren't disappointed. The villa was well equipped although the kitchen was a little small for 4 people and potentially 8 if you used both sofa beds. We had a lovely view over the marina and the sea from the 10th floor. The pools and beaches are lovely and as every Marriott staff were very efficient. I found the bed very hard and mentioned this, very quickly they fitted foam toppings which solved the problem, they also solved the waste disposal which got blocked immediately. Every request was followed up by reception to make sure we were happy. Everything about the reseort is very efficient. My only warning is be prepared for a very large resort with alot of people, it is not an intimate experience, you can't find private space outside but I am sure most people who book to got there are not expecting that. It was a bit big for us, we prefer a quieter more personal experience. You can't fault Marriott for that, they are running a very large resort very very well.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place”
Reviews.Author: mat031
Reviews.Content: The location is beautiful, the rooms too. I was surprised at how good the restaurants were. everyone on the staff was very nice to us, I will be back here for sure!

Reviews.Title: “2nd Stay in a slice of heaven on earth!!”
Reviews.Author: CandyCaneCA
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay here. Total slice of heaven again. We stay in the two bed/two bath ocean front villa. So beautiful!! This is a timeshare resort, not a hotel..everything is clean and the grounds and pools are so plush with waterfalls and beautiful plants and flowers everywhere.. Someone posted that there are two pools, but there are actually three different pools, and five jacuzzis spreadout throughout the grounds..It's nice too because there are family jacuzzis for all ages, adult only jacuzzis, and 14 & up jacuzzis. I cannot wait to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ko'Olina is worth the drive”
Reviews.Author: Traveller_From_CA
Reviews.Content: If you are reading this, you know that Ko'Olina is west of Honolulu and maybe 30 minutes from the airport. It is not far, it's easy to get back and forth to the sights, and it is well worth the drive to stay away from Honolulu and Waikiki Beach. I would highly recommend staying here. There were several things I wondered about before staying here that I thought I would pass along that might be helpful. ROOMS We had a 2bdrm non-lock off with 6 people in it. It was spacious, had a great view of the lagoon and pool. We used the kitchen facilities for every meal and ate on the balcony every night. There were no noise problems since the new construction is finished on the outside, they are working on the inside. The whole facility is in great shape. LAGOON The lagoon is fantastic for a dip and play time with the kids, although a bit chilly. The rocks break the waves at the inlet, so this is not a good place for boogie boarding. It is also not a good place for snorkeling. I was worried about crowding since it seems kind of small, but it was never crowded. There was always alot of chairs and alot of space to spread out in the water. There is also a nice walking path that goes by all 4 lagoons, great for an evening walk to watch the sun go down. Disney's Aulani is 2 lagoons down, and I can see that one byt the JW Marriott getting crazy busy. POOL There were 2 pools and both were great. The first one has a sand bottom entry and a shallow playing area for little kids. It is bordered by alot of greenery and there is alot of shade. The 2nd pool was even better with a slide, several waterfalls, a cave and meandering water paths. I never found the pools overcrowded and we never had trouble getting an umbrella to drop our stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time-Share, Not a "Hotel"!”
Reviews.Author: Cubfan102
Reviews.Content: We own at this resort. It is a time-share facility, not an elaborate hotel. We have owned for nearly 10 years and love coming back yearly! We have a two bedroom, two bath unit with a full kitchen and living room. If you come here and you're not a time-share owner realize that this IS a family place so yes, there will be lots of kids and family type things going on. We really appreciate Marriott because they listen to what we would like to see here, and have done a lot of it, and more. We don't come expecting a hotel with room service et al, and neither should you. The scenery is unparalleled and the facilities are wonderful. We enjoy the idea of having our own kitchen because we stay for more than a few days. We stay for weeks. Grilling is a big part of our stay with fresh fish, fruits and vegetables a part of our daily diet. The breezes, sunsets and water views are incredible, friendly staff and more than comfortable accomodations make us know that we are ohana and welcomed home every time we have returned. Highly recommend!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perrrrfect family vacation”
Reviews.Author: whatsinaname50
Reviews.Content: We felt like we were royalty. We rented a two bedroom, 2 bathroom suite. What a surprise to open the door and look out at the ocean.......stunning. My husband, myself and our 4 children were thrilled with the location, the scenery, the warm safe lagoons. The full kitchen came in handy - we only ate out twice while on day trips. We attend the on-site luau and loved every moment of it. No need to eat out - Safeway and Costco are just 7 minutes away. You will need a car but it is well worth it. We did alot of exploring and might not have if we were in downtown Waikiki. So relaxing - can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “If only it was closer, I would be there every year!”
Reviews.Author: forthelove
Reviews.Content: This was our third time staying at this resort and it is amazing! This is our favorite vacation ever. The entire resort is so well maintained, staff is very friendly and this is not a tourist trap. Ko Olina is more built up since the last time we were there, but it is still not over crowded. For a perfect Hawaiian vacation this is the spot! I just wish it wasn't 11 hours for us to get there. We plan on going back every few years.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott vacation club owner”
Reviews.Author: Daisymae1367
Reviews.Content: I booked Oahu because plane tickets were cheaper than Kauai and Maui, which really are the best of Hawaii. We are so over Waikiki. However staying at Ko Olina we were pleasantly surprised. The grounds are very open, the views are gorgeous and the staff were wonderful. You really need to rent a car if you stay here. Costco, Target and Safeway about 8 minutes away. We stocked up the first day because we did not want to eat on the property. Longboards restaurant was such a rip off, but we were waiting for our 4 pm check in and we had no choice. Food and drinks was not very good. We drove a couple of days to North Shore. Turtle Beach was awesome. Matsumoto shaved ice a must. Spent a day at Pearl Harbor and Dole Plantation. One day getting surfing lessons at Waikiki. If you've always wanted to surf this is the place to learn. When you wipe out you fall into 3 feet of warm water and soft sand. We did the Fia Fia Luau... Our comp for listening to the timeshare. Pretty good food and show was entertaining. My 7 year old was mezmerized. Overall a great vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort overall, but...”
Reviews.Author: likeanicehotel
Reviews.Content: Overall, we had a very nice week long stay at Marriott's Ko Olina Beach Club. The property is pretty, the rooms are large and well kept up, the service was good (Tina, the concierge should get some sort of medal for her enthusiasm!), the gym is great, and the pools are fun. The best part of the property by far, is the series of lagoons, each of which is a quiet little oasis on the ocean. We rented snorkel gear and had a great time exploring the reefs and looking at tropical fish. Considering how crowded and noisy the pool areas were, I was surprised by how relatively empty the beach was. There were always plenty of lounge chairs available --and the views were seriously beautiful! As nice as the property is, we had a couple of issues. As other have said, the restaurants onsite are very expensive and pretty mediocre. It's a resort, so I get why they are going to be expensive, but If you're gonna charge a lot of money, the food should be good and none of the restaurants on site were great. The Marketplace has sandwiches and snacks which is convenient, and there are grills on site to cook up lunches and dinners, but if you're not in the mood to cook yourself every day, you're limited. There isn't much food within walking distance except for Roy's (which is great/expensive) and in the new shopping center down the road which is still mostly vacant (a long, but do-able walk.) At the shopping center, we ate a couple of times at the mexican place called Just Tacos, which was good and pretty affordable (and has more than "just tacos!") I think that when the Disney resort opens soon, the shopping center will fill up quickly and there will be a lot more food options. So this issue might just take care of itself. The biggest issue I have with Ko Olina is the location. We picked it because we didn't want to be smack in the middle of Waikiki, but Ko Olina is so remote -- isn't near anything! So definitely rent a car and expect to drive AT LEAST a 30-40 minute drive to any attractions except for golf (ie: Waikiki, Pearl Harbor, horseback riding.) Also, don't expect a scenic drive. It's highways all the way. So overall, we thought it was a nice property with a few flaws... but if they don't seem like flaws to you, then you'll have an excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wow ! Picture perfect postcard Resort.”
Reviews.Author: 359miraloma
Reviews.Content: It's July 10th we arrives yesterday, great Vacation location without all the noise of the city and crowd. The check in line took forever, there were 6 CSR checking guest in it took us apps 45min to get to the counter. Marriott needs to have more staff at check in, especially when 15-20 guest are checking in. The staff here are all extremely friendly and helpful with the Aloha Charm. The weather is just perfect, it's in the 80s with a nice breeze. The beach on prooerty is not crowded amd the Water nice and warm in the lagoon. Target and Costco are only 10 minutes away with lots of other shops and restaurant. FYI : I traded one of my weeks with II, all exchanged weeks are assigned floors 1-5 only. I insisted on a higher floor advised 6 And above are for owners and those renting directy From Marriott. Even though the week deposited by owner of Ko Olina was a platinum week. We are looking firsts to the next 7 days to go slow to enjoy our vacation. We will be back again for labor day week 2011. We own 6 Marriott properties including Newport Coast I would have to rate this one the best Marriot Resorts. We only stay at Marriott timeshares when on vacation even trading only Marriott, my standards are high along with Marriott's 5 star. Enjoy your vacation here. We had Rain twice today which was nice but unexpected. We will be back every 2 years have to to to Maui and Aruba too. We are here to relax and do nothing this is the place to do that. Our 5,10,11 year olds are having ao much fun and enjoying the resort. We own a lot of M

Reviews.Title: “Awesome...great resort for couple of family...perfect for our honeymoon.”
Reviews.Author: mrdie27
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough good things about this place. Great service...friendly staff. Lost track of how many pools and jacuzzi's. One Lagoon onsite...and others within walking distance. There is so much to do...activities for families etc. Barbecue/grilling area...great and cleaned daily. Great resources for planning day trips/sight seeing. Had full kitchen, washer dryer and monstrous king size bed...balcony with great view. Beautiful views. Restaurant - Longboard's is quite expensive but if you hit them up for drinks during happy hour 3-5pm, not too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Great family vacation spot”
Reviews.Author: Tmag10
Reviews.Content: This is a grat place for families. But quiet enough for couples who want to relax as well. The rooms are perfect with two large rooms living area with pull out sofa full kitchen and washer/dryer. There is plenty to do in the area but the best thing we did was snorkel with our three kids 8, 13, 14 in the calm crystal clear lagoon right down the path from our building. The hotel did not feel busy or crowded and we had hours of fun checking out the fish. Im not really the fake lagoon type but this was dome right and had a very natural feel to it that allowed us to explore in a safe and relaxed way. The fitness center was really nice and centrally located which made it easy for my husband and I to take turns working out. We bought some food/ snacks at Target a few miles away and stocked the refrigerator. We had an awesome dinner at Roys which serves high end fusion bit also accommodated the little one. Everyone was friendly and kind. Golf course is right there and you can shuttle over if you don't want to move the car. There are also other restaurants really close by. We drove to the north shore one day great day trip. This hotel is awY from the touristy areas but still full service and Marriott-ish.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Trip"”
Reviews.Author: sunandsnowNewYork
Reviews.Content: Ko Olina is a great spot for families. The pools are great for kids, as are the lagoons. There are sufficient dining options at a variety of price points - We tried them all. The concierge ( Tina for us) was super helpful. The bartenders were great. Sites in Oahu are spread out, so you need a car. Ko Olina was 20 - 60 minutes from anything you may want to do.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott's Ridiculous Rules Ko Olina”
Reviews.Author: rdwarrior1
Reviews.Content: I have just stayed at Marriott's Ko'Olina Beach Club - what a JOKE! 1.You cannot put up a beach umbrella on the beach - Like I have been doing on Kaanapalli beach for the last 20 years. I have fair skin and cannot be in the sun - I would like to sit down by the water and watch my grandaughter swim in the ocean. 2. You cannot use or put in your Paddle board in "their Laggon" to paddle out of the lagoon - but you can rent their Kayaks and tramplolines to jump in the water - so the safety issue does not apply - also they have little or no fish in "their Lagoon" smorkeling here is weak. They will sell you their $17.00 Hamburger. Very Dissapointing

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort - but WAY too many kids.....”
Reviews.Author: theblondegirl85
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 5 days in Waikiki and 5 days at the Marriott in Ko Olina. We figured Ko Olina would be the relaxing part of our trip, but unfortunately, this resort was swarming with little kids and there was ZERO quiet and relaxation. There is a "adult/reflection" pool, however, there are still children in it all day long. In fact, a young girl threw up in it while we were there. So much for an "adult" pool. If you have small children, this is a great family resort, HOWEVER, if you're a couple looking to relax or on your honeymoon or anniversary trip, I would definitely look at staying somewhere else. Yes, the grounds are beautiful, and the beach is beautiful, but as a couple looking to relax without children for a few days, this was NOT the place to be. And yes it is pricy, but hey - it's Hawaii.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymooner's Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: GabyN29
Reviews.Content: Amazing beautiful gorgeous hotel! OMG! LOVE this place, people are great! You can see the sunset from their beach, everything is beautiful, starbucks on site, awesome LUAU! highly recommend it! :)

Reviews.Title: “Finally, A Relaxing Vacation”
Reviews.Author: lululouise
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one bedroom villa with a view of the golf course. We had a wonderful time doing nothing! Well, we did go to pool and take a walk everyday down to the J.W. Marriott. We like to stay here for the space, the lagoons, and being away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. Here's a few tips: (1) If arriving during the day, make sure you stop at Costco and Target to get your food and whatever necessities you need. (2) If arriving late in the evening, stop at the Island Market (aka ABC Store) and pick up something to tie you over. It's a few blocks away on the way to the resort. (3) I wouldn't recommend eating at Chuck's. For the amount of money you spend, you can make your own steak and shrimp dinner and have plenty leftovers for the next day. (4) Have fun and relax...it's Hawaii!

Reviews.Title: “Our third stay here and we will be back!”
Reviews.Author: mike89t
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been been visiting the Ko Olina Beach Club for years. We loved it so much we ended up purchasing a time share there. It's important to remember that this is a time share property. So if you are expecting high end room service and such the JW Marriott that is next door is a better choice for you. With that said, this property is fantastic. The grounds are beautiful and the villas are large and tastefully decorated. There is plenty of room for a large family to spread out. If you get the larger 1 or 2 bedroom villas they come with a full kitchen and laundry machines. By having full size laundry machines in your room, it allows you to pack lighter. We tend to do laundry 3-4 times during our stay. It's really convienent. With a full sized kitchen that has pretty much everything you need you can really save on food costs. Why take the family out to breakfast for $80 when you can easily cook it for under $10. It's a great way to save money that can be used on other fun stuff while on vacation. There is a Safeway just a few miles down the road that we go and stock up at the first day we arrive at the resort. We really love the pool areas as well as the lagoons. My daughter was 6 when we visited and I took her snorkling for the first time in one of the lagoons. The lagoons are great because they are protected from the big surf by large rocks stragically placed at the enterance to each lagoon. Yet each lagoon is still open to the ocean allowing for endless types of tropical fish to call the lagoons home. My daughter had a blast and was blown away by all of the beautiful fish that she saw. The pools are fantastic as well. My 4 year old who doesn't swim yet loved the shallow beach entry pool. My daughter loved the new pool which was added recently. It has a fast waterslide incorperated into it. I can't say enough good things about this resort but it is far from perfect. 2 of the 3 times we have stayed here our room wasn't ready by the 4pm checkin time. One time we had to wait 2 hours after the 4pm checkin time for our room to be ready. The restaurants that are onsite are overpriced and the food is just OK. Although the grill by the pool does serve decent food and really good drinks. We did have some broken stuff in our room once. Microwave missing a foot that would rock. Dishwasher that had broken loose and would fall over when opened. Wood floor warped in the kitchen and creaked. However everything was fixed when we called the front desk. They quickly sent up a service person. Still that took away an hour of our vacation waiting for them to come fix these problems. With that said, the problems were very minor. We love staying here and the kids can't wait to go back in October of 2012.

Reviews.Title: “We love it here!”
Reviews.Author: elj111
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to KoOlina, my husband's first, and my parents' fifth, and we all loved it. It is a great place, very clean, friendly staff, and has great facilities. We didn't have any kids with us, but it would be a wonderful place to take kids, and there was plenty of room to avoid children if you wanted to go that route too!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Family Venue”
Reviews.Author: Lanne65
Reviews.Content: This is a time share property and we had a portion of a larger suite. The room was spacious enough for my husband and myself with a king bed, seating area, balcony, bath and kitchenette. We did not want to cook on this trip! There was no room service in this building, due to the time share aspect of the property. The property is beautifully maintained. There are many activities for all age groups; exercise sessions and golf for adults, crafts and fun projects for younger children. There were several dining venues on the property with varying price ranges. The JW Marriott was nearby with an excellent restaurant, as well as the restaurant at the golf course.

Reviews.Title: “If they could figure a way to charge for air, they would!”
Reviews.Author: Rayandbobo
Reviews.Content: Nice place, kind of inconvenient location way out in the boonies... I wonder why they would charge $30/night for parking... they will nice and dime you to death.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and relaxing.”
Reviews.Author: Kehoe356
Reviews.Content: We stayed in May 2011 and it was one of the most relaxing and beautiful places we've been to. Enjoyed every minute and can't wait to go back. Away from the crowds at Waikiki. The lagoons were awesome. The people at resort were very friendly and so were the locals.

Reviews.Title: “A jewel on Oahu”
Reviews.Author: TracyHern
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in a couple of places on Oahu, and this was by far my favorite. It was a little out of the way (about a 20-30 minute drive into Honolulu) but has a fantastic beach, lots of comfy rooms, and great amenities. It's right on the beach and has its own little harbor, golf right next door, and lots of fun things to do during the day. We stayed in the timeshare part, and the rooms were great. Kitchen was large, beds were comfy, and we were able to get adjoining rooms that we could lock off if we needed a little privacy. There were not a lot of restaurant options nearby, but there was a good deli where we ate breakfast each day. And one of the coolest parts was the unlimited soda refills - we purchased a couple of mugs at the beginning of our stay and we were able to refill them unlimited times throughout our stay (at the deli, only during daytime hours when it was open).

Reviews.Title: “Always a great time!”
Reviews.Author: Gwen523
Reviews.Content: My husband and I purchased a timeshare at the Ko Olina Beach club in 2007, and had not visited since. We've taken vacations every year, just not back to Hawaii. Going back in February was just as much fun as we remembered! The resort is still very well maintained, they opened another pool to attract the kiddies (draws them away from the other pools - which is good for us adults traveling alone), and I love being able to use the grills for dinner some nights. We had steaks, prawns, lobsters, grilled vegis and corn (all purchased from the local Safeway and Costco), which we took to our rooms and enjoyed with several bottles of wine while watching the sunset from our balcony, or one night while watching a movie we rented from the local blockbuster. My only complaint is the food onsite. The restaurants are all subpar. However, this isa small draw back, because traveling to decent restaurants in Honolulu or on the other side of the island was a great time (minor traffic jams, but NOTHING like LA traffic.) Note: As a owner parking was free for us, but I understand it can be expensive for non-owner. All-in-all, I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL - AVOID KOLOHE'S BEACH AND BAR GRILL”
Reviews.Author: forbm
Reviews.Content: Great stay at Ko Olina Beach Club. The only downside, very poor food at Kolohe's Beach Bar & Grill. Overpriced for "soggy burgers". Probably the worst food we have experienced. This place makes Tacco Bell food appealing.

Reviews.Title: “This is how you picture your dream Hawaiian vacation!”
Reviews.Author: laceyhancock
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel! Great pools, awesome beach, gorgeous views, excellent service. We stayed in a newly remodeled two bedroom room in building 2. Very clean, lots of space, comfortable king size bed, nice shower heads, big bath tub, strong water presure, big balcony... the only 2 complaints I have about the room was the day they came to clean our room they didn't change the bed sheets (I actually like them changed daily when on vacation, but I'll settle for once a week, but they didn't even do that - I think it's because it was a "timeshare"). And the other thing was we kept the air conditioning was on 65 and high fan the whole time and it still got hot at night - not very great air. Other than that, it was fantastic!!!! Stay in a ocean view room - totally worth the extra cost! The shaved ice by the pool was so yummy, the food there was great - pricy, but hey you're on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Forget the Beach Club, head down Ko'Olina to the JW Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Traveling4BiznFun
Reviews.Content: The most important piece of information for any visitor to know about this Marriott is - this is not a hotel, it is a timeshare property that rents rooms on a daily basis. I suppose if you are looking for a room with a kitchenette, this can be an option in your search. If you are looking for anything else by way of hotel amenities, the JW Marriott down the road is 10x better. The Beach Club has very small rooms with poor views. It also understaffed with (seemingly) undertrained staff. Of all the trips I have taken to Hawaii, this Marriott was absolutely the biggest disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!!!”
Reviews.Author: pawsthebest
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely Fabulous!! It has 4 lagoons on the property which I enjoyed walking along and swimming. The snorkeling was great there as well. They have great facilities, rooms were very comfortable and the grounds were immaculate!! I'm hoping to stay there again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home.......literally.”
Reviews.Author: StrangeTripper
Reviews.Content: What can i say? We traded into this resort for the 3rd time over the past several years.... Got a spacious 2 BR, ground level room that faced the ocean and was 30 steps from 2 hot tubs and the pool.... Fully stocked kitchen with all the appliances we have at home, delicious oversized shower, decadent king beds in each room, 3 large flat screen TV's (we DON'T have these at home!), in-unit laundry and FREE covered parking close by...... Our 3 and 5 year old boys LOVED the pools, water features and the beach.... In addition, i enjoyed grilling several dinners on the nearby outdoor grills..... Costco, Target and other shopping was 5-10 minutes away, so stocking up for the kitchen was a breeze...... What more could we ask for? I realize people stay at resorts for different reasons. Our plan when staying at the Marriott timeshares is to have a family vacation with all the comforts of home (and then some) once or twice a year.... That said, i can kinda understand some of the negative reviews if people are expecting a romantic getaway or get stuck in a hotel room while expecting a condo unit and so on.... My only complaints about Ko Olina (the area, not the resort itself) is that it's about a half hour from PH, Waikiki, HNL, traffic permitting (double or triple that during rush hour)... Then again, Oahu isn't that big, so the far reaches of the North Shore, traffic permitting, is less than 1.5 hours away.... Also, Ko Olina is near one of the most un-scenic parts of the island....and yes, an industrial park is not far away----it's just down the road from the Costco..... But if you drive a few miles to the North, it gets beautiful again..... That all said, if staying in a naturally beautiful place, or staying near all the "action" is important; or if you don't care to cook and eat in, then the Marriott Ko Olina Beach Club is probably not for you...... I do have a few small complaints regarding this resort----constant cold air blowing when not needed or wanted. Couldn't turn it off. Also, i did notice some people who appeared to be unauthorized guests using the facilities---locals and maybe spring breakers crashing the pools..... Overall, we feel this resort is awesome (for our needs) and plan to return.....

Reviews.Title: “Paradise....”
Reviews.Author: sea jules
Reviews.Content: Beautiful grounds,great beaches,great snorkeling, super nice pools...excellent location just twenty minutes to Waikiki and thirty minutes to the North Shore.Would absolutely stay there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed the Ko Olina on our first trip to Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: emily&brad
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Ko Olina Beach Club for a week in early December, 2010 in a studio room. My husband has always wanted to visit Pearl Harbour, so our first trip to Hawaii had to be to Oahu. I wasn't interested in the craziness or crowds of Honolulu, so this was a good option for us - away from the craziness, but close to anything you'd need. We traded through Interval to stay here, and at the time we were told that all that was available was a studio. We learned after arrival that because Marriott now has its own vacation club that they aren't making the bigger rooms available for exchanges with outside agencies anymore. So FYI non-Marriott owners - you'll probably find it harder to get get higher floors, bigger rooms, ocean views, etc. However, parking was free for us and I really appreciated the calls from the owner's desk prior to our arrival - I still felt like I was treated as an "owner" (though we met others that didn't have the same positive experience). That said, we did have an ocean view room on the 11th floor of the new tower, and the room was just fine for the two of us. While we looked longingly from our tiny (TINY!) balcony with table and 2 chars at the one next door with sun-beds and lots of room, we managed with what we had. If you do get a view of the ocean from your room, it is SPECTACULAR - I would sit out there in the mornings with a cup of coffee and look for whales (and even saw a couple!) The furniture in the Naia tower was all new - including a fitness room right in the tower that we found more comfortable than the bigger one open to all resort guests. And if you're in a studio you won't have laundry in your room, but there are several laundry rooms you can use throughout the building.We thought the tower (and our room) was great and I don't think we'd have done any better anywhere else with a similar category room. The grounds are great. There is a walking/running trail along the property and lagoons that will give you a decent 5km up and back. We didn't have our little one along with us on this trip, but we'd bring her back to this resort for the pools and lagoon alone - small water slides, fountains, a shallow/beach entry pool area, and lots of places to play. Being that we were there without her, we enjoyed the "quiet" pool and adults only hot tubs :) Either way, lots of space and chairs available, even though we were told the property was close to full during our stay. We ate at several of the restaurants onsite and next door (at the JW), and the food was fine. We had the breakfast buffet a couple of times - mainly for convenience (as we didn't have a full kitchen to cook in), and it was fine - nothing to write home about but it did the trick. We had the sushi buffet at the JW (decent sushi and pretty good selection), ate at Roy's (yum!! great meal), and at the steak house on-site (pretty good). Yes, things are on the pricey side at the resort but that was what we expected. We attended the time-share presentation - partly because we were interested in finding out more about the program but we also wanted the free Fia Fia tickets :) The presentation was informative, we were out within the time promised, and although we didn't buy, we appreciated the opportunity to ask any questions we had about their ownership program and the property. Much lower pressure and MUCH more respectful than other time-share presentations we've attended. Fia Fia was excellent. Go. Its a small show, but the chance to watch the Chief in action is worth every penny (or every moment of the time-share presentation). Great for adults and kids. Go. Otherwise, we kept busy with drives up to the North Shore (ask the locals about which shrimp/snack trucks to stop at, they won't lead you astray), drives around the island, a day a Pearl Harbour, a helicopter tour (that was COOL!!!!), a trip in to Waikiki just to see it (craziness!!), got a massage by the pool (very nice), a sunset tour on the Ko Olina cat (leaves from the marina next door - AWESOME), and some good ol' R&R. I don't know that we'd go back again without our kids - but only because there are so many other places I still want to see. But I can see this being a great spot for us as our little ones get older.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Vacation”
Reviews.Author: iLove2vacay
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 (including a 3 year old) stayed here for 6 nights the beginning of March. I knew it was a good hotel from the reviews on this site but I was amazed by the end of the trip. Check in was smooth, the valet were so helpful and nice each time we asked them for directions or needed help with our bags. We had a one bedroom room then upgraded to a two bedroom. The ocean view was amazing. We had the breakfast buffet the first morning at the restaurant on the beach. It was good except for the birds that walk all over and they don't really move when you shoo them away. Other that that it was okay. The rooms were spacious and clean and upgrading to the two bedroom was the easiest transition ever. We packed up all of our belongings and they had someone take our times to a locked room until our room was ready. EVEN our clothes on the hangers and our refrigerated items. All of our food was placed in a large tupperware container for the move. We hung out at the pool until they called us which wasn't too long. There's a gorgeous golf course nearby for those interested. I couldn't believe how nice the staff was. Everyone we encountered was sooo helpful and genuinely nice. It didn't matter if it was the front desk staff, the valet, the concierge, the pool attendants, or the waitresses everyone went above and beyond our requests. One thing that we would have like to see is more restaurants on site. Since our room was a fully stocked condo we made too many trips to the local target to load up on groceries. One place that guests should definitely shop at is the market ABC store located down the street from the hotel. It's in a little store area across from the Disney hotel with a bunch of restaurants. We found the groceries to be alot more economical than the hotel's marketplace and not as far as target (which isn't very far). The store also offered a hot bar and the food was really good. But it was great for a quick run to the store if you don't want to go to far. Some guests even walked to the market (not us). We found everything in there including my son's soy milk that he can't live without. They offer you a store credit depending on how much you spend so save your receipts. My mother used it to pick up a few souvenirs on the way to the airport. Now the pools.....The pools were the best part of the hotel. As most parents of small children know; the kids love the pool even though its not the safest place for them. That's not the case at this resort. This was the ONE place where my son could play on his own. One side of the pool had the beach feature so the water was extremely low, the younger kids could play as they wanted to. The pool had two fountain like spouts for the kids to step on and play with. The kids could sit on the sand, go in the pool or walk over the the playground and play (which my son did every other five minutes). There was a bar-like set up for towels, ice cream, toys and sunblock purchases. There was even a air hose for parents to use to blow up the endless water toys for the children. The hotel even set up a bin of water toys for children to play with. My son truly enjoy this pool. The nearest jacuzzi was a family jacuzzi so my son also enjoyed (it was extremely hot). It would have been good if the pools opened earlier than 7am. Coming from the mainland we were up at 4am with nothing to do for 3 hours. Entertainment........Make sure when you check in you get the resorts schedule of activities. They have so many things for children. They offer fish feeding , arts and crafts, exercise classes, and so much more. We purchased tickets to the Fia Fia show which was amazing. The food was good and the host of the show was sooooooo funny! It was a great way to spend the evening and well worth the price ($90 per adult $45 per child). It was great show and my son often asks to watch our video of it especially the fire throwing parts. If you plan on attending the Fia Fia show buy your tickets as soon as possible since its assigned seating. We did the hotel tour of Pearl Harbor and the downtown area which was really good also ($40 per person). The tour guide was very knowledgeable and knew the answer to every question asked. One thing to know that the concierge didn't tell us is if you sign up to do the pearl harbor tour PACK LIGHT. Since we had a small child I packed a baby bag with the usual. But you can't take anything with you that can't fit into your pockets into the Pearl Harbor exhibit. If you don't mind leaving it on the bus then its not a problem. But we were shocked when we realized that we had to leave our valuables on the bus. So if possible, leave that stuff in the safe in your room. We ended up taking with us the stroller, a camera, and a credit card and cash. That was it. It rained off and on the whole day so we ended up buy sweatshirts and plastic ponchos in the gift shop. But other than that it was great and its a must see if you go to Honolulu. Also make sure to check out the outlets if you like shopping and Waikiki Beach (do it in the day time its waaaay too packed at night). Make sure you have on comfortable shoes too because its a long strip to walk but its fun if you're shopping and stopping to eating. The Honolulu Zoo is on Wakiki beach also. There's a flea market that happens on Mondays and Wednesdays at the stadium, we found that to be the best place to pick up souvenirs and more (again wear comfortable shoes). It was a really great trip (other than the tsunami scare), we are already planning our trip next year to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “DISSAPPOINTED”
Reviews.Author: 7TRAVELLERS
Reviews.Content: The property is beautiful. The resort staff lack training in the finer details of customer service. The service is not what you would expect from a Marriot. Valet area was not helpful in getting the luggage organized and seemed understaffed at arrival. Check in was not very informative or detailed - I receive better at a Motel 6, Super 8. It was like you were being herded like cattle & no real attention to details. Same thing with the Concierge desk, with all but one young lady who was exceptional Restaurants were very pricey for the kids menu $10 hot dog & fries. Adult menus were fair and reasonable. Food quality was average pub fare, not what you would expect from a Marriot. Poolside bar - chalkboard menu is poorly presented & misleading. Bartender was rude and abrupt. Activities - the wife took a snorkeling lesson. Instructor was not trained, not helpful, and rude. One lifeguard was exceptional with the kids. Timeshare sales office was good - no pressure, very detailed. However, they did not communicate effectively regarding the gift. There is a disconnect between sales office & concierge desk about explaining gifts from the sales office & how it works with the bookings & redemption from the concierge desk. Gift ended up being useless with no value. Thanks for wasting my time. These kinds of poor service should not happen at a Marriot

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, very relaxing, first class”
Reviews.Author: Torpster
Reviews.Content: First I want to say that the grounds are beautifully landscaped and all the staff members we had contact with were very pleasant and helpful. Checked in Saturday, arrived 2 PM but room wasn't ready until 4 PM - they gave us access to the resort and pools until our room was ready, the valet held our luggage and even put the milk and beer we purchased prior to our arrival in a refrigerated holding area. We had an efficiency for 3, my wife and I and our 17 year old son. It was about the size of a decent sized hotel room, king sized bed with pull out sleeper sofa, and had a very small balcony - two chairs and a little table. The kitchen area had a microwave, toaster, coffee maker ,sink, and some cups, saucers and silverware. No corkscrew for you wine drinkers. The one bedroom units had much more floor space and a larger balcony. We traded for the room through Interval International and as such were not charged for parking, which was a pleasant suprise. The paved beach walk connecting the lagoons is about 1.5 miles end to end, so you can get in a 3 mile jog going from one end to the other and back. The workout facility had some top norch cardio equipment, dumbells, and weight machines. The area for mat work (stretching, abs, etc.) was limited, but the facility was never that crowded so it was ok. The food prices were high at the casual restaurant -$15-18 for a sandwich and fries, over $6.50 for a beer and over $11 for tropical drinks. The steak place was a better value - most dinners were in the $26-$32 range but that included a soup and salad bar. The on-site grocery store was also pricey. However, within a mile, across from the entrance to the JW Marriott, there was a very good mexican restaurant Just Tacos, with dinners around $10-$15, 24 oz Dos Equis for $6.50 and frozen drinks for about $8. Also, across from Just Tacos is an ABC store (think UDF on steroids), with more reasonable prices on beer, wine and groceries. Of course you can go about 4 miles to Target - they have a food section and the prices weren't bad. You definitely need a car if you stay here - we used RentalCar.com and got a Malibu for 8 days for $210. Gas was $4.16/gallon. The resort is currently upgrading the room decor this summer - sofa's carpets, drapes - but quite honestly our room was in pretty decent shape. The staff did occassionally check the pool area to make sure guests had their wristbands, as it is easy for non-resort guests who are visiting the beaches to walk onto the resort property. While there were some people who looked like they were not guests (resort guests have striped towels) this didn't seem to be a major issue.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort, GREAT beach”
Reviews.Author: coffeediva08
Reviews.Content: Resort was beautiful, meticoulsly maintained. Beach was wonderful, pools great. We had a 2 bedroom condo, worked well for our group of 6 women and 2 kids. Drinks were very pricey, only complaint!

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: IAFamily4
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed 4 nights at the Ko Olina. 16th floor, corner, full ocean view was worth the price. One bedroom suite. Full kitchen, washer/dryer (definitely a plus!). Gorgeous sunsets, beautiful grounds. Restaurant on site was absolutely superb, also enjoyed Roy's at Ko Olina Golf Course. Both are a must. Short trip to Pearl Harbor, Waikiki, North Shore, Dole Plantation. Just plan around morning/afternoon rush hours. Service was very good, fitness center spacious and plenty of weights/equipment. We were there starting 3/16 so didn't experience tsuanami issues. Teenage son wanted to try boogie boarding so we traveled up to North Shore (Sunset Beach) for the waves. Definitely not for the novice, though...he hung in there but currents were very tricky. Matsumotos for shaved ice/beans/ice cream. Oahu is just as beautiful as Maui once you get out of the cities...

Reviews.Title: “Just what the doctor ordered”
Reviews.Author: Kellergirl
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 amazing nights at this beautiful resort just over a week ago. Couldn't have asked for a more relaxing quiet stay. Our villa was on the 4th floor just over the grassy area where they have the luau, great view and we had more room then we really needed. Spent time floating around the lagoon, watching whales breaching from the hottub and just relaxing. Never felt crowded, unlike our stay in Waikiki, and the sunsets were to die for. Quick walk across the street we found good mexican food at Just Tacos, ice cream and the ABC store all at the market place. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort... Terrible Service and False Advertising”
Reviews.Author: Love2Travel1598497
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our 10th wedding anniversary and were very disappointed. First off, we happened to be here during the Tsunami. We were on the north shore when the sirens went off. The roads started getting jammed up so I called the front desk and was told to go where the locals were going. We did so, and spent the night in our car up in the hills. After the "all clear" we finally made it to the hotel, very tired and ready for a nap. When we explained our situation, the lady at the front desk showed no empathy and told me our room was cancelled since we didn't show up. I explained I had called the night before and was told to do what the locals did, which was go to higher ground for the night. She then told me she would have someone else make us a new reservation. This took at least 15 minutes. When the lady in the back came out, I asked if we were finally ready. She gave a snappy response and again showed little empathy for our situation. I understand they were probably tired as well from the previous night, but I was amazed at how little care they showed. We finally got into our room which was fine, but definitely false advertising. We signed up for an "Ocean View" room, but you can't see the ocean from our room. I called the front desk and they explained that "Ocean View" is a category and not that you can actually see the ocean from the room. She actually told me to go on my balcony and try to see around the rest of the building and that we might be able to see it. Amazing. I'm a very frequent Marriott guest, but I will never stay at this resort again. The resort itself is nice, but the service was terrible. It's definitely not a place you want to spend a 10th anniversary at.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we could stay longer!!”
Reviews.Author: Namy1122
Reviews.Content: This was my second time to Hawaii and first in Oahu and I have to retire here when i get the chance. Love the atmosphere here whether its the staff or the locals. Everybody is more than friendly at the hotel which i don't understand some of the reviews i read. I stayed in a studio which is more than enough since I go to Hawaii to see the surroundings not to stay inside and moan about the furniture. Of course hotel food is overpriced, it always is and its never the best. The drive from the airport and downtown Waikiki is about 30 minutes which is not bad at all for me. I guess maybe because I'm from NYC and I deal with traffic all the time. You have Costco and Target 15 minutes away and a quiet lagoon on your doorstep with Waikiki beach and shopping 30 minutes. I did end up buying my first timeshare here because i know without a doubt that I will love coming back. Just hate the 10hr non-stop flight but well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING-Reason why we own it!”
Reviews.Author: jwebb81
Reviews.Content: We visited Oahu back in 2007 and stayed in Waikiki like everyone. We were asked to take a tour of Ko Olina and check out what they have to offer. Immediatly my wife said we werent buying, 3hrs later after seeing the rooms, the grounds and friendly staff we didnt hesitate to purchase a 2 bedroom villa. We are going back for our 3 trip, and have sent both my parents and sister there for vacation. Everytime we go back or check in we see better things. I've read many reviews which is what has prompted me to write this review, I have read about people complaining about the staff and how the area is "okay". I'm not sure what you are used too but we my wife and I travel to a different resort every year and have stayed at some very nice 5 star places and this resort is at the top of the list. Remember you arent spending $10,000 a night, for the price of this resort and what you get I would give it 10 stars. Hawaii is all about fun in the sun and relaxing, you can do all that here at Ko Olina. If you are looking for a great resort and want to buy with amazing trading power, this is it hands down!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Diversion from the Mess that is Now Waikiki”
Reviews.Author: Andrew G
Reviews.Content: Travelling with a family of 5 (2 parents and 3 children) we apparently violate the quantity laws for Oahu or Honolulu that prevent more than 4 people sleeping in one room. The Ko Olina Beach Club provides that 2 bedroom option that provides an abundance of room and space. And if you are staying on Oahu and want ready access to the beach and great pools that the kids will enjoy, the Ko Olina Beach Club is your choice. I've been to Oahu 5 times now over the last 20 years, but this is the first time with the kids (ages 8, 14 and 16). Waikiki is turning into a city disaster, which is quickly reminding more of Manila than it is of the safe little surfing village of the 80's and early 90's. We went to Waikiki for twice during our stay, and saw more homeless and had our 16 year old daughter and my wife rudely accosted and propositioned by drunks along the beach. Prices for dinner are out of control, there is no parking, and growth is out of control. Don't expect to go to Waikiki for a relaxing vacation with a family. On the other hand Ko Olina provides a safe, clean, and all encompassing resort for that visit to see one of the United States true green jewel of an island. With so many important historical and geologic places to visit and tour on Oahu, consider destinations and resorts outside the hustle and bustle of Waikiki.

Reviews.Title: “Local Resident on a Mini Vacation... :)”
Reviews.Author: kananimerseburgh
Reviews.Content: I took my boyfried to Ko'olina for the weekend and I have to say we both enjoyed it alot. I am a local resident and nine out of ten time we don't get the service we would like because they tend to cater to tourist more than the local residents. I had feared this, but I have to say that we recieved great service! I would defintely stay here again, and would reccomend it to all my friends/family. This is a kid friendly hotel, and "yes" there were alot of kids - but it didn't seem to bother us. We enjoyed drinks pool side - which to me was priced reasonably. Yes, parking was a bit steep - but parking is expensive anywhere in Oahu. Overall, our one bedroom suite was spacious/clean/and beautiful. I have to say the bed wasn't comfortable to us, and had problems sleeping. But service we recieved was exceptionally. And "YESS" I will stay here again....

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but the lagoon was closed”
Reviews.Author: NoDumbPeople
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, but the lagoon was closed. Spacious 2-bed. Would highly recommend this place. The only drawback is parking and sometime a bit too crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Value, but mediocre”
Reviews.Author: xoxx
Reviews.Content: We are owners at Ko Olina and have made several visits here. The rooms are looking dull , out of style and need refurbishing. When you sit on the sofa you sink down into the springs! They are very skimpy with bath and kitchen supplies. Parking can be a problem. When we fist came here, Marriott had an owners cocktail reception. Now the substitute is an early morning activities meeting which is basically an advertisement for all on and off property activities that you have to pay for. Don't appreciate the continual sales pitch and being "nickel and dimed" for everything. Once the Disney complex opens, Ko Olina will be in for a big change and we think for the worse.

Reviews.Title: “We are going back”
Reviews.Author: mommyspice
Reviews.Content: We wanted a place away from Waikiki- and this was it. Luckily, we didn't let first impressions ruin our trip... What they call an ocean view room isnt- but, as the manager pointed out, if you stand at the edge of your balcony, you can see some ocean. They offered us another room- and if you look past the power plant, you can actually see the ocean. So we opted for the first room even though IMHO it was poolside, not ocean view... Why we liked it- go to Costco and Whole Foods, buy your provisions and cook your meals in the decently outfitted kitchen. Grill outside. Avoid the restaurants. Bring your own booze and make your own cocktails. You can have the best of a relaxing Hawaii vacation without all of the fuss. Definitely go for the one bedroom suite. And if you DON"T go on the tour, they will offer you a return trip for next to nothing- we are going back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great resort, except absent security”
Reviews.Author: felinfoel
Reviews.Content: We love this report, and just returned from our 2nd trip there. I have one issue: they do not seem enforce security anywhere in the resort, except the slide (only) in the slide pool. As a result, we often saw one adult with up to a half dozen children, none wearing resort bands, and the kids would often misbehave. My wife and I made a game of it: when we heard a pack of loud unruly kids, I would ask my wife (without looking): "Let me guess, no wrist bands?" I was always right. I had to pull my kids from the slide pool twice when I saw other kids climbing on the bridge between portions of the slide pool by the Nai’a Pool Bar, and jumping off the railing (with children swimming below). We asked for security twice, and nobody showed up, so we gave up. I was going to speak to the lone adult watching the bridge-jumpers, but she was taking pictures of them and laughing, so I didn't waste my time. Marriott: please fix this.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort...studio could have been better”
Reviews.Author: GMUgrad05
Reviews.Content: I was able to get a reservation at the Ko Olina through a timeshare exchange. We were able to get a studio room (which is a very small room, enough to fit two people comfortably) I was originally fine with the studio because it was just my husband, myself and our 1 year old daughter. Well, then at the last minute, my mother in law came with us so as you can imagine the studio room quickly become crowded. I tried to call Marriott to see about an upgrade, but they said that there was nothing they could do since I booked the room through Interval. Fair enough. We arrived at Oahu at 10 PM at night due to our flight being delayed and the airline losing our luggage. They accidently put the luggage in a later flight. Fortunately, we were coming from Maui so it wasn't a huge wait to get to our luggage (just a big inconvenience). Anyway, when we got to the resort, the front desk staff was very friendly and helped us to get settled. The room was clean, however, I thought the colors were a little too dark for my taste, and I noticed that there were ants in the room. I found ants in the bathroom, bedroom area, and the kitchen sink area. (We had no food when we checked so I knew the ants weren't there because of food). Anyway, it did annoy me, but I just dealt with it because I didn't spend money on a trip to Hawaii just to spend my entire time in a hotel room. Another complaint, I had about the room was that I found it to be misty and humid. Now, onto the positives, the resort is very beautiful and well landscaped. I liked the lagoon area and pools. I thought all the staff members were wonderful and very helpful. I also liked the fact that the resort is a little out of the way and secluded - although, they are starting to build up around the Ko Olina area so I don't know how secluded this resort will be in the next 5-10 years. I will say that this is a large resort so the pool and lagoon area can get crowded depending on the time of day you go there. When I had a chance. I tried to go to the lagoon late in the afternoon so it was not so crowded. You will definitely need a rental car if you want to drive around the island. They also have a Fai Fai luau, which I thought was excellent and worth the price. This is definitely a family friendly, kid friendly resort so if you aren't vacationing with children, or if you do not like children or want to see children running around the property with the parents running after them, then you may want to consider going to another resort that caters to a more mature audience. I have a kid so I didn't mind, but if you have no children and are considering vacationing here, just know that the activities tend to cater towards families with small children.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond all of our dreams”
Reviews.Author: Donna745
Reviews.Content: After 20 years of marriage, my husband and I finally had the honeymoon that we never had. The Marriott's Ko Olina Beach Club was above and beyond our dreams. The hotel is beautiful. The rooms are spotlessly clean and every amenity that you could need was available, from a washer and dryer (including laundry detergent) a full kitchen with dishwasher,and a wonderful bedroom with kingsized bed. Any thing that you requested was taken care of quickly. The balcony had wonderful views of the mountains and or ocean and included table, 2 chairs and a lounger chair. I can not begin to describe the gounds. Beautiful plants and the pools match the beautiful island.Spotlessly clean and is a bit of Paridise on earth. We have vacationed in the Carribean and Europe and KoOlina far surpasses all. The staff in all areas quickly became like friends. From the front desk to the housekeepers and grounds staff, they were eager to be helpful and always had a smile and aloha. We hope to return to this Ohau and will stay only at the Marriot's KoOlina Beach Club.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory service except for the front desk...”
Reviews.Author: Bluejoecool
Reviews.Content: Location wise it was far but we enjoyed the privacy in comparison to Waikiki where it's crowded with tourists... The lagoon and pool was the only thing that caught our attention... And I guess I can include the lobby as well. The room was somewhat mediocre but surprisingly the parking was extremely high...especially for the location. The valet attendants, bar tenders, and servers were attentive and very friendly. However, we were both surprised that four of the front desk agents that assisted us during our stay weren't so welcoming. Upon check-in we got greeted but it felt COLD and as if we were being rushed to our room. And when we stopped by a couple of times to ask a question, it felt as if we interrupted something important and received a couple of "sighs" and smirks from the look of their faces. This was the only sad and unfortunate experience we had throughout our trip to Hawaii... Other than the poor service from the front desk, the other staffs and the wonderful weather took that mess away... We will be returning to Hawaii in May but we will choose another property to compare the services.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: fil-a-go
Reviews.Content: Wow! Amazing pools, activities and everything. Just a little out of the way. We are going back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location if you want to stay away from the crowds.”
Reviews.Author: Chukes17
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I wanted to stay away from the crowds at Waikiki on our visit to Oahu so we chose Ko Olina. We had a great time at the Marriott Ko Olina Beach Club. The room was pretty standard for a Marriott brand hotel but the overall hotel property was gorgeous and so were the views from the balcony. The property had several pools and jacuzzis with separate sections for kids and adults only. We enjoyed the beach at Ko Olina very much and went for beautiful morning runs. The staff was nice and the hotel bartenders served up the best mojitos we'd ever had. We'd definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place, but too big and generic”
Reviews.Author: ihavethetravelbug_7
Reviews.Content: This resort is beautiful, we stay at Marriotts all over the world and this one just felt too big. The enormity of the resort almost made it lose the Hawaiian feel. Pools are great, beach is great but is man made. They missed figuring out how to make this place feel smaller than it is.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful and tranquil stay!”
Reviews.Author: cornbread35
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited The Marriott Ko Olina from January 7th to the 15th. Check in went smoothly. We were there before our room was ready, but we were given a temporary pass to use for the lockers, beach bars, etc. They called our cell as soon as our room was ready so that we could complete check in. The room was very nice and up to what we are used to for Marriott Vacation Clubs. Comfortable beds, nice fixtures, a nice (but small) kitchen. Outside amenities are very nice. The elevators were a pleasant surprise. So many times reviews complain about having to wait too long to get one. We could usually get an elevator within a minute of pushing the button. It was nice to see the gas grills getting scrubbed every day, so you knew that they were clean. The kid’s pool seemed very popular and busy. The adult pool was quiet. Neither pool was heated, so the water was quite cool but refreshing. There seemed to be plenty of seating around the pool and on the beach unless you waited till noon or after, which is late by most beach resort standards. There is a nice 3 mile beach walk along the front of the resorts along the various lagoons that ends down by the J. W. Marriot. Great for walking and jogging. While we were there they had severe downpours and flash floods. It caused a brown water alert and the ocean water was contaminated, so the lagoons were closed and guests were not allowed in the ocean for several days. Some people got upset, but I don’t see how they thought this was Marriott’s fault. We just walked up to the pool for a dip if we needed to cool off, but we were glad we took our photos of the beach and ocean before the water turned brown. It had been awhile since we were last in Honolulu. We were quite surprised by the traffic on the highways. Rush hour was a dead stop on H1, so plan accordingly if you are driving between Ko Olina and Honolulu or Waikee during those times. What is a quick 20-30 minute drive becomes an hour and a half. As other reviewers have stated, you trade the peace and tranquility you get from being away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki for the fact that you may have to face that traffic on the highway. You really should have a car if you stay here, as there is not much you can get to by foot. Which brings me to my final point. There is not enough parking at Ko Olina. Being a Marriott Owner, we opted for self parking which was free. However, on each of the 3 evenings that we came back to the property after 9 pm, we found a sign at the garage that said that the garage was full and we should use the valet. Two of those evenings we drove around and found a space available, not in the garage but on site. One night we did leave the car with the valet and paid for valet parking. We very much enjoyed our stay at Marriott’s Ko Olina, and if it was not so far from our home in Maine we would definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: downtown75
Reviews.Content: We visited the Ko Olina as the guests of our friends for whom Ko Olina is their home resort. It was possibly one of the most beautiful places we have ever been, and within 30 minutes on the property, we decided to join the Vacation Club. Positives: 1) rooms were gorgeous, beds were comfortable. 2) grounds were also beautiful, and the 1.5 mile walking trail along the coast were beautiful. 3) The pools were clean, the jacuzzis as well, and you could always get a beach/pool chair. Suggestions: 1) There were a lot of great free activities. We loved feeding the fish in the lagoon in the morning, they had a great torch lighting ceremony with hula and fire dancers that was free, we also went on a great native plants walk with a very knowledgeable guide. 2) My husband and I did a surfing lesson through Surf Girls, at nearby Barber Point - which was A-mazing. 3) We highly recommend dinner at Roy's - the Golf Course's restaurant. Truly fantastic food. Beyond fantastic. Azul at the JW Hotel was also good. 4) If you're looking to save on dining, there are lots of grills on teh property. We did a big grocery shop at Target for dry goods (and the prices were totally comparable to what we would spend here in upstate NY) and the grocery store for meat/veggies/fruits. This saved us A LOT of money. 5) The Marketplace (little convenience store in the resort) sells a 24oz mug for $35 that gets free refills for the duration of your stay - soda and coffee. If you drink a lot of soda - this is a great bargain. We rather regretted purchasing the mug, as we could have just made coffee in our room for much cheaper, and drank water. 6) We also did the Ko Olina Ocean Adventure snorkelling - there had abeen a lot of rain the previous week/weekend, so the snorkelling was really disappointing - we didn't reef snorkel, but they did find a pod of dolphins for us to snorkel near and that was cool. But not worth $250. 7) Also took the $10 Ukelele lesson at the resort - which was also fantastic. I'd never played a string instrument before, and after an hour, was rocking Twinkle Twinkle and Wipe Out. 8) Ko Olina really isn't centrally located to touristy things - Pearl Harbor was the closest at 15 minutes away, Honalulu was about 20, and the North Shore about 75 minutes. But if you know and accept that going in, it isn't a problem. 9) We were travelling with another couple and their three month old baby. They had the one bedroom unit and we had the studio unit and it was perfectly set up. We shared kitchen facilities, but also had our own microwave and mini-fridge, so that if we were up early, we could still make breakfast. The walls were also pretty thick - which was much appreciated - you know, with a 3 month old next door. Overall, I truly loved our time at Ko Olina and am very much looking forward to going back.

Reviews.Title: “Great destination away from the crowds”
Reviews.Author: w0rk2play
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised with this hotel/vacation club. It is located about 30 min from Honolulu on the Leeward side of the island. There is so much room at the resort and the layout is so pleasing you don't feel crowded. We were traveling with our adult son and it was easy to have plenty of space without kids. However, I do think the days are limited if you prefer to vacation without kids. Disney Resort is being built at this time - if kids are in your life - I can't think of a better, more fun and safe place to go (Ko Olina). Back to the good stuff; lots of walking paths, pools, lagoons, clean air and you really can relax. BBQ grills are located at each tower and that made the trip even more fun for us (we like to grill). Costco, Safeway, etc are about 10 minutes away. We were more than pleased with our experience on Oahu - not being sure what to expect - it seems to be an island that offers big city, rural, remote, quiet - whatever you are looking for. We had two guest rooms, 2/3 bedroom suites were unavailable. The guestrooms worked great - but I do think the suites would be the way to go if you are traveling with others. Clean, great staff, perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “The Good, the Bad and the Not So Ugly”
Reviews.Author: maddyChicago
Reviews.Content: We were in Hawaii for almost 15 days over Christmas and we spent 10 of those days at the Marriott Beach Club in Ko Olina. I am hoping that the review is helpful for fellow travellers as well as for the Marriott staff since there are some areas that need improvement. At our check in, we were told that our room was (1) an ocean view and (2) in the same building as the rest of our extended family. Neither was correct and no one fixed the issue during our stay. A "sorry" basket was delivered by the front desk but in no way made up for either error. Huge disappointment all around. We were told that our view was "technically an ocean view but because we were on a low floor, we wouldn't be able to see it through the vegetation and trees". This is what they actually told us! Needless to say, we asked for our bill to reflect a downgraded view. They didn't offer, we had to ask for it. There are three towers; Kona, Naia and Moana. The Kona tower is the main building and an ocean view looks directly towards the lagoon and ocean. I can not teill you the difference between a low floor and a high floor. The second tower, the Moana, where we stayed is angled and truly overlooks one end of a pool, bbq pit and the parking lot. We were on the 3rd floor and our ocean view had no view of the ocean. The 3rd tower is the Naia which I understand is the newest. Several trips in to that tower convinced me that it was the nicest. That tower is angled over a pool, the lagoon and the ocean. Other family members had low floors (3rd and 4th) and each had an incredible view. Our villa in the Moana was beautiful and spacious. The other tower had similiar decor and layouts. I think that the design (layout) was perfect and allowed privacy for large families staying together (Lots of doors!) Loved them. Housekeeping is exactly as described by others: dishes put away, towels changed and bed linens were not changed over the 10 days (not sure why) but bed was made and garbage was taken away. Our unit also came with washing machine and dryer. Pools: Several posters mention an adult pool but there wasn't one. One of the 3 pools is a "Reflection" pool and it was supposed to be quiet. Kids are allowed but horseplay and games were discouraged. As a result, there were not many kids at that pool. The lagoon pool has the volleyball net and basketball board so that had a ton of kids. The 3rd pool at the Naia had waterfalls, hidden coves etc and was probably the prettiest. It also had a bar. IMPORTANT NOTE to MARRIOTT STAFF: We noticed lots of dead snails, slugs and worms in 2 pools. When we pointed this out to pool personnel, they told us that it always happens after heavy rainfalls. Well if you know that, then you should be vacuuming the pool floor after heavy rainfalls. It was really gross! Inspect your pools each morning! Restaurants: There are only 2: Chucks Steakhouse which was so-so and had an unimaginative menu. Since they aren't affiliated with the Marriott, they actually compete for Happy Hour and their prices are better. Host stand needs more training. The guy with the "System" was rude and unprofessional. The other hostess knew it and tried to curb/correct him several times. Painful experiences for many people on the 3 nights we went there (2 against our will). The beachfront restaurant, Kolohe's had really great sandwiches and salads. It's a bit pricey for sandwiches ($15-18) but the convenience, view, taste and staff made it all ok. The Mai-tais are better here than at Chuck's but the Happy Hour price is $3.50 more than Chucks. Thought the staff there did a wonderful job. Target, Safeway and Costco are about 10 minutes away. Use the map the staff provides not your GPS because one of ramps is closed for construction. GPS also had us go on the highway from one place to the other and the route should have been local streets. The on-site grocery was limited and expensive. If you need a quick grocery, there is an ABC store over by the golf course and that had a better deli, fruit, wine and dry goods selection of items. Sightseeing: The best traveler guide we had for the west and north shore was "Oahu Revealed" which we purchased on the Amazon website. It was more locally oriented than Frommers and Fodors. We had an amazing time on the north shore. We visited the Triple Crown beaches, Haleiwa and the famous shrimp shacks in Kahuku (Fusi and Romy's). We also drove through the Turtle Bay resort and checked it out for future vacations. On the east side, Kailua Beach was amazing and would definitely recommend it for families of all ages, sun and shade and calm waves. We had lunch at a friendly and charming place, Kalapawai Cafe. Ready made sandwiches and salads, along with other entrees made it quick and refreshing after a day in the sun. Waikiki: If you already live in a big city, skip it. It's crowded and crazy. One thing we learned: If it's raining in Ko Olina, it may not be raining on the other side of the island. Don't let the weather stop you. However, it is important to heed weather warnings with flash floods and rock slides blocking roads.

Reviews.Title: “One Word-Absolutely Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: romadaro
Reviews.Content: You just can't go wrong with this place. This place is heaven on earth. From checkin to checkout, a truly unforgettable and terrific vacation experience. The only improvement would be in the housekeeping service, which we found a little disappointing. On the day that our room was refreshed, we happened to be in the room when the maid came, so we excused ourselves and went down to the pool while she performed the service. Unfortunately, shortly after we got downstairs, I remembered something I left in the room and went back to retrieve it and the maid was gone-DONE! It couldn't have been more than 15 minutes! All she did was empty the trash, change the towels (but not the linens), put the dishes in the dishwasher and pull the comforter up and fluff the pillows-but very haphazardly. Although we expected much more, we got past it, but did let the front desk know at checkout. But, overall, we loved the place so much that we bought a timeshare unit !

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and great service!”
Reviews.Author: northshoregirl1
Reviews.Content: The hotel has beautiful grounds, muliple pools and hot tubs(some which are adult only). The customer service is exceptional and the beach area/lagoons of Ko Olina area are beautiful. Only downside was the cheapest restaurant, which was casual/by the beach was a bit $$(sandwich $18) and not the greatest. However for the same price we enjoyed lunch at the JW Marriot near by and it was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice resort”
Reviews.Author: ChuckDenver
Reviews.Content: We wre given a room number at check in, when we arrived at the Hale Moanna building we wer put in a studio with a view of the loading dock and the trash compactor. When we went to the desk the man at the desk told us that was the only room he had and he did not know what happen to the other room. He was very rude, he told us he would have a manager call us. after three days we talked to a very nice lady at the desk, she tried to help us but said she had no rooms. We were there on a time share exchange and we went to the presentation. The lady at the presentation was very nice and very informative. She said they could not get involved with the rooms. I told her I would not buy anything from the Marriot afer I was given a room that was so bad I could not open the patio door from 6am till 10pm because of the noise. The resort was one of the nicest I have been in, the shows very very good , the food and drinks were great and all the employees except one were great. In November we were at the Wyndham King's Creek and purchused a time share. The salesman told us that we should look into the Marriott's program, he said they were number one in service and we should buy into their program. After this experience I can say Marriott"s is not number one.

Reviews.Title: “Best way to have a miserable Hawaii vacation”
Reviews.Author: Silversmith
Reviews.Content: Worst experience ever on a vacation. Turned in Gold 5 star 1 bdrm time share condo , got the bum's rush from Marriott and Interval International. Requested 1bdrm or studio. Got a tiny hotel room, worse than Holiday Inn Express quality with bad staff. No kitchen, very cramped room, no place for luggage, and barely a place to sit. No table or chairs. The unit we traded was gorgeous, hot tub in room, full kitchen, all amenities, view. This one had a balcony that was unusable - tiny, no room for ,table/chair, bird poop, view of parking lot. Had to park 1/4 mile away. The facilities were at best adequate. Most pools very shallow, full of kids. One okay 30' pool for 1000 rooms with double rows of lounge chairs crammed around it, like Jones Beach in July. Very very uncooperative front desk. Just didn't care. Marriott is in this for the money, and this place doesn't give value. Because it was a hotel room, we had to eat out every meal. The on-site restaurants were very expensive, and the only other options were to drive to four other huge comparable expensive Marriott hotels on the same huge site. This side of the island of Oahu has not been developed, and this Marriott complex is all there is. Terrible poverty if you drive north on the west coast of Oahu - people living in cars, camping in beach shelters. Unbelievable that the USA is allowing these conditions to exist. Nothing to do outside the Marriott without a real expedition to Honolulu which involves a lot of time and traffic. Very aggressive hard sell on buying time share. Took advantage of people we met who were unfamiliar with time shares. This is a scam to get primarily renters, some Interval people to Hawaii, merely to run them through the sales scam mill. Honolulu is well worth visiting to see the World War II sites. The USS Arizona Memorial is so moving, on the water at the site of the ship, like a chapel. Don't miss it. We drove to the North shore of Oahu and saw the waves that form the surfers Pipeline where the international surfing competitions are held. 30' waves, extraordinary. You really need a car to enjoy your visit. Aside from Pearl Harbor related excursions, the very best part of this trip was our day trip to the Polynesian Cultural Center. It has villages representing 8 Polynesian cultures, and really gets you into the culture of those islands hundreds of years ago. Fascinating, and well worth one or more days. Each tribe showed off its own dances, from the laid back Hawaiian hula, suited to an island with no neighbors for hundreds of miles, to the fierce war dances that got island warriors ready to hunt their enemies on adjacent islands. The evening program with dances, fire throwing and all is an event we'll never forget. The eastern coast of Oahu, especially the southern portion, seems to be where "real people" live on Oahu. Lots of real little towns, beautiful coast, great restaurants, even bookstores! I'd stay there if I went to Oahu again, but all in all, we saw the Pearl Harbor sites, and would prefer the other islands.
