Honolulu is very built up, expensive NYC type brand stores, crowded beaches, probably lots of night life. We also visited the island of Kauai and fell in love with it. It's gorgeous, much less settled, quiet, with the most extraordinary foliage, shore line and cliffs. Great snorkeling and fabulous restaurants. The helicopter trip is breath-taking. We'd go back there in a minute, and very happy to have purchased a Shell Vacation Club property there. SVC gives fabulous service, and their resorts are fabulous, each with many pools/hot tubs overlooking the water. We're trying the Big Island next on a trade with our SVC property.

Reviews.Title: “Beatiful location, wonderful properity but there were some definate "issues" with service so beware!”
Reviews.Author: Rachez
Reviews.Content: The property was beatiful! The service was iffy: we were checked in 1 and a half hours AFTER check in time after traveling for 12 hours. We were sent to a building in which our key cards did not open! We diwere not informed of the vaious parts of the property and thus did not realize the full extent of what we could use until 1/2 way through our vacation. The propery was magnificant! The resturants were expensive, even the beachside casual resturant. Expect to pay $15 dollars for a drink. We are long time Marriott owners, We decided to upgrade to the Destinationa Program. We dropped 12000. 00 to do so. This is on top of the 40,000.00 in property that we already own. Our pints were not deposited. We were to have a waived first year fee as an incentive: we just got the bill. We were told that we would have access to our program in August. It is still not on line. We now have to chase down what we paid for. As much as I love Marriott, I am truly regreting my faith in the Marriott name. I wonder how long it will take for me to get what I actually paid for. Be very careful. They use white boards to "tell you the story" of what they are offering you. GET IT In WRITING AND DON"T LEAVE WITHOUT PROOF! Our sales person kept showing us how great the syatem worked with other time share sales programs that used points... how worthless is that? I just hope we are not screwed... GOOD LUCK! I hope you are smarter then we are! Oh, by the way: our rent a car was broken into at the resort and in the parking lot and the security tried to get us to NOT report it to the poilce which by the way makes them look good and leaves us holding the bill. Guess what? We were smart on that one. By reporting to the police (hawaii 50 (Ha Ha) by the way not too smart) the damages were covered by our insurance in their entirety and there was no change in our insurabce status. Of course there was a therf on Marriott property that was now an official record.. but oh well.. not my problem . In fairness... the property is fabulous! We would go back despite the issues! Rachaele

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful facility...for kids.”
Reviews.Author: palmer101
Reviews.Content: A mixed experience. We had a high floor, 1 bedroom "mountain view" (no mountains, but marina, some ocean and an industrial park). The unit was beautiful and quiet until someone with a fussy toddler moved in next door; the noise goes right through the lock-off door. Parking is expensive and tight, the lot for our building filled up fast late in the day so many were forced to valet park. The pool areas are beautiful but noisy, children everywhere. The lagoon beaches are lovely, and the long walk area connecting all 4 lagoons. It is also an easy walk to golf clubhouse and Roy's restaurant, a bit farther to the Ko'Olina Station area with an ABC for provisions, Mexican restaurant, BBQ place and an ice cream shop. If you need to get out of the city for a few days, this fits the bill. If you go to Hawaii to experience Hawaii, then Waikiki with surfers, outrigger canoes, traditional free hula shows, museums, zoo, aquarium, shopping is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “If we could own any timeshare, this would be what we would pick.”
Reviews.Author: wipeoutsue
Reviews.Content: I didn't end up leaving Hawaii purchasing a timeshare, in fact, I didn't even go to their informational meeting in which they offer free Fia Fia Luau tickets. But, if someone were to ask me which timeshare I would buy of any in the world, I might just choose this Marriott Ko Olina Beach Club. This is our second time staying here, both times we stayed for six nights. The first and last are just travel days, so we basically had five full days of play. We have been tagalongs with extended family who own a Marriott timeshare. Both times, they had ease of exchanging their 2 bedroom/2 bath Marriott in California with this one in Hawaii. Hawaii is such a easy jaunt over from California, why wouldn't you vacation there? November turned out to be a great time to travel. They said it was 90 percent full, but it was really not crowded at all. Last time, we went in January and it felt equally sparse. This time, for some unknown reason, they upgraded us to a 3 bedroom/3 bath unit. It was heaven. This place was like a little mansion. We only slept six but we could have slept 10-12 people comfortably. (Three young families would have been perfect!). On the property, the Fia Fia "fire show"/ luau was really well done. We saw the Paradise Cove one last year. And while the paradise cove had more activities, the food and the overall show was better on the Marriott property. We had small kids and love their kids activities. We especially recommend the Kamiya race cars for the boys and the luau for the girls. The raft race is fun too. It's so easy to just hope out of your hotel room and go snorkeling too. Lots of fish and turtles if you just swim by the rocks. The kids just enjoy playing in the sand and swimming. But it is a little cold in November-January, so we enjoyed the spa too. The bummer is that you pretty much have to drive everywhere if you want to take a day trip, but going to the north shore, Dole Plantation, and Pearl harbor were all doable. We steered clear of Waikiki this time because it felt like such a long drive. But on the flip hand, you are away from all the touristy spots and it feels like you have the island to yourself. Don't pack much....washing machines are in every room. And if you forget something, there is always costco, target, and safeway in the next exit at Kapolei. We bought our own food and just cooked to keep cost low. Of course, if you want high end shopping, you will have to go to Waikiki. I don't think this will be the last time we go to this resort. Perhaps next time we'll sit in their informational meeting. But since we know we like it so much, it's probably better if we don't.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: uki_guy
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough about this place. Wonderful man-made lagoons that have no waves but constant ocean water. Beautiful beach areas and pool areas. Plenty of walking trail along the beach between JW Marriott and Ko Olina Beach Club and Marina. Amazing sunsets! Visited Waikiki for half day and it looked like a run-down place compared to this area.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquility in Oahu - beats Waikiki”
Reviews.Author: HodgesCat
Reviews.Content: Prior to staying here, we had spent 4 nights in Waikiki, which I was happy to leave behind due to the non-stop hustle and bustle. At Ko Olina, we rented a 1-bedroom villa (# 20510) on the 5th Floor. Extremely spacious, very upscale, with only very minor signs of wear and tear. Although we had an "ocean view" room on the 5th Floor, our ocean "view" was blocked by the tops of the palm trees. Apparently, if you are a renter, the higher floors such as 8 and above (which have the best views) are reserved for Marriott Time Share owners. Parking is pricey at $30 per night but is apparently free if you are a Marriott Time Share owner. The room did have one major design flaw. The a/c unit (a/c handler) is located in the bedroom, so it was a bit noisy in the bedroom (so that was a bit of an impediment to sleeping well.) The lagoons are fabulous, like something out of a movie. Be forewarned that a massive Disney resort is being built nearby, which will soon bring swarms of people and which could upset this peaceful balance. Do your shopping ahead of time at the Safeway (just a short drive away) because the prices at the resort's mini-market are shockingly high. Overall, I would highly recommend the Marriott Ko Olina if you're looking for a relaxing getaway for a week or more. It is great for a family, but even if you don't have a family, you will enjoy the peaceful atmosphere, the spacious accommodations, and the great views.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, peaceful, and relaxing if a little dated”
Reviews.Author: marilano
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott Ko Olina for only 2 nights quite recently, and wish I could have stayed much longer. I'd gotten a very good nightly rate directly from Marriott's website and was treated like a regular hotel guest--daily maid service, no timeshare presentation, etc. I'd been a bit confused about this beforehand. I had a one-bedroom villa (even though it was just for me), with a nice, modern full kitchen--granite countertops, modern lighting, full-size stove and frig., microwave--with appropriate dishes and cookware (although it's good to know that there will be only one day's coffee provided--with only two little packets of sugar, and none of the basics of cooking, like salt. So stock up before you get here if you plan to have coffee or any meals. I stopped at the Safeway in Kapolei, right on the way to Ko Olina from the airport). The villa (more like a large one-bedroom apartment) was huge and very clean, although the design was a bit odd, and made getting to the bedroom a rather long walk through either the two bathrooms or through the living room and then an odd and rather useless small sunroom (or was it a very small den or a very small extra "bedroom" since the small loveseat might have folded out? I couldn't tell). The living room had a nice, new, large flat-screen TV, a comfortable couch to watch it from, and a couple of large sitting chairs. The dining area was part of the living room, and had a full-size dining table with 4 (or was it 6?) pretty comfortable upholstered chairs. There was a nice view of the resort when you were seated at the table or on the couch.The furniture was typical Hawaiian "tropical style" although a bit big, bulky, and dated. But everything seemed very clean and was generally comfortable. There was a very good size lanai, well designed to maximize privacy and with a small table and chairs as well as a lounger. I'd asked for an ocean view and would have liked to have been a couple of floors higher (I was on the 6th floor) to really be able to see the view over the balcony railings and the palm treetops. But if I stood up on the lanai, I had a wonderful and mostly unobstructed view of the resort and the lagoons/ocean, and I saw a couple of wonderful sunsets. The lanai had a glass partition up to about 2 feet high, so would be safe for children. The bed was pretty comfortable, although perhaps just a bit too firm for my taste; a softer pillowtop would have been nice. The bedding was good quality and there were plenty of pillows (regular and European square ones). There was an older but good-size tube TV in the bedroom, although perhaps they'll be replacing it with another flatscreen. I liked the fact that by closing the sliding wooden doors in the bedroom and the wooden blinds in the connecting "sunroom" you could get the bedroom really dark for sleeping. The hotel was quiet at night, so again good for sleeping. The a/c in the villa worked well, although it was a little noisy in the bedroom, so I kept turning it off and on during the night (so that was a bit of an impediment to sleeping well). The bathroom was really two bathrooms: one with a vanity and a nice walk-in shower and one with another vanity and a deep soaking tub. Being a shower person, I never used the tub (and wasn't sure how easy it would be for someone like me with bad knees to get in and out of it without any grab bars). There were wooden panels between the tub and the bedroom--for romance, I guess. This set-up with two sinks and vanities would be ideal for a couple or family. The shower head was old and apparently clogged, so sprayed a bit unevenly, but apart from that and a bit of water overflow from the glass shower door, the bathroom was very functional and very clean. The towels weren't the softest, but were very clean, in good shape, and reasonably large, and there were plenty of them If you have any mobility issues, be aware that this resort is quite spread out. There are three towers now (and another one is pending, I think), so if your room/villa is not in the main tower (and mine wasn't), keep in mind that everything else is (restaurant, sundry store, computers, check-in desk, etc.). From my tower, it was actually a bit of a hike to the lagoons, which are past the pools. I never made it to the third of the 3 pools since it was the farthest away from my tower. The pool area, though, is very nice, with an adult pool and another pool catering more to children and families. There were also at least two hot tubs. There's a nice sandy beach by the nearest lagoon (the only one I tried), and beach chairs/loungers available. Although I'd thought that one could snorkel in at least some of the 4 lagoons there, the concierge said they'd really be too murky for snorkeling, so I didn't try. You borrow beach towels from a counter in the pool area and must return them before you leave (and they do have some snorkel equipment to rent). You can replace the towels whenever they get wet or dirty. You can also find some shaded sitting areas by the pools, too, if the Hawaiian sun and heat start to get to you. The parking is pricey (about $30/day), although there seems to be plenty of it. Everything at the resort is pretty expensive. If you didn't bring a computer and therefore can't use the free wifi, it's 29 cents/minute to use the computers in the main tower's small business center. The Marketplace shop (for sundries, some food, and some tourist items) is over-priced, but I was glad to discover that a new ABC store (with a nice deli in it) had recently opened in the Ko Olina Station, a very short drive (or a long walk) from the hotel. There were a few small restaurants in this little strip mall, too, which I didn't try. The hotel's main restaurant is a steakhouse that seemed expensive (and didn't appeal to me as a non-meat-eater, although it says "Steak and Seafood") and then a more casual open-air bar and grill near the lagoons. They did offer free music one evening at the bar, but I didn't partake. One thing to keep in mind here as in many other parts of Hawaii--most things (including the lobby) are open-air, so if you want to escape the heat and humidity, you're almost out of luck (except in your nicely air-conditioned room or villa). My research had suggested that the food might be better at the JW Marriott Ihilani (a short drive or long walk away from the Beach Club), so I went there one day for lunch at the Naupaka Terrace (with a 10% discount courtesy of the Aloha Desk at the Beach Club--worth a visit for coupons and a free tote). It, too, is open-air, but the food was pretty good and not badly priced for Hawaii. I also went to Roy's (part of the famous chain of Roy's) at the Ko Olina golf club near the hotel for lunch, and the food there was excellent. Roy's has a nice view of a lagoon or small lake with black swans in it, which I enjoyed watching. I'd recommend trying Roy's, although dinner prices are much higher than lunch. All in all, I'd highly recommend the Marriott Ko Olina if you're looking for a relaxing getaway for a few days or a week or more, especially if you have a family, but even if you don't but value peace, quiet, spacious accommodations, and great views. I'm not sure how often one can get good nightly rates--especially if you want to stay less than a week--but I felt like it was well worth it. I was going to Honolulu for a conference right afterward, and really missed Ko Olina once I got into the Honolulu noise, crowds, and traffic. It was only about a 30-40 minute drive from the airport to Ko Olina, and although the north shore might be more lush (since Ko Olina is on the dry leeward side of Oahu), the resort is beautifully landscaped and relaxing, and the lagoons are really nice for safe swimming. The staff at the resort are very nice, too, and seem to have the Aloha spirit, too. I highly recommend staying here for those in search of relaxation.

Reviews.Title: “I hope I get to go back again!”
Reviews.Author: Drool
Reviews.Content: The resort is absolutely beautiful. We had a sleep 8 with 2 private bedrooms and a full kitchen and living room. It was big enough to live in full time. The beach lagoons are very safe and relaxing to float around in. The resort pools are beautiful with waterfalls to swim under. We cooked most of our own food in our kitchen, but did eat out one night at the beach bar and grill. My son raved about his tuna melt and I loved my club sandwich on focaccia bread. We went to the Fia Fia night and were entertained from start to finish, it was well worth the money spent. The only negative I can think of is that we never found a place to go dancing. I'm not sure if there is one on the resort or if we just never discovered it - I probably should have asked someone.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic resort, would stay there again in a heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: tslovell
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a week for my 50th birthday. I had low expectations, as we had traded a timeshare room and couldn't request where we wanted to stay. I was just happy to be in Hawaii. However, the resort, room, and customer service were all top notch. The grounds are beautiful, like an oasis, the room was huge and lovely, and the beach was wonderful. I could see where during a busy time it could be overrun with children (which it is perfect for), but it wasn't bad this time of year for couples like us who want to get away from kids to relax. The only negative is the lack of eating choices, and the exhorbitant prices at the casual beach restaurant, but there are new places to eat and a market at the housing develpement nearby. Otherwise it's a drive to eat anywhere else. You could easily make all your meals in the enormous kitchen, though, if you wanted to save money. I will also add the parking was free to us because we were Marriott owners, though not at this resort. We will have very happy memories of our stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, Loved Every Minute”
Reviews.Author: NaMacTonawanda_NY
Reviews.Content: This was by far the best vacation me and my husband have ever had. The Ko Olina puts Disney hotels to shame with it's beauty and conveniences. We had a 1 bedroom, ocean view villa complete with full kitchen, laundry, 1.5 baths, living and dining rooms. Although I requested a high floor room with a view of the ocean, we got a first floor room with a view of the bushes which was facing the ocean. Not bad though considering we got an awesome deal by joining Marriott Rewards. Location was just perfect, far from Waikiki and Honolulu and all the crowds. At most, there were maybe 50 people at a time on any beach lagoon. No fighting for beach chairs. The beds were so comfy, I actually slept every night. And I can never sleep in hotels. No problems here. The housekeeper came in while we were at the beach, and when we came back to the room, she actually put the dirty dishes in the dishwasher for us and ran the washer. Really, now that's service! I loved being able to do the laundry every day. I popped a load in before going to bed every night. (They even provide detergent). Made packing and unpacking when we got back home so easy. I wish all hotels had this. The man made lagoons were perfect to spend an afternoon at or to watch the gorgeous sunset. We saw large sea turtles and one even came up on shore. Very cute! We ate at Chuck's Steakhouse once, which was decent but way overpriced. The mai tai there was terrific and only 4 bucks! I recommend driving the 10 mins to Costco, Safeway or Walmart in Kapolei and picking up your food items for the week. We saved a lot of money by making our own breakfast and lunch every day with groceries from Safeway and then eating dinner in town at night. The ABC Store across from Aulani (Disney) is the best place to shop for souvenirs or quick food items. We got an angus steak and some salads from there, and for $15 we had dinner! Oh, and the resort has BBQ grills you can use if you'd like to grill. The Ko Olina staff was amazingly friendly and helpful, which is so refreshing coming from Northeast USA where people can be rude most of the time. We went to the Paradise Cove Luau down the street and it was unbelievable. The hotel concierge can book the tickets for you. A quick 10 minute walk takes you to Ko Olina Ocean Adventures where you can book a cruise to snorkel with fish, turtles, and swim with dolphins. They include a lunch afterwards which is nice. I recommend NOT picking up the Aloha Package at the front desk however. This is a timeshare and they will try to sell you. We didn't pick it up, and they called us 3 times to remind us. Just don't pick up the package and you will save yourself a 45 minute timeshare pitch, unless you want that. All in all, we will be back. Great location, great employees, great service. It doesn't get much better than Ko Olina.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort”
Reviews.Author: nanenoon
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a 2 bedroom villa with an ocean view and loved it- perfect for 3 adults and a six month old. They provided us with a crib and high chair. Beautiful property with pools and lagoon- great for swimming. Grills outside perfect for a barbeque. Con: came back from a trip into Kapolei to find two security guards coming out of one of the bedrooms- stated that our towels on the balcony cannot be on the railings- a safety issue- so, what were they doing in the bedroom?? No balcony there! Took the Ko Olina Kat trip on the water and it was amazing! Other than that, great trip and will return

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Resort-Total R & R”
Reviews.Author: gallows
Reviews.Content: There are lots of reviews for this property so I am just going to give some tips/highlights of our stay. This is the 3rd Marriott Vacation Club we have stayed at-they have all been great. We traded in our Myrtle Beach location so we were hoping for oceanview but not expecting it-we didn't get oceanview but they did give us a marina/golf course view so it was OK. We had a 1 bedroom which was spacoius and beautiful. The pools are all very nice-lots of hot tubs. It wasn't too crowded the week we were there which was nice as you could always get chairs at the beach or pool with no problem. We had two good dinners at Chuck's and it is so nice to sit outside and watch the sun set. It's a little pricy but there are not alot of options. We had lunch one day at Kolohe's which was good but at $16 for tuna melts we thought very pricey-nice setting though on the edge of the beach. We did do as others recommended and drove to Target-10 min away and picked up a few groceries/beverages for the room-this saves alot even just getting breakfast items/snacks. That same exit also has a few restaurant options-we at a a great Italian restaurant-Assaggio's, Outback, and for breakfast at Zippy's. ABC store at Marketplace on same street as resort is also a good place to pick up groceries/souveniers. A car is definitely needed as there is not too much right in the area-Hotwire has great prices-we got a full size car for $15.95/day. We thoroughly enjoyed the onsite luau-Fia Fia which is held on Tuesday night-make your reservation ahead of time as your table is assigned based on when you book-we were right up front at the table front and center-perfect view!! We also loved the Sunset Cruise on the Ko Olina Cat-the crew was great and we had a blast!! They picked up right at the resort. Great pictures from both!!! We did do some sightseeing as it was our 1st trip to Hawaii-we climbed Diamond Head-not easy but breathtaking views!!! We did the whole Pearl Harbor complex-Arizona-Missouri-Bow Fin. Plan for several hours if you want to do it all-we were there for 5 hrs. If you go on Wed/Sat/Sun-there is a Flea Market of sorts at Aloha stadium-all kinds of souveniers (all new stuff) and it's right near Pearl Harbor. We went over to Waikiki-had to see it!! Glad we were staying 45 min away in the quiet Ko Olina-it's a zoo there, but something to see. Eat at Duke's-great lunch buffet and right on the beach!! Dole Plantation was OK-a bit overrated. Enjoy your stay-we tried to balance sightseeing with enjoying all the amenities of the resort.

Reviews.Title: “A terrific home away from home”
Reviews.Author: DelS_10
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the Ko Olina Beach Club while on business travel from August 28th until September 23rd. My room was a kitchenette with King size bed and golf course view on the third floor. Self parking was available on the 1st and 2nd floor and was $30 per day (same as valet parking). My room had a coffee maker, microwave, toaster, small refrigerator and dishes for 2. Complimentary laundry rooms were located on floors 4,7,10, and 14. The resort covers a lot of space with 3 pools in one area and another pool area more suited for childen with a water slide. The bed was very comfortable and easy to get used to. The only negative thing that I noticed was a lack of ventilation (A/C) in the bathroom. The restaurant on the beach (Kalohe's) was a good place for the breakfast buffet (rice, eggs, sausage, bacon, potatoes, pastries, fruit, yogurt, cereal, bagels, juice and coffee) and begin the day looking out at the lagoon or to have a sandwich later in the day and especially catch the sunset. Newspapers are available but you have to be nuts to want to read one when surrounded by the beauty of the resort. It is a time share property but I was never hassled by any of the sales people and treated pleasantly by all of the staff people that I came across. The lagoon is a very nice place to get into the salt water and then rinse off for the pools (the quiet pool was my favorite). There are also several spa's around the pool area including one with a water view at the property edge by the restaurant. I traveled around Oahu quite a bit and after the busyness of Honolulu and Waikiki, I was glad to return to Ko Olina (20 minute drive). There is a nice shopping area between exit 1 and 2 on H1 that has a Safeway, Longs Drug, Target, K-Mart, Costco, gas stations and quite a few restaurants. Target has the best prices for food and Costco is the best for macadamia nuts. There are activities available both at the resort and around the island for a fee. On Tuesday there is a Luau type of show called "Fia, FIa" and there is music at Kalohe's on Sunday and several other evenings. A snorkeling cruise is available on the Kai 'Oli 'Oli at the Ko Olina marina which was great fun watching the spinner dolphins and snorkeling with the turtles. My wife was able to join me for the last week and she enjoyed relaxing by the pool, exploring the property, and checking out the artists by the gift shop. All in all, the Ko Olina Beach Club was a great place to be welcomed to Hawaii and a place to want to return to.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother with a studio!”
Reviews.Author: DizDragonfly
Reviews.Content: Every hotel has a few bad rooms and I think we got the worst one. We were in a studio on the second floor of the Hale Moana building. The second floor is ground level on the ocean side. Although the view of the resort was lovely from our lanai, it was directly next to the entrance to the resort for the entire building. There was absolutely no foliage in front of the lanai to create some sense of privacy. We ended up feeling like the Walmart Greeter as everyone walking in or out had a perfect view of us sitting there (many of whom commented on our reading material or meals). Everyone was just being friendly, but it wasn't very relaxing. This room also shares a wall with a utility room of some kind and there was an annoying persistent hum heard through the wall in the bathroom. Speaking of the bathroom, if the vent looking thing on the ceiling was a fan, it didn't run. There was a large dead cockroach on our lanai all week. Although housekeeping straightened up the tiny table and two chairs out there, they didn't remove the dead bug. There were stains on the curtains and the chair in the room was very banged up. The pool towels were a disgrace, threadbare and holey! If you can help it, avoid the on site restaurants. They are crazy expensive and nothing special. The good points: Then landscaping is beautiful. The grills outside are a nice touch. The staff was very friendly and helpful when we had questions about the area. The lagoons are wonderful. If you stay in the Ko Olina Resort, plan on having a car and doing some grocery shopping and cooking or eat at the many restaurants outside of the resort a few miles away. If you stay in a one bedroom it may be worth the cost to stay here, but don't bother with the studios.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Far Away From The Crowds”
Reviews.Author: LouiseTheTraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel with my husbands parents timeshare for a week. Upon arrival, we were not too impressed. We had the hardest time of our life trying to find the right building as there were no signs, when we did finally get into the main lobby, we stood in a 20 minute long line and then spoke with the receptionist to get checked in. The receptionist was very nice. We arrived at 2:30pm to ask about an early check in but they said our room wasnt ready yet, so we came back at 4pm. My mother in law requested us an ocean view in the main tower on one of the top floors. We ended up in the furthest tower away from the ocean and a partial view of the ocean. The room itself was small, but okay. We had a studio room (smallest available), and we had a hard time moving around in it comfortably. The view was pretty good. The room was a little dusty and the maids left the toilet seat up (a pet peeve of my husband) before they left, not the best presentation. There was only 35 channels on the television, not much to choose from. The room was for the most part up to date and modern. The pools were pretty nice, not too many kids and not too much screaming. We went to the beach during the earlier morning hours and there was always lots of space to swim and have fun in the sand. It would have been nice to have that option to swim out further into the surf or have more waves, but they contructed lagoons to prevent waves. The shaved ice was very yummy. We did eat at Koholes Bar and Grill, STAY AWAY! Total rubbish food and expensive! Rent a car if you plan on visiting the tourist areas out of Ko Olina. They told us the traffic was terrible in Honolulu, but we are from Seattle and laughed at their interpretation of "bad traffic". All in all, the hotel is probobly one of th nicest on Oahu (most hotels are icky in Waikiki) and its definitley seculded so you wont be near the crowds. The area surronding the Ko Olina is suprising, it was very dead and there was lots of graffiti around, being from Seattle we would say it looks alot like Eastern Washington. Parking can be really hard to find if you are not back at your hotel by 7pm. Most of the time we found a spot somewhere (really tight spaces for even the Camry we rented). But otherwise, if they are totally out of spots you are forced to valet park. I would HIGHLY recomend getting a room with a kitchen, eating out is hard in that area. Plus most of the resturnats arent very good or expensive. Oh and stay away from their "welcome" speach they offfer you when you first arrive, its on the second floor and they will pressure you into buying a time share after they have offered all these good coupons. Overall, we probobly will go back as our parents own atimeshare which they are stuck with, so free lodging for us. But otherwise, we would rather do Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing resort!!”
Reviews.Author: steda
Reviews.Content: Ko'Olina is the best Marriott resort I have stayed at. This resort has it all. It emulates what Hawaii is all about...Aloha. The staff was great. The rooms were clean and well stocked with everything you would need. They had bbq's that we used. The pools were wonderful. Our favorite was the slide even though we probably looked pretty silly because my husband and I are both over 50. We snorkeled in the lagoons and saw some turtles. We had a wonderful massage and ate at both the pool bar and Chuck's steak house which were delicious. The lobby is beautiful. It was a peaceful serene resort and we would highly recommend it. I have stayed at the Maui resort and Kauai but Ko'Olina is the one I always return to. If you are afraid to go because it is Honolulu don't be because it is miles away from all the craziness of Waikiki. The sunset's are the BEST!!

Reviews.Title: “We will stay longer next time!”
Reviews.Author: IdaChen
Reviews.Content: An excellent place for leisure and fun with your family. The beach is great with 4 lagoons. My husband snorkels and I play in the shallow water in the lagoon (I'm not a swimmer). There are also pools and jacuzzi. I like the barbecue facility there. The service is good. The bar at the pool side is excellent, food is tasty and price is reasonable. We want to join the cruise activity to see the dolphin, but it's not available in Sunday. Next time we will stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly Positive”
Reviews.Author: Shoeiejs
Reviews.Content: As has been noted on here many times, the Marriott Ko Olina is a timeshare property, and its not close to anything on the isalnd of Oahu. These shouldn't be a surprise to anyone anymore - just resolve to rent a car and enjoy being away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. Being that its a Marriott timeshare, its run much more like a traditional hotel than a typical timeshare. That being said, this is a beautiful property. The room was tastefully decorated, the grounds of the resort were beautiful, the pools and beaches were wonderful. Would I stay here again, probably, but I'm not completely sold. Here's what you need to know, for being such a high end property, the walls are paper thin. When the telephone in the next room would ring, I could easily hear the entire conversation of my neighbor. Considering my wife and I were here for a romantic week away from the kids, I can imagine what my neighbors heard emanating from my room. Marriot and the developer cut a significant corner here in failing to adequately sound proof the rooms, and it did detract from our experience. Can you get over that-sure-you're in Hawaii and not likely to ever see your neighbor again as long as you live, so we decided who cares? Only other drawback was the food. There is a decent beach bar at the Ko Olina to get drinks and munchies, but do not, under any circumstances, eat at a full meal at this beach bar, or at the supposedly "upscale" Chuck's, also on property. Here is where the isolation of the resort can sometimes be an issue. As East Coasters, we tend to eat much later than Hawaiins, where restaurants typically stop serving dinner around 8:30 p.m. So on two nights, we sort of got stuck eating at the resort. Truly-the food at both of these restaurants is virtually inedible. The salad bar at Chucks was swarming with fruit flies, the steak was a congealed hunk of meat. At least they didn't screw up the Johnnie Walker, but hey, that's just ice and a glass. To top it all off, the meal at Chucks was about $125 for two people. I wouldn't have paid $20 for it. The beach bar (I believe its called Kolohe's) isn't much better, but at least the prices are significantly less. If you are stuck on or near the resort for meals, walk the 1/4 mile down the beach to the J.W. Marriott Ihilani Resort, were the restaurants are all either 4 or 5 star. Quite frankly, we are foodies and the best meal we ate in Hawaii was at the JW's 5 star rated Azule. The staff are mostly friendly and eager to assist. There was a mistake in cleaning our room (since its a timeshare you don't get a full "cleaning" service like a traditional hotel-but can request one for a small fee). We requested that our room be cleaned several times, rather than merely "tidied." On one occassion, not only was it not cleaned, but not even tidied. When we informed the staff they immediately ensured that our room would be thoroughly cleaned the next day, and waived all charges for the extra cleaning. In short, if you want the Waikiki experience, don't want to invest the $$$ on a rental car for a week and can't deal with Honolulu's rush hour traffic on the occassions you might want to venture to Honolulu/Waikiki-then the Ko Olina is not for you. If you want a quieter "off-isalnd" experience, without actually going to Maui or Hawaii, then the Ko Olina may fit the bill. One more caveat, right now the four beach "lagoons" are very quiet, serene and uncrowded, but, as has been noted by others, Disney is currently constructing a resort right next to the Ko Olina. Let me tell you, its going to be enormous, and given that its a Disney property, probably teeming with children. This might change the entire balance of this little area of the island.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for families”
Reviews.Author: mperez1999
Reviews.Content: We don't own a timeshare but we "rented" a week from an owner off eBay. The set up and property make this ideal for our family and for vacationing with other families. We rented a 1 bedroom with full kitchen. The kitchen is great because we can cook or store food to save on eating out. If we wanted eat out there are great strip malls within a 10 minute drive. There are 3 pools including a shallow one for smaller kids and one for older kids/adults with a slide, tunnels, and waterfalls. The lagoons are a short walk and was perfect for our toddler because the water was flat with only tiny waves. As long as we have a young child we will definitely be vacationing here again.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Ko'olina was PERFECT for our Ohana!”
Reviews.Author: Ohanaof6
Reviews.Content: We booked the Marriott Ko'olina because we wanted to stay as far away from Waikiki as possible. If you want the same and want comforts of home, I highly recommend this resort! We are a family of 6, with kids ages 16, 12, 9, & 8, so the fact that the Marriott Ko'olina had 1 & 2 bedroom villas available was exactly what we were looking for. For cost savings we rented a 1 br, but even with 6 of us, it was plenty of room. There is a small nook, adjacent to the master bedroom, with an oversized couch that we used as a second bedroom for the little ones and it worked well for them. The full size kitchen was awesome too! We cooked all of our meals in our room or used the bbq's that were nearby. There is a Costco and Safeway that are nearby for convenient shopping. This resort is perfect for families and couples as well. My parents were traveling with us and are timeshare owners with Marriott. They also stayed there and loved all of the amenities the resort had to offer. Because it of it's location, you didn't have to deal with the traffic either. The resort is a little more pricey than what you'll find in Waikiki, but the atmosphere, rooms, location and especially the conveniece of the full size kitchen are well worth the extra money spent. This is one of the most relaxing vacations we've had in a long time!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: tkrosey
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at Ko'Olina. LOVE it!! People are always saying "Oahu is too crowded" but they haven't been to Ko'Olina! One day in Waikiki and I've had enough but I stayed at Ko'Olina for 2 weeks and it's so relaxing. Oahu is not that big so it's easy to get to the North Shore and some other beaches if you want. It is a family resort so if you don't like kids stay away, but I didn't see any unruly ones. You do need a car to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: Stephysue76
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely time at the Marriott Ko Olina. The grounds were great! Nice beach although it is manmade and there is no real snorkeling from there. The pools were nice and there was one area that would be great for families with little kids. Our room was kind of like a small standard hotel room (we were just in a studio) but it was more than adequate and was really what we were expecting. It did have a minifridge, sink and toaster and microwave. Although, it would have been great to have more of a view (we looked at the parking lot and mountain) but everybody wants that and it really was fine since we spent more time out and about than in our room. We traded for this through Interval Intl. and did not have to pay for parking which was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: hico01
Reviews.Content: This hotel may be great if you’re an owner. We booked an “ocean view” room and got a view of some bushes. We went back to the front desk and got a view of some trees. After more discussions we finally got a room where you could look through the trees to see the ocean. One oddity of this place is the AC system. There is actually a vent that constantly puts out cold air, than on the wall is the individual room thermostat and vent. WHY do you force cold air into someone’s room for which they have no control over. We actually had to turn the heat up on the individual system to warm up the room. They said its for humidity control, ridiculous. I have been to dozens of hotels in Hawaii never seen anything like this before. The grounds are amazing. The landscaping crew does a great job. The pools were nice and hot tubs warm, two of them even had waterfalls. The service from the front desk was just ok, nothing special. The beach on property is great. There are actually four of them in the resort area. We often walked up and down. Kolohe's Beach Bar & Grill is great for breakfast or a drink at sunset. Don’t eat there for lunch or dinner, overpriced and the food is not really all that good. Chuck's Steak & Seafood was excellent. Both my wife and I loved their salad bar and entrees. Delicious food and great service, gorgeous views. I wouldn’t go back to the Marriott vacation Club, though will be interested to go to the Disney property when it opens. If you want to get away from it all go to Turtle Bay Resort on the north shore. Rooms aren’t as nice, but the views from them and the property are amazing!! Beautiful grounds, endless beaches and forest to yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Chandler523
Reviews.Content: This is a great place for family with young kids. The hotel is very well-maintained & clean. There is a huge swimming pool with hot tubs, waterfalls, caves and water slide. There are 4 man-made lagoons, which are perfect for the little ones. This place is different from Waikiki Beach, it's more quiet and peaceful. Our family enjoyed it very much, will definitely return for another stay.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable!”
Reviews.Author: clank1368
Reviews.Content: This hotel was incredible. I was concerned about the location when I booked it -- but it was the best place to be! Rooms incredible, staff helpful, pools perfect, beach beautiful, great walking trail, and wonderful restaurants and bars.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in paradise - peacefully off the strip”
Reviews.Author: fandafoo
Reviews.Content: My parents are Marriott timeshare owners, so this is the 3rd Marriott Villa we've stayed at on the Islands, 2 on Kauai and this one on Oahu. I was very hesitant about going to Oahu again, as our last experience on our honeymoon felt so hectic and busy. This place is nice because it's away from the main strip, so it's peaceful and quiet, though stocked with amenities. There's also a Costco and a Walmart very close, which is great since we cooked in a lot. Our 2 year old absolutely loved both the pools and the private beach with beautiful sand. You definitely have a rent a car if you want to tour the entire island, or if you just want to relax, you can totally just stay there the whole week and be content as well. I'd highly recommend this place, and will definitely look forward to coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Family Resort”
Reviews.Author: MTZK
Reviews.Content: A nice place for families, older couples, but as a young couple here's some tips for making the most of the Ko Olina: 1. Rent a Car - That way you can travel the island, not many (if any) activity shuttles get out to the Ko Olina. Parking is expensive but cheaper than taxis or the sedan service. Most of the resort activites are family orientated. 2. Don't eat at the resort - The food was average at best, there is a place called "Just Tacos" on the Ko Olina property (easy walking distance) that is the best best best Mexican food in the area and reasonably priced as well. Or buy your own food and bring it in, we were still able to make many meals without a stove in our unit. BBQ's are ample on the grounds. 3. If you're looking for some adventure, the Stand Up Paddle adventure at the Ko Olina Marina is great. Highly recommend. 4. Go to the resort Luau "Fia Fia". It is the best show on the island. The food and entertainmetn was great. 5. Don't shop at the Marketplace on the grounds, there is an ABC type store near Just Tacos, go there for your basics and some gift shop stuff. Plus a great salad bar $6.99 for a big salad with your choice of toppings, for you healthy meal seekers.

Reviews.Title: “$19,500 for a view of an industrial park”
Reviews.Author: TominHawaii
Reviews.Content: Third time staying here. Twice as a regular customer and this time as an every other year "mountain view" owner. My room is in the new building (Hale Nai'i) which has a slightly different configuration than the previous rooms we had. They expanded the bedroom by getting rid of the separate lounging area and turning it into a "work area". The cabinets over the refrigerator are gone leaving little room to store groceries. Changed out the TV's and cabinety but the furniture is too far away from the screen. No screen door on patio window out to the lanai. I liked the old rooms better. Our mountan view is really a view of the marina. The problem is that there is an industrial park and refining plant behind it! Asked to be moved but was told there's limited availability (in my category of room). Told we could check back tomorrow but would have to check out at 10 am and check back in at 4:00 pm. Yep, that sounds like fun..carting clothes and food and stuff across the parking lot. Not doable..... When asked why we were assigned this room, I was told I didn't book early enough in the year (April for a Oct vacation) and that they came as close as they could to meeting my criteria. Silly me, I guess I should have specified that I didn't want a view of the industrial park........ They want you to be happy but really don't seem to have much flexibility to accommodate their owners. I was assigned a better room when visiting as a prospective client versus what they gave me as an owner. So from here on out, I'll be converting my week to points or exchange to another resort and will never return to this place.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort, Far From the Action”
Reviews.Author: EllisTravel
Reviews.Content: This is an absolutely stunning property! We were given the week by my father for our honeymoon. He is an Interval International member and we got pretty lucky to book here since these rooms don't come up for exchange very often. We had "studio" lock-off which was pretty standard. A nice marble bathroom, standard size tub, wet bar with small fridge and microwave. The "lanai" was very underwhelming. It was small with a view of the tops of palm trees. We were on the 4th floor and maybe had we been lower we could've seen the pool or higher the ocean, but oh well. You only get a mid-week "tidy" service. Makes you realize how nice it is to come back to a fresh room on vacation each day, but again, not a big deal. What makes this property special are the grounds. Huge pools, large jacuzzis and breathtaking beaches. Clear blue water in the lagoons which is calm as can be. On the beach there are a lot of lounge chairs and cabana rentals available ($20 for 4 hours). Most of the people were young families or older (>50) couples. Children not overwhelming (probably the time of the year) and plenty of room to find activity or to avoid it. They have a great beach bar and restaurant called Kohele that has the absolute best views of the sunset. Good convenience store but you absolutely have to go to the Safeway (get a savings card or use your "Dominicks" card if you have one) and stock up for the week. Get chicken for the grills, cereal for the morning and save yourself a lot of money which will make you feel better about actually spending the $200 for 2 people on dinner a couple of nights. Speaking of...go to Roy's on the golf course (get the creamy tomato soup).....skip Azul at the JW Marriott. Disney is building a mammoth property next door but the main construction is up and not distracting at all, in my opinion. Waikiki is about 30 min away but over an hour in traffic. Traffic really is as bad as they say. Try to plan excursions to avoid the major rush hours. Definitely hike Diamond Head, you can go up and back in about an hour and the views are out of this world. Try surfing at Waikiki, amazing experience. Giovanni's Shrimp Truck (Shrimp Scampi for sure) on the North Shore for lunch is a must!!! Ted's Bakery on your way back for a cheap dinner and pie. Bottom line...very nice hotel, but a hike to get anywhere. Worth it for families or those that just want to relax in luxury....(such as honeymooners :)

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Vacation in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: jane_in_va
Reviews.Content: As far as I'm concerned, this is top notch all the way. We own a time share here and this was our third time back. This time we split up the time share. For one week we stayed in the "Lock Off" section - like a regular hotel room with some added amenities of a small refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker and wet bar area. We bought some groceries and made dinner several times using the outdoor grills available on the grounds. We enjoyed the small but nice balcony area for reading, having morning coffee and relaxing. This room w/bath was nice, well appointed although there could be better lighting but it wasn't really a problem. The second week we moved into the other side - a suite. We had a separate bedroom with a king size bed, a huge bath with shower, two separate sink areas and a large soaking tub. There was a full kitchen complete with dishwasher, stove, refrigerator, completely furnished with dishes, cookware, knives, etc. and a washer/dryer. There was a large dining area and livingroom with a TV (so my husband could watch the game!). A larger Lanai with a wonderful marina and ocean view. Simply fabulous. Our only complaints were the on-site restaurant (Chuck's) and the adjacent store - all on the first level. The restaurant was expensive, the sides offered (we tried an island sweet potato) which was waxy and not very tasty. My steak, a good size sirloin, was tough and not that great. The price, however, was pretty high. Service was good but, again, overpriced for what you get - we didn't go back after the first time and probably won't again on our next visit. The "convenience" store next to the restaurant offers a bit of everything at highly inflated prices. Of course, they have a captive audience but if you have a car, go over to the nearby ABC store and get what you need at a much lower price. As a time share owner here, I'm very satisfied with this resort. I love Marriott Hotels and their other properties and I always can count on them for good service and quality. My only complaint is in the "value" department - the value for the rooms is fabulous but that rating is for the other things on property only otherwise it would be a 5! The free parking is for owners - not sure what the fee is for those who are using this resort like a hotel. A complaint is that the high speed internet in the rooms did not work properly at all the first week and only after constant adjusting and getting hotel staff to come to the room and work on the system several times the second week. Fitness center is not free but there are enough swimming pools and lagoons and walking/running trails that you don't need to pay for this. Again, this relates back to the "Value" rating.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Paradise on the Southwestern side of Oahu”
Reviews.Author: TravelingChristy
Reviews.Content: The resort was amazing! The pictures on Marriott's website don't do it justice. There were actually 3 different pools. One had waterfalls, one was shaped like a seashell, and the other had water volleyball, etc. in it. There were also 7 jacuzzis, some of which had waterfalls as well. There was a waterslide in one section. We had our own private lagoon right off the ocean and the JW Marriott was just a few minutes away and we were allowed access to their lagoon as well including fish feeding in the morning. There are grills located throughout the property so you can cook. My friend and I purchased all of our food at a place like Sam's and didn't eat at a restaurant the entire 5 days. We ate, fish, steak, shark, chicken, and sausage all week. Our 1 bedroom villa had a full kitchen, dining room, living room, balcony, lanai, and two bathrooms. It also had a washer and dryer. The concierge was the bubbliest, nicest lady I have ever met! The hotel offers lots of packages. We went on a snorkeling/dolphin excursion on a catamaran which runs out of their harbor. We swam with sea turtles, fish, and then road on the cat while about 90 spinner dolphins jumped around us. Because the hotel isn't located in Honolulu, it is peaceful and quiet. I like this over the bustling touristy area near Waikiki. We also went up on the North Shore and swam and even went on a shark cage dive. Our favorite day was the last day. We snorkeled at Hanauma Bay on the Southeastern side and then went to the Paradise Cove luau. Fantastic! It would be a great hotel for families as well as there is a lot for children to do. The children that were at the hotel while we were always seemed to be in bed early so you never heard them in the evenings if you strolled around the property. They also have a great gift shop with great ice cream!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection for Young Families”
Reviews.Author: skipsterNewYork
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to KOBC (last time this year as well). I think the reviews are all over the place here because they have lost focus on what the property is--a time share. It happens that it is a Marriott, and my opinion is that it meets or exceeds the Marriott standard one would expect. If you are a young family, you will not find any place better. The resort is spotlessly clean and the gentle lagoons and pool complex are ideal. Anything greater than the studio lock-off room gives you a full kitchen, dining room, washer/dryer, dishwasher and so-on. Shopping and off-property restaurants are 10 minutes away. You do need a car. Period. I understand that any visitor wants to get full disclosure before they make plans, but if you are a honeymoon couple or a visitor who doesn't have chidren, why would you go to a time share in high summer season? That doesn't make sense to me when there are proper hotels all over the islands, including the JW Ihilani just steps away? Regarding views from the room: we have been in the Moana tower twice, and the non-ocean views are not spectacular. OK. So go to the pool/lagoon beach/Na'ia bar/Kohole's restaurant, any day and watch the gorgeous sunset. We have always found the service to be professional and helpful when needed. Because we had a time share week, resort service is not proactive and in your face every minute. That's the nature of a time share. I have not been to the resort off season or shoulder season. I would imagine that if you don't have or don't want kids around, that would be a better time to go. But I don't understand going to a time share in Hawaii in high summer and complaining about kids or some of the flaming comments about service. I'm not disputing that their daily rates are premium and that you are entitled to expect a high-level experience. All I am saying is that I believe the time share is premium but it is a time share and I would choose a proper hotel if I minded being around young families or children.

Reviews.Title: “If View is Important...Beware!”
Reviews.Author: Californiamamabear
Reviews.Content: I had seen the reviews prior to my trip in June, 2010 and actually called the hotel TWICE about my concerns regarding the "industrial" area and parking lot views I'd read so much about. I was told there was no industrial area and all the views were spectacular. They're not. My first room was on the 4th floor and 75% of the view out my slider was parking lot, cars and 4 lanes of highway. The top 25% of the window was three palm trees. I tried to get moved, offered to pay whatever it cost to get moved to a room that didn't have a depressing view, but they wouldn't budge. I explained that I was told I had a "Garden, mountain or island view" and that I have been to Hawaii at least 15 times and have never seen any garden, mountain or island view that looks like an industrial war-zone. Other than horrific view, the resort was terrific - immaculately clean and the room exceeded my expectations. If you are in just a standard "room" it is a lockout portion of their timeshares and they're teeny tiny...more like the size of a cruise ship cabin but the 1 bdrm unit we had would have been a 10 if not for the depressing views. The front desk discourages everybody from dining at Chuck's. We ate there three nights and had stellar food and service.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time here!”
Reviews.Author: nalani65
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at Ko'olina and we were pretty happy with the experience. Although the reviewer before me has nothing but bad things to say, I think that maybe they were expecting some deserted island in the Pacific maybe?? Any ways, we live on Oahu and this was a little "staycation" for us, as it was a 3 day weekend. We got the 1 bedroom Ocean view villa in the Moana Tower. It was nice and had a lot of great amenities. The room itself was HUGE! Loved the fact that there was a FULL kitchen, separate bedroom and shower and tub for bathing. We never ate at any of the hotel restaurants b/c we figured we'd might as well enjoy a good meal in our room seeing as we had a kitchen. Target, Costco, Safeway and many other stores nearby made it easy to get groceries and then come back and cook. We saved a lot of $$ this way, plus we were never disappointed about any meals! The only thing I really didn't care for about this hotel was the fact that they charge you $30 for parking and Ocean View consists of 3rd floor and up. Whether you valet or self park it was the same price, and the "ocean view villa" was anything 3rd flooor and up. LOL- all I could see was a tiny speck of ocean, but oh well! In my opinion, the parking's a little steep and the view guidelines vague-but hey, it's Hawai'i! It is a little crowded, the pools especially, however, you would get this anywhere in Hawai'i during the summer and it would be WAY worse in Waikiki! We preferred to swim in the lagoon any way, pool water kind of grosses me out any where I go! They had a movie night on the great lawn with popcorn for the family, which was a nice idea. They had fish feedings, and many other things to do for out of towners. My suggestion would be that if you prefer to go where the action is, stay away from here. Kapolei is not nearly as developed as Honolulu, so if you want night life/bars/clubs/shows, anything more than beach/pool/hotel activites, then stay elsewhere!!! Otherwise the Marriot Ko'olina Resort is a great choice! We plan on coming back again!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the whole family”
Reviews.Author: travelagentjo12
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fabulous. The resort offered everything we wanted. The only down side is that it is far removed from everything else on the island. Great things we discovered: - Fia Fia Luau is on Tuesday. We did not go, and the kids were bummed. They wanted to see fire twirling. HOWEVER, if you go the lobby around 8pm, you can get a perfect view of the show with fire twirling. (without paying $$$$$) -ABC Store (gift shop/market) down the street from the resort. It had everything from food, to little souvies and postcards. It offers a lot more the MarketPlace at the hotel. -Grills at the hotel- I never thought we would use them. We picked up a few things at the ABC Store at Ko Olina and grilled them... PERFECT. -Pool to the far left. Waterfalls and slides. They also have shave ice from 11a-4p -Lagoon Feeding- every morning at 730am, you can feed the fish in the lagoon. The kids thought it was the best. One thing we learned on the vacation (just not at the hotel).. the locals are very laid back. VERY! But super super nice!!! We had a scuba trip planned from the hotel. The bus picked us up late and we missed the trip. The local at the marina said "dat boat done gone bra". We learned quick, this is the norm. We laughed and went with the flow.

Reviews.Title: “If you want lip service with a smile! This is the hotel for you!”
Reviews.Author: BigWashSr
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nice.. But if you want to hear the Disney hotel be constructed while you try too relax in your "mountain side" room, well you will have a great time. Tried to get moved to the ocean side, there was availability but not for less than an additional 50 dollars a night! With the addition of the 29.00 parking, the 25.00 breakfast (per person), and the 12.99 internet fees, this is the hotel for the high roller! Plus the hotel personnel have a distinctive way of blowing you off with a smile. It is truly a gift that deserves to be seen first hand. The property is absolutely beautiful, but the customer service sucks! This is why I am a Priority Club member!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Use Points for Marriott Ko Olina”
Reviews.Author: egbthomas
Reviews.Content: We booked a mountain view room with points at Marriott Ko Olina. We were extremely disappointed after twelve hours of traveling from New York to be given a room that was smack on top of the garage. We get to see two levels of garage parking. To call this a mountain view is gross misrepresentation and fraud by Marriott. We are Marriott owners elsewhere but we were treated like third class citizens because we paid with points. Do Not Think of using points to stay at this property.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our Expectations”
Reviews.Author: NJFAB4
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights at the Marriott and we had an amazing experience. Our 1 bedroom villa was immaculate and from the lobby, to the pools, to the beach, the place is beautiful. The staff was very friendly and went out of their way to suggest places to visit and things to do. The Fia Fia (luau) held every Tuesday is a lot fun. Our kids really enjoyed it and the food was very good. The kids also got a kick out of seeing the Black Pearl (Pirates of the Caribben ship) which was filming the fourth film at a nearby beach. The only negative about the hotel is that there is usually a charge for the kids activities. But with the beach and slide at the pool, the kids will keep plenty busy. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: arydalch
Reviews.Content: The beach coves are perfect for young kids, but teens looking for waves will have to go somewhere else. Loved being so close to the beach, and having a full kitchen for snacks and to keep water bottles cool. Great condo type set up, but with the luxury of a Marriott Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay As Usual”
Reviews.Author: MizzPisces
Reviews.Content: Wonderful 8 vacation days at the Marriott Ko Olina. This is not our first time although it is our first time to trade thru Interval. Since our last time at MKO, they have added a new whole wing to the resort, complete with a huge swimming pool with hot tubs, waterfalls, caves and water slide. We booked a one-bedroom villa and upon check-in, we were given the ocean view penthouse suite in the new building. We had the view of the entire resort and endless ocean views! We had our breakfasts and dinners on the lanai every day, and we enjoyed the sunset while sipping wine from our lanai as well. This place is well-kept and the grounds are immaculate. The entire staff is wonderful and courteous; I can’t praise them enough for their consistent great service. There are 4 lagoons to snorkel and swim in and there is a lagoon (I believe it’s lagoon 3) where the resident turtles live (I only saw one turtle but I know there were two at one point; but Lucky, the one with the missing fin, is MIA). MKO can be really quiet at night and you will need a car to get around. So if you are expecting a Waikiki experience, do not book here. This is a resort for people who want quiet relaxation in a beautiful and peaceful surrounding. My fiancé is a Marriott Vacation Club owner and we attended the 90 min. timeshare presentation. I really fell in-love with our room; he actually ended up buying a 3br/3ba ocean view villa as an early wedding gift!! So now, we get to come back and share this beautiful place with families and friends every year. We are already planning our getaway next year!

Reviews.Title: “NOT FOR TEENAGERS OR OLDER KIDS”
Reviews.Author: MVLUN
Reviews.Content: I tried to upgrade during our check-in since I was told over the phone to proceed upgrades when checking in. I even offered to pay the difference but apparently, the Marriott was booked at 99% capacity. We had a handicapped 2 bedroom with teenagers. They had bars all around the bathrooms and showers and tub were not the most comfortable. The kitchen were not convenient either since it is for the disabled guest. I called down to asked why we were in this particular room, and I was told that the room was all they had, and I pretty much don't have a choice. What shocked me was I said..."I guess I'm pretty much screwed since I don't have anywhere else to go...", and the guest service said back to me...verbatim.."Yes, you are pretty much screwed...Mrs. ____." I was shocked, and I could only say,.."I can't believe you just told me that I was screwed..I can't believe you represent your hotel and speak to your guest in that manner" That pretty much stated my view of the Marriott Ko Olina Villas. We own a fractional residence at the Ritz Carlton Club which is managed by the Marriott Corporation, and I've stated my views and experience with the Ritz Carlton Hotel and Club. I guess I learned my lesson to never stay at any other, but the Ritz. The lagoons are great for little kids, but not when my kids are now older. The check-out was the same as the checkin. We did check out 3 days earlier when a hotel in Waikiki opened up. The front desk never asked how my stay was, but wanted to know if we are all out of the room so they can clean it for a new guest. Well enough said. Was very disappointed since we do own a property managed by the Marriott Corporation. The Guest Services Personnel should be trained a lot better to upgrade the standard.

Reviews.Title: “Compressed chicken parts sandwich”
Reviews.Author: brucebush
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay very very very clean rooms . But the food offered at the beach food outlet has gone to the dogs from a year ago july . Come on marriott whats up with serving a compressed checken parts sandwich ,thats nasty . are waitress agreed and ask us to let the management know what we thought . when staying at this place with a kitchen we recommmend stopping at safeway or target first . the food is very high even for hawaii hot dogs are 10.75 .. we also had dinner at Chucks located on the property it was priced in the 25.00 range it was ok best to eat there tue night at 5pm so you can enjoy the entertainment. servers here heard you like the cattle tourist we are . They talk above you .the marriott on maui is very kid friendly we have a 7 year old and they remember is name from 6 monthes ago . we will go to the beach club on maui before we would ever go back to KoOlina . The Beach here is manmade but very safe for very young children no waves ...

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on earth!”
Reviews.Author: CandyCaneCA
Reviews.Content: All I can say is that this place is heaven on earth. My Dad and also another family member are owners. We stayed in a two bedroom two bath ocean view condo, and it was the nicest vacation that we've ever had. They keep this resort super clean and every detail is covered. First class all the way. Pools and lagoons were absolutely gorgeous. I can't say that one bad thing about this resort. The creme de la creme. Can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Everything is perfect at the Ko Olina Beach Club”
Reviews.Author: rtwtraveller10
Reviews.Content: This resort is superb nothing went wrong - rooms are wide and very well furbished - the gardens are absolutely well kept, swimmining pool is quite nice but too crowded - the beach just in front of the resort is much better - staff is very professional and well trained. No trouble for parking - when I was there in 2009 they were starting works for a Walt Disney Resort pretty close to the hotel.... If you are aware that resort is about 50 minutes (more during peak hours) drive to Waikiki it's a perfect place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “just what I hoped for”
Reviews.Author: LACA31
Reviews.Content: This place was really a nice surprise. The staff is friendly, grounds are clean and pretty, and the vibe was really nice. Great place and easy to get around the island from here

Reviews.Title: “Great resort, gorgeous views”
Reviews.Author: Gigi028
Reviews.Content: You could definitely think that this is a five star hotel instead of a resort, great staff, very accomodating. This is in the top of the line of other Marriott properties, the bedding is outstanding, everything you can imagine in your own house, including washer/ dryer. To have the chance to cook and/ or grill will save you a lot of $$$. Bar service by the pool, absolutely amazing sunsets and postcard-like beach front. We would definitely come back with the kids next time, they had lots of activities for little ones. Valet service was great, always giving you directions and tips to different places. We got this as an exchange thru Interval, it took almost two years in a waiting list but it was absolutely worth it. They kept on calling to offer a smaller unit or different location but we stayed firm on our decision to get this hotel and boy are we happy!

Reviews.Title: “I love the Ko Olina!”
Reviews.Author: babushka721
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd visit to the Ko Olina and it's still as wonderful as ever. We are owners here and don't regret buying here at all! The sales presentations are so low key and never any pressure to buy. We were able to check in a little early since our room was ready. We had a view of the mountains, the pool and the ocean. The view was awesome from our room on the 7th floor. I know another review stated there were a lot of problems with bug bites. Perhaps this was an unfortunate incident...we've never had any bug bites on any of our visits and some friends we know that go also have never had problems. I can't complain about anything here. Everything is wonderful from the location, the staff, the grounds, the room and the services! Concierge is awesome too...be sure to see Tina...she's so friendly and upbeat! I love being on this side of the island and would never choose to stay in Waikiki! Just make sure you have a rental car. We drove around the island and loved the sites. Having Kapolei so close is great. You can pick up food at Safeway, there's a Target & Costco there along with a TON of places to eat. Zippys was one of our favorites for their Gourmet Teriyaki Burger and their French Toast is the best I've had! If you want to eat at the Ko Olina, Kolohe's is good but pricey but definitely go at least once for dinner at sunset. It's so pretty! Chuck's Steakhouse is there too but we've never eaten there so I can't comment. We did the Fia Fia Luau there and really enjoyed it. The food was decent, not great, but you definitely won't go hungry and there were lots of choices. Their cake after was really good! Be sure to visit Dole Plantation for a Pineapple Whip ice cream...so good! We stopped at Matsumotos in North Shore for the best shaved ice. There is a "turtle beach" in North shore that's worth a visit too. You can look at the giant sea turtles that come to shore and you can swim or snorkel there too. Ask concierge and they'll gladly point it out on the map. If you love shrimp stop at Giovanni's Shrimp truck on the highway past North Shore, heading towards the Polynesian Cultural Center. Be sure to bring a permanent marker to sign the shrimp truck! We also stopped at Pearl Harbor and did some shopping at the Ala Moana outdoor shopping mall. Stop at Leonard's Bakery in Waikiki too if you love malasadas (a portuguese donut). We had so much fun exploring! The Ko Olina is a wonderful resort to relax and unwind at. You will see the most beautiful sunsets here and if you just want to lounge by the pool or beach there's never a problem and we always found plenty of chairs to use! We cant'y wait for our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “I love this resort!”
Reviews.Author: christine01028
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying at the Ko Olina Beach Club, and I have to say - I simply love it. We had two, two bedroom units in the Hale Moana tower (in my opinion, the best views for the sunset). Firstly, the rooms are very well appointed; you cannot beat having all the comforts of home while on vacation. There are a ton of things to do at the resort, and shopping in nearby Kapolei (Costco, Kmart, Safeway, Target, etc.) is very convenient. The resort is so beautifully landscaped - it is just breathtaking. Palm trees, hibiscus, and plumeria are everywhere. The pools are great too. I even had fun on the slide - usually at other resorts those are just for kids. Two complaints though - there are tons of locals that use the pools and the BBQs day and night. They bring their whole family and take up huge areas of lounge chairs and are not at all friendly to other guests. We were very surprised by this considering this resort is for owners of the Marriott. One night, a group was particularly rowdy by the BBQs under our lanai, and when we called the front desk about it, they brushed us off about it - and never came to check it out or ask the group to leave. We watched them leave via the beach parking lot around midnight. Lastly, lounge chairs get saved by guests as early as 6am - even though they are not in use. This is such a frustrating practice, and I wish Marriott would police it better. Overall, it was an amazing experience at Ko Olina - the sunsets are forever burned in my memory. 4 1/2 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the KoOlina!!”
Reviews.Author: Por2gal15
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Koolina from June 3-10 and absolutely loved it! I was worried about it being a timeshare resort, but you would have never known it while staying there! The resort was gorgeous! I traveled with my parents, sisters, husband, and 2 year old daughter. It was perfect for all of us. The pools were amazing and the lagoons perfect for swimming/snorkling in. My daughter would spend hours in the pools and lagoons. The resort was so quiet and not crowded at all. We spent a day going around the beautiful island and had lunch in Waikiki...thank goodness we didn't stay there. For us it was way too hectic, too many shops, and very little beach access. The beaches we're tiny compared to the beautiful beach we had at Koolina. If you are going to party, probably Waikiki is for you, but if your going to have some pure relaxation and with family (since its perfect for children) this is the place for you. We had a 2 bedroom non lock off Condo in the newer tower (I believe 30) and it was heaven! Beds comfortable and the rooms beautiful. It was so nice having a kitchen as we ate breakfast and lunch there every day. The resort has a couple of tasty restaurants and a market that sells lots of food and other things. If you want a full grocery store--its only like 5 minutes driving away from the resort. I can't express how much I loved this place....I will defintely come back..it was heaven on earth :)

Reviews.Title: “One of the most beautiful and fragrant place on earth.”
Reviews.Author: mocatlady
Reviews.Content: As you enter the resort you are greeted as family. The beauty of the resort astounds the senses with flowers and extraordinary decor abounding. The accommodations offer comfortable living with a homey atmosphere. The bed floats you to sleep as you review the tropical surroundings in your dreams. There are four man made lagoons that provide a safe swimming and play environment even for the youngest child offering views that are majestic for their parents. Several pools dot the resort offering tranquility for the adults and a cave, waterfall, and slide for the kids. This was our third time there, and we are already planning for next year. This is a must visit resort. Mahalo.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: k10754
Reviews.Content: We love this place! Although this is a timeshare the service here is more in line with a 4 or 5 star hotel. The staff here really goes above and beyond. In fact in the middle of the night when my daughter woke up sick with a fever and the on site market was closed they opened it just for me! Considering there is a grocery store only a few miles away I really didn't expect such service. If you have kids this place is wonderful. Many pools to choose from as well as ocean lagoons that are safe for little ones to swim in play in all day. This was our second trip here and we loved it so much this time we actually bought a timeshare. Have only been back a couple days and I am already planning our next trip back.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise for Us!”
Reviews.Author: gee81680
Reviews.Content: I must say i wasn't sure if we wanted to stay in Waikkiki or in Kapolei being that in Waikkiki your near everything,this was our first trip. Celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary. We did a timeshare exchange through Interval.We were offered a studio twice. I wanted a 1 bdroom, i was trading my 2bdr,. I was willing to downgrade it was for HAWAII!!! On the 2nd offer and told by the representatiive from Interval that 1 brm and up are really available to the (home )owners, I didn't want to risk not getting the date I wanted, As we were doing a vow renewal on a specific date, so we grabbed the studio, it was just the two of us. My husband and I could not be more pleasantly surprise, the resort was lovely, everything we wanted, Beautiful landscaping, clean,tranquil, and the beauty of hawaii, romantic, the staff helpful,courteous,friendly,accomodating,and full of aloha spirit.
