We had a to our surprise a ocean view woophiee(i did happen to mention that we were celebrating our 25 anniversary in an email the resort sent me prior to check in, in regards to any events and activities we might be interested in--I don't know if that helped in the room we recieved and when we checked in they had it noted and also sent up a box of chocolates and a card with well wishes for our special celebration that was a nice surprise) I would like to mention also I had called the resort weeks earlier to find out about doing a ceremony and they set me up with Alohabridalgallery and their rep. she took care of evevrything we needed for our vow renewal on "Secret Beach" it was everything I hoped for. So every morning we'd awake to the pacific ocean view and then the sun and the birds singing if you like that! We chose to have our breakfast on our lanai everyday that memory stays with us --lovely!!! At night the best sunsets- wow it really is Hawaii! What more can I say! Thanks to the reviews on tripadvisor we went for it. Great choice for us. If you want the clubs, a fast pace activity, and the city scene this is not the place for you , if you want down time, do what ever you feel like time, whenever you feel like because you just want to unwind--- this is it!!!. This is a family friendly resort and that means kids--hey thats ok as long as their not yours--right :). The activities they have you -can pick what interested you. Then there are sights to see! A car rental is best so you can come and go as you please ---Waikkiki is 30 min. Pearl harbour 20min, Dole plantation 20min. and so on. The mall area is one exit away maybe 5mins( target,kmart, chili's,taco bell, mcDonalds, pizza hut,nail salons,beauty shops,supermarkets,and so on) . The Activiites desk attendants are great with information and setting up activites for you. The directions they have ready for you where you want top go are the best I've seen--I really hate to get lost:(--but we sure didn't Thanks to Racheal!) The restaurants on site my favorite was Choloe Grill with the view of the water, the palm trees ,the sunset, the music in the background, the vibe was aloha, food was very good and the pina coladas delicious! In short I would say we were not disappointed at all --it then seems the 13Hr travel time from the east coast was in the end worth it(be advised!!!)I could go on-the Bed was the best --everything in our studio( 20 804 in Hale Moana Bldg ) perfectly clean and to Marriot standards.In all would definately go to Hawaii again and stay here in a heartbeat! Read other reviews get as much info as you can and go for it I did --And they lived happily everafter!

Reviews.Title: “Nice week on the beach.”
Reviews.Author: arep
Reviews.Content: every thing was fine at this resort, not outstanding and not bad, we should have done some homework and got the upgrade room. limited kitchen means eating out allot and that gets expensive. we traded a time share on an other island so we got owner parking, if not for that it would have been an extra $30 per day. all in all Hawaii on the beach is hard to knock. PS one real down side is no satellite TV, missed hockey play offs.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: Heartsmileykid
Reviews.Content: We traded into the resort through Interval. Had a 1 bedroom villa, as well as a lockoff unit. I really liked the size of the villa, and all the included amenities for cooking/cleaning (dish washing soap, plenty of dish washing detergent, paper towels, plastic garbage bags, etc.). The pool, jacuzzi and water slide were a lot of fun. Don't worry, the slide isn't just for kids, they allow adults to go down, however it is enclosed and in the dark. My first time down, I was so surprised at how fast it was! We tried out the Ko Olina Cat morning snorkeling cruise which was a lot of fun. The crew was really nice and helpful. The boat takes you out to this section called electric beach, where we were able to snorkel with all sorts of fish. Overall our trip to Hawaii was wonderful. I would recommend this resort to anyone trading through Interval that is interested in going to Hawaii. It was a good stomping ground for us to really get out and explore the Island.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Trip at the Ko Olina Resort”
Reviews.Author: monsterdun
Reviews.Content: I am an owner of Worldmark and traded into the Marriott Ko Olina Resort through Interval International for a 3 bedroom unit for 4 adults and 3 kids for the dates of 4/10-4/17. After 18 hours of a hell trip of airline travel from San Jose to LAX to HNL.....arrived at the resort and took all the stress away! My brother and his family arrived before us, so was able to check into the resort around 2pm...and to make up for our long airline delays, we got LUCKY with an Ocean View room....which some was blocked by the palm trees in the front, but still got a spectacular view (so if facing the ocean, try to get the higher floors, anything above 7, and you get the best views…but we weren’t complaining). Our unit was a 3 Bedroom, 3 bath, which was basically a 2 bedroom unit with the separate lockoff 1 bedroom studio unit ...and this worked out perfect for us. My wife and I took the master, the kids in the 2nd bedroom with 2 twin beds, and my brother and his wife took the lock off unit which had a king size bed and sleep sofa. Very nice and clean, hawaiian decor....and lots of room...we had no issues at all with all of us in the unit with room to spare. Full kitchen, stacked washer & dryer (which made it nice so we didn’t have any dirty clothes to worry about when we got home) As other reviewers mentioned, there are local stores to shop, Safeway, Target, and Costco (and the strip malls have numerous places to eat), all less than 15 mins away (really 2-3 exits away). We took advantage of this to buy our groceries for breakfast, lunches and snacks. The grounds are very nice and all the kids loved swimming in the 3 local pools and local lagoon! We usually stayed at the main pool with the water slide, and the kid friendly pool with the zero entry beach pool. The weather was unsually cool for the week we went 4/10-4/17, so the kids really enjoyed sitting in the hot tubs to warm up. I played golf at the local Ko Olina Golf Resort, which was nice....booked an 12pm tee time to get the cheaper rate, but because there were not alot of players on the course that day, was able to get off earlier and had no issues in playing time. Windy, but very nice! The concierge helped book Snorkeling Cruise for my wife, son, and brother’s family which they said was awesome…saw 3 whales and about 30 dolphins swimming next to the boat, but snorkeling a bit rough because the weather was windy which made the water choppy. We did a drive to the North Shore 1 day and visited - Dole Plantation (gotta luv them Pineapple Whips) - Had a snack at the Giovanni’s Shrimp Truck (get the spicy…nice burn), - Grab a sandwich from Storto’s Deli (with the Papaya Seed dressing…made an awesome sandwich – only negative is sandwich could have used more meat) - And for the kids, a stop at Matsumoto Shaved Ice! On our last nite, we did goto the Paradise Cove Luau, which was nice, and very close (Marriott has a shuttle that circles their hotel, resort, and golf course, which made it very easy to get around). When you check in, Marriott “suckers” you in to visit their Welcome desk within 24 hours to get a discount card to use at their resort, restaurants, golf course, and concierge services, and they entice you to sign up for the Marriott Timeshare Presentation, which we signed up for just to get the gift voucher. The presentation lasted 90 mins, and the guy wasn’t pressuring at all, but the negative was that he was saying that I got lucky to trade in, and when all the Marriott units sell out in 5-7 years, he mentioned that I would NEVER be able to trade in again….we’ll see. We did this to get a $75 gift voucher (which we used at Roy’s Restaurant, located at the Ko Olina Golf Club… which if you are staying at the resort, to make a point to dine at one evening….great dishes!!). There is construction next door for the new Disney Resort, but this was not a bother at all. The only issue we had was with Billing, where my brother and I had separate accounts set up for charges, and for some reason, eventhough we gave room numbers to charge, they still mixed it up, so it took about 15 mins to clear up before we checked out. Overall, and awesome experience, and would love to stay here again….but hoping to trade into the Marriott Resort in Maui for next year…so maybe we will get lucky again!

Reviews.Title: “OK resort but a long trip to anything”
Reviews.Author: 1frequent_eater
Reviews.Content: Unless you have kids under 10 avoid. There are better destinations. We are Marriott Owners with a different home resort and traded this through Interval. This Marriott has two reservation codes 1 or 2. Apparently ANYTHING that comes from Interval via trade is ranked a two and gets the parking lot, oil refinery, desert landscape view. (Being a premier owner at MVC I thought I'd have some pull but was wrong. I called for months to request an ocean view and found out I was labeled a 2 and had no other option but a mountain view ie desert view) The view was very disappointing but given that we were in Hawaii we tried to make the best of it. However, it was windy everyday which made the balcony worthless. (If you are on the ocean side the resort blocks most of the wind and you can see sunset). About the resort: -Check in was easy and we were able to get into out two bedroom a few hours early which was nice. -They offered valet parking for $5 a day which is not needed. There is a parking garage with elevator access that seemed to be more convenient than using a valet. -It was a nice two bedroom with kitchen which we have grown accustomed to from the MVC. Nothing different about this and it was spacious for two adults and two teens (After day six it was getting a little small!!!!) -The pools were clean, grounds were well kept and the service was great. -There is not a need to 'grab' your seats at 8 am as there were plenty of loungers in the pool area and beach. -The beach was great and the water was perfect. If you choose to snorkel it's $10 and worth it. Lagoon two is better as it had turtles and more fish. Location: This resort is great if you want to get to a destination and stay there all week. Other than additional hotels on the property (Marriott and a Disney construction zone) it is near nothing that one would wish to go to on a vacation (Fifteen minutes to a Target, Safeway, Costco, Chili's, Outback etc). It is an additional 15-20 minutes to anywhere else. (40 minutes to Honolulu for dinner, 30 minutes to Pearl Harbor). After two days our two teens were BORED as were we. What to do: Dole Pineapple plantation (about 30 minutes). See North Shore beaches and surfers (45 minutes) Pearl Harbor (30 minutes) Waikiki (45 minutes) Negatives- View, Restaurant- Chucks was awful (not too expensive, bad food), Location is not great for anything other than tanning. Positives- Good staff, clean pools, little store on premise was convenient and priced accordingly. Overall - Save your money/vacation time and go to a different island or location. This is a resort plopped in the middle to nowhere and completely man made.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful family timeshare vacation”
Reviews.Author: spengle1
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at Marriott's KoOlina Beach Club (grandparents, daughter, son-in-law and 2 boys 11 and almost 14). The property is stellar - beautifully maintained, 3 pools each with different amenities, hot tubs reserved for families, adults, kids, great pool bar and restaurant and upscale restaurant with patio dining, bar with good happy happy specials, in lovely location. Two bedrooms each with full bath, full kitchen with W/D well appointed, balcony, fast elevators, excellent staff. Believe them when they say that check-in is late afternoon - but they cheerfully store luggage and refrigerate groceries so that you can enjoy the property while waiting for your unit. The overall KoOlina property with it's swimming lagoons, path along the coast, access to the JW Marriott Hotel at the opposite end of the lagoons, golf course, Marina is fabulous. We, of course, drove all over the island to see all of the sights - most places less than an hour away. This location is on the less populated west coast so it's a drive to most of the sights - a plus for us since it was out of the crowds and traffic,but could be a negative if Waikiki is more than a once or twice visit. Don't miss driving to the North Shore to see surfers, to the East for Shrimp trucks and Kialua Beach, on the H3 and/or Pali Highway through the mountains, Pearl Harbor and many other sights. The on-site Fia Fia Luau is well worth the price for the show alone (food is good not great, multiple drink coupons, crafts exhibits, much fun). If you plan to go to luau - make reservations well in advance for best seating (pay with credit card or call and ask for confirmation). Free parking for one care if owner or exchanger. Paid parking for 2nd car or renter.l All in all a great vacation with wonderful family members (and the sunsets are phenomenal!!

Reviews.Title: “OK - but there are better choices”
Reviews.Author: CalBeacher
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a resort that's great for young kids, you don't need anything other than a pool and sandy beach, and will be cooking your own food in the condo, and you want to be on Oahu, then this is the place for you. However, there really is nothing here other than the Beach Club Resort and several other timeshares that are under construction. The manmade lagoons are OK - but can't compare with a real beach. Restaurant choices in the resort are limited (Chuck's or Kolohoe's) and neither will take reservations. The food at Kolohoe's is prepped ahead of time (according to our waitress), and it tastes like it. Chuck's will cost you about the same and the food is better. If you're looking for a romantic resort, a great beach, and dining choices - this is not the place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Resort”
Reviews.Author: greenlakegirl
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Marriott Ko Olina Beach Club. Our trip to Oahu was a family vacation for some rest and relaxation over the holidays with our kids (ages 3 and 6). This is a great resort for families and young kids. I would not recommend it for couples as the place is filled with kids. But, if you have young kids, this place is truly a dream. Keeping that in mind…here’s why the Marriott Ko Olina is a great resort for families with kids. 1) Kid friendly Lagoons– Resort is located on the west side of the island of Oahu. The resort sits in one of eight man-made lagoons. The lagoons are tranquil and make for the perfect opportunity for young kids to wade into the ocean without concern about strong undercurrents. It’s like swimming in a pool (but in the ocean). If the lagoon in front of the resort gets too crowded, you can walk along a paved path to one of the adjacent lagoons located on either side of the resort. They are less crowded and just as beautiful. The paved path is also a great place to go running. Beach chairs are free at the resort lagoon and there is $35/day charge for cabana rentals. 2) Good Kid Pools – There are 3 pools on the property. One is a quiet pool, geared towards adults. The other two pools are great for kids. There is a toddler wading pool that re-creates a “beach” where kids can wade directly into the pool. It’s shallow enough for kids to stand and this pool was my 3-year old’s favorite location at the resort. There is also another larger pool with lovely waterfalls and a pretty fast waterslide that my 6-year old loved. Plenty of Jacuzzis are located around the resort for the kids to use. 3) Kids Club – The resort has daily kids activities outside of the pool options. If your kids want a break from the pool and sun, there are many different indoor activities to choose from. Some are free of charge and some cost a fee. However, the activities seemed geared more towards younger kids (12 and under) versus teenagers. Otherwise, we felt the amenities and the service at the resort were very good. We are not Marriott Vacation Club owners but rather booked our stay via Marriott’s webpage using our AAA membership discount. We booked a 2-bedroom unit with an ocean view. Our unit was on the 6th floor - it was very spacious with a lovely ocean view. The units had a washer/dryer, free Wi-Fi access, DVD players, flat screen TV’s, and a well stocked kitchen. The kitchen was a little on the small side relative to the rest of the unit but it served its purpose. The fitness center at the resort is also nice – spacious, lots of windows, and clean. If you like to frequently dine out, keep in mind the options for restaurants on the property are limited. There are two restaurants and a luau that occurs once a week. The luau was pretty good – food and entertainment were decent. The food at the two resorts restaurants was also good. Also, close to the hotel is a Roy’s restaurant at the Ko Olina Golf Club and there are a couple of restaurants at the JW Marriott Ihilani Resort. Both are within walking distance. The resort is also within ten minutes of the town of Kapolei. In Kapolei, there is a Target, Costco, Safeway, multiplex movie theater, and many casual dining options (i.e. Chili’s, Outback Steakhouse etc). This is where you will go to do any of your shopping and provides additional casual dining-out options. If you stay at Ko Olina, I do strongly recommend that you rent a car. You need a car to go anywhere outside the resort or around the island. If you are staying longer than 4 days, you will want to venture outside of the resort. If you have time, take a trip up to the North Shore. We really enjoyed eating shrimp at Giovanni’s Shrimp Truck, seeing turtles swim up to the beach, and having shave ice at Matsumoto. It was excellent! My only big criticism of the resort is the steep daily parking charge of $30 per day. If you are not an owner of Marriott Vacation Club, you will pay this fee. It’s a little ridiculous since there are no free parking options yet there is plenty of space for parking around the resort that you can’t use. Another tip: if you want to avoid the timeshare pitch, avoid picking up the “welcome packet” from the concierge upon arrival. This is where they rope you into a 90-minute sales pitch. If you don’t pick up the “welcome packet”, you may receive a couple of phone calls to attend but you won't be pressured too hard. Overall, we enjoyed our stay at the Marriott Ko Olina and highly recommend it for a family vacation with children. We will definitely come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Resort- Better Than the Ihilani !!”
Reviews.Author: JIMCHI
Reviews.Content: We just spent a week at the Ko Olina Beach Club and what a wonderful stay it was. We have stayed at the nearby Ihilani at least once a year for over 15 years but decided against it this year because of the massive and noisy construction going on at the Disney resort being put up next to it. We made a good decision and I suspect we will always choose the Ko Olina Beach Club instead in the future. We had a two bedroom ocean view villa in the Hale Nai'a Tower. We were on the 8th floor in villa 30839. The view couldn't have been better- the lagoon and ocean views were close up. Aside from about 6 end units in the Hale Kona Tower, I believe that the views from the ocean view rooms in the Hale Nai'a Tower are the best. A new addition to this tower has been completed but has not been opened yet- those rooms will not have as direct a view of the beach and ocean. Our villa consisted of a fully equipped kitchen about the size you would expect in a nice condo. There was a combination dining area living room which was about 25' x 16'. The balcony was 16' wide by about 5' deep and had a chaise lounge and a dining table and 2 chairs and an unobstructed view. The main bedroom was quite large with a king bed and a desk. There was plenty of room for a rollaway bed which we needed. Attached to this bedroom was a bathroom with a large tub and a vanity. Another door lead to another bathroom with a large stall shower, vanity, and toilet. The second bedroom, located across the living room, was a bit smaller with a king bed and a bathroom with combination tub/shower. This bedroom also had a small balcony with a table and 2 chairs. As others have remarked, the public areas are beautiful. The lobby, located in the Hale Kona tower, is open air and has many of the attributes of the gorgeous Hyatt Kauai. Downstairs and open air are The Marketplace, which is a large gift shop which also has some of the characteristics of a mini-market (e.g. a refrigerated and frozen foods section, sandwiches, salads, snacks, wine, etc.) and a Chucks Steakhouse (seemed expensive). The pool areas are terrific. The pool (actually a combination of connecting pools) in front of the Hale Nai'a Tower has a tunnel waterslide and a cave. One of the pools by the Hale Kona Tower has a sand beach, suitable for very small children. Another of the pools by the Hale Kona Tower is a "quiet" pool. Despite being there over Easter vacation, we never had much of a problem finding chaise lounges either by the pools or at the beach. There is no charge for chaise lounges or towels, but you must wear a wristband while using the facilities. The lagoon and beach couldn't be prettier or more relaxing. It's very large and most people tend to crowd together in the center of it. But the sides of the beach were almost always empty so I just pulled my chaise lounge over there. There are also three other lagoons with beaches, two of which seldom have anyone on them but have no chaise lounges. Although this is a Marriott timeshare, we were there just as regular hotel type guests. They did keep pushing us to go and pick up their "Aloha package". I was suspecting it was going to be a sales pitch for a timeshare, but it wasn't. It just was a beach bag, maps, and a 10% discount card for the Marketplace and restaurants. The only sales type pitch we got was on our last day when someone left a message offering us a $399 rate for a standard room for 6 nights anytime during the next 18 months. I suspect that would entail a timeshare pitch if we had taken it. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We travel a lot and stay only in 4 and 5 star hotels and resorts. This was definitely one of the better resorts we have stayed at and will definitely return again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: shelleymetcalf
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a wonderful stay at the Marriott Ko Olina Beach Club. We were in room 20230/20228 in the Mohana tower. It is a 2 bedroom lock off on the ground floor. We were right by the bbq's, pool and a beautiful grassy area that the kids could play to their heart's content. We enjoyed the beach every day and had great success snorkelling. The pool with the water slide and water falls was very warm and a lot of fun. We also enjoyed the $2 snow cones almost every day! We took advantage of the free trolley that rides around Ko Olina. Take it down to the JW Marriott and see the hammerhead sharks and sting rays in their lagoons. We went on the Ko Olina cat sunset cruise and had the most remarkable time. We saw a mother whale and her calf. The mother gave us quite a show by breaching 7 times! We went to the Paradise Cove Luau and had a fun time. Lots of activities to do if you don't mind waiting in lines. We also golfed twice at the Ko Olina golf course - very pretty. We stopped in at Costco on our way there to buy food for the week and that definitely saved us a ton of money. It was a wonderful trip and I'm missing it greatly.

Reviews.Title: “A great family place”
Reviews.Author: grizman-btm
Reviews.Content: Loved it here. The resort is great with tons of things to do with the kids. Great pools, great beach lagoons to swim in the salt water, in fact there are 4 lagoons and not much wave action. Saw lots of tropical fish and several sea turtles. The nicest part of this property is that its pretty secluded. No crowds on the beach, as the only other property in the area is another Marriott about a half mile away. Lots of activities for kids at the pools, with slides, multiple hot pools, water basketball and volleyball. We definitely will be back.

Reviews.Title: “What a place!!”
Reviews.Author: nancyb3281
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rooms, friendly, attentive staff. Stunning beaches and pools. No negatives at all. Far enough from the city but close enough to drive to any place on the island. Would go back in a minute!!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing time away from work.”
Reviews.Author: Parris
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from the Marriott Ko'Olina resort in Oahu and loved every day we spent at the resort. Our room was beautiful with a wonderful view of the ocean. We could sit on the lanai and watch the whales and the sunsets. The room was a two bedroom villa which we only used one but the full kitchen was great and saved lots of dollars. We did eat at the beach side grill two nights and the food and service were good and the sunsets and music were memorable. The frozen Mai ties were really good. The trail in front of the resort was really nice for walking and jogging. I look forward to our return visit in 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Soft-sand beaches, lovely facilities, peaceful Oahu location.”
Reviews.Author: sitesea
Reviews.Content: About 25 minutes from the HNL airport is the Ko Olina Beach Club. As a mellow alternative to Waikiki this can't be beat. The standard guest room has a small kitchenette so it is possible to prepare some meals "at home" if you wish. Our 9th floor oceanfront room provided a lovely view of the masses of palms trees below and spectacular sunsets. The guest rooms are very comfortable and clean but curiously lacked a desk/table for working or dining. The lanai had a table and chairs so meals can be taken outdoors. Bar-b-ques are available for public use and many guests grill their dinner. The Ko Olina area has four swimming lagoons with wide, sandy beaches. A paved trail and grassy lawn connects the lagoons and makes a nice running/walking path for a 3 mile round trip. We enjoyed the beautifully maintained grounds and open air lobby of the hotel. Staff said it was at 90% capacity but we never felt crowded. Due to the fact that this is a timeshare there are many families and lots of activities for their entertainment, but the vibe is neighborly rather than unruly. The beach area is so large it is possible to find a private spot to enjoy sunning, swimming or snorkeling.

Reviews.Title: “Not Returning Anytime Soon”
Reviews.Author: TravvySavvy
Reviews.Content: -We were told our timeshare promotional room would be a 1 bedroom with separate living area and full kitchen. Promotional material mailed describes 1, 2, 3, bd villa. Great because we planned to make our meals. We arrive to a studio room with a kitchenette and ADA bathroom. The shower is so narrow I fight with the curtain regularly, as a slender, able bodied person I can't imagine how someone with a disability could use it. Our consolation prize is that we have a great view. -Want to speak to manager. Get the hotel manager. Nice lady says we have to talk to the timeshare manager, who has never contacted us despite our repeated requests. -Athlete teenager wakes up with back pains from sleeping on the pullout sofa. Request cot, they say only have egg crate foam. Okay, but why did it take a second request to receive a torn foam mat? Teenager sleeps on couch with legs hanging over edge. -In evening, request more decaf ground coffee and sugar, they say yes. Coffee never arrives, and a call in the morning reveals that they don't provide the service. So why again, do we have to call twice to find this out? At least they did bring it that time as a "courtesy". -Self Parking was full one night, therefore I had to valet to park car by hotel, where they already charge $30/night. Good gracious! BTW That's more than the cost of our standard size rental car per day. -Our 90 minute required presentation is today, needless to say we won't be buying anything here, I am not sure if we will even be returning. It's not so much the amenities of the hotel, which are nice, it is more that we were baited with unfulfilled promises. I feel bamboozled, like I am at a used car dealership. If you are fine with an efficiency room, we got our deal for $399 for six days, so don't let 'em get you with a higher price. They told us on our first day that we could have upgraded to a one bedroom for $250 more, but nothing was available, they said they had "tried" to call us before, but they didn't say anything when when we called them back, and the first time they called they said we had a one bedroom!. Our rental car wasn't included. We also got two $25 gift certificates to use at certain restaurants at the hotel and some discount card.

Reviews.Title: “such a wonderful place!”
Reviews.Author: TorranceRyan
Reviews.Content: My family has been to Marriott's Ko Olina 3 times and it has been wonderful every time. The rooms are large, well kept and the decor really fits with the ocean views and beaches outside your window. The facilities are beautifully manicured. The beach is clean and the lagoon keeps the water calm, which is great for our your children. My only criticism is the parking fee. $30 per day - ouch!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: Nsatter88
Reviews.Content: it was my first time there and it was so nice! private beaches and lots of events, they had a fun mai tai party there, my dad ended up buying a timeshare there so we go there regularly.

Reviews.Title: “Just Awesome.....”
Reviews.Author: Family-of-7-Sydney
Reviews.Content: We are a family of seven, five children rangeing in ages from 12yrs to 24yrs, this place has everything for all age group, great food, great pools, man made beaches....not sure if you could ask for anything more.....we have travelled all over the world and this is definately my favorite holiday destination.....our children also love it there and our family holidays are something we look forward to. Very happy Australians

Reviews.Title: “A memorable stay”
Reviews.Author: hiral07
Reviews.Content: I went with my wife on vacation for a week and we stayed here. The hotel itself is gorgeous. It has a private beach and since its located in the west part of Oahu, the sunset is spectacular. The resort does plan activities throughout the week but my wife and I decided to explore the island on our own and did not take part in any on-site activities. Rooms were fairly spacious, we had an efficiency bedroom. They have a gym with I believe is open 24 hours (which I found to be extremely convenient). The service and housekeeping was excellent. I very much loved the free wifi and the free parking (free for members only). The only downside is the location of the resort. Most of the activities we did throughout the week involved being in the North Shore, East Side and Honolulu area so every day involved driving to our destinations. I would highly recommend renting a car. The traffic in Honolulu is not so bad if you avoid the peak hours. If you want to visit places in Oahu, my advice would be to start early in the morning and bring everything that you need with you, haul it in the trunk of your car and go out and explore!!! Its a beautiful island and I would definitely go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to bring entire family”
Reviews.Author: VarHouston
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd visit to Ko Olina. This resort is very family friendly with planned activites everyday, 3 different pools, onsite restaurants, nightly entertainment, lagoons for swimming and snorkeling, beautiful walk to the JW Marriott (additional restaurants and activities). The villas are large with a full kitchen, perfect for families with children who find in difficult to go out to eat every night. Market Place has everything you may need during your stay from food to gifts to take back with you. I suggest renting a car to get around the island. Safeway and Target are only about 10 minutes away to stock up on groceries, etc. The resort feels like it is on the other side on the island, but it is only about 30 mintues from the airport. (a relief if you have been on the plane for a long time)

Reviews.Title: “This place is so quite and nice.”
Reviews.Author: 262santana
Reviews.Content: The pool was blue. The drinks were cold. The fishing pod was full of fish. We rode a harley around the island. Sunset Dinner Cruise was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Timeshare Sales People are Annoying!”
Reviews.Author: tallblonde42
Reviews.Content: I will have to agree with most of the reviewers that Marriott's Ko Olina Beach Club is a great place to hang while in Oahu. However, be weary of the timeshare sales people. It gets VERY annoying after several attempts! Advertised penthouse "lockouts" are not on the top floor and very small.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott at its very best. 10 out of 10 - we loved our stay.”
Reviews.Author: Sharon T
Reviews.Content: Just back from 2 weeks in Hawaii, a week of which was spent at the Ko Olina Beach Club. This is an amazing resort with brilliant staff and facilities. WE have previously stopped at the JW Marriott next door and enjoyed our stay, indeed we thought the service at the Ihilani was unsurpassable. However the Ko Olina Beach Club has proved a worthy contender as ‘our best hotel’. The rooms are of a very high standard with kitchen facilities and a nice balcony, in our case with views across the pool towards the ocean. We ate at the restaurants and found the food to be of an excellent standard at a good price. There are loads of additions that make this hotel great. It has three amazing pools, bbq areas and is all set in landscaped grounds. There is an excellent clean and safe man made beach, with a safe swimming area. It’s worth snorkelling in these lagoons as we have seen many varieties of fish and on one occasion were able to snorkel alongside a green sea turtle. This is a great hotel with staff who really take a pride in their hotel and the service they offer. Well done Marriott – a jewel in your crown. We can not wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Very well kept place”
Reviews.Author: Admiral Ron
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marriott Ko Olina Beach Club Jan 29-Feb 5 2010. Very Beautiful resort and the up keep is spectacular and the grounds very well maintained. I did not travel there with kids but I can see this would be a great place for a family vacation. We decided to take advantage of the Costco nearby and bought food/snacks for the entire week. Unlike other stores their prices are the same as their mainland stores which was a bonus. We took full advantage of the 12 grills on the property and grilled almost every night. We rented a car (which is a must) since there is really nothing close by the resort and drove the entire island. North Shore was great and managed to find a surf competition that was going on that weekend. We at in Haleiwa at Haleiwa Joe's and had a fantastic lunch. Went kayaking off Kailua beach on the Southeast side of the island and snorkled Hanauma bay. Getting back to the resort the had activities all day for everyone and Tuesday night they had a very nice luau and show. If you are a jogger you will love the paved path along the ocean which leads around all the Marriott properties. They have 3 very different pools that will accommodate anyone and a 24 hour gym complete with steam/sauna and showers. I would recommend this to anyone at any age for a nice relaxing vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but be careful when choosing rooms”
Reviews.Author: Altarossco
Reviews.Content: My wife, ten year old daughter, and I went for a week. perfect place for a young family. Definitely a five star resort. We had a two bedroom unit and was very spacious. I think they say it is approx. 1300 sq. ft. and I believe it. This is where the "be careful" part comes in. We were on the seventh floor, mountain view. View was of parking lot and refinery in the distance. It was not terrible but if you are on any floor below 7 or so, you will see cars and more importantly, hear the horn of every car returning to the resort as they lock the car doors with the remote. Ocean view rooms appear to have spectacular views. One note on rental cars. We chose the four door jeep and it was a nightmare trying to put up canvas roof and worrying about stuff being stolen out of it. Go for the Sebring or Mustang convertible! Had the Sebring on Kauai and loved it. They were all out on Oahu. Also, keep in mind these are high rises and you don't just open your door and go right onto the sand. Disney is building an 800 room resort next door so expect lots more people on the now quiet beaches next year.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: HTuanda
Reviews.Content: It has all the amenities for young and old! Beautiful pools, nice beach, plus there is even a sunday worship service with the best views! Awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful high rise property on altered shoreline.”
Reviews.Author: rydelldesign
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Marriott Ko Olina after staying a week in Maui where we had rented a condo in a nice small complex. Going from a condo where the ocean was practically outside our door to the high rise of a Marriott made me realize how much I prefer the small condo. Granted, the Ko Olina is a gorgeous property. We took the nice walkway along the ocean over to the Marriott Ihilana Resort and noted it is equally beautiful. Our two bedroom condo at the Ko Olina was beautifully decorated with luxurious linens and every necessity. We used our Marriott points for our stay so we were asked if we would attend a Vacation Club (time share) meeting. We agreed since it was only an hour and a half commitment. We actually didn't mind and learned quite a bit. In fact we learned that the Ko Olina property was purchased by a Japanese company in the '90's. They built a hotel (which is now the Ihilani) but went bankrupt. Meanwhile they'd altered the coastline by blasting out four "coves" which are now the beaches for the hotels. The more I thought about this the more I wondered how in the world they got away with this! The "beaches" were not natural but I imagine the coast was quite rocky and they needed beaches for the hotels. This just didn't sit right with me. The reason I say this is because If you are looking for a natural setting, this is not your place. I would recommend this hotel to families who are traveling with children. The pools are geared toward children although in the next phase an adult pool is planned.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome family hotel - will return for sure!”
Reviews.Author: DodgerJohn
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a week at this property. Loved it! Let me start by saying we are 40ish with kids who are 5 and 7. We tend to stay at mid-level hotels like Marriotts, Hiltons, etc.... Occasionally bump up to Four Seasons, et al. Having stayed at several Marriott timeshares we knew roughly what to expect. We have stayed at Maui timeshare and Kauai timeshare. We liked Ko Olina BETTER than the other two. PROS: Pools and beach were AWESOME. The Tuesday night show (Fia Fia, I think it was called) was great though a tad long. Great service all around the hotel. The car was always waiting for us by the time we got downstairs. My wife had a massage, poolside, and she loved it. We did some of the activities at the kids club and the staff was exceptional. Wireless internet worked great and was free. No pressure to take the timeshare tour; which we opted to skip. The room was great. We had the 3 bedroom and it fit our family of four and my mom who was with us. The full kitchen was nice to have though not used much. The main gym was nice but equipment could be a tad better; no pedal clips on the bikes!? Did I mention the pool and the beaches!? Seriously they are awesome for a family! Chuck's steak house is nice. Kohle's (the main restaurant) was pretty good. All in all, we were very pleased with the hotel. Oh ya, Marriott arranged for perfect weather all week which was very nice! :) CONS: My main issue is the lack of food options at, or near, the hotel. Also no shopping. Lastly, the waterslide (a long tunnel) was a bit too scary for my kids. Oh ya, if you are young and single this probably is not the best hotel for you. It's a family place first and foremost. FOOD: We had a very nice meal at Chuck's but it's pricey if you go there every night. We had a few meals at Kohel's (one each of breakfast, lunch and dinner). Each meal had a decent variety and was nicely prepared. However, I wouldn't call it "excellent." Thumbs up would be all I can say. Beyond those two there isn't much around the hotel. There is a Roy's in the Ko Olina complex and then a few places down the road 2 miles in Kapolei. We had breakfast at Zippy's 3 mornings which was good but not great. We also had breakfast at KOA Pancakes which was also good but not great. Both Zippy's and KOA had nice banana pancakes. Really not much I can say bad about the place though. Oh ya, and new shops and restaurants are opening in the coming months right there in the Ko Olina complex. In conclusion I give this place an enthusiastic THUMBS UP! Really, for a family this place is TOP NOTCH!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Family Resort for those who want to feel away from it all on Oahu!”
Reviews.Author: Caribvacationer
Reviews.Content: We spent 10 nights at Marriott's Ko Olina Beach Club from December 31, 2009 through January 10, 2010. This was our fourth trip to Hawaii, but our first trip to Ko Olina. As reference, we are a family of four (40-something professional adults and children ages 20 and 7), we live in Florida and we vacation 3-4 times per year, often in the Carribean, sometimes on cruises and occasionally in the great cities of both the East and West coasts USA. We are Marriott Rewards members and Vacation Club owners (Aruba Surf Club), but we also vacation at Four Seasons and Ritz Carltons. Our preferred cruise lines are Holland America and Disney. On this trip, the children and I arrived early and spent the first three nights in a one bedroom unit in the Hale Kona tower. The room included a nicely appointed kitchen with a stackable washer/dryer, a living/dining area, a balcony with a small table and two chairs plus a lounge chair, a "study" area with desk and a master bedroom with king bed and bathroom (soaking tub, two sinks and separte shower.) We were greeted by and friendly and effiecient valet staff who took care of us the entire stay. We found the open air lobby to be inviting and check-in was quick and painless. When my husband and daughter's friend arrived, we simply opened a door to convert our one bedroom unit to a two bedroom unit. The second bedroom had a pull-out sofa and queen bed and a second full bath. We traded a week at our Aruba Resort for this Resort so we were treated as "owners" during this portion of our trip. Translation...the first three days we received daily housekeeping "tidy" service...the second 7 days we received one "tidy" service. Also, the first three days, we paid $30+ daily for parking...the second 7 days we paid $5 daily for parking. We shopped in Kapolei (both Safeway and Target) and ate most breakfasts in the room. There are many gas grills throughout the grounds so we enjoyed bbq chicken one night, as well. The pools are lovely, but cold. Chairs were mostly plentiful, but also mostly in the shade. Sunny chairs were tough to come by most days (and, as always) there were plenty of people who placed towels on chairs, but never used them (what is wrong with people?) Towels are found in two towel huts and wrist bracelets are handed out at the huts. We enjoyed the $2 shave ice by the pool most afternoons. The Lagoons are beautiful, as well. And we never had a problem finding a chair on the beach. There is a strict "no alcohol" policy on the beach, so don't picture yourself sipping a mai tai with your feet in the sand! The mai tai's, btw, are delicious by the pool. My daughter is a college tennis player and she found the fitness facility to be top notch. She also enjoyed the roof top tennis at the JW Marriott (but not the long complimentary ride to the courts.) There is a 1.5 mile oceanfront path for walking or running, as well a lap lane in one of the pools. We enjoyed both onsite restaurants, but the casual beachside one offers slow service during the lunch period. Charley's Steakhouse has good food and excellent service with lovely sunset views and early bird specials. You can order "take out" from either location for dinner in your room. The Marketplace offersonsite basic groceries, tshirts, lotions, snacks and starbucks coffee throughout the day. The kids did the Tuesday night Fia Fia luau and said the food was adequate and the entertainment was "cheesy." We also enjoyed dinner at Roy's...no view (faces the driving range)...but excellent food and service. My husband golfed the onsite course. He said it was great, but pricey. He also did a google search for a less expensive course and took our 7 year old up the Leeward coast for an afternoon on another nice course. The drive to North Shore is about 45 minutes, as is the drive to Waikiki (traffic can be heavy.) We spent more time in the car this trip, but we covered a lot of area. We did a "Lost" tour with Ed Koss, we hiked diamond head, we ate Leonard's malasadas and took surf lessons at Barber's Pointe with "Girls who surf." And with two 20 year old young women along, we hit the Shopping at Ala Moana and Royal Hawaiian. And did a snorkel tour out of the Ko Olina marina...lots of dolphins, whales and turtles. Very cool. Overall impression is that Ko Olina provides a great space for a family vacation on Oahu. The lobby and grounds are beautiful, the staff is friendly and the amenities are nice. It is a bit remote for many of the traditional Oahu acitivities (like surfing)...but the flip side is the serenity and peace. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Still love the Ko Olina”
Reviews.Author: josh1231
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 6 nights in a 1-bedroom in mid-January. As always, we had a wonderful experience. We were in the Moana tower. Check-in: We arrived at 10:00 p.m. and checkin was a breeze. There was no line, handed the front desk person my credit card and ID, 2 minutes later I had my room key, and 5 minutes later I was in my room, with my luggage following shortly. Everything was perfectly smooth. Valet & Bell service: Every member of the valet service was so helpful and nice. I can't really say enough about them. They were very quick to get my car, very quick getting my luggage to my room, and very friendly and helpful with directions. Valet is only open from 7:00 a.m. to 11:00 p.m. at the Moana tower, so if you want your car outside of these hours you have to use the courtesy phone out front and call, then they send someone over. Normally it takes about 2 or 3 minutes to get your car, outside of these hours it's probably 5-8 minutes (though you might be able to call the front desk and have the bring it down, didn't think about this until I left). Grounds: The grounds are simply wonderful. The pools are really nice. The Lagoons are great for catching some sun and swimming in. There are grills all over if you feel the need to do some cooking out. There's a general store which has miscellaneous overpriced items like milk, eggs, sun block, etc. There are a couple resturaunts, which I did not eat at, though I did eat at Chucks Steak house on-site. It was actually quite wonderful and only $80 with tip, which for an on-site hotel serving prime beef, I thought was wonderful. The grounds are wonderfully decorated with many flowers and lots of color. Rooms: The rooms are fantastic. They have granite counter tops, full size refrigerator, stove, microwave and dishwasher. the unit has on room which has the toilet, sink, and shower, and a separate room with the tub, which my wife absolutely loved, though it was not a jetted tub. The beds as you will find with most newer Marriott timeshare properties are extremely comfortable. There's also a separate little area that can be used for storing your luggage, or sitting and reading a book. the living room is very roomy and very comfortable with a sofa and 2 recliners. The balcony is sufficiently large for eating a nice meal on. Location: You'll hear a lot about Honolulu traffic from the locals. The one thing they forget is they are forced to drive at certain times to get somewhere, as vacationers we are not. If you want to go to Waikiki, don't leave between 7-9, unless you don't mind some traffic. Its quite heavy around Waikiki and starts to get backed up a long ways before then. During normal times it's about a half hour drive to Waikiki. It's about 40 minutes up to the north shore as measured by Matsumoto's :), about the same as Waikiki is from the north shore I believe. Traffic is much nicer around Kapolei, than it is around Waikiki. As I stated my wife and I love Ko Olina. It is not for everyone. If you want action, nightlife, live music, etc., don't stay here, you won't be happy having to drive constantly to Waikiki. If you like relaxing, spending some romantic time with your partner, feeling more secluded, this is your place. When I was in my 20's I would have only stayed at Waikiki. No in my mid 30's I much prefer Ko Olina.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing in every way!”
Reviews.Author: sunnyCA28
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 1 week in a 1 bedroom unit. It had a full kitchen, bedroom with king bed, living area, dining area, and balcony. Our unit was on the 4th floor facing the lagoon pool. It had a peek view of the ocean and was really nice. This property is gorgeous! It is extremely well-maintained, from the pools to the spas to the landscaping and common areas. The 3 pools were wonderful...it never, ever felt really crowded and we were always able to find a chair. The lagoon/beach is wonderful...calm and beautiful. We enjoyed many gorgeous sunsets there! Roys at the Ko Olina golf club is a must do....amazing food and surprisingly reasonable prices, especially if you do the 3 course dinner which included appetizer, entree, and dessert. Make reservations, though, because they fill up fast. Definitely rent a car if you come...there is lots to explore on the island! We did Pearl Harbor and the Iolani palace, hiked Diamond Head, and enjoyed the shrimp truck on the North Shore. The only complaint we had was with the Ko Olina Cat (the boat tours that run from the marina next door). Twice they pulled our whale watching trip in early...instead of picking us up at 1:30 they called our room at 12:00 and said we needed to be picked up at 12:30. Well...it's vacation and we were not sitting around our room waiting for a call. We rushed back from what we were doing and got there at 1:30 to find out we missed the whale watching trip for the day. They promised to comp the trip the next day and said there was no way they would change the time again. Guess what!?? They did it again and we missed it again. Frustrating... We ended up getting a comp sunset cruise, which was nice, except that they spent the whole cruise talking about how awesome the whales were that afternoon--on the cruise we were NOT on. We were really disappointed :-( But, otherwise, the hotel and staff are amazing...we would absolutely go back in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Peter-YVR
Reviews.Content: Rented a 2 Bedroom Ocean side timeshare in the newest building called "Naia". The stay was great. The lagoons and pools were a highlight. There wasn't as much fish as we were hoping to see in the lagoons, but they provided a very relaxing and safe place to hang out. The pool was great for the kids - interesting design with a good waterslide for the kids. Must go to the JW Marriott to see their pond - stingrays and hammerhead sharks. I'd say that the lagoon in front of the JW was the best. As a timeshare renter, the only thing I found odd was that housekeeping only comes in once a week (mid-week) to do a cleanup. The kitchen and dining areas were fantastic, saves a ton of money eating meals in house. Safeway, Costco, restaurants and other shops within a 10 minute drive. A car is a must have. Overall a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “My 2nd stay at Marriott Ko Olina Beach this year”
Reviews.Author: holidaysholidays
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from Dec 13 to 18 in a Mountain view 1 bedroom suite in Hale Kona Tower on the 5th storey. I was surprised to that this Mountain view room overlooked the marina with a glimpse of the ocean. The suite was very spacious, with a full sized kitchen, laundry facilities, king sized bed, bathtub, shower, dining table, sofa couch etc. The only unpleasant encounter in the room was when we sighted a little centipede crawling in the bathtub that we had to get rid off ! The wireless internet in the room was slow most times except one of the nights where we were up at close to midnight. I had to print a document, as such had to use the business centre - even though the usage charge shown on the computer screen was $0.30 per minute, there was a minimum charge of $1 to use the computers. We were able to book this suite from Marriott.com for less than $200 per day through a Marriott family and friend rate but we needed to provide check in a letter from a friend working in Marriott. Another observation was that the cost of self parking has increased since July 09. This is our 2nd stay in this resort. When I looked at our July invoice, we paid $26.18 per day for self park and in December we paid $30.37 per day (including tax). As expected, the pools in the resort and Ko Olina Lagoons were great. We went snorkelling in Lagoon 1 and 2 but the waters in Lagoon 1 were far too murky. In Lagoon 2, we could sight a few fishes around the rocks but it was nothing spectacular. The pools were not very crowded this week, which is probably the low season. At the hut close to the gym where they provided towels and wristbands for the guests and owners, there was a board that showed numbers on wrist bands - these persons "won" root beer floats and shave ice. Too bad we noticed only on the last day as we had thrown out all the daily wrist bands. For kids activities, there were several throughout the week but our child only attended one - craft making session (Christmas decorations) which cost $1 per craft. Cost $3 for 3 crafts (1/2hr session). Our child was the only one in that session! Luau Having attended the Fia Fia Luau in July this year which we enjoyed tremendously, we reluctantly decided to give the Fia Fia a miss and try the Paradise Cove Luau this time. Never realized that the Paradise Cove luau was located just beside the JW Marriott Illilani hotel. The Fia fia luau was held on a Wednesday this week instead of the Tuesday (which is its regular day). I booked the Paradise Cove Luau over the phone through a 3rd party travel vendor, and got a way better rate (about $20 less per adult) than booking directly with Paradise Cove. Decided to get the cheapest package (side seating) as I was betting on the Luau not being very crowded. Overall, I think both Luaus are quite different. The Fia Fia was on a smaller scale (less people), but it gave a very warm feeling. Kids could sit up front to watch in the Fia Fia luau. There were more activities to see and engage in the Paradise Cove Luau such as throwing spears/stones at targets, getting temporary tattoes, making coconut leaf handbands and wristbands with orchids, people marching withe roast pig (kalau). When I think back the food was better at the Fia Fia one, with a separate menu for kids (had kid's favourites such as Macaroni & Cheese). The Paradise Cove Luau's food was average. Tipping is included in the price for the Fia Fia one, but not the Paradise Cove one, as there were little baskets for you drop your tips as you engage in various activities.

Reviews.Title: “Don't ever stay there! They false advertise. Worst vacation ever.”
Reviews.Author: mallya
Reviews.Content: This "vacation club" is all about greedy revenue generation, lies and bad customer service. Many of their ocean view rooms don't have it. Also, be carful when you reserve a "mountain view" room category because many of those rooms have parking lot views or ugly industrial plant view. The serivce is terrible. The managers have no common sense, they are not empowered to do anything and frankly, they don't care. The facility is very limited in the services offered. They advertise free wireless internet service in the rooms but do NOT provide that. You'll need to drive 8 min to the nearest grocery store. Everything at the resort is out rageously over priced. Don't ruin your precious vacation in this resort. It's a waste of money and a lot of frustration.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous sunsets, turtle beaches, great pools”
Reviews.Author: srjefe
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed at the Marriott time share. Had a great time. Nice place. Although we went sans kiddies, there were lots of families there. It was a VERY family-friendly place without honking off us adults looking for some alone time. Great pools and a lagoon beach. We snorkeled a little right there in their little lagoon beach and saw fish. Just a few lagoons down we saw sea turtles that swam right up to us. You're not allowed to touch them in HI but they liked our company. And we didn't even feed them! They have a luau there every week which is OK. Not as action-packed as some of the others on the island but the food was great and we didn't have to drive anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “5 start location! -- Hotel itself is good, bit of a mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: videohb
Reviews.Content: OUR STAY My wife and I stayed 1 week at the Marriott Ko Olina after trading a timeshare through Interval International. The resort is about 30 minutes (depending on traffic) outside of Honolulu. A rental car was needed as we did a few things around the island, however it was nice to spend time in this isolated resort -- a relaxing place for a vacation. Check-in was smooth. LOCATION This is the most stunning aspect of the Ko Olina Beach club, so I thought I'd start with it. The location is beautiful. Specifically, the ability to walk to the ocean water within minutes of leaving your room is what makes a vacation here the most enjoyable. The four man-made lagoons have been around long enough where you can forget the fact that they are artificial -- the fish, birds, and other wildlife have grown accustomed to the lagoons, creating a pretty naturalistic experience. While snorkeling, you notice the rocks within the lagoons are covered in various types of plant life, coral, and sea urchins. The first couple times I went snorkeling, I was able to see quite an array of fish and other marine life. The whole cast of "Finding Nemo" was there (except for the actual clownfish, which I didn't see). Depending on how far out you are comfortable snorkeling, the colors and shapes of the various fish get more and more exotic. Each lagoon has an artifical rock barrier at the edge that disrupts the breaking waves coming in from the ocean, so unless the waves are especially huge, the water is pretty calm within the lagoon. During my last few days of swimming, some giant waves began coming in, causing some pretty big ups & downs in the lagoon water. Nothing really dangerous for an experienced swimmer, but the wave activity did kick up quite a bit of sand underwater, making the water rather murky -- thus not much was visible during snorkeling. However, it was during one of these "wavy" days when I was swimming in lagoon #1 that I came within a few feet of a giant sea turtle. A friendly and surprisingly tame creature, he didn't seem bothered by the humans. It was an amazing experience! The meandering pathway that connects the 4 Lagoons is a pleasant walk. My wife and I strolled along it everyday, between the Ko Olina and the JW Marriott. At Lagoon #1 (near the JW Marriott) and Lagoon #3 (near the Ko Olina Beach Club), guests in either of the Marriott properties can rent "cabanas," which are covered and padded beach chair-beds that make it quite inviting to spend a lazy day on the beach, overlooking the water and feeling the ocean breeze. Location downsides: Currently there are not many downsides. However, there appears to be a large resort under construction (I've heard Disney?) directly in front of Lagoon #1. Sometimes the sounds from this construction site are disturbing. Also, once that resort is completed, I assume there will be larger crowds that could make the place less enjoyable. Another downside is the close proximity of what appears to be some factories/refineries -- very close to the Ko Olina area. (see my comment later on about "Bad Experiences") HOTEL ROOM We found our hotel room to be clean and comfortable. The bed was luxurious. However, we were given a "Mountain View" room, which basically means you have a view of an empty field in the distance, the refinery, a bit of the marina, and in our case, a good portion of the parking lot (see photo). Since we spent most of our time outside of the room, this wasn't too big of a deal. But it would have been nice to be able to enjoy the spectacular ocean view from our room's balcony. There was no way for us to transfer to an ocean view, because apparently when we made the timeshare trade through Interval International, the type of room that Marriott traded us into was "Mountain View," and the front desk told us that whatever you trade into (even though we had no choice in it), is what must be assigned. We started out in the Hale Moana Tower, the for reasons explained below, we actually moved to another Mountain View room in the Hale Kona Tower. The first room had a larger (kingsize) bed, but an outdated television (see photo). The second room had a smaller bed (queen size) but a new flatscreen television. Unfortunately, the cable signal was not in HD, so the flatscreen picture was not optimal. Internet: One great thing about the room was the free Wi-Fi internet. I really get irked by high-end hotels that charge enormous prices for the use of internet. The connection in our room was sometimes weak, but generally strong enough for web use on my iPod Touch. However, heavy browsing or downloading using our laptop was much slower, about dial-up speed. Still, great for checking email and simple web stuff. HOTEL SERVICE The staff were generally very nice and polite people. I had good experiences with front desk staff, the bellhop, and was most impressed with the staff members who ran the cabana rentals on the beach. One of the guys remembered my name after meeting me once, and greeted me a couple days later as I was walking on the outdoor pathway. It was convenient to be able to charge cabana rentals and restaurant food at either the Ko Olina or the JW Marriott locations to our room account. Food: The poolside restaurant overlooking Lagoon #3 is overpriced and not very good. The restaurant within the JW Marriott is "vacation priced" but with good food. Given the close proximity of Costco in the town nearby, we actually prepared our own meals a few times by getting some various fish and veggies, and then grilling them on the gas grill BBQs that the hotel provides in the common areas outside. This was a good alternative to only eating at the hotel restaurants, or the Chili's in the town. Parking: Parking was very convenient (although sometimes the lots would get quite full and it was hard to find a spot). Fortunately, parking was included in our timeshare exchange, so we did not have to pay any extra fees. Late Check out: On the day of our checkout, our flight departing Hawaii was not until night time. The hotel allowed us an extra hour of "late" checkout (11 am instread of 10 am). This wasn't much, however...they also gave me a keycard that provided all-day access to the lockers and showers next to the pool; and they informed us of an "owners lounge" where we could rest up and kill time before leaving the resort and heading to the airport. Since I spent most of our last day on the beach and swimming, this was quite convenient. BAD EXPERIENCES Truth be told, our "Bad" experiences were limited and did not ruin our vacation. But they were significant enough to be mentioned. One evening, about halfway through our stay, a horrible sulfur (like a stink bomb) smell permeated throughout several floors of our tower. It was quite pungent and made it difficult to stay in our room for several hours. On top of that, my wife was 6 months pregnant at the time and we didn't want to risk her being exposed to whatever substance was in the air. As she stayed in our friend's room, I complained to the front desk and requested a move to a different tower. The smell apparently was bad enough that the Fire Department was called. I ran into a couple Firemen in the hall who were investigating the cause. The hotel was accomodating enough to move us to a similar room in another tower, but they still refused to give us an ocean view. I guess this wasn't mandatory for them to do, I just thought it would have been a nice gesture to "make up" for the inconvenience of having to re-pack all our stuff and change locations. No such luck. I don't know what the source of the smell was. But it may have had something to do with the close proximity of the factories/refineries. On the day we checked out, a similar bad smell was in the air at a different part of the resort (closer to the golf course)...and again, the Fire Department was there to investigate. SUMMARY Overall, we had a wonderful vacation at the Marriott Ko Olina. We spent most of the time outside. There were occasional rainy times during the days, but they were short-lived. I would recommend going during non-peak times. We were there the week after thanksgiving, it was very idyllic and not crowded at all. However, I imagine its a different scene during summer vacations and holidays. As the area develops and more resorts are built, I'm not sure the same experience will be maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, leaves a bit to be desired”
Reviews.Author: cornerdog
Reviews.Content: Very nice place, WAY better than Waikiki beach... too crowed over there for my taste. The wireless internet sucks and there are really only two places to eat. Those are the two drawbacks... other than that, the location and the amenities are excellent. The pools are fabulous. Very pleasing to the eye.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: missytex
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went in September of this year for our anniversary. We felt like we had the place to ourselves. It was so quiet with school year having started. This was the most beautiful resort. I can't remember one thing that wasn't in place or manicured. The only complaint I would have is that we weren't greeted near as well as we were when we stayed at the Marriott Maui Ocean club a few days later. We were greeted by several people and given a beautiful lei. Our son was working for the Marriott Corp and we had a terrific rate. We rented a convertible for about $14a day more, which was more than worth it to us. Gas was about $3.5 a gallon which I expected to be over $4 a gallon. Food prices and restaurants had very reasonable prices. Shopping was reasonable too. I couldn't figure out if it was the economy or if we just live in a high cost of living area of the country. We live near Dallas, Tx. I hunted down flyer mile offers from credit cards and with our son's discount and some hotel points my husband had from business travel, we were able to have an awesome trip for an amazing price. Can't wait to do it all again. Planning and finding the deals are half the fun to me. (FYI)My camera had the wrong date on the pictures.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Resort”
Reviews.Author: Aussietraveller0907
Reviews.Content: Had been to Oahu ten years ago - stayed at Turtle Bay (in private condos overlooking the golf course). This was so much better! From the moment we got there, it was great. Apart from the first room we were given ( overlooking the grass and footpaths is not what I would call an ocean view!). We went and saw the front desk and they moved us up four floors. The staff were very friendly across the whole resort. We ate at the restaurant on the beachfront - Kolohe's - on four nights - lovely every time! The staff at the front counter were so friendly, they could certainly give other restaurant staff a lesson in customer service! The room was very well appointed. Everything you could imagine to cook with. Beautiful decor, comfortable beds (so important!!). There were quite a few families with young children, but we had no problem with noise. I'm sure it would be different in vacation periods. Attended the Fia Fia show on Tuesday night and it was a fun night! Even though it rained towards the end of the show (staff were quick to bring towels for everyone!). We shopped at Target in Kapolei for our food and drink supplies - which saved us quite a bit of money. We drove into Waikiki and to the outlet which wasn't too bad a drive. Traffic was only a problem if you chose to go in peak periods. We also drove to the north shore (and met a guy that actually saved our nephew when he was surfing at Pipeline once!) and shopped at Haleiwa Town for different souvenirs. They have beautiful art galleries for anyone interested. We drove to Pearl Harbour as my husband wanted to go on the USS Missouri, but unfortunately it was in dry dock :( We should have checked first - apparently it will be out of action for a couple more months. It was a bit annoying to have to pay extra for parking (because there weren't any other options to park anywhere else. We used valet parking because it was the same rate as self parking :) Overall, would thoroughly recommend this resort if you want to get away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki and prefer a more relaxing environment. You will need to hire a car, but that's the best part - you get to explore the island at your leisure!

Reviews.Title: “Ko Olina a great vacation resort”
Reviews.Author: EagleDad
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriot Ko Olina Beach Club 10/31 – 11/6. We used our Marriott points to stay at the resort. Like many previous reviews, the Beach Club is absolutely beautiful. The grounds are gorgeous, public areas well kept and the beach lagoon is very nice. We had a two bedroom unit in the newer building. There were 4 adults and 2 kids and we fit very comfortable with 2.5 baths for everyone to use to get ready. The kitchen was nice - having the ability to do breakfast and a few other meals really saved us a lot of money. There are grocery options nearby with a Safeway, Target and Costco. The Target store is new and has and extensive selection of groceries but no fresh produce or bakery. There are also several restaurants in this shopping area. We ate one night at Hapa’s Grill and had great food. Staying out at this resort you will definitely want a car. It only took us about 20 minutes to drive out from the airport. Some days with traffic it was 40 minutes, but a very easy drive. Be prepared to pay $25+ for parking, but cab fare is about $60 each way. We found the staff to be very friendly and accommodating. Working with “my friend” Tina at the concierge desk (those of you who meet her will know what I am talking about) she booked dinner reservations, golf tee times, snorkeling trips, etc. We did attend the time share presentation – they were offering free tickets to the Fia Fia event as well as a snorkeling trip. Definitely worth the 90 minutes to have over $300 in gifts. The Fia Fia luau on Tuesday evening was great. Very entertaining, the food was good and when the rain started coming down the staff was there with fresh out of the dryer towels to cover up with. I have to admit our favorite time there was hanging out on the beach and swimming in the lagoons. The water is warm, the sand clean and it was nice being right there when it was time to head back to the lagoon. The pools were great too. After spending a couple of afternoons in Waikiki and seeing the crowds on the beach, we appreciated even more the peace and calm of the Ko Olina Beach Club. We will back some day.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but beware of the 'ocean view' rooms”
Reviews.Author: ChrisSakhalin
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a stay at the above hotel with our family of 2 adults and two children aged 9 and 11. The reviews already listed for this hotel are accurate so I will just add some aspects that are missing from the reviews that could be useful. First and foremost this hotel/resort is a timeshare place. This is not a secret but as we were not there as time share owners I can add some comments for what they call 'renters' once you get there. As the place is mainly timeshares the occupancy will always be high. Essentially the resort is nearly always fully booked. This was not a problem when we were there are there were not many kids around. But, I can imagine if you go during the main school breaks it would be a lot different. The rooms for renters seem to be just in the Kona tower. We paid the extra for the ocean view room and were very disappointed to mainly be looking at the marina with the refinery behind it. We were also above the hotel entrance so had a great view of all the cars coming and going. If you looked in the right way though you could see the sea. My wife went to see the front desk and they were very accommodating and worked hard to find another room. This room overlooked the pools and had a much better view of the ocean. It transpires that the ocean facing rooms are all timeshares so as a renter you would not get these rooms with the far better views. One aspect of the rooms I tried to find some information on was the layout, as we took a one bedroom villa and would have to be using the sofa bed. All the rooms in the resort are adjoining! Something we wish we had known. This is because the design of the rooms is such that there is a one bedroom villa and a studio next to each other. If you take either the studio or the one bedroom villa then the adjoining door is locked. If you take the two bedroom villa the door is simply opened. Fortunately, our neighbors were quiet and we did not experience any problems but if you take the suite and have a family next two you it will be very different. When people are talking in the adjoining room it is quite easy to hear them in your room. If you go to the Aloha desk for your 'discount vouchers' you can probably guess what is coming - yes, they want to sel you a timeshare! The pressure is not too bad and the deals on offer for going to the 90 minute presentation look good value, but we gave it a miss. they did try to call us a few more times to convince us to go but we declined and they seemed OK with that. They did not give up though and on the last night tried to offer a 'bounce back' deal to get us to come back at a reduced rate. Even though we are from the UK and have just about no chance of buying a time share half way across the world they did not give up. I guess its their job. All said and done it was not too high pressure and we had a little bit of fun knocking them back. As per the other reviews the place is very nice, well kept, very clean and a great get away from Waikiki. The car parking fees are a bit of a scam. Just a way of hiking the prices up I feel. The in room internet was poor. The WiFi signal would keep dropping out and when connected if felt like being back in the era of dial up. Maybe it was just my room though as I did not try it elsewhere in the hotel. All in all a good stay and recommended for a stay in Oahu. But, we went also to Maui on our trip and if we went back to Hawaii we would skip Oahu in favor of the far more laid back Maui and the other islands.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Ko Olina, but not for everyone”
Reviews.Author: alexsndiego
Reviews.Content: We exchanged our lock off at Marriott's Canyon Villas in Arizona (where we own) for what was originally a lock off. A couple month before our stay, Interval International called me and asked if we wanted to upgrade to a 1 BR for $70-ish (can't remember). We accepted the offer and we were happy we did. Here is my brief review and tips: Location: Ko Olina is on the west side of island about 25 minutes from the airport. The location is NOT convenient to airport, Honolulu, and Waikiki. A rental car is must. The nearest town for restaurants and groceries is Kapolei which is about 5 minutes away. The west is still somewhat industrial with a power plant to the north of the resort and an industrial harbor to the south. But the area is undergoing a transformation. This may be perfect for some people. We prefer the slower atmosphere of Ko Olina. Pools: 3 pools and various jacuzzi's are just incredible. 1 pool is multi level and has a water slide. 1 pool is the reflecting pool for those who want a somewhat more relaxed experience. 1 pool with flat sand entry, volleyball net, and basketball rim for the kids. Gym: Nice collection of cardio and weight equipment. Steam room and sauna in each gender's locker room. Locker room is available for use if you have a late flight but check out at 10 am and need a place to shower before your flight. On Site Restaurants that we tried: Kohole's - Marriott owned with views of the beach/lagoon. Typical Marriott food. Chucks Steak and Seafood - decent, solid. Prices reasonable for Hawaii. Steaks are solid but dont expect Ruth's Chris. Roy's - Typical Roy's. Good food. Good service. But to me, Roy's is just Roy's. Lagoons: Snorkeled Lagoon 3 which is in front of the property. Nice safe place for kids. Snorkel near the outlets to see the fish. I went surfs were 6 feet high, thus the fish were looking for shelter and found the amount of fish to be good. You can rent snorkel stuff at the activities desk. If you are a Marriott owner you get a discount. Excursions: I recommend Ko Olina Ocean adventures for a great snorkeling experience to 2 sites plus in water experience with wild dolphin. Not be missed! Lunch is pretty basic with sandwiches from the grocery store but the quality of the experience was great. Spoke with other guests who used Ko Olina Cat and said the food was a buffet but the snorkel site was only 1 and they didnt spend enough time in the water. Off Site Restaurants: Kozoku Sushi Kapolei - pretty good japanese and sushi with a conveyor belt style approach to serving. Sushi goes by you and pick up the one you one. You pay per plate with color coded plates with different costs. Also has an all you can sushi on Sunday nights for $28. Hapa Grill - for a local breakfast with the locals. Be open minded and try a local breakfast. Parking: Parking requires payment, valet or self. Self parking is both tight in availability at night and width. Dont get a full size car unless you absolutely need it. Get a mid size for easier parking if you can get by with it. North Shore: No trip to Oahu is complete without a trip to the North Shore and Haleiwa. Stop by the Dole planation on your way. Have a local meal with the various shrimp trucks in Haleiwa. Ask where Giovanni's shrimp truck is. They have the best garlic shrimp scampi. Avoid going to Kua' Aina bugers. Over rated! Cash only. No refills. Dry/Stale Bread. And not the best burgers. I would rather have a burger at Kohole's at the Beach Club than this place.
