I am a serious burger connoisseur and I feel sorry for anyone who thinks Kua' Aina is the best burgers they ever had, because you need to get out more! Souvenir Shopping: Best place is the swap meet at Aloha Stadium on Saturday, Sunday, and Wednesday. Best deals on t-shirts and all the other stuff you have to buy your friends and family. Not the place for you person stuff but if you dont want to spend a lot on other people this is the place to go. Only $1 per person admission which included parking. Bring water with you. Its in the parking lot of the stadium and it can get hot. Room: We were surprised that our upgrade was to a Penthouse ocean view. We totally enjoyed the view from the 16th floor. We didnt even have to ask or beg for it. The 1 BR is awesome with a soaking tub, 2 bathroom vanities, and large step in shower. Kitchen had full amenities, 6 person dining room table, one tv in living room, one tv in bedroom, patio with a cocktail table for 2, and a chaise chair. AC has sensors that turns off when it senses no one in the room to save energy. AC will also turn off if the windows and/or sliding door is open. Side note: Preference for room location is approximately as follows: Ko Olina owners, other Marriott Vacation Club Owners, Renters based on room rate, and other exchanges. If you come from another vacation club and expected to have a room selection like you are a Marriott Owner, you are maybe expecting too much. Getting mad at the front desk wont help you with your room location. I have worked in the industry and getting mad never works. Yes, unfortunately there are some rooms that face the parking structure. But Ko Olina does not sell itself as a place with ALL ocean views. This is the inherent game of time share exchange process. Dont blame the front desk person. We had a great time but the overall feeling of Oahu does not suit use. Traffic to Honolulu is BAD. Very BAD! We prefer the Big Island where things are spread apart and you get a true Hawaiian experience. Ko Olina Beach Club is a great resort with great amenities and nice relaxed location away from the hustle and bustle. But you have to drive anywhere and even the nearby town of Kapolei can we be an experience with traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Our great time in Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: daisybelle_0224
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from our trip to Oahu, Hawaii. It was my husband and I first trip ever to Hawaii, so we wanted to go somewhere with a lot of things to do. Oahu did not disappoint. We had a great time! We stayed at the Marriott Ko Olina Beach club through a timeshare exchange. It was a great place to stay if you don't mind driving about 20 minutes to get to Honolulu. The charm of staying somewhere off of Waikiki beach is that it is not as crowded, and the natural beauty of Hawaii and the ocean is not spoiled. I suggest anyone who visits Oahu must go to Pearl Harbor and see the Arizona memorial. Another place you must go is to the Polynesian Cultural Center, it was a lot of fun and a whole day activity. I can't wait for another trip back :)

Reviews.Title: “Go Elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Teri22
Reviews.Content: This "efficiency" unit was a trade from a one-bedroom ocean-view in Aruba through Interval International. We were not happy about the automatic downgrade as we weren't trading from a Marriott Property. The unit was nice, however the view of the parking lot was not. Because it was a small unit, we were not able to take advantage of cooking in our room, but having the grills outside were nice and we met a lot of nice people there. We would take trips to Costco to pick up steaks, mahi mahi, etc. and eat outside next to the Marketplace since the parking lot view was not too appealing to us. The location of the facility was nice, even though it was out of the way, but we agreed that being in Waikiki is more our style. The lagoons are nice for families and for swimming. If this wasn't a trade, we would have been happier with our room, although when you go to Hawaii, the view is what it's about. We did a timeshare tour and both agreed that Marriott is not for us. We spoke with many people and witnessed several check-ins of those who were not satisfied with the units they were given (and they were owners). We met a couple who had a Penthouse which we visited and even they had problems renting their lockoff unit (which we would have gladly taken if it was available!). You can't even trade within Hawaii for the same view that you have at Ko Olina. We'll give Disney a try (where we own) when they open next door and see the difference and the courtesy that is standard. Don't get me wrong. We have stayed at many Marriott's and they have been first class. The customer service here is lacking, and when you're told they will get back to you and they don't, it leaves a bad taste in your mouth.

Reviews.Title: “Something for Everyone”
Reviews.Author: Taina505
Reviews.Content: Through our timeshare we were able to visit Hawaii. Ko Olina is located in the southwest corner of Oahu. It is not very developed as yet so it was very peaceful. We really noticed the difference when we went to Waikiki after having climbed Diamond Head. In contrast Waikiki was crowded and noisy, but still beautiful. We had a quick lunch and headed back to Ko Olina. The resort is great. We had an efficiency (no stove) with sink, micro/toaster/coffeemaker/sink and small fridge. A sitting area with sofabed, coffee table, end table, a large TV console adjacent to our King-size bed. And a small balcony through the sliding doors with a view of the hillsides. There are laundry rooms on certain floors. You gain access with your room key. It's free just buy your own soap.The resort has 4 man-made lagoons with a walking path that connects them all. There are a few on-site eateries. But go out and explore the other nice restaurants. Kolohe's Beach Bar and Grill faces the lagoon and is great for anything especially breakfast and lunch. We like to find new restaurants for dinner. The service is great no complaints there. We had a leak in our floor and they kept coming up to look until finally one guy figured out that someone had forgotten to turn something off in the a/c system from a prior maintenance visit, which was causing the leak. You will see all kinds of people here, singles, couples, families. Everything is kept beautifully and well maintained at all times. We love Marriott! Hawaii's not bad either. Ya gotta come at least once!

Reviews.Title: “I would go back anytime!”
Reviews.Author: nsbyrer
Reviews.Content: They are very friendly, knowledgeable, and helpful. Tina helped us get what we needed. There is plenty to do. The beaches are beautiful. The pools were clean and nice. Their program for what is available at the resort was informative. The resort is kind of far away from Honolulu, so if you are planning on doing things in town a lot, you might want to rent a car.

Reviews.Title: “It was amazing!”
Reviews.Author: njesst
Reviews.Content: The view that we had and the island was gorgeous, couldn't have asked for more!

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly staff, at times condescending and rude.”
Reviews.Author: wespam2009
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 8 days and from the get go the staff was rude. We arrived at 7pm due to an airplane delay and they tried to put us in a room that was handicapped accessible. We politely declined and were told that there was another room, overlooking the parking lot, but it was not ready. Asked to speak to the manager, who came and did not treat us any better. Were told by both that we needed to have our AAA card faxed b/c we forgot it. We did this first thing the next morning and received a message from the front desk later, saying they would be charging us regular rate if we did not have the AAA card faxed. Called and said we did, they said we didn't. Called AAA first thing the second morning and had them re-fax and call us back to confirm they faxed it. Called the front desk and were told, " Oh we got it yesterday." Went on a time share promotion and the young man was also condescending. He got visibly upset with my husband and made a smart remark to me as well. Got three telephone messages from the "welcome center" saying we should stop by to pick up a $50.00 gift card. We called each time to say we already got it. On the third day, they called and left another message, so we stopped by to tell them that we got it and to please stop leaving the message. Instead of saying thanks for letting us know, the woman at the welcome center said, "well, why don't you just forget the message then?". All in all the rudest staff at any hotel/resort we have ever stayed at. Poor job, Marriott!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great relaxing, family vacation!”
Reviews.Author: hopper0123
Reviews.Content: The Ko'olina Beach Club is a great family vacation spot. There are several pools to choose from and easy access to the beach. Kids can also participate in various activities. Costco and Target are now open in nearby Kapolei as well as many other restaurants. Staff is always friendly. Our family enjoys staying here every year!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but no Island Feel”
Reviews.Author: TrishSF
Reviews.Content: Traded my timeshare week to stay at Ko Olina Beach Club. This resort is about 15 miles from downtown Honolulu, that is a plus if you want peace and quiet. Easy drive from the airport. The resort is in a gated area, grounds are nicely kept. First impressions of this resort is nice, looks like a normal upscale hotel. Being a timeshare the suites are huge and they recently remodeled. Pools fit everyones needs nicely, pools for kids, pools for sunbathers, water slide (that was fun). They have a beach area, but is feels pre-fab. They made about 4 coves for people to swim in, but that are very safe, very little wave action. So basically it is a salt water pool (disappointing). Ko Olina is growing and they are opening up more of their timeshares to buy - so there is a big push for you to see what they have to offer (could do without the sales pitch every 5 ft.) There really is no nightlife at this resort, nearest town is about 5 miles and still no real nightlife. A few resaurants like Outback, Hana Sushi, and local fare.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome trip to Ko Olina”
Reviews.Author: Goonyer
Reviews.Content: Off the beaten path, the Marriott Ko Olina was well worth the 20 minute drive from downtown. The resort is so awesome that you never want to leave. Rooms are clean, food is way better than expected. Had great walks along beach with wife. Enjoyed pools and cove with teenage children

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking”
Reviews.Author: SandyLMC
Reviews.Content: The Ko'Olina resort truly is a great family location. Plenty to do for teens or children of any age. The service is outstanding, you can have it your way. Daily cleaning to do it yourself. The rooms are very large and comfortable, not really rooms, they are homes with all the amenities and them some. This is a great location for complete relaxation or hop in a car and you can get almost anywhere w/in half an hour. The ocean front rooms have amazing views! unbeatable sunsets from every window!

Reviews.Title: “Away from hustle-bustle of Waikiki”
Reviews.Author: aabbzz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at their vacation ownership studio for 3 nights. It was a typical hotel type room w/ a pull-out couch, so 4 can sleep comfortably. The bathroom was roomy enough, but the shower was designed for childrenpeople under 5' tall! It looked like there used to be a tub, but they got rid of it and just tiled it to make it look like a shower. I'm only 5'2", but it was quite uncomfortable to use. One of the pool was very salty. I'm hoping that it was b/c they put sea water in it. Overall, it's a fine resort that's away from hustle-bustle of Waikiki, but close enough to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Resort!!”
Reviews.Author: hdmanny
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 10 day family vacation in Oahu. The first nights were in "busy" Waikiki, but then we moved to the Marriott Ko Olina Beach Resort, in Kapolei. This place is incredible!! We arrrived at the resort and were immediately impressed by the grounds. 3 great pools for the kid's to enjoy. Also, the ocean lagoon was very nice for the kids to swim in. There was a welcome "mini luau" on Monday evening . The facilities were always clean and the staff friendly. I would definitely recommend this resort for any family who wants to stay away from all the "hustle and bustle" of Waikiki.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: LoraTennessee
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Hawaii & the Ko Olina was perfect! Lots to do, the food was terrific, and our kids loved it! Please check out the Ko Olina Cat, also!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Ko Olina”
Reviews.Author: JJnCJ
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Ko Olina Marriott was September 11-18, 2009. We were lucky weather wise. Sunny and 89 degrees every day. I mention that because every morning walking to breakfast at Kolohe’s grill was worth the flight from Maryland. We were in the Kona Hale building and coming around the walkway towards the grill, you see the blue ocean, trees, beach, and clear ski and think about selling your belongings and moving here. The grounds of this resort are simply beautiful… Peaceful... Relaxing. We own in Atlantic City and had an extra week in the bank so 2 friends joined us in their own room. We only have an efficiency unit, so the bed and couch we more than plenty for my wife and I. Our friends (2 ladies) worked out their sleep details. First night there after a long day of travel, we were ok to chill at the grill, listening to John Valentine, an EXCELLENT guitar player and singer, as the sun set in the distance. We got some postcard worthy shots of this. Unfortunately my advice probably will not help too many reading this because we have friends we were visiting out there and we also wanted to see other island sites while they were at work, so our stay at the Ko Olina evolved around breakfast a few mornings, and 1 day on the beach. However I hope the follow info proves useful so someone. Kolohe’s is open for breakfast until 10:30, then again around 11:30 for the afternoon. It closes at 9:45pm. We only had 1 meal besides the 3 breakfasts and that was the on the afternoon of our arrival. We all thought the food was very good. The other restaurant, Chuck’s steak & seafood, we were told is open until 11pm. We never ate there because we were out and about. The resort was very quiet after 9:45. I don’t know about the hot tubs after the sun goes down because we were usually spent by the time we got back and headed to our rooms. We planned to hang out but it never happened. We took the shuttle to Roy’s at the golf club one night to see how things were there, but it was very quiet too. So I suppose you have to bring your own party if you go here. If you plan to see Oahu, while excursions can be obtained at the desk in the lobby, I recommend you rent a vehicle. Some activities should not be tied to a schedule. Like driving the north shore side of the island, hanging out along Waikiki beach at a restaurant or international market, discovering a beach to hang out or watching the surfers. Plus, the Ko Olina is about 30 minutes from the airport, 35 minutes from Waikiki. Oh, and make sure you have a GPS or a very good map if you’ve never been there before and want to see things. It’s not hard getting around, but you can get lost. Gas was $3.30 per gallon of regular the week we were there, so figure that in to your plans. Coolest things we did. Blue Horizon Helicopter excursion. Our pilot was Toby and he was great. Fascinating seeing the island from the air at a slow speed. You fly over Waikiki, Diamond Head, the Polynesian Center, the Dole Plantation, Pearl Harbor, among other points of interest. Toby had a wealth of knowledge about the island. IF YOU DO NOTHING ELSE, YOU MUST VISIT THE ARIZONA MEMORIAL. The feeling of being on the site and hearing the story of the attack on Pearl Harbor will never leave me. Polynesian Cultural Center – Experience some traditions of the inhibits pacific islands throughout the complex, enjoy pretty good food at the luau while entertained by island performers, than see a great show, “The Story of ‘Ha’ – The Breath of Life”. The Ko Olina seems to be a great place if you want a quiet, relaxing vacation. School is in just about everywhere so after Labor day seemed the perfect time to go. I would go back in a second except from the east coast it’s 11 hours in the air to get there. We can be almost anywhere in the Caribbean in 2-4 hours. BUT, I would go again and probably relax a bit more than we did.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Ko Olina”
Reviews.Author: Igo57
Reviews.Content: We traded our Orlando timeshare for Ko Olina and we loved it! The resort is beautiful as are the rooms. Our view was not that great but we really didn't spend to much time in the room or at the resort as we did some day trips. The pools are nice, very tropical feeling. Although we did not swim in any of the coves they were just lovely to look at as you walked by. We did have lunch a couple of times at the poolside grill and the food was good. Also, had dinner one evening at Chuck's and the food there was also very good. Yes, this resort is not really that close to any attractions, but that did not bother us. There is a Safeway and several resturants a couple of miles up off the highway which was very convenient. Marriotts shuttle bus will bring you to their marina, golf course, Roy's and JW Marriott next door which was nice too. The traffic can get alittle crazy on the island in the surrounding areas during rush hours times, that was the only part of the trip that I did not like :( But it was always nice to come back to the peaceful resort at the end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis On Oahu”
Reviews.Author: MAJenkins
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from our stay at Ko Olina. We are Marriott owners and traded for a One Bedroom with a full kitchen and laundry facilities. This was our first full week stay on Oahu. We prefer a slower pace and have been to the other islands many times. We found the Ko Olina to truely be an oasis from the hustle and bustle of Honolulu. Our most enjoyable times of the week were spent on the beach at the resort. We had a mountain view room with a view of a par 3 hole on the golf course and a partial view of the marina. If we looked real hard through the power poles we could see Diamond Head. Our room was clean and well appointed. Any questions or minor problems were handled quickly and nicely. We chose to use the valet parking and because we were Marriott owners, we only paid $5 per day instead of the $26 per day. The beach and lagoon were never very crowded and very relaxing. We rented a cabana each day and I feel that for $30/day it was one of the better deals at the resort. We ate at both restaurants on site and found them both to be fine. They were probably a little on the high side, but it sure beat driving to Honolulu. Overall I would recommend this resort to anyone looking for a quiet getaway from the city.

Reviews.Title: “great for a relaxing time”
Reviews.Author: Surf&Ski
Reviews.Content: The ocean view room was spacious. The room had a small fridge and large balcony making breakfast overlooking the beach ideal ,,,after going downstairs for their free coffee. The fish pools by the hotel had lots of vairiety, the lagoon was perfect for early morning swims and the lengthy pathway which linked the other 2 lagoons made for a wonderful relaxing or invigorating jog. You are not right by Waikiki but that is the nice part of this hotel. It is quiet, peaceful and safe (you have to pass through a gate to get to your place). Hope to go back again soon. Look for the specials on their special pricings on Marriott's home page.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: basketballtraveler11
Reviews.Content: I currently stayed here for 5 nights in the beginning of August with my family. The hotel itself is gorgeous. My parents, who stayed at the JW Marriott, enjoyed the "kids" hotel better then their own. We had a 2 bedroom suite that slept 6 people (ages 17-27) comfortably. The kitchen has everything you could possibly need and the grills were wonderful to cook on. The marketplace is a little expensive and was one of the only things open to get food the night we arrived. The lagoons are wonderful to swim in as well as the pools. Our only complaint was the lake of night life because of the ages of everyone in our party. The hotel is perfect for families with younger children wanting to escape the craziness of Waikiki Beach. We enjoyed it but would have had more fun being in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Astounding resort, but beware the season”
Reviews.Author: mdwatkin
Reviews.Content: This trip was my second stay at Marriott's Ko Olina Beach Club and I have to say that it is a highly desirable resort destination. So much so, that on this particular trip we finally gave in and bought into the MVCI time share program. I love the Ko Olina and will return there again for many reasons; great location away from Waikiki, private lagoons with lots of marine life, pristine beaches, super nice hotel rooms with washer/dryer and kitchenette. One thing to be aware of is the time of year that you go. For US tourists the best times are in late spring or early fall. The hotel was under staffed despite anticipating heavy check-in on the day of our arrival. There were very long lines and we got so tired of waiting for our luggage we went up and retrieved it ourselves after an hour. The staff were overworked but still remained friendly and courteous. Avoid summer and winter if possible because the non-US tourists flock there at this time. Why avoid it then? The cultures of other people are not always acceptable; a mature couple pushed our kids to the ground to get to some free pieces of coconut that were being given away, young girls without tops, two girls making out with each other in the lagoon and to top it off, a little boy relieved himself on the sidewalk in front of Chuck's restaurant with his dad calmly watching despite us yelling at them during the meal. Marriott stated that there's nothing they can do about these incidents so again, beware what time of the year you go or it may not be friendly for your US born family. A tip for would-be visitors is to head to the Super Target that is a few miles east of the property. You can stock up on food, personal items and a wealth of water and beach toys that are affordably priced. The restaurants on the property are good, especially Chuck's steakhouse but the prices is far fetched ($8.25 for a PB&J sandwich, $15 for a stack of 3 pancakes). The new water slide and recently completed tower are great and our family will definitely be back there again. Just not in the summer or winter.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort away from city life”
Reviews.Author: Mrs.Flowers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to celebrate our anniversary. We used Interval International to exchange our time share and kept our fingers crossed to get a good hotel. When we arrived the staff was extremely helpful, from the valet to the front desk. They made the experience very welcoming. The resort is beautiful with clean room and grounds. It sits right in front of it's own "private" beach. There is a lot of families so being a young couple was a little awkward but that was no problem when sitting by the beach side bar. The pools are also nice but there is really no need for them with the beach a step away. Overall, this was one of the best hotels I have stayed at and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise All In One”
Reviews.Author: Shima55
Reviews.Content: Just got back last week from Oahu. Stayed at the Marriott Ko Olina in their three bedroom villa. Our rooms were on teh 8th floor, overlooking the ocean, lagoon and pool. What an outrageous view! The people at the Marriott were all so friendly and helpful. The place was clean and new. We were next to the new wing which hasn't been furnished yet so we had complete privacy for our large group of 10. We had the breakfast brunch at Kohole ($14.00) and dinner at Chuck's Steak &Seafood. The shrimp scampi there is to die for. If you are a Marriott timeshare owner (like I am... I exchanged my three bedroom Grand Chauteau in Las Vegas for the Ko Olina), you get 10% off at the restaurants (including the JW Marriott), a percentage off on swimming gear rentals, and complimentary parking. The layout of the resort is fantastic. There are four lagoons (the second lagoon has the most tropical fish and we even saw a sea turtle), water was calm and blue (although a bit salty so I advise wearing goggles), and a 1 1/2 mile walking/jogging path along the beach. They have fitness rooms fully equipped with sauna rooms, and bar-b-que grills throughout the complex. Ate at Roy's at the golf course and since the weather was perfect, we sat outside. Food as great as always. This is truly a 5 Star Resort and one that I would highly recommend. The great part is I'm a Marriott timeshare owner and could exchange for here again, which I definitely plan on doing.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary”
Reviews.Author: skipsterNewYork
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a week at the Ko Olina--if you are a family with young children, you'd be hard pressed to find a better vacation in the sun or by the sea. We were registered guests of a timeshare owner so we had the same privileges as owners. Our room was the smallest of the offerings--the studio--but the layout including galley-type kitchenette was just fine for we three. If you have read the entries below for this resort, every positive review is accurate in my opinion. I am fortunate to be able to travel regularly and this place is "buttoned up". That means, the staff greeted us on arrival because they knew we were coming, explained exactly how check-in and parking would work, followed up immediately after check in to see if our unit was satisfactory and followed up after every request to verify that it had been fulfilled. The one superlative I will add is how well the staff maintains the property. The place is immaculate--buildings, grounds, public areas. Each time I used a public restroom it was spotless. For me, the attention to details and cleanliness is what makes the resort extraordinary. Also, the layout and collection of swimming pools and beaches is just fantastic. The only negative I might see for others is that in high season (summer, school vacations) the place is teeming with kids. For us and our son, that was a plus, but others might be put off. I have not visited in shoulder season but since we go back to school late in New York, the number of kids was dropping even by the time we left, so perhaps the crowd is different when school is in session.

Reviews.Title: “best resort I have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: mreichny
Reviews.Content: This resort is by far the best resort I have ever stayed at. I came here after spending a week at the Hilton in Wikiki, and this resort was by far the highlight of our trip. After spending a week fighting for chairs by the pool and baking in the sun b/c the Hilton does not give umbrellas or shade, we were gladly surprised when we showed up in the afternoon and found chairs and umbrellas available by any pool we wanted. The resort had three pools, each one with its own charm. One had its own fake beach and another had a water slide and a circular pool with a cave and waterfalls. There was plenty of seating available at all pools, and there were also poolside bars. The pools were the perfect size for the size of the crowd there. There was also a nice beach that was calm because it was set aside by a cove that sheltered the waves. The rooms could not be nicer. We stayed in a one bedroom villa which had plenty of room for two adults and two children. In Marriott style, it had a very comfortable bed with a down comforter. The only thing that this hotel lacked was a nightlife. It was about a 10 minute drive from the nearest town, which was a suburb that is typical of southern california. It did not appear to have any bars or clubs and the restaurants were all fast food and chains. For a bar, your best bet was to go to the JW Marriott, which was either a 15 minute walk or short ride in the hotel shuttle. If you are planning a trip with kids to Oahu and just want a pool and beach resort, you could not find a better place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! You'll love it too!!!!”
Reviews.Author: imupforitru
Reviews.Content: The Ko'olina Beach Club provides everything you need to enjoy Paradise away from the city. My kids spent hours in the pools! The baby pool was perfect for my 1 year old. The other pool had waterfalls, caves, a slide and the third pool was nice as well. It was steps away from the private lagoon and the sunsets were gorgeous. The rooms were great with all the luxuries of home. The restaurant was a little expensive, but it was nice having appetizers and an ice cold beer watching the sunset. Can't wait to return for another visit!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Counting the days until we can return.”
Reviews.Author: forthelove
Reviews.Content: This is our favorite place by far. We are Marriott Timeshare owners and decided to trade our week for Hawaii. And a few years before our trip I had been to Waikiki and really just wasnt a fan. It was very touristy and crowded. Yes some fantastic restaurants, but just way too crowded. When I pictured Hawaii I wanted peaceful and relaxing. Ko' Olina is the perfect place for that. The location is very private, only a few hotels. The beaches are public, but very quiet! There are a few lagoons which is perfect because the water is calm and you are not rock climbing in the water. The only downfall to the location is that the only restaurants in walking distance are the ones at the resorts. They are great, but pricey. So utilize your kitchen. The rooms are amazing. Beds are so comfortable, showers spacious, views fabulous, and a fully stocked kitchen. So buy some daquiri mix!!!!! It literally is a 2 bedroom/2 bath apartment. The breakfast was my favorite meal to eat out. It overlooked the water and one day we saw whales in the distance!!!! The staff was great. They were always wanting to help how ever they could. And make sure you attend the luau onsite. I have been to quite a few and this was by far one of the best I have seen. And you do not have to drive anywhere! HIGHLY RECOMMENDED and I am a vacation snob.....I have been there and done that when it comes to budget accomodations and hostels....now vacations are not as many so when I go I only want the best.

Reviews.Title: “Really Loved It!!”
Reviews.Author: meerkatkate
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Ko Olina for one week and loved it. The grounds were beautiful, as were the pools. The ocean lagoons were OK. Great for children. There is gentle wave action. But snorkeling in lagoon 4, where the hotel is, I did not see one fish, not one. That's OK, though, because we snorkeled at other beaches around the island. The check-in was fast and easy. And the check out was one phone call. There were only 2 problems we encountered in the beginning. One was the room. We were supposed to have an oceanview room but the second floor with palm trees in the way didn't qualify as far as we were concerned. When they told us that was an OV room we simply said it was not acceptable. We were then cheerfully given a room on the 5th floor. We could see the ocean but it was so far away that I wouldn't pay for that room category again. The other one was the towels in the room. Now you may think that is a petty complaint, but these towels were gross!. I told my husband we would only use those towels at home to wash the car. He said no we wouldn't, they might scratch the paint. Really, they were gray, dingy, and disgusting! I called the front desk and told them exactly that, too. Within 15 minutes we did have fluffy white towels brought to our room. The restaurants were good but there were only 2 of them. The Marketplace had snacks/sandwiches. We spent a lot of time at the Ihilani for meals. They had a wonderful breakfast buffet and dinner was good, too. At the KoOlina, Kohole's was OK for lunch but their breakfast buffet was not very good. The other caution I would give would be that in August when we were there, there were hoards of teenagers. Really hoards. And I think you can figure that comment out. Also, this is not the place for anyone who wants to be in the action. Waikiki is the place for that. We didn't want the action, though. We loved the KoOlina at night and walking to the lagoon and listening to the waves and looking at the stars at night. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Ko Olina!”
Reviews.Author: Broncofan01
Reviews.Content: Four of our grown kids and 2 grandkids joined us in Hawaii for a week at KoOlina. This was the second time for us and we plan to return with all the kids again in October. We liked that we were away from the hustle bustle of the city, yet close enough to everywhere! We have really enjoyed Fia! Fia! each time as well. The suites have been great, the beach bar an awesome place to watch the sunset, and a great massage on the beach! The staff has always been most gracious and we would recommend this resort to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “What a beautiful resort!”
Reviews.Author: we_bk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the resort for 3 days and then stayed for few days at the hotel in Waikiki. What a lovely resort and we enjoyed every single minutes. We booked 1 bedroom with ocean view and the suite is very spacious for four of us. We are not the timeshare owner and we just booked through Marriot hotel. We did skipped the timeshare presentation although they have very attractive show ticket or free trip for us. Actually, they are quite pushy to make us to attend the timeshare presentation. The service was excellent and the staff is very friendly and professional. The pool and lagoon were great for my kids. My son especially loved to snorkelling in Lagoon 2 which he found fishes and green turtle. It's not too crowded in Lagoon 2 and I just sat at the shade to watch them swimming. The staff stated the best time for snorkelling in Lagoon is around sunrise till 11 am and you would see quite a lots of fish. We cooked most of time and it is very convenient to shop ( Costco, Target and K Mart nearby). Overall, the resort is beautiful and we'll come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort and Great Place to Stay with Teens”
Reviews.Author: michettism
Reviews.Content: Started a 12 night Hawaii trip at Ko Olina, followed by stays at Wailea Marriott in Maui, and then back to Waikiki Marriott. Ko Olina was clean, comfortable, very spacious, and well maintained. We travel a lot and the room at Ko Olina was our boys (12 and 15) favorite (including comparing it to DVC 2 bedroom Beach Club Villa). The pools were fun and the beach was great. We used the beach/lagoon directly behind the resort (there are 5 man made lagoons in total, others further down had better snorkeling I'm told). Prices were reasonable at the Marketplace and restaurants. We purchased plastic rafts for only $6 at the pool. We took the shuttle to the nearby Marriott Ihilani Resort to have breakfast one morning. Ihilani is an awesome resort as well.with a shark and stingray pool, etc. Check in was easy a Ko Olina and the staff friendly and helpful. We wanted to get a building closer to the main area of the resort and we could have switched, but the agent pointed out that the view of sunset was better in the room we currently had. We never make use of the kitchen in vacation club villas but the clothes dryer comes in handy when you need to dry bathing suits. One morning pressed for time, we had to skip breakfast and opted for hot breakfast sandwiches at the marketplace - Good food and reasonable prices. If you are keeping to a budget, you can save money and get a good meal this way. We didn't spend a lot of time at the resort because we had a full agenda (PCC, Pearl Harbor, Shark Encounter, Waimea falls, etc). Only negative is that the pool areas were crowded and it was hard to find pool chairs, so we went to the beach. Towels had to be traded which was a little inconvenient - you could not just drop off damp pool towels at night and pick up new ones in the morning. Since Ko Olina is an out of the way location, it is great for relative quiet base for an Oahu vacation. It is only minutes from H1 for getting to all key attraction areas. In comparison, staying at Waikiki provides all the excitement of the strip, sights, restaurants, shops, crowds, etc. For our teen son, Waikiki had the advantage for surfing and for great stores (QuickSilver, ONeill, Element, BillaBong, Honalua Surf Shop, etc). Overall, Marriott Ko Olina was an awesome resort and we definitely want to go back and are considering the timeshare there. Disney is building their Vacation Club resort between Ko Olina and Ihilani Marriott Resorts. I will provide reviews for Wailea Marriott and Marriott Waikiki separately.

Reviews.Title: “Still Our Favorite Hawaii Locale But Maybe Not For Long”
Reviews.Author: jellyb
Reviews.Content: Traveling with 8-yo and 9-yo this is our tenth trip to Hawaii. We've been to Maui, Kauai, and Big Island at least twice. This is our 5th time to Oahu and our 4th time to the Ko Olina Resort our first time was shortly after it opened. We always trade in to this resort with our Palm Desert White Week which cost us $7,000 purchasing on re-sale. I feel sorry for those who bought Ko Olina weeks direct from Marriott - pricey! But if it weren't for these less informed folks, Marriott wouldn't build places like this as they wouldn't be profitable for them. Someone has to buy the initial offering. I'd just rent from an owner here if I couldn't get another Marriott to trade to Ko Olina for much less. I find it pretty funny how they have the drapes drawn over the windows by the elevators in the preview center so you can't see the nearby oil refinery. With that said, I'm happy to report the resort is still top notch, even with the expansion. Everything is more or less perfect here. Yes you can get a more rustic experience on Maui and especially Kauai and the Big Island, but we've found the combination of the conveniences of the Ko Olina resort with the man made lagoons and all the amenities., activities, and the option to go into the "Big City" of Honolulu/Waikiki or head to the North Shore and watch the world class surfers. More specifically, Marriott has maintained the units well. They appear to be handling the large capacity well, but I think occupant rates are down for this time of year due to the economy and the third tower appears only half complete. The pools and the beach were not crowded although you need to get to the pool early for the best seats. Tip: If you're not a "sun person" and you can't find a shady spot, rent the covered lounge chairs as it is what of the few things in the resort that is not overpriced. The other best deal in the resort is the Happy Hour at Chucks. $4 Mai Tais, Beers, and Well Drinks. And the Fish and Chips on the appetizer menu is meal sized! Out kids loving feeding the giant Koi in the pond. The service at Chuck's is outstanding, three people will be waiting on you, a waiter, a drinks server, and a bus person. We preferred this to the beach bar as prices for food are no cheaper and the more casual beach bar. Tip: The snorkeling was best on the right side of Lagoon 4 by the Marina. But only mediocre compared to other places we've snorkeled in Hawaii, but very convenient. Do some of the activities. They are fun for the kids and low cost. The Tamiya Race Car Building and Race is worth it. The kids love it! You can drive 5 min to Kapolei where they have dining, Costco, Target, K-Mart, you name it. Overall Marriott has still hit a home run on this resort. It is relaxing, convenient, and flexible for whatever vacation you want. Relax at the beach one day, do the activities the next. We will probably avoid this place during high season (summer and winter break) in the future as I expect that a combination of finishing the third tower and the economy coming back will make this place a lot more crowded and as far as I can tell they have no more pools or restaurants planned so I wouldn't be surprised if during high season the place eventually ends up being a zoo as more people discover it and fill up the larger lodging capacity. Tip; Forget the timeshare presentation. We wisely never did it. The tempt you with resort dollars or tickets to shows, etc. It's not worth your time. If you can afford to go to this place in the first place, your vacation time is worth much more than they can offer you to sit through a high pressure sales presentation.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip!”
Reviews.Author: cahill05
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Honolulu in June. This was the second time I have stayed out at Ko Olina but the first time out at the time share (previously stayed at the hotel). My husband stayed in the main tower and had a lock out while the rest of my family had a 2 bedroom villa in the new building. They were upgraded for the first week to a penthouse villa which had vaulted ceilings and was beautiful. Only complaint there was that they had to move after the first week due to some error on Marriott's part. They handled the move and gave us all passes for the luau which was actually really fun. One of the better one's I have been to and the food was excellent. The hotel is great and we had excellent service the whole time we were there. We sat through a time share presentation and were able to go on the dolphin snorkel for free which was so fun. The morning is supposed to be better so that's what we booked. They had breakfast and drinks (2 alcoholic pp). The crew was really fun and we found tons of dolphins. We thought the snorkeling was just okay but it was worth it bc of the dolphins. We also ate at Roy's, request to sit out on the patio and watch all the golfers come in on 18. Definitely get the pineapple infused martini, it was delicious. My husband and I went up to the hotel one night and had dinner at Azul. BTW, there is a shuttle bus that runs to Roy's and the hotel which was nice but its not a far walk up to the hotel, we walked back after dinner and felt very safe. The atmosphere is good, make a reservation for the terrace, we wish we had. The food was just okay. We did the preset menu based on our waiter's recommendation and weren't super impressed. We did hear from others that the food was great so maybe it was just our meal. We went to Pearl Harbor on a Sunday morning. Got there around 7:30 am and made it in the first group. TIP: You have to go to where the Bowfin is to get tickets (to the right if you are facing PH), we didn't realize this and walked up to Pearl Harbor only to be told we had to walk all the way back to the Bowfin to get our tickets. We did the audio tour while we were waiting and thought that was great. We did the Swap Meet after Pearl Harbor since they are so close. We got a couple things but nothing super exciting and if you are pressed for time I would skip it. I definitely recommend hiking Diamond Head. It was a hot day (definitely get there early) and we had to walk far bc the parking lot was full. TIP: If the lot is full just circle around and wait for someone to come out. People are always coming and going and by the time we had walked an extra 20 minutes up the hill from a different parking lot there were 5 spaces open. Also bring lots of water! The view at the top is worth the hike. We did the whole thing in about 2 hours but we took lots of breaks with my parents and also spent awhile at the top. Another thing we did was drive up to the North Shore. There are lots of beaches along the way, Waimea Beach seemed the prettiest. We made the mistake of driving all the way out to Turtle Bay (I would skip it) and then coming back but by then it was too crowded and we couldn't find a spot. One thing I would HIGHLY recommend is stopping at Ted's Bakery. The food is outstanding and would have been worth the trip alone. We also stopped at the Dole plantation on our way back. It was worth it for the Dole Whip but I wouldn't spend too much time here. We rode the train that takes you out to the pineapple fields which we all thought was interesting. I would skip the maze though unless you have kids that might really like that. If you are into golf Ko Olina has a really nice course. We also played out at Ko'olau off H3. It was one of the most challenging and beautiful courses I have ever played. I highly recommend it. We stopped at Boots & Kimos for breakfast which is also another must do. Get the pancakes with the macadamia nut sauce and you will not be disappointed. It gets pretty crowded though so get there early. One cool thing though is they take your order while you wait outside(inside only has about 10 tables and no bathroom for public use) so by the time you sit down your food is basically ready. We did go into Waikiki for a day, my parents were staying at the Royal Hawaiian (gorgeous hotel) the first day so we met them and had our own slice of the beach. It was fun for a day but took forever to get there bc of the traffic. Overall it was a great trip. If you are interested in bars and partying this place isn't for you. If you just want to relax and have fun then you will enjoy Ko Olina. We spent a week there and then spent another week in Fiji. Check out that review on Qamea Resort if you are interested.

Reviews.Title: “Bring Your Kids!”
Reviews.Author: MonocleTraveler
Reviews.Content: If you've got kids, this is the place! Lots of cool swimming pools, waterfalls, slides and a beautiful sandy beach with lots of shallow swimming. If you're looking for a quiet, relaxing getaway - forget it. We're owners at this resort and bought several years ago - when it was a quiet getaway from Honolulu. Since then, it's full of families and kids, kids, kids everywhere! The locals have discovered the hotel, and you can find them using the pool and spas (they figured out how to get a guest wrist band) and nearby grounds. And they bring their kids. I mentioned to the management that it would be nice to have part of the grounds for adults only - there's 3 swimming pools, why not set one aside for adults? A nice quiet corner where one can enjoy an adult beverage and bask in the tropical sun - in peace and quiet. Apparently, my idea isn't a new one, but the Marriott's management resists the idea because they take pride in their "family" vacation reputation. So, if you've got kids and don't mind the noise, this beautiful resport will be your paradise. The rooms are well appointed, but as an owner I didn't expect to get a room overlooking the parking garage with a view of the oil refinery next door. It was such a disappointment. I complainted to the hotel staff and to corporate staff, but they haven't acknowledged my complaint, as I haven't heard from Marriott's, even though it's been 6 weeks since my trip. Can't wait to go back to Kauai ...

Reviews.Title: “Amazing! Wonderful! Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: LisaV-06
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at this fantastic resort. What a terrific vacation! We stayed in a 2 bedroom (lock-off style) villa with ocean views. Both the 1 bedroom & studio were rather large. The resort is simply gorgeous. I can't say enough about all the amenities, the cleanliness of the ENTIRE resort, the professionalism/friendliness of the staff. They quickly brought up a crib, playpen, highchair & sheets upon check-in. The fully stocked kitchen included ground island coffee, kitchen sponge, dish soap, dishwasher detergent & tide. The pool & lagoon were wonderful for my 14 month old & there were plenty of activities for all ages (i.e.: hula lessons, lei making, movie night on the lawn, art classes, cooking classes, baby & toddler arts & craft, etc.). Both restaurants onsite were excellent & very reasonably priced. You definitely need a car to get around because it's a little ways out but we preferred it that way. There's a brand new Costco, Target & grocery store a couple exits down. Don't even consider any of the hotels in congested, smoggy, seedy Waikiki...especially if traveling with children.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort, friendly staff & amazing pools!”
Reviews.Author: ZiggysMom
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our stay here and can't say enough good things about it. We were traveling with an 11 yr old, 7 yr. old and a 9 mo. old baby, and this resort was perfect for everyone! The pools were designed wonderfully using natural lava rock and were perfect for the older kids as well as the baby. Nothing worse than being in a pool that drops right off and you have to worry about the kids being too deep, too fast. Not here! There is a shallow sandy beach entry that smaller kids love, with a volleyball and basketball net at the other end. You can check out balls for these for free next to the pool. The larger pool has a super fun water slide and waterfalls the kids loved. Several hot tubs make it even better, with one of them looking over the ocean. Beautiful! There are four lagoons along the beach in front of the hotel that provide opportunities for snorkeling and playing in the sand. The water was quite murky in lagoon 3. Much better snorkeling in lagoon 2 where we actually got to swim with sea turtles! If your mask is fogging up, just use a leaf from one of the plants growing along the sea rock by rubbing it inside your mask ~ it works great! There's Starbucks coffee inside the marketplace including yummy frappuccinos as well as muffins, sandwiches, etc. The food at Kolohe's was delicious! We made our own breakfast in our room, then had a nice lunch there with an ocean view. Kids meals (12 & under) were only $8 including a drink, and the kids burgers were large enough to fill up my BIG eater. We didn't try a lot of different things, but can definitely recommend the burgers and the tuna melt sandwich. At Chucks, we enjoyed fresh fish that even my kids devoured. The Ahi and Mahi Mahi were delicious. Included salad bar was a bit weak, but the fruit was really good. Can't say how their steak is, but if you're in Hawaii, you should probably eat fish! We had a one bedroom suite on the twelfth floor with an ocean view that was perfect for our family. The boys slept in the living area on the pull out sleeper, and we had a king size bed in the master. There was a perfect sitting area for the baby's crib off the master that you could even close off the shutters to, giving you privacy but still the ability to hear her. I really liked that they had real cribs, not the usual pak 'n play that most hotels have. Make sure you bring your own baby blankets ~ I had one for under her and one for over her. She slept, well, like a baby! :) I found the staff to be very friendly, helpful and generally happy. I can't imagine anyone having a problem with any of them, as I found the valets, pool staff, restaurants staff, and marketplace delightful. Speaking of valets, that was the only bad thing...$25/ day for parking, but I felt like we got such a great value on the hotel that it was worth it. Free WiFi was handy too. Overall, we had a wonderful vacation and I would not hesitate to recommend this resort to my friends and family!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing! But must have a car”
Reviews.Author: RashaAlMahroos
Reviews.Content: The resort is amazing. I felt that I was in paradise. The pictures on the website do not do it justice. The lobby was stunning (much more beautiful than the lobby at the nearby Marriott Ko Olina). It has several pools, several beautiful lagoons (shared with the Marriott Ko Olina Resort), a landscaped golf course, several restaurants (Roy's being the best), and several hidden jacuzzis. You could literally stay in the resort without leaving (though I don't recommend that you do that because Oahu has a lot of things to do). Their concierge service is excellent. The resort has shuttles to an from the Marriott Ko Olina and the Golf Club although you can easily walk. There is one thing you might want to keep in mind before staying here. The resort is really family oriented. There are a lot of cute little children running around and swimming, so it is great for families. We do not have any children but we didn't find the children bothersome at all, but maybe thats because we went in April before school was out. The resort was really quiet overall. The one thing I would not recommend in this resort are the restaurants which were just average and really overpriced. I suggest going to the nearby grocery store (only a 5 minute drive) to stock up on snacks and breakfast goods. However, Roy's in the adjacent Ko Olina Golf club was excellent. If you do decide to stay here, you have to rent a car. Otherwise it will be very difficult for you to see the rest of Oahu. Parking is good and if there are no spots they will valet your car for free.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden treasure!”
Reviews.Author: LBBBIowa
Reviews.Content: Totally surprised by this amazing resort. This was far more than we ever anticipated. I highly recommned.

Reviews.Title: “BEST PLACE ON THE ISLAND!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mulcher1
Reviews.Content: Away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. I advise you to get a car, it is about 20-30 min from Waikiki. Everything is immaculate, nice beach coves for snorkling tanning etc.. Staff is great. Went on the timeshare tour and got 2 free tickets on the Ko Olina catamaran (Over $200 savings). Will definitily come again. Restaurants are pricey. Roys across the street was better to eat. Pools are great especially the one with the slide and caves. Self parking was included. Right next door to Paradice Cove luau.

Reviews.Title: “Still love it here!”
Reviews.Author: AlohafromMD
Reviews.Content: We lived on Oahu from 1995 to 1998. We've stayed at this resort twice before with friends who are owners, but last year finally bought. This was our first stay as owners. Stayed from June 5 to June 17, in a one bedroom villa mountainview. I always loved this area, even when we lived in Kailua, to go for an afternoon or evening. It feels like you're on a neighbor island, but with all the conveniences of Honolulu so close by. Got two rollaways, as the sofa sleeper wasn't very good. Our unit was one that hadn't been given the soft goods refurbishment yet, but that was fine for us. We were originally given a new unit in the new tower, but the view wasn't good, and we wanted the little sitting room off the master bedroom. We moved to an older building, with a much better view. Unit was really not very clean when we got in (grease on the counter tops and the floor in the kitchen seemed to have been mopped with coffee) but I picked up some spray Lysol at Target when I went out stocking up the first afternoon, so I cleaned it myself. We really enjoyed the new pool. The kids loved the slide! Snorkeling in the lagoon one over is great all day long - lots of beautiful fish. Definitely loved the new Target (man I wish there had been one there 15 years ago!) and the new Costco. We got almost all our groceries between the two places, and cooked every day. Nice with two kids - we ate so well! Fish at Costco is very fresh, got fruits and salads there, went to Target first for other items. I can't wait to go back again, in a year or two! If you are a fan of Hawaiian music, you know Hapa. We got to see Nathan at Chai's Island Bistro one night (he's there most Fridays) - awsome to hear his beautiful music! And great dinner as well. I highly recommend going there - it's at Aloha Tower.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS”
Reviews.Author: pannie20
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very nice and away from the hustle-bustle of Honolulu. Grounds are very nicely landscaped and staff is very accommodating. Do rent a car so that you can drive the island. Must see the North shore (surfers) and stop at one of the shrimp trucks (Giovanni's-North shore). Ted's bakery is good also. Do go to Pearl Harbor and climb Diamond Head for spectular views. Beware though it is hiking through uneven terrain with rocks, etc. No heels ladies (just saying that as we saw some women heading up the mountain with stilettos!) There is also about 100 + steep steps to climb after the 1 mile walk. Sunsets are brilliant and breath taking. Do get a Lei at the airport -it worth the money! Waikiki Beach is nice - a lot like South Beach but worth seeing. Park off the main strip and walk but have quarters for the meters as you get 10 minutes for 25 cents. There is also a famous old Pink hotel on the beach there that you should see, but forgot the name. PS There is a Costco on the island around the shopping centers, where you can get cheap food and desserts!

Reviews.Title: “Good for kids and their parents”
Reviews.Author: gilgbuch
Reviews.Content: peaceful, beautiful and kids love the lagoon. mom and dad loved Azul.

Reviews.Title: “Great for little kids”
Reviews.Author: TravelerFromOC
Reviews.Content: Lots of different pools to choose from, waterfalls to play in, a waterslide (closed, unfortunately, many of the days we were there), lagoons with great beaches and snorkeling, away from the hustle of Waikiki. On the days we weren't venturing out to see other parts of Oahu, the resort was a very good place to entertain the little ones. Those looking for more to do at night may not like the more remote location, however. Buildings are pretty new, so its in very good condition.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, Great staff, would go back!”
Reviews.Author: sjensen81
Reviews.Content: When you pull up and the valet already knows what building your room will be in I knew this was going to be a cut above. I was not disappointed in any way. Rooms were great. Full kitchen, 2 bedroom, 2 bath. Beautiful grounds, great snorkeling in the lagoons. Saw a sea turtle in the lagoon right in front of the property. (Best snorkeling for me was lagoon #2). The staff was super nice and helpful. My daughter even commented that at other hotels you feel like the staff is nice because they have to be, but here she felt they were generally happy, nice people. If you drive up the west coast (past all the homeless people) there is a supermarket called Tamura, a bit of an adventure, but less expensive than the Safeway. Parking is expensive for non time share owners....

Reviews.Title: “NICE place”
Reviews.Author: roncase99
Reviews.Content: Particularlly good for those with kids. Shop and do your own cooking and BBQ.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Paradise!!!”
Reviews.Author: jtownleyc
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our trip to the KoOlina Beach Club this morning and I already wish I were back there. The resort is immaculate, beautiful, well-planned and is away from the "commercial feel" of Oahu. The first time I was in Hawaii, I stayed on Maui and although it is beautiful, I still felt like I could be staying in any warm city with palm trees, etc. because there was a McDonalds, grocery store, Blockbuster movie rentals, etc. right down the street. My husband and I like to stay where we feel isolated from the everyday fast paced life we live the rest of the year. KoOlina is just this type of place. If you like to be in hustle and bustle, this is not the place for you. However, if you want to feel like you are away from all of that, this DEFINATELY is the place for you!! The really nice thing is that just 2-3 miles away in Kapolei, you can buy groceries and go to Target and rent movies - it just is out of sight from this resort. Every detail from the villas, to the pools, to the landscaping, to the lagoons is perfect and absolutely beautiful! The 3 mile roundtrip jogging/walking path makes exercising seem like fun when you have all of that beauty to look at as you pass by. Our children (ages 13 and 10) loved every minute there. We purchased groceries and utilized the grills and saved a ton of money on food. We did however go to dinner at Roy's (KoOlina Golf Club) and enjoyed it very much. The beach is beautiful with lots of soft sand and beautiful clear water! The service from the staff was first rate. Everyone was very friendly and accomodating. When I called the front desk for extra blankets, they sent housekeeping within minutes and 45 minutes later I received a call back checking to see if I indeed had received the blankets. Frankly, anyone who has complained of service here must really have impossible standards, because we saw nothing that remotely resembled bad service. My advice is that if you are contemplating a trip here and want a beautiful place to stay away from traffic and noise (but still close enough to see Pearl Harbor, Hanaumu Bay, North Shore, etc) this IS THE PLACE TO STAY!!!!!!!!!!! Book it and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “GORGEOUS Hotel! Absolutely Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: supermanhicks
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 5 nights last week and the hotel was stunning. The pools are incredible and MUCH better than any of the other hotels in Ko Olina, especially the JW Marriott (which only has one small pool). We loved it! I wish we had a better room though, they unfortunately couldn't move us to another one. They said the hotel was at full capacity and with three towers and not a million people walking around, I found that hard to believe. We were stuck on the first floor looking at a rock wall. BUT...with that said, the room was really nice and cozy. Parking was expensive, $25 dollars per day if you self-park and $30 for valet. The hotel all in all was great, there is a brand new shopping center just a few minutes away, it is far from the hustle and bustle of Honolulu, which we loved. I wish it were a little closer to the North Shore though, because we ended up going to the North Shore nearly every day...we loved it! I would defnitely recommend this hotel to a friend, it really was a beautiful place. The lagoons were great. There were some colorful fish/crabs in them, but not nearly as many as would be found on the North Shore or Hanauma Bay. The lagoons are a perfect place for children and adults because they are calm and the beginning of it is very shallow, then it gets about 20' deep. I loved swimming in them! The hotel also has cabanas for rent on the lagoon which are great, $20 for 4 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing and away from the rat race”
Reviews.Author: shaste2000
Reviews.Content: Our stay was part of the timeshare persentation. We were treated very well . The service was warm and friendly from the front desk personnel to the grounds keeper. Rooms were cleaned and well maintained. The beach and hotel ground were kept well manicured. The lagoon was very safe for any child with fish swimming around them to entertain. Security was everywhere and very visible. We felt very safe. We enjoyed it so much that we purchased a 8 night 7 day stay for next year. A couple of things that could be better. We had to pay $20 per day for parking. That was outrages. Dinning was also on the high side ($10 for a hot dog). We had one order of spring rolls (very good), two sandwiches, a non alcoholic beer and ice tea 52 bucks! Wow! We found a strip-mall at ext 2B that had a variety of resturants plus Safeway. Average cost per person for lunch or dinner was $7.50. that's worth the short trip.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place but could be better”
Reviews.Author: TJLandof10000lakes
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Marriott. Room had a full kitchen, was nicely sized and had a comfortable bed. The grounds are very nice, and multiple swimming pools are available. There are some very nice lagoons available for salt water swimming. Very cool ponds with small hammerhead sharks and rays. Although everything was nice and much attention had been paid to keeping the grounds attractive I thought that overall this place was too big, had too much sprawl and a bit of an 'antiseptic' feeling or that it lacked character compared to other luxury hotels. Maybe it was the Ko Olina area...the nice part of Ko Olina is that it is away from the Honolulu traffic and noise, but it is on the dry side of the island (less tropical feel to it), and close to the industrial harbor of Barber's Point. Although I would stay here again, I'd look at other options first (like Turtle Bay).

Reviews.Title: “LOVE this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sunnyblues
Reviews.Content: We got married next door at "Lanikuhonua" and this hotel was so convenient. Breakfast menu was fantastic. Service was great. It is out of the way and not in Oahu, but it is a GREAT getaway from the city life. Rooms were very clean, and the group rates were very very reasonable!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice resort but "out of the way"”
Reviews.Author: sf7307
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our weeklong stay at the Marriott Ko Olina. We chose not to be in Waikiki, preferring to be in a quieter location. Honestly, outside the resort (which is beautiful -- very nice rooms, beautiful grounds, excellent gym, lovely pools), it was a little too out of the way.....first, the drive from the airport is downright ugly until you get inside the Ko Olina resort, second, even once you're inside the resort, it's obviously not developed the way it was intended to be. The lack of a "core" (such as Whaler's Village on Maui) or even other hotels/condos on the beach walk, is a negative. Once the Disney resort is up and running (it's under construction now), maybe the originally-planned "town center" is more likely to be built. The issue with not having it is that there's hardly anyplace good to eat IN the resort (not a fan of hotel restaurants), and no place to just poke around (like Lahaina).Nearby all you have is the suburb of Kapolei, with every chain store you've every heard of in your life (some okay restaurants, but if I wanted to be surrounded by Target and Costco, I'd stay home). That all said, if you're a family and are staying "on property", or if you just want a "get away from it all" vacation, it's lovely and, as I said, the pools are great. The man-made lagoon beaches are very nice. We thought the service was excellent. WiFi works at the pool. All in all, a lovely resort in kind of an odd location. The question is "would I recommend this hotel to a friend" -- the answer is yes, but only "with an explanation".

Reviews.Title: “Could be a Worldclass Resort, if only....”
Reviews.Author: SFBayLuv2trvl
Reviews.Content: We read a lot of reviews on this site before going and after staying a full week, we totally agree with the overall theme. It's a beautiful resort with tastefully decorated rooms, but service was spotty. There were only 3 people who went out of their way to help us. The rest of the staff did only the minimal required to keep from getting fired. Marriott cut expenses where they can and it is totally noticeable. Some cheesy things that happened: 1. The Luau Tuesday nights is out in the open. We were walking past it and stopped to take a look. A security person promptly came up to us to tell us to leave because we didn't pay for the Luau, so we were not allowed to watch. If we had any thought to attend the next Luau, it was quickly dashed. 2. The front desk was able to accommodate our request to move into a different unit. The first unit overlooked the resort's main driveway that leads to the lobby and parking lot. We were in the first unit for almost an hour and left some dirty dishes and disheveled beds. Just a few minutes after settling into the 2nd unit, we got an irate call from housekeeping complaining about the mess we left behind in the 1st unit. We don't know what they think to accomplish by this, except giving us a picture of how poorly the staff is schooled in the 'hospitality' trade. It took the shine off the people who came through with the room change. 3. Wrist bands, everyone has to wear them if they want to use the pools, towels, etc.., even our 4 year old who has sensory issues. We were all sitting in the hot tub and were approached by the ever friendly security personnel. He told us he was doing a random check to make sure only the resort guests were using the resort facilities. I wore the only wrist band and vouched that my husband and two children were also guests. Apparently that wasn't enough, he looked up our room number and put wrist bands on everyone. I guess common sense, an using personal judgment isn't part of the job description. Even though we gave a high rating to this place and recommend it (for a one time only). We will most likely not come back. It is a physically nice place to stay in, but the bad service really killed it for us.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property marred by the gross lack of customer service”
Reviews.Author: woodee
Reviews.Content: The location is beautiful and I think I would have had a nice trip were it not for a horrible customer service experience. Definitely a case of a small issue becoming a huge distracting problem for the entire week. We requested a room change - did not want the handi-accessible room as it did not have the dual vanity and tub. We even were willing to give up our 'ocean view' for a island view. The manager said she'd be willing to accomodate with 24hr advance notice and therefore she could switch us the next day. We call down the next day, and get the same runaround. - "We can accomodate tomorrow, please call us back tomorrow morning and we will have something for you..." What about our conversation the previous day? Oh, sorry, no record of that, but just call us back tomorrow. Incredible!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place for Families”
Reviews.Author: 4&Counting
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after a fairly horrific experience at the Moana Surfrider, and thank goodness as it redeemed our Hawaiian vacation! I can't say enough about how kid and family friendly this resort is. The rooms are well-appointed, there are lots of great amenities and activities (go to the morning fish feeding if you can), and I found the staff to be extremely friendly and helpful without being overbearing or fake. If you're going on a family vacation to Oahu, this is the place to stay. And I've learned that if your kids have a great vacation, so will you!

Reviews.Title: “About as good as it gets for families with children”
Reviews.Author: ptirvine
Reviews.Content: There are tons for reviews for this resort so what else can I say? Well we never saw the rest of the island except for the Target, Safeway, and Costco. Is that a good thing? I think so. We have 3 kids and our youngest is 2 so we don't like to drive around too much and lug all their junk around. So we found enough to do here to keep everyone happy for a full week. Fishing off the rocks just outside the lagoon. Snorkeling in the lagoon. Kayaking in the lagoon. Checking out the tide pools in the lagoon. But that is not all. The pools are really nice also. The newer section has a medium level water slide. Warm waters, waterfalls, jacuzzi, sandy bottom pool. There is even a dry sauna and steam room that you can use without signing up for a spa session. That is rare that you have access to those without paying extra for the spa. We did not use the spa itself, but it did look a little small and unimpressive. Restaurants are good enough, but you can't eat in just 2 places for your whole stay. We prepared most our food in the kitchen and on the numerous outdoor grills. Never had a problem getting one. THE BAD (really not that bad, but I feel I have to list some): Workout room is good enough for cardio, but not good for weights. Only mid week "tidy" service. Did not change sheets, just towels. Bed was a little hard. I am used to my super plush pillow top. Tube TV's. Yes I prefer plasma and LCD's. Electric stove. Did I mention that the bad isn't really that bad? No nightlife. Not bad for me, but maybe for others. Small spa. Ihilani has a nice one you can use though. Price.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely property- a few service/staff issues”
Reviews.Author: x2vacation
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Marriot Koolina for 5 nights. My husband and I are particular about our accomodations and therefore we were pleasantly surprised by how lovely this property is. The developers have done a beautiful job with the exterior and interior. We stayed in a two bedroom/ two bathroom ocean view unit which was plenty of room for our family of 5 ( 2 adults/3 kids) The unit was very clean and well appointed. The view was advertised as ocean view and was nice, not great. The unit had a partial view of the ocean in the distance and the beautiful pool and landscaping. It also overlooked a huge vacant lot (future hotel?) and small parking lot. We experienced good service at both of the restaurants on every occassion. The only criticism is the inablity to order small, indiviual items for breakfast such as oatmeal or a bagel. If you wish to dine at the restaurant for breakfast, Marriott makes you purchase the buffet or a choice of three huge plates of food and sometimes you are just not that hungry. Usually, the service personnel at Marriot Hotels are well trained in customer service. Marriot is in the business of sales. Unfortunately, these employees appear to not want to be bothered. I wanted to extend my stay. At first, the front desk person told me there was no availability. I immediately got on line and found out there was availability. Then she said my only option was to move to a different room mid stay. I am abbreviating the many many phone calls and days this took. Finally, I went to the front desk service person and asked to speak to the manager. At first she refused to get the manager, she stated the manager could not help me. After several requests, she informed the manager who in minutes arranged an extended stay with no room change. I have read other reviews that stated the guests had good experiences with the concierge. That was not our experience. After waiting a long time in long lines, we unfortunatley got the same one every time. She was not very helpful unless you like one word responses to questions and a dismissive attitude. She was clearly in a hurry to move us along so that she could go on to the next guest. Generally my family and I enjoyed our stay and would visit again. We stayed the last two nights of our Hawaii vacation in Waikikii , at the Hilton Hawaiin Village. The Hilton gave me a greater appreciation for the Marriott .

Reviews.Title: “Stay here and forget about Waikiki”
Reviews.Author: sluebeck
Reviews.Content: If you are going to Oahu and want a great Hawaii experience, then stay here. Most people want to stay in Waikiki because that's the famous location, but its like staying right in the middle of a major downtown business district. If that's what you want then go for it..... If you want quiet, peaceful setting with private beaches ( and I mean 4 beaches), protected lagoons with tropical fish and great snorkeling, beautiful tropical grounds and quiet, then this is the place for you. Did I mention that they have three different pools, with related soaking pools and a waterslide for the kids all set in a tropical setting with palm trees and tropical vegetation for atmosphere. I'd recommend it to anyone. Its about 30 miles north of Honolulu on the west coast. Its beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic FAMILY Resort (even with the wind...)”
Reviews.Author: Sils12374
Reviews.Content: OK, I would have to agree with the previous post that it would not be the best spot for a couple looking to relax (or get away from kids). However, for those of us with kids it was wonderful. We are owners but we'd never been. We used the 1 bedroom portion and found it to be perfect (4 yr old slept in the enclosed lanai off the master bdrm on the little couch, son on sofa bed in main room). Brought very little clothes and used the washer/dryer daily. We were on the 6th floor of the Moana Tower with an ocean view. We were there from 3/29 - 4/5 and the only downside to our trip was the 7 day WIND (several locals told me it was unusual to have so many consecutive days of strong winds....) So we spent more time in the wind protected pools vs the beach, but that was OK because my kids loved the water slide, the water falls and the FAMILY hot tubs (the pic of the pool above is very old. It's now the lagoon pool and has a sand bottom/beach, volleyball and bball & lots more rocks and plants). I'm attaching pool pics & video. On the calmer days the beach was great. We snorkeled and saw lots of cool fish (by the rocks). The lagoon is well protected so it's VERY calm. In fact, my kids (4 & 9) wanted some wave action so we asked the concierge for advise and she recommended Barber's Point and gave us written directions (5-10 min). Since I mentioned the concierge I'll take a moment to comment on how wonderful they were. Super nice and loaded with good info. When we asked about the North Shore she gave us GREAT INFO and directions on Waimea, Shark's Cove, Banzai Pipeline, Hale'iwa Village, etc (be sure to ask about the turtle basking spot. Very Cool!) We spoke with the concierge right away and obtained so much info we realized we didn't need to sit thru the boring "Monday Meeting" which describes all the possible excursions. As far as excursions go we did several. Fia Fia - the on-sight Luau and it was the first I'd ever been seen. The food was great (kid's option also - chicken tenders, mac & chs, etc). The chief was a great showman and really got the kids involved. I, personally, thought it ran a little long and wouldn't do it again but it should be done once ($220 for all 4 of us). The same Samoan Chief does the welcome event and that was a lot of fun too (kids liked it a lot). Star Gazing - on-site ($107 for the 4 of us) and it was pretty cool. My son loved it! The gentleman who ran it was great with kids and really knew his stuff (seeing Saturn was wild!). Whale Watching (w/out snorkeling) - I knew it was late in the season so the concierge suggested Hawaii Nautical because they give a voucher good for 2 years if you don't see a whale. We saw lots of dolphins but no whales so we had a fun boat ride and a voucher for next time ($200 for all of us). Koolina has lots of activities for kids and adults. My son got to make a cool warrior canoe (6") and my daughter painted a masterpiece on a coconut. If you have kids take the walk (or shuttle) to the JW for the FREE morning fish feeding. Kids loved it and they give away 5x7 laminated cards on lanyards w/pics of the local fish. At the Maze Hut (Lagoon Pool) you can check-out frisbees, horseshoes, bocce ball, etc. (Here's a secret- don't waste money on pool floats or sand toys... since nobody wants to pack them back they leave them at the pools and the staff puts them in an overflow bin on the e/side of the hut. EVERY morning I saw new tubes and sand toys left homeless....) The grills on-site are also very nice! I agree that a car is a must with the Costco, new Target, Safeway, restaurants a few off ramps away (cooked most our meals in the room. FYI - smoke alarms a VERY sensitive... sorry neighbors :-). We went to Pearl Harbor one day and, since we did the Arizona/Missouri a few years ago decided to check out the Bowfin. It's a WWII Submarine self tour that the we all found very interesting. God Bless Submariners!!! ($28 for all 4). We went to Waikiki one night and I was reminded why I hate it. Too many people! Back to the relative serenity of Ko'olina. Bottom Line - We had a fantastic family trip because Marriott Ko'olina is a fantastic resort with wonderful amenities and great staff. We can't wait to go back!!!
