If you're thinking about buying, our sales rep at Marriott ([--]) was fantastic and no pressure. We took weeks to finally decide. Soooo glad we did.

Reviews.Title: “Not for couples or singles”
Reviews.Author: hairly
Reviews.Content: I read many of the reviews here to get a feel of how others experience was at KoOlina. Some of the poor reviews should be thrown out, because it is obvious they were written before expansions were built. There are plenty of food options, from sandwiches to Chuck's Steakhouse all with great food. Housekeeping was inconsistent, but the room was always clean. We were there for almost 5 weeks and they came in every Wednesday to do an overhaul cleaning. My biggest complaint is that the floors never got washed, including before arrival. The rooms themselves are extremely roomy and comfortable., affording all the comforts of home and more. The beach is a man made lagoon, of which there are 4 of on the whole KoOlina property. There are 3 pools and 7 hot tubs, so you would think you would have some space. Not always so. The resort is on a remote side of the island, away from the city and nightlife. Consequently it is overrun by families of all sizes with kids of all ages. The pools are loud with kids constantly screaming for no reason except for the sake of making noise. Of the 7 hot tubs there is 1 designated to families with children, a few that 10-18 year olds need to have a parent and a few more adult only. None of this means anything as kids are in all of them, parents bring babies into the adult only ones and NEVER is there any monitoring of hotel staff to be sure that the rules are followed. There are 2 very nice side by side ones of which we tried to relax, while there were kids doing cannon balls on the adjoining. The beach which is open to the public has a few hundred lounge chairs of which are posted "for KoOlina guests only". Get out there early on the weekend, or you won't get a seat, because the locals take them up. Again no staff to monitor. The real kicker were the grills. Each building had a set of 6 grills, which were great. Apparently on weekends the hotel allows there staff to stay there at a very discounte rate. They come in, bring their extended families of about 25 people, completely take over a set of grills (3 grills to a set), line of the coolers, set up tables etc, while the kids run through the gardens back and forth to the pools, the "employees" are partying for hours, not allowing the paying guests access to them. Then they brag to the guests, some of which are owners, that they are staying there for $100. Very tacky and unprofessional. As a past Marriott employee, I was mortified and angry that the hotel allowed their employees to stay there. Other than all this, it really was a great resort, our room was on the mountain side, which was great because it was quiet. We stayed our last night on "ocean view" of which we could see the grills, and it was very loud. This is a great place for families with children, but if you are a couple looking to relax, not sure I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Vacation at Marriott Ko Olina”
Reviews.Author: JasminedogLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: Marriott Ko Olina Beach Club is a timeshare on the western shore of Oahu. As other reviewers have noted, a car is a must since the resort is about 30 minutes from the Honolulu Airport and about 45 minutes from Waikiki. The rooms come in a studio (with mini-kitchen and a sleeper sofa), a one-bedroom (with full kitchen and sleeper sofa in the living room), or two-bedroom units (highly recommended for families). In our opinion, the Marriott Ko Olina Beach Club is the best in Hawaii. Ko Olina is a master-planned community of residential housing, with four man-made lagoons fronting the ocean. The lagoons were designed to diminish the waves, making them ideal for snorkeling and swimming, but not for surfing (one should head to nearby Kalaeloa beach on Mamala Bay for some great surf known only to the locals). The various lagoons are home to a wide variety of fishes that feed in the lagoon (and therefore better than the over-visited Hanauma Bay near Waikiki). The Marriott Ko Olina Beach Club fronts onto the third of the four lagoons, while the JW Marriott Hotel and the under-construction Disney Hotel/Vacation Club resort share the first lagoon. The Paradise Cove Luau is also located in the Ko Olina resort, along with Roy’s restaurant in the golf clubhouse and a full yacht marina where we took advantage of the Ko Olina Catamaran snorkel tour (more on that to follow). A new shopping village similar to Whalers Village in Ka’anapali is also slated to open later this year. The resort access is guard-gated to only residents and guests at Ko Olina. In addition to fronting the beautiful third lagoon, the Marriott Ko Olina now has 3 of 4 timeshare towers completed, with 3 large and very beautifully designed swimming pools. One pool has a portion that has a very shallow sandy bottom ideal for little children, the pool closest to the beach is large and terraced for some great lounging in the water, and the newest pool has grottos, waterfalls, and a 100 foot indoor waterslide. The resort has the convenience of Oahu access, but none of the touristy Waikiki craziness and expense. The 45 minute commute to Waikiki is its advantage, not disadvantage since it is located on the uncrowded west side of Oahu. Yet 5 minutes away is the new community of Kapolei with the conveniences of inexpensive local restaurants, a Safeway, a K Mart, a brand new Costco, and an even newer Target (Hawaii’s first). Kapolei also had a multiplex movie theater and the Hawaiian Waters water park (neither of which we had time to try). But probably our best memory is being able to have the space and luxury in our 2 bedroom unit. We were assigned a room in the newest “Naia” Tower. The furnishings were brand new, the kitchen was fully stocked and well laid out, and the bathrooms and beds were luxurious. It truly was a home away from home (and even better). The pictures attached to this review will speak for themselves. On Tuesday night, we decided to check out the luau called Fia Fia. The star of the show is Chief Sielu Avea who was the star Samoan fire knife dancer at the Polynesian Cultural Center from 1981 to 2001. The Fia Fia Luau is his own show. At $78 per person, we initially thought it was more expensive than the nearby Paradise Cove luau. But afterwards, we concluded it was a far more intimate luau, a great set of performances, and a plentiful buffet luau … especially if you enjoy Kalua Pork, Teriyaki Beef, Mahi Mahi, and BBQ chicken. Correction to an earlier Trip Advisor review: The Tuesday night Fia Fia luau will cost you money, while the Monday night torch lighting ceremony is free. Some guests tried to view the Fia Fia luau show for free from the perimeter of the lawn area (since the show is on the grounds of the Marriott Ko Olina) or from the balcony of the lobby that looks off the grounds from a distance. But don’t be cheap with your spouse and family … the dinner and show are well worth paying for. To save some money, we also purchased breakfast and lunch groceries and cooked in, so therefore we did not try Kolohe’s or Chuck’s Steakhouse. But we did eat at the local chain Zippy’s in Kapolei for dinner and did a trek twice into Honolulu to meet up with my sister in law who was on business at the same time we were in Ko Olina. For a snorkeling and sailing experience we purchased tickets on the Ko Olina Cat, which launched from the nearby Ko Olina Marina about a block away. At $110 per person, it was expensive (includes lunch and beverages), but they guaranteed whale or dolphin sightings otherwise a second trip would be offered free. We snorkeled just up the Waianae coast near an ugly water treatment plant. But the warmth emanating from the plant causes algae to grow in abundance … meaning tons of fish feed here. It was the most fish we ever viewed in any island snorkel. No mammal sightings, and so the Ko Olina Cat guaranteed a free trip good for within the next 2 years to our family. A great deal which we will take advantage of when we revisit the Marriott Ko Olina in 2010.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: thc2009
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Ko Olina Beach Club about two weeks ago for five days. We were assigned a studio that faced the parking lot, but other than that, everything else was great. The property is beautiful and pleasant with lots of palm trees and flowers. Owners have access to a private beach right outside in the common area. It's just a very well-designed, clean, secluded beach area. There is a free shuttle that takes people to the Marriott Golf Club (where Roy's is located) close by and the Marriott Hotel about 2 minutes down the road. The restaurant at the hotel, Azul, is superb. If you request to sit outside, you are steps away from sting rays and small sharks (not sure what they are called) that roam around in a pool. The designs/architectures indoors and outdoors are beautiful and magnificent with huge white columns and lots of greeneries. The most important aspect , of course, is the food. It's excellent and very reasonably priced. Back to discussing the Marriott Ko Olina...The location is great. You are about 5-10 minutes away from Costco, Safeway and Long's Drugs. There is a huge shopping plaza in the same area. You can find lots of restaurants there, too. Yes, it's about 30 minutes away from downtown Honolulu, but it's not so bad. I guess if you prefer staying in a quieter area, it's a better choice. The only downside is the parking - it's like $20 some dollars a day for self parking.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Resort On Oahu Hands Down!”
Reviews.Author: vegaseaglesfan1
Reviews.Content: You can't get much better then this resort. From the villas that face the ocean to the service, this resort cannot be beat! We stayed in a gorgeous 1 bedroom villa overlooking one of Ko Olina's 4 lagoons. The villas themselves are probably around 1,000 sq feet for a 1 bedroom and feature a full kitchen with everything you need to make a perfect meal. They also feature a washer and dryer which comes in handy. There's a bathroom with a toilet, sink, and shower, then another bathroom with just a sink and oversized bathtub. The villa also has a small reading room with what I call a mini bed. Overall you can't beat these rooms, they have everything you need for your entire stay not to mention all the room you could ask for, and the balcony was a fairly good size featuring a table with two chairs and a lounger. You can't beat eating breakfast in the morning overlooking the ocean and also eating dinner watching the sunset. Talk about a romantic dinner! The resort has their own market which has a starbucks and sells some other food items as well as some grocery items. But your better off going to the Safeway just down the H1 freeway to save some $$$. During our stay we ate at Chuck's SteakHouse which had some pretty tasty steaks cooked to perfection and all meals include their salad bar which was average. Resort also features activities you can take part in from hula lessons and yoga to hawaiian style bowling. They also feature 3 pools and numerous jacuzzi's. And their beaches are great that's all you have to do is go down early and grab your chairs and put your hotel issued towel on them and don't have to worry about anyone taking your spot, it's great! Bottom line, if your looking for a secluded resort outside of Waikiki this is the place! They have it all here for you not to mention to superb service. Everyone from the valet and bellhops to groundscrew were super friendly and if you needed something they would help you. Awesome stay, we'll surely be staying here again in a few years.

Reviews.Title: “Best place in Oahu”
Reviews.Author: Faxgirl
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for a week in late February. I have traveled quite a bit and must say I was very impressed with this resort. The on-line pictures don't do it justice. The grounds were impeccable, the staff was very friendly and accommodating, the rooms were extremely comfortable and clean. We didn't even need the mid-week maid service; in fact, it saved us the hassle of worrying about any valuables left in the room while we were out. This resort is ideal for couples wanting a romantic, quiet vacation. It's also perfect for families with small children. The resort is huge and plenty of space to spread out. We didn't feel crowded at all. We reserved a Queen bed w/ Mountain View. We were pleasantly surprised to find a California King bed, sofa and kitchenette (small fridge, microwave, toaster, dishes for 2, coffee maker & even came with dish soap, sponge and paper towels). The water view would have been much nicer, but the mountain view wasn't bad. It overlooked the golf course and some housing developments at a distance. We save a lot of money by selecting a Mountain View. The marble counter tops in the kitchenette and bathroom were a nice touch. It's a gorgeous property! Guests have access to 4 lagoons for swimming and snorkeling. (You can buy snorkels at the Marketplace or local Wal-mart for cheaper than buying them in advance and packing them ~$29). The pools at this resort were very elaborate w/ waterfalls, a water slide and cabana bar service). Shaved ice was only $3 and cocktails available at the bar. Adult beverages and food is a bit pricey, but worth the splurge on vacation. We took a trip with Safe-way Foods on our first day to purchase breakfast foods, fresh fruit, drinks (including liquor), etc. We actually bought a small blender at Wal-mart to make our own frosty beverages. Much to our surprise, Wal-mart was also the best place for small token souvenirs. We didn't do a Luau because I'm vegetarian and they don't cater to non-meat eaters. Instead, we opted for the luau at the Polynesian Cultural Center. This resort is a timeshare property. If you have the opportunity to take the 90-minute preview - Go! You'll get to choose from a gift excursion (to name a few: catamaran snorkeling tour, whale/dolphin watching, sunset cocktail cruise). It doesn't take much to qualify for the timeshare preview and it was nice to tour the larger 2 BR units w/ full kitchen. We chose not to buy, but didn't feel any high pressure either. Everyone was incredibly friendly! Be sure to attend the activity preview at the beginning of the week and register for free door prize drawings. It gives you a taste of all amenities available during your stay. Fia Fia is a free show on the lawn mid-week. Pool towels are plentiful. There are at least 4-5 restaurants on the resort that you can charge to your room. The Marketplace sells Starbucks coffee and has a pre-packaged section stocked with goodies from Cheesecake Factory, Coldstone Ice cream (whole b-day cakes sold here), drinks, fruit/cheese, etc. The resort is in a more secluded area of the island, but this is a huge perk in my opinion. There certainly wasn't a lack of things to do. We ventured over to Waikiki to explore that for a day. As we walked through all of the famous 4/5 star hotels, we were even more appreciative of our luxurious accommodations at Ko Olina. We almost stayed at the JW Marriott which was nice, but not as nice as the Marriott Beach Club. We dined at one of the the JW Marriott's restaurants which overlooked the outdoor open shark tank. That was cool to watch! The Marriott Beach Club offers an ongoing complimentary shuttle service throughout the resort - it takes you to the JW Marriott, yacht club, and Roys Restaurant (highly recommended and extremely accommodating to vegetarians &/or special diets). The paved sidewalks are inviting if you're up for a stroll. Parking is tight, but you'll definitely need a car if you want to explore the island. Self-parking is charged to your room. When it's full, valet will park it for no extra charge. Be sure to double-check your bill at the end of you stay and request adjustment if necessary. Rent a car at the airport - I recommend bidding via Expedia. Do it in advance b/c car rentals do sell out (I was surprised!) All car rental co's have free shuttle pick-up from the airport (I was expecting ours would have a counter on-site, but it didn't). Check your home car insurance plan before you leave home to make sure the rental co doesn't scam you into buying extra insurance you don't need. We also packed our own portable Garmin Nuvi GPS which is very handy! We stayed Friday-Friday. Here's a sample itinerary that may be helpful. FRIDAY: check-in, trip to Safe-way Foods. Ask the produce staff rep to recommend some local fruits. The Hawaiian Gold pineapple is The Best! Much better than Dole. (Pssst... on your way back home, after you go through airport security you'll have time to shop at the airport gift shop. This is your only chance to buy a 3-pack pineapple to take home a taste of Hawaii. I wish we would have known!). SATURDAY: Visit timeshare concierge for Welcome Packet. Sign-up for 90-min preview later in the week. Explore resort. SUNDAY: If you plan to tour Pearl Harbor memorials, go early and pack snacks if you want to avoid buying mediocre food there. (You'll have to leave everything in the car. No purses or even diaper bags allowed - strictly enforced). Carry your wallet, camera, and a fleece with inside pockets if you get chilly early and have extra things you need to carry discreetly). We left the resort by 6:15am and got in line by 7am. The line grew by hundreds within a half hour - no joke! I'm not an early riser, but I was glad we took the advice of the concierge staff. USS Arizona tour is free. If you have time, I recommend taking a guided tour of the USS Missouri ship. It was pretty cool! These 2 tours took up the entire day, but it was worth it. MONDAY: Attend the free activity overview during the morning. Arrive early to get a seat and complimentary fruit juices/coffee/tea. Also register for free door prizes drawings. It gives you a taste of all amenities available during your stay. This would be a great day to enjoy the resort, take pictures at sunset, make reservations for dinner at Roy's (save room for desert). After dinner, take a dip in the hot tub while sipping on a frozen Mai Tai. TUESDAY: We set out for Polynesian Cultural Center. In the morning, stop by Dole Pineapple Plantation for the 1.5 hour tour. Buy your postcards and order a Whip desert (print coupons on-line before you go). Eat lunch there or pick out one of the food vendors along the beach road. While you're there, be sure to take time to pull off and park while you eat so you can watch the surfers. Keep your eyes peeled for whales in the distant see. Drive toward the Polynesian Cultural Center and plan to arrive between 2-3pm. There is a McDonald's next door in case you still need a quick snack. Don't get suckered into buying the higher priced VIP tickets or upgraded theatre seats - it's not worth the extra $. We ended arriving at PCC closer to 3:30 which meant we didn't have time for the IMAX which I was bummed about. Nonetheless, I'm not sure I don't think we would have wanted to stay for an entire full day. The luau buffet offered several vegetarian foods, but nothing spectacular. Hawaiians love there meat! Food was just okay - probably about the same as any luau, but without the adult beverages (PCP is alcohol-free). The purple poi rolls were my favorite - sweet like a potato roll. The night show was worth seeing! It's a pricey ticket, but you do get to see and learn a lot. Many gift shops to explore as well. WEDNESDAY: We went on the afternoon catamaran snorkel/dolphin tour. They gave us a free snorkel, provided lunch and 2 complimentary drink tickets (bring a little cash for tip - the service is worth it!). We Loved It! Take showers, grab a cocktail, and head down for the early evening free Fia Fia show on the lawn. Don't forget your raffle ticket they gave you in your welcome packet. THURSDAY: Take a drive on H-3 (the most scenic). Stop off at Hanama Bay (but I wouldn't bother paying to go down to the beach - you have better snorkeling at the resort). Been there, done that. Now drive toward Waikiki and stop off at some of the scenic spots along the way. If you want to see Waikiki, I recommend arriving and parking in time to avoid rush hour traffic b/t 3-7pm. Park, dine, shop, relax, explore the famous hotels like Ala Moana and Royal Hawaiian. You'll have an even greater appreciation for your decision to stay at Marriott Ko Olina Beach Club. The Hawaiian people are incredibly friendly. Have fun, wear sunscreen and enjoy your vacation. Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel (Rental Car a must)”
Reviews.Author: wbranch3
Reviews.Content: This was our 1st time in Hawaii. This timeshare was one of the nicest that I've stayed in. The staff and the other guests were VERY friendly. We didn't get any housekeeping services during our week stay, but we still enjoyed it. You need a rental car if you stay here. Most of the tours don't pick up here, so we had to drive to a location where they would pickup. We were traveling without our children, but looking around there were plenty of people with their children. We went to the Fia Fia show, and really enjoyed it. I can't wait to return with my family.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds, greate location”
Reviews.Author: hseifert24
Reviews.Content: This is a Marriott timeshare resort, we traded our week in Orlando for a week in a 2 bedroom unit. We stayed in the newly opened tower, with a mountain view. We were impressed by the size of the resort, the location was great with many pools and and ocean lagoon. The staff was very friendly and helpful, everything here was top notch. Very nice contrast to the city hustle-bustle of Waikiki. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Suprise”
Reviews.Author: StayStrong
Reviews.Content: This review is a little dated and is submitted now due to the fact that we've noticed that some of our digital images of this resort would complement others submitted by other guests. We first stayed at this resort in June 2007 arriving a few days early before we embarked on an inter-island cruise. We chose Ko Olina as we were a family of four with teenagers and wanted an alternative to booking two rooms on the Waikiki strip. We received a AAA rate that saved us a substantial amoujnt over booking two rooms elsewhwere. We arrived late at night and therefore had no issues with traffic or lines to check-in. Although it was night-time we knew we found something extraordinary. Our kids started to explore and scope out the resort resulting in a two thumbs up gesture. We were in a very comfortable modern one bedroom with a kitchen, dining and separate sleeping areas. We were lucky enough to land an ocean and pool view. The staff was friendly and courteous and our issue with an unworking ice maker was quickly resolved with a replacement refrigerator/freezer. The grounds were beautiful despite the on-going construction that we were aware of when we booked. Needless to say we are now owners of a two bedroom with a lock-off. Last year we traded our unit for a two bedroom at the Kaui Waiohai but since we flew in and our of Honolulu from the mainland we arranged to stay a couple of days at our home resort. We did more exploring on this trip and found nearby restaurants and shopping that was reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Not for Solo or Business Travelers”
Reviews.Author: Military_Traveler11
Reviews.Content: Sick of Waikiki and wanting a change, I stayed at Ko Olina for work in Mililani. This is a great place for families, but is not meant for business folks or solo travelers. The guest rooms (without kitchens) are tiny - smaller than normal hotel rooms. I had a view of a wall from my porch, and the layout of the buildings was inconvenient. There is no work space in the rooms. The fitness center was decent enough, and everyone was friendly - even though most were shilling timeshares. They ran out of parking one night, which was a hassle. Next time I stay, I'll bring my family...

Reviews.Title: “Overall, I would recommend Ko Olina.”
Reviews.Author: MH_Golfer
Reviews.Content: I went on the preview package deal with spouse, kids(age 6 and age 3), and the kids’ grandparents. I used Marriott points for the grandparents and we were able to put them in the lockout while we were in a 1 bedroom suite. The resort is very good – three building, three pools, six hot tubs, and well maintained grounds. The room was excellent – clean (no bugs as mentioned in previous reviews), fresh towels every day, excellent utensils in the kitchen, two flat screen TVs, and a DVD player. My favorite part of Ko Olina is the lagoons. Lagoon number 4 is not so good but the three others are excellent. The sand is soft; the water is clear and warm. Lagoon number 2 is the best for snorkeling. There is a Sports Authority about 10 minutes away that has good prices on flippers and snorkel equipment. Other thoughts: 1. The pool water was a bit cold. 2. Self parking is definitely a problem – there are not enough spaces and they fill up fast in the evening 3. There is no hand cream in the room. Shampoo, conditioner and soap – but no hand cream. 4. Jelly fish arrive 10 days after a full moon. It is unwise to go into the lagoons while the jelly fish are there. Yes, we lost a day to the jelly fish while we were there. 5. Don’t plan to go to Honolulu for dinner – the traffic is pretty nasty. The kids loved the hot tubs and the slide associated with the pool. There are lots of kids’ activities but most require a fee (~$5-$10). Having a kitchen in the room is excellent – makes breakfast, lunches and dinners in the room with the kids very easy. The resort is very kid friendly. The pools have lots of shallow sections for small children. The pull out couch was good enough for the kids but I don’t think I would have liked to sleep on it.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous resort with fantastic views and close proximity to shopping”
Reviews.Author: KayteeMaryland
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for six days and five nights at Marriott's Ko Olina Beach Club, and its pictures do not even do it justice. This resort is even more beautiful in person than any of the pictures I've seen online. The grounds are well-manicured and spread out over several acres, and its lagoon beaches are lovely. Ko Olina is close to a shopping area in Kapolei that has a Safeway, a large Starbucks, drugstore, several restaurants and fast food places, gas stations and other stores typically found in shopping plazas. In particular, we found the Hapa Grill a good place for lunch and dinner - it has a diverse menu and its prices are quite reasonable. The KOA Pancake House, which is located on the same side of the shopping plaza as the Hapa Grill, has fantastic pancakes and breakfast foods. There is another KOA Pancake House about ten miles down the road in Waipahu as well. Also in this shopping plaza is a Filipino place, I think it's called "En Fuego," or something similar: be warned - when you walk in, it looks like a once-abandoned butcher shop, and the pictures of food are somewhat unattractive to the typical American. In contrast to the somewhat "scary" atmosphere, our food was excellent. We wandered in for breakfast (after KOA, we decided to try another place for variety) and ordered their Hawaiian pancakes with a side of katsu (deep-fried chicken). The pancakes were fantastic! As far as Ko Olina itself, it is about 19 or 20 miles from Honolulu. The drive is no big deal, although traffic can get a little heavy going into the city, especially during rush hour. The resort has these expensive-looking modern grills that owners and guests use for grilling, which is a great option! There is a nice Marketplace that carries Coldstone cakes and assorted mini-mart type food. Although the food is obviously more expensive than if you went to a regular grocery store (and what hotel convenience store isn't?), it does have a good variety of unique gifts that are quite reasonably priced. Buy your groceries at Safeway, and you won't complain about indulging in some overpriced ice cream! We recommend also purchasing souvenirs not just from the Ko Olina Marketplace, but also from the ABC stores. There must be seven of these stores within every two block radius in downtown Honolulu, and they have a decent selection of souvenirs, quality and otherwise. Views from the North Shore are incredible and it's worth the hour drive to other side of the island from Ko Olina. Realize, however, that there are some areas of the North Shore that people who do not have much money inhabit. Everyone on the island is not wealthy. We visited Matsumoto's for shaved ice, which was very good but not worth the drive in itself. You can get good shaved ice anywhere on the island. In all, we do not regret having spent more time exploring the island than on resort property, but do wish we had a few more days there so we could have lazed around all day just at the resort. Its pools and hot tubs are artfully designed to appear as natural lagoons surrounded by stones. They are truly stunning and entirely enjoyable. The beach sand is lovely, soft and hot, and the waters are calm due to their protection from the surf in man-made lagoons that surround the resort. Staff were professional, friendly and actually enthusiastic in many cases. We never met an unpleasant person on staff, it was beautiful. Our room was well-maintained, kudos to the cleaning staff. Although the resort was filled with people, it was always quiet and serene in our building, and the grounds never seemed noisy or crowded in the least. We recommend Ko Olina to anyone who enjoys an aesthetically pleasing environment that is elegant, serene and beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Close to paradise”
Reviews.Author: SunnyboySoest
Reviews.Content: Yes, I was and am a Marriott fan, but you will become the same after a visit to the Ko Olina Beach Club. Friendly people, excellent room(s), the best bed ever had, elevator which seem to wait for you, splendid swimming pools, nice beach and a garden close to paradise. A weak point? May be the absence of a good breakfast service in the week-days. On the other hand after a 10 minutes walk we found a good breakfast at the nearby Marriott hotel. Playing golf was very expensive, but we did not have time for golf. If you have money you may want to buy a unit in the north-west side of the newest building; perfect view if you watch the coastline.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families with little ones”
Reviews.Author: Lechonita
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this resort for families traveling with young children. We brought our 20-month-old son for a week in January and he had so much fun. The beach is on a sheltered lagoon, so it doesn't get the pounding surf that is so common in Hawaii. There are tons of pools, including a huge wading pool with sand at one end. Our little guy just loved the water, sand, beach, and sun. We were very happy with our room. We had a one bedroom villa and it was quite comfortable and spacious. Having our own full kitchen made mealtimes with a little one much easier than trying to eat out several times a day. The resort provided us with a crib and highchair, which were nice extras. The room had a huge master suite that could be completely shut off from the living space. This was great because we put the crib in the living room, and then after our son's bedtime, we could retreat to the master suite and take a bath, watch TV, etc., without worrying about waking him. I am very picky about cleanliness and felt the room was very clean and the housekeeping service did a thorough job. We did have daily housekeeping, however, which I understand the timeshare owners do not get. The resort's grounds are beautiful and very well-maintained. We felt the resort staff was very polite, friendly, and helpful. This was our third trip to Hawaii, and we felt this resort had one of the best staffs we have encountered there. My only other comment would be about the location. It is definitely not for everyone. The Ko Olina Beach Club is in a gated resort area. That area is very nice, but it's a gated resort. Once you leave the resort, there is not much to do in the immediate area. The town nearby (Kapolei) has strip malls with a Safeway, drugstore, fast food, and so on, but it doesn't offer much fine dining or nightlife. That was fine with us because we have a toddler, but I would not recommend this location for young singles or couples without kids. Yes, it is fairly close to Honolulu, but unless you don't mind sitting in miserable traffic, you probably won't want to make many trips from this resort to Honolulu. Overall, we had a wonderful time here, and would recommend it to families looking for a peaceful beach getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort While on Oahu”
Reviews.Author: java27
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week long stay at Ko Olina and loved it! It's hard to find a place on Oahu that has all the peaceful, quiet, and beautiful beachfront amenities that you expect from a resort but away from all the craziness of Waikiki Beach. Short drive to all the great things to see, but we enjoyed coming back to the peacefulness of the resort. Staff was very friendly and helpful. They went out of their way everytime we needed something and provided a couple of good recommendations for food away from the resort. We stayed in one of the studios using Marriott points and found the room to be very clean and spacious (basically a normal hotel room). We had a good view of the ocean and we were on the 6th floor. The pools and lagoons were very spread out - it was full but did not feel crowded. We sat through the time share presentation to get free Marriott points and was not high pressure at all. Very professional - it is a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: JB33
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week long stay at the Beach Club. It was absolutely beautiful! The rooms were so nice and homey and the pools, beach, etc were fantastic. I will agree with others though that the housekeeping was horrible....We were there on invitation to purchase into the timeshare and those who do or who rent directly from the hotel ARE supposed to have daily cleaning service....owners or people who rent from owners do not. I found this out after we had sand all over the carpet for two days and called to have it vacuumed. The employee was shocked the floors/tables were not being cleaned daily. On a good note, the dishes were washed and towels were replaced every day, with only one day where they forgot to come completely and I had to call for service at 5pm...With this, my one and only complaint out of the way, everything else was great! We loved using the BBQ's and eating outside. We stocked up at Safeway on food and drinks and saved a lot of money that way. There are also daily activities everyday like Bingo, tattooing, etc, just check your newsletter when you check in. Another tip is that if you don't want to pack or buy floaties or sand buckets, check the corner by the lagoon pool hut first thing in the morning for stuff to use. People (us and two other families for sure) leave things behind for others to use. There is a free Ko Olina shuttle bus that you can take from the Beach Club to the Marina, Paradise Cove Luau, Roy's, and the JW Hotel. We used that for the Luau which was wonderful, and Roy's which is a can't miss! I tried the four fish sampler and my husband had the shrimp & scallops (both sooo delicious)! For our daughter they have a kids three course presentation which was so nice...quesadilla first, then fruit & veggie crudite, and a choice of several main dishes. She had a lot of fun with the service...she had her own waiter too! I thought the ambiance would be a little tropical, which it wasn't, but the food and service made up for that. Another must do is North Shore and maybe lunch at the beach restaurant of Turtle Bay...beautiful. Make sure to bring your snorkels and bathing suits. We didn't because it was raining at our hotel, but blue skies on North Shore. The JW has a shark/ray pond which is fun to see...We had an awful lunch there though. Horrible service and prices were too high for no view. All in the trip was great and we will definitely return again.

Reviews.Title: “Love Ko 'Olina Marriott”
Reviews.Author: beachbumchicago
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are owners at the Marriott Ko' Olina beach club. We think it is a great vacation destination. For all of you who complain, IT IS NOT A HOTEL!!! There is no room service and the housekeeping is not daily. Do you not research a vacation spot before you book to see what it includes? Do you not ask questions when you book your reservations? An yes, owners Should get special treatment at resorts when we have purchased there. Building 3 just opened the first of this year and with all new places there are growing pains.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Resort!!!”
Reviews.Author: TaylorLasvegas
Reviews.Content: This resort is absolutely amazing for all different types of people. It is very clean and has a great atomosphere! Has a kids pool, a few jacuzzis, regular pool, and is right on a private lagoon! What more could you ask for???

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend this property to anyone - very poor service”
Reviews.Author: Stevied888
Reviews.Content: Our first impression of the Marriott was there were an army of bellman that swoped down on our car and it wa sintimidating. That was were the staffing ended... First of all the description says this property has 210 rooms but Marriott lists it at 596. It is actually in 3 large high rise buildings. The pool areas are impressive and there are lots of waterfalls and 7 jacuzzis. We had a studio room which was ok for a short stay on the 15th floor. Most rooms have great views of the water, marina or mountains. . It was brand new but very poorly designed with no dinetet area and lots of wasted space. However that is where the kind words end. The property for being new had maintenance issues with the jacuzzis and elevators. The staff shortage first showed up at the front desk which had long lines the entire time we were there. It was raining during our stay so they had closed the restuarants. The only dining option was The Market Place convenience store which as a result was very picked over and had an express men of a hot dog $9, hamburger $10 fish sandwich $16. For a store for guests they actually had very little in room dining options. In addition to the restaurants being closed the bar was closed, the concierge /welcome center was closed,. the activity hut was closed, the pool bar was closed. The pool slide was closed. You see the trend. We chose to head off property to eat and found some nice restuarants. It was odd to be at a property in Hawaii that did not even have tropical drinks for guests. They must be having labor issues. Never have I stayed at a property this major that had no services available for their guests or owners. Presumably owners paid a lot of money for these timeshare units and boy are they not getting what they paid for at all! There are many hotel options on Oahu and in Hawaii as well as many timeshare options. Marriott is not at all competitive. They may have a beautiful pool and a brand new building but that is only a small part of what it is about.

Reviews.Title: “New Year's Week”
Reviews.Author: travelresearcher22
Reviews.Content: We bought a week from an owner on Craigslist for his Penthouse 2 bedroom unit. I would say that for the most part we really liked our experience. The resort is BEAUTIFUL and very well maintained. The lagoons are great for swimming and snorkeling. The resort was at 96% capacity but it felt quiet and peaceful even with the sold out numbers. There was always beach chairs available and loungers at the pool as well. We never had trouble waiting for anything(restaurants, valet, towel service or pool side waitress). We really liked that it was far way from the hoards of people and shopping mecca's at Waikiki. Being at this resort really felt like we were totally on vacation. From our penthouse unit, we saw whales going by daily and unlike the previous poster, a owner unit comes with some perks. First of all, parking is only $5 for Valet and free if you park yourself. The posh Cabanas at the beach are only $5 and you get discounts at the restaurants as well. So, try to rent a week directly from an owner. I would agree that the beachside restaurant is mediocre at best. We had dinner at Chuck's and although it was expensive the service was great, portions hearty and it was delicious. We did all our shopping at the Safeway about 2 miles down the road for the rest of our meals. There are also BBq's available. I would say that you really do need a car to get to the store or travel around the island. We did take a day to tool around Oahu. I would recommend Giovanni's shrimp shack on the Northside, the Arizona tour(but go really early like 6AM to get in or you will wait for hours), the Aviation Museum, and Hawaiian Fire Surf Lessons only about 10 min from the resort. Our older kids loved the surf lessons! We also did the Fia Fia Luau on site and it was great to have this experience without having to leave the resort. I would return again to this resort but only if I was in an owner unit and got the perks they offer for staying in one. It feels like to me that you are treated different if you are an owner. We felt like we got the VIP treatment from everyone who interacted with us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: davidnhollyminor
Reviews.Content: One of the best family vacations we have had. The location, the food, the lagoon.... Perfect. We started off each day at The breakfast buffet and ate so much we often did not need lunch. The lagoon was perfect for family time and relaxing. The man-made barriers kept the water nice and calm and perfect setting for little ones. For Marriott guests, the rafts, sea kayaks and other items were no charge. It was great spending time around the lagoon in the kayak checking out the crabs, the turtles and other wildlife. The pool is more of a large children's pool, so if you are looking for more, you might be disappointed. Around the Hotel their is a Sting Ray Pond which has daily feedings and a Shark Pond to let you observe the animals during the day. The Golf Course is very nice, but does not have the views or holes like Princeville or Kauai Lagoons. But it is always nice ot play golf on the islands Next door is Paradise Cove, which is the best Luau on the island in my opinion. It is worthwhile paying the upgrade to get better seating and the free drinks and you do not have to wait in line for food either. Ko Olina is away from Waikiki and all the touristy stuff, so don't expect that here. It is for relaxing and having fun. It is also not far from the North Shore and the greatness on that side of the island. Which is the best part of Oahu. I will be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, bad service and bad attitude”
Reviews.Author: Kaismommy
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our 7 day stay at Ko Olina Marriott. We were there from Christmas day to New Years day. First off, the beaches were beautiful. Property is well manicured and everything looks wonderful from the outside. Room: We got a 1 bedroom villa, which was really nice. The room was big and it was definitely nice to have a kitchen and washer/dryer in the room. We also have a 18 month old toddler, so having the bedroom and living room separated was nice, since he goes to bed at 7pm. Cleanliness: The housekeeping does not clean your room completely everyday. They mainly tidy up your bed, rinse off the bathrooms, put the dishes in the dishwasher and occasionally vacuum. Our first night, we found a broken glass on the carpet by the kitchen and immediately called housekeeping to get it vacuumed the next day. I was furious because our toddler was running around barefoot and he could have stepped on it. When I called housekeeping, they just acted all surprised and kind of acted dumb. The next day, I had to call again to get the housekeeping to show up ASAP to vacuum the room. It was not until I actually talked to the housekeeping person on the same floor, that they would actually vacuum the room. Food: FLY INFESTED RESTAURANT WITH HORRIBLE, OVERPRICED FOOD at Kolohe's. Seriously, it was Denny's quality food for 5 x the price. Also Marriott's website claim you can get breakfast, lunch and dinner at Kolohe's which is a mistake. They have breakfast buffets only on Fri, Sat and Sun. Which means, you are stuck with muffins and eggs from The Market Place or you have to cook your own food. Kolohe's don't open until 11am for lunch so you're pretty much screwed. (and forced to eat disgusting food) Service: The staff seem friendly at first but most have bad attitude or just act dumb. We had issues with our key cards not working the last 2 days. We had to go back and forth 3 times to get the door to open. Even when we call from our room to let them know that the door isn't working, they mention that they would send someone over and never did. Finally, we had to go down to the frost desk yet again and the lady there acts surprised and doesn't seem to recall that we just talked to her on the phone 30 min ago. Some of the concierge have attitude issues and were very unhelpful. When we called to arrange the hotel pick up at the airport, then called again to cancel, rather than them making the phone call to cancel, they gave us the phone number and told us to call and cancel on our own. Where is the customer service?? Price: They will seriously rip you off here if you don't have a car. Oh wait, even with a car, they will rip you off by charging you $26 per night to park. We didn't have a car at the beginning of our stay. The cab ride to safeway will cost you about $30 one way and if you use the transportation service they recommend (VIP service), they will charge you $42 one way just to go 5 min. So basically, you're stuck spending money at either Kolohe's or at the Market place if you try to cook your own food, or you will have to spend $60 just to get to Safeway on a cab. The Market Place only has things like eggs, cheese and milk if you want to cook anything. They have other minor things like can food and microwave popcorn, ketchup and mustard. Go to Safeway immediately and get some food, if you can. Or bring lots of food & household goods from home. We will never stay here again. Disney actually bought nearby property and will be building more resorts here. The beaches are beautiful and the water was calm so it's great for family with little kids. But if we ever come here again, I much rather stay at Disney's resort than Marriott Ko Olina. Don't waste your money here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort - Would Return”
Reviews.Author: af847
Reviews.Content: This is simply a great place to spend a week or two. The rooms are top quality, the staff is friendly and helpful and the grounds are immaculate. Well thought out, georgeous, everything thought of. Here are a few tips: on your way there, go to the Safeway two exits before Ko'Olina and get everything you need. The restaurants on the premisis are excellent but way overpriced. Still, treat yourself to the breakfast at the outdoor cafe. It's awesome. Bring your own snorkel gear or buy it at the mini mart in the main building. Beware of the time share pitches. You can buy what they're selling online for half of what they're asking. Just check. Do the catamaran boat trip. It's a great experience. You'll see dolphins. Enjoy your time!

Reviews.Title: “Fire half the people”
Reviews.Author: Worltravelah
Reviews.Content: I'm a Marriott Silver preferred member and I expect a lot from their properties. I had problems, and while most were addressed fairly promptly with courtesy, it's my opinion that they should not have happened at all. First my "ocean view" room looked out on a hillside and a high rise. I called the desk and they insisted that it WAS in an ocean view room. I actually started laughing because I could not see ANY water. Not even a pool. OK so with discussions from a manager, Mark, he "did me a favor" and did get me a room where I could see a sliver of water. The bell man never showed up to move my bags. I did it myself. After struggling for 2 nights in the new room on a sagging damp mattress with broken sides I did call the desk and they did send up a new one. But AGAIN: this should not have happened to begin with. When one is paying hundreds of dollars a night for a room, they should make sure the furnishings are top notch. The furnishings of these rooms are getting very tired. The room suffered from side to side as well as noise from above. When I called the desk for late checkout I was threatened with a 75 dollar fee and room key cut off. Bad attitude with a sing songy voice from Emily. I could not get into my room until 4 but they wanted me out by 10. In the end I won the argument. But when you are paying hundreds of dollars a night you should not be having such arguments, ESPECIALLY when in the end a late checkout WAS possible. You must rent a car to stay here. It';s an 80 dollar cab ride and there is no public transportation. Also you would be captive to their "company town" restaurants and Mini-Market paying extortionist prices for small crappy products. So they screw you for 27 dollar a night parking! Total rip off. Of course the pools appear nice and the beaches were immaculate. But that to me is to be EXPECTED. How would I fix this place? FIRE HALF THE PEOPLE. There are people with attitudes mulling around all over the place doing absolutely nothing. Put these people to work making a little free coffee for the guests in the lobby in the morning for example. Or fire them. Use the money you save from firing the idle staff to improve room quality and service.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding resort”
Reviews.Author: NJ-travelman
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review specifically to offset a previous review that panned this resort. My wife and I have two Marriott time share properties in Florida and Las Vegas. We traded one of our timeshares for a one-bedroom villa at the KoOlina resort. We really like Marriott because there is a consistent high quality to all of their resorts. KoOlina is no exception. First the service. We were welcomed graciously at the front door, the front desk and the valet who brought our luggage to our room. Each day we were greeted by every employee, whether passing in the hall, in the elevator or at any of the desks (front, consierge, pool side , valet or restaurants). The villa was equally impressive - a large bedroom with a comfortable king bed. The bedroom had it's own terrace (lanai) fwith a view of the mountains and down to the lagoon pool. The living room had a large pull out couch, two large chairs a TV and a wide terrace facing the ocean. The dining room sat 6. We were on the 8th floor at the end of the buiding and had catheral ceilings throughout the villa. The rooms had digital AC/Heat controls and also large ceiling fans - so we were able to keep the villa at a very comfortable temperature. There was a kitchen with granite countertops, side by side refridgerator, stove, microwave and dishwasher. The grounds are kept pristine. There are lagoons with fish, two swimming pools with a beach area for children. There is also a lagoon right on the ocean. It is shaped like a horseshoe with the narrow end by the ocean. The ocean waves break before coming into the lagoon so it is great for swimming, snorkeling, or just floating in the water. KoOlina is a full service resort that is at least a half hour by car from Honolulu. The good news is that it has everything onsite needed to have a great vacation. The bad news is that if you want to do sightseeing, the resort is a distance from everywhere. It took 45 minutes to drive to the North Shore where the surfing contests were (25-30 foot waves). Honolulu was a half hour drive without traffic. During the morning and evening rush hours, that time doubles - traffic is a nightmare. Waikiki Beach (40 minutes away) is worth the trip. It's the Rodeo Drive of Hawaii - you see people walking past stores in bikinis and carrying surf boards. At the KoOlina resort, we ate at Chuck's Steak and Seafood restaurant. There is an included salad bar that was so-so. My wife and I both had the sirloin steaks which were very good. There is a mushroom side order that I would highly recommend (whole mushrooms in a rich brown sauce). We also had lunch at the cafe on the beach - sitting at oceanside. Food was very good. Overall, KoOlina is a first class resort - with friendly, helpful staff and exceptional facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: AnotherOpinion
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently visited this resort and had a wonderful experience. This was our sixth trip to Hawaii and our first to Oahu. We chose this resort because we needed accommodations for a family of four and did not want to stay in Waikiki. We stayed in a beautifully decorated one bedroom "villa" which was just right for us. We had a full kitchen and an in-room washer and dryer which was most convenient. There are numerous outdoor barbecue grills that may be used by guests who so choose. The grounds are spacious and the beaches are sheltered which was perfect for the kids and adults alike. We also enjoyed the pools, which were lushly landscaped and kid-friendly. A plethora of daily on-site activities are listed, however we chose to explore the island on our own. The resort is about 30 minutes from the beautiful windward side of the island and 40 minutes from the north shore. Honolulu and Waikiki are about 35-40 minutes away, but beware heavy traffic at rush hour. We chose to dine in the room and at simple local restaurants and can recommend Hapa Grill, KOA pancake house, and L&L Drive Inn all about 10 minutes away for family fare. Everyone we met in the service industry was wonderful, from hotel staff to rental car staff to waitstaff at local restaurants. I would highly recommend this resort for a family vacation, particularly if you have a larger group of family and want to avoid the bustle and commercialism of Honolulu/Waikiki.

Reviews.Title: “If you enjoy this place you are part of the problem and blind”
Reviews.Author: krylena
Reviews.Content: I have read the reviews here and am astounded. Either the Marriott pays people to say nice things or there are more people out there that are elitists who are so blind that they can not see the seething underbelly of a company that utilizes practices where the staff are indentured servents. Perhaps the fake landscape and the piped in scents have eroded your humanity and you can not see that the staff are only nice to you because if they are not nice and as fake as the landscape then they will have to join the increasingly larger population of homeless lining the beaches. First, I do not trust the Marriott as there was a gimmick everytime we turned around. It started after I booked the trip and bought the plane ticket. I had purchased a package deal and was never told that there would be additional charges. In all, I was charged 25% of the package cost in additional charges. I couldn't do anything because I had already paid and bought the ticket. But it felt unfair. We get to HI and I will say that Ko Olina was beautiful, initially. Beautiful flora and pools, nice smells and decent rooms. The staff are absolutely wonderful and everything is taken care of. So that is the initial impression and the elitists that love that place and will go back again apparently were only capable of seeing that. Marriott is all about keeping all the money at the Marriott. If you do not book everything through the Conceirge then you will have to deal with the local people trying to make a buck (who can blame them) and pay even higher prices for a fake tour that has been so sanitized that you never get to take in the culture and ambiance of HI. Then we sat through the presentation which is not high pressure but asked to speak to a manager because we were astounded at the seediness of the Marriott. We sat down with a manager who said the following (I am not lying here and I was stunned). They do not like white people here on the island. We have built all these homeless shelters but they just won't go into them, they stay on the beaches and we are trying to push them further north. Stay away from the camps. I was so stunned and never before in my life have I been so ashamed at being white. This man came to HI, was part of the massive commercialization that has raised prices so high that the people of the Island can no longer afford to live in a home on their own island. This same man and the Marriott have convinced people of the Island that this indentured servitude is good for them because it gives them a job and benefits and if they do not do everything they are told then they will have nothing. That this man would think that I am part of his hatred and prejudice. After that we went to the "complimentary breakfast" the next day. Now first off, I have never stayed anywhere that the complimentary breakfast was not offered daily. Here it is Sunday and Monday. So we get our plates together and start to eat when the staff person comes to us and says that is the buffett and will be $13.99. I said the sign said it was on the first floor she said that was right but they had to move it. So I was offered the choice of paying or watching this food being thrown away. I was sickened by this cavilier attitude towards waste. I was already stunned that there isn't any recycling beng done. So we paid. Then the next day we saw the complimentary breakfast. People had to listen to a presentation to sell more stuff for over an hour so they could have a free half muffin and fruit with coffee and juice. With the Marriott, there is a catch for everything. They are slimy. Places like the Marriott take from the people and the land and give nothing back that does not serve them. Those who associate with this company are no different. One more thing, if you are as outraged as I am, please donate to a reputable charity in HI that serves the people of the Island and the many, many homeless that have resulted from white greed and avarice. Then I implore you to be as awakened as we were and support the homeless in your local community. It only takes a few bucks or a few hours and is a better way to spend time and money.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: care84bear
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ko'Olina September 29-October 4th, 2008. We purchased the vacation through a fund raising event on a whim so we weren't quite sure what were getting ourselves into. Other reviews on this resort were very helpful, so we thought we would return the favor. Bottom line, we had a great time and wished we could stay longer. Here are some more details: Facility: The grounds are beauitful. We enjoyed both pools and the shaved ice you can purchase at "The Maze" Hut. There is a nice walking path that runs along the lagoons and connects to the JW Marriott. Good for running or walking. Hotel Room: We stayed in a 1 room villa on the first floor. No view except a peek of the golf course over the wall. Not a big deal. We didn't spend a lot of time in the room anyway. The room iteself was awesome. It was big and luxurious for 2 people. There was a full kitchen, stocked with dishes, flatware, utensils, pots and pans etc. Everything you would need if you want to save some money on food and cook yourself. There was also a washer and dryer which was nice. They even have a "starter kit" filled with a box of detergent for one load. If you can upgrade to a villa from a lockout , I would highly recommend it. Con on the room: The pillows were a bit flat. Activities: We were given a chance to "pre-book" some activities before we arrived for a slight discounted price. We booked the "Fia Fia" luau and an afternoon snorkel trip on the Ko'Olina Cat. (Catamaran). The luau was fun and entertaining. Food was good. The Ko'Olina Cat was by far our favorite activity. We did it on our last day there and we would have gone on a second trip if we had time. The afternoon trip offers more of a chance to snorkel. We saw several sea turtles and lots of fish. The water was warm and the staff on the boat were great. They guarentee that you will see dolphins or you get to come back for free. We actually didnt see any, which they said is rare so we got a ticket for a free trip on the boat next time we come (good for 2 years). Food: We took a trip to Safeway (exit 1B on H1) and bought breakfast food and snacks to save a little money. We did eat at Chucks which was just ok for us. I ordered a steak and thought it was a little fatty. Salad bar was good. Our favorite was Roy's. The service and food were both excellent. Pricey but worth it. There are grills on the hotel grounds (nice ones) if you want to BBQ on your own. Misc. Rent a car. The hotel is 20-ish miles from the airport and if you want to do any sight seeing around the island you will need it. We made a day trip to the North Shore, saw Pearl Harbor, and went out to dinner one night in Waikiki (fun shopping there). Self Parking at the hotel costs $21 a day, more if you do valet. Watch your speed on the highways. Lots of cops out there and weird speed limits in places. If you want to take home chocolate covered macadamia nuts, try Walmart. There is one in Pearl City. They come in cases w/ 6 boxes each in them which was nice. We brought 2 cases home. We loved staying there and wished we had a few more days!

Reviews.Title: “Not as great as it used to be.”
Reviews.Author: cruzerd
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Marriott Ko Olina 3-4 times on an exchange from our Marriott in Palm Desert. When we first stayed there we thought it was amazing, unfortunately this time we were not as impressed.. Location: For many this is a negative, but I enjoy the remote location. It is close enough to go into Waikiki for dinner and an easy drive to the N shore. I love the lagoons and snorkeling. Check in: Quick and easy, bellman brought our bags to our room even though we opted for Self Park. Which leads me to parking…the spaces are so small even with a midsize car it was a squeeze and there isn’t a sufficient amount of parking spaces. Room: We were in a 2BR in the Kona (original) tower. It was a Penthouse; it had high ceilings and an extra balcony off the Master BR. The view was called Mountain, which was actually Marina and some of the power plant in the background. All in all the view was not bad. For some reason when I stay here, due to the layout, I feel like I am constantly walking around in circles! The 2BR is spacious, although sleeping 8 would IMO be a little tight. The beds are not as comfortable as they used to be and the pillows could use replacing. We also had a roach infestation, yes it is Hawaii and I can handle a few bugs but not larvae on the stove and floor…Engineering came and set bait but it took a few days before it did any good and even then we still found a couple of dead ones each morning…YUCK! My biggest pet peeve with this property is there are no screens on the windows and doors. In the weekly activity guide there is mention of mosquitoes and they ask you to keep doors closed, but with the trade winds blowing, I would really rather not sleep with the AC on. Marketplace: Convenient for snacks and prices on some basic groceries were not too bad. We bought the mug that gives you unlimited coffee, tea and sodas. I am an iced tea drinker so I refilled it constantly, plus you can take to Kolohe’s and have it refilled. We like iced coffee, so we would fill in the evening for the next morning. Dining: The prices for food and drinks at Kolohes have increased significantly in the last year or 2. But it is convenient and the food is pretty good. It is a great place for sunset and a mai tai. Mario makes great drinks, a couple of the other bartenders use well when the recipe calls for top shelf. We did not eat at Chucks. Roys is our favorite, yes it is pricey but you can do pretty well having appetizers and salad. The JW also has a few dining options which are pretty good. Pool and Beach: Didn’t use the pools at all this trip but spent most of our time at lagoon 3 or snorkeling 1 and 2. There were a lot of families and kids Sat-Mon but the rest of the week it felt less crowded. The construction was not a problem, the newest building looks to have some amazing views and a great pool. I think it is partially opening at the end of this year. This will not be our first choice for an exchange in the future, maybe if we could guarantee a Villa in the new building.

Reviews.Title: “Hawaii Hidden Paradise at Ko Olina”
Reviews.Author: trojans96
Reviews.Content: Every year we spend at least a couple of weeks vacationing in Hawaii. However, for the last couple of years we have discovered Ko Olina and have been staying there at the following properties: Marriott's Ko Olina Beach Club, JW Marriott Ihilani Resort. However, this year we discovered and stayed at the Ko Olina Beach Villas. The experience there was unmatched from any of the other properties that we have stayed at previously. We felt like we were staying at a luxurious vacation home of our own and not at a 500 sqft. hotel room. Our family really fell in love with the Ko Olina Beach Villas at Lagoon #2. The luxurious beach front property was just completed in 2008. The 1361 sqft. condo that we stayed in was magnificent. It has 2 master suites and 2 bathrooms. All of their beddings were Hotel Collections. You can check them out at stayatondo.com. We will definitely go back there again next year.

Reviews.Title: “To the naysayers...”
Reviews.Author: misplacedcajun
Reviews.Content: With some trepidation, we embarked on our 6 day-5 night tour of the Ko Olina resort. Trepidation was based on some of the reviews we read here on TripAdvisor. I don't know what some people expect from this type package, but we were extremely pleased. Comparing it to a previous "preview package" tour of the Marriott on Kauai, We don't hesitate recommending it. The staff was great, the room was more than adequate, and the entire facility was outstanding. Sure the meals on property were a little expensive, but what do you expect from a RESORT catering to people earing $100K/ year?? Besides, there were alternatives just a short drive away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: etprelude
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Oahu on Sunday and had a great time. We stayed at the Marriott Ko Olina resort in a mountain view room (actually a view of the golf course). We were very happy with our overall experience at the resort. The pools were nice, the lagoon was nice, the rooms were clean and comfortable. The only real negative from the entire experience was that the hotel was located on the westside of the island. We happened to enjoy visiting the beaches, eating, and doing most of our activities on the other side of the island. So if you don't mind driving, this location would be great. Recommended places to eat: Boots and Kimos (the best pancakes) Zippys Giovanni's Shrimp truck (great shrimp) Leonard's Bakery (great malasadas) Jimbo's (Udon and Japanese food) Gina's BBQ (cheap Korean BBQ To-Go) Dole Plantation (great Dole Whip ice cream) Tanioka's

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Resort”
Reviews.Author: scubadadSeattle
Reviews.Content: We Stayed at the Marriott's Ko Olina Beach Club August 16- 21st 2008. We loved it! My wife & I have 2 children ages 5 & 8. We stayed in a 1 bedroom villa "accessible" room on the 10th floor. We stayed in what is called Mountain View. We had views also of the marina which was nice. We had 2 full showers, one was a normal shower/ tub combo. I think you only get 2 full showers in the "accessible" room. 2 showers is great with a family of 4. We had a problem the 1st night with the AC. It kept kicking off & on all night. Which is very loud since the unit was in the bedroom. The next day we turned the AC to ON instead of AUTO. We then had no more problems with the AC. Our 5 yr. old slept in the reading nook area on the little yellow couch. She had plenty of room. We just used the bedding meant for the sofabed. Our 8 yr. old slept on the rollaway, which was free & we are not owners. The Marriott website says no rollaways allowed, but call the hotel directly & you will be able to get one. The kids both slept in the reading nook area. There is no curtains in that area so we hung a blanket on the window and kept the room divider open for ventilation. We went to the free torch lighting ceremony at the hotel. They only have it once a week on Tuesdays. We all had a great time. The show lasted about 45 minutes. We went snorkeling at lagoon 1 & 2 with 2 being our favorite. The water was much more clear at lagoon 2. We saw a decent amount of large fish & 1 turtle at lagoon 1 & 2. We rented a paddle boat at the hotel for 45 min. at a cost of $20. It was one of our kids favorite things to do. This is the best place we have ever taken the kids. We didn't love Oahu, but because of this resort we are planning a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort”
Reviews.Author: jlutzky
Reviews.Content: My family (wife and two daughters aged 9 & 6) spent a week at the Ko Olina resort. We were offered a time share deal (take the presentation for a low rate for 5 nights, 6 days). We upgraded to the one bedroom villa in the presentation. The room was great. We had a full kitchen that was well stocked, a dining room table that sat six, living room area for the kids to sleep in, a small sitting area that led into the bedroom which had a king sized bed. Everything was well decorated and plenty big enough for us. The kitchen came in handy. On the first night we went to the market and stocked up and avoided paying the usual high costs of breakfast and lunch at the resorts. Also, although we didn't use them they had grills for making steaks, burgers, etc. that were in the common areas. The resort itself was very nice. There are two pools, one with sand on one end which my younger daughter loved playing in. The lagoons are well protected making for easy swims. The lagoons are almost too well protected, since it doesn't feel like you're in the ocean. Our kids like playing in the waves, but there weren't any waves. There are two restaurants at the resort, Chuck's which is a steakhouse and Koheles (not sure I'm spelling that right). Chuck's was a pretty standard restaurant with steak and fish. Koheles has a buffet on Friday and Saturday night. The buffet was pretty standard (crab, prime rib, chicken, etc.) but one good thing they had for kids was a special kids table at the buffet with mac & cheese, chicken nuggets, PB&J and jello. We thought that was a nice touch. The Ko Olina area also has a Roy's at the golf course and a few restaurants at the JW Marriott. There's a shuttle that runs around the resort area which we took a couple times which comes in handy. Couple random items: Ko Olina is very isolated which has it's positives and negatives. We spent one day in Waikiki and it was just a big city with a nice beach but not very quiet. If you want to get away from everything, Ko Olina is a good option but if you want to be in the middle of everything this is not for you. This is very much a family resort. There were kids everywhere, so if you want to be at an adult resort again this is probably not the best place. The staff was very friendly and helpful at all times. The concierge helped with reservations for dinner and booked the Ko Olina Cat for a dinner sail which was great. Although there is construction next door on a new tower, the hotel is already done so we didn't hear anything the whole time we were there. There is some mild airplane noise (not in the rooms but outside). Both commercial and military jets seem to fly over quite a bit. We thought the resort was nice, and if you can live with the few items we mentioned you'll have a great time here. Since we're from LA we didn't find Oahu as nice as Maui (Oahu is a little two built up for our tastes for a tropical island), but this is a great option if you prefer oahu.

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely Visit”
Reviews.Author: mjjpower
Reviews.Content: We visited the resort after being offered a great rate back in October via the timeshare special. My husband and I left the children with family and did this trip to Oahu "childless!". When we first arrived we were checked in very quickly. I was so impressed with the valet parking...it is expensive ($25/day vs $20/day for self parking) but we always had our car when we requested and the valet parkers were always willing to carry up items to our room...they were so nice! The room itself was a 1 bedroom villa and it was gorgeous. We were on the 5th floor overlooking the pool. We could see a bit of the ocean as well. The grounds are spectacular and so much nicer than the JW Marriott hotel down the way. We rented a cabana one day which was a fabulous way to spend the day. They brought around little drinks of water and towelettes occasionally. I love the fact that you can leave the cabana, go back to your room for lunch etc and the cabana is always untouched and ready for you when you get back (no worries that it will be given away). We had dinner one night at Chucks and the service was incredible as was the food. We used our "marriott dollars" we were given for attending the timeshare presentation and it paid for our dinner ($100). The presentation in and of itself was fine. When we signed up for this trip in October I was working just about full time in the Mortgage Industry....we all know how well that is going right now, so we knew that buying a timeshare was not an option. Aaron was our presentor and he tried very hard to make the presentation pleasant even knowing full well that we would not be purchasing. It was not a hard sell but I did sense that his conversations with us were scripted or just over-used. I am sure it is not an easy job to sell these to people but he could have smiled more (if you are reading this Aaron....you have a great smile...you should share it!) and it would have made us and anyone sitting through one of these presentations relax a bit more. Oh well....it worked out just fine. My only complaints were the oceanside bar and grill left a lot to be desired. The drinks were extremely expensive and I really didn't think my Mai Tai was all that great. We ordered the combo appetizer plate and it was also not that tasty. Our waitress seemed a bit annoyed when we finished and asked for our check...she kept saying "are you sure you don't want another drink? You really want to leave????" . I loved everything else. Did I mention how friendly everyone was? Patrick down at the beach services booth gave us an awesome map and outlined a trip around the island for us..even giving us some great LOST scenes to check out (the TV show). He was kind enough to write his cell number down on the map in case we got lost or had any questions. The drive around the island ended up being one of our favorite memories of the trip. I highly recommend Lanikai beach....oh my gosh, we went on a week-day and there was nobody there...heaven on earth! Okay, I think I will sign off but I recommend the Ko'Olina to all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: ColumbusRail
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week at Ko Olina. We loved the resort and give it very high marks. The rooms (we had a 2 bedroom facing the pools and ocean on the 5th floor) are great -- very similar to other Marriott time shares but more spacious if anything. Check in was relatively easy. The valets were very good. Our room was not ready for about an hour but we went to the beach bar for lunch (okay not great). The pool areas are very nice (a bit crowded -- lots of people). The beach areas are very nice -- we really liked the lagoon that was one to the right as you look toward the ocean (much less crowded and better snorkeling). No waves to play in but a nice beach for relaxing. We had dinner at Chucks and thought it was very nice -- good food, great setting and very nice service -- better than some of the reviews we had read here. Towels are available but you must sign for them when you get them and when you return them. Great grills for fixing food. Grocery is about 5 miles away but you can run into traffic if you are not careful. I was shocked with the quality of Fia Fia and would strongly recommend this luau on every Tuesday night. Funny, entertaining and the food was good. I was not expecting such a quality show. Great sunsets -- wonderful photo opportunities every night. Nice walk to the Marriott hotel. Pretty grounds but a very small pool in our opinion. Overall, we thought the place was great and would not hesitate going back again if it weren't for the plane ride from Ohio.

Reviews.Title: “Wow ! My Family Loved It !”
Reviews.Author: azdawg
Reviews.Content: We just got back from this resort this morning. Wow ! We had such a great time. I went with my family which consists of a daughter 6 , a son 11 and a daughter 18. I got this time share week as a gift from one of our friends. ( nice friend) We stayed in a beautiful 2 room suite facing the pool. The suites had a large central dining area w/ a pull out sofa and two large seperate bedrooms. The suite had nice wood trim and high recessed ceilings. The staff was very friendly and helpful. This resort has one main beach lagoon with (chairs & cabanas) and two other lagoons leading down a path to a hotel on the same development, the JW Mariott. The grounds are landscaped with lush tropical plantings including a sizeable koi pond. Their are two large pools just outside the main lobby. One of the pools has a beach shallow end for small children . Nice. There are two restaurants onsite . Chucks ( pretty nice) with veiws of the ocean at sunset. The laggon , casual with even better veiws of the ocean. And I will say that the Mai Tai drink I had at the lagoon bar was the best drink I have ever had. Gotta try it. Anyway my kids loved it. It never seemed that crowed even at 100 % occupancy. We went on the sunset cruise w/ Koolina cat. We went on horseback rides at Turtle Bay, shopping at north shore , swam w/ the dolphins at sea life park , visited Pearl Harbor and snorkled in Hanauma Bay. Two great activities right at the resort were the Fia Fia Luah . ( Worth every cent) and my familys favorite activity the star gazer night. They actually brought full size telescopes down to the resort and showed my kids how to find stars and planets. ( We saw the rings of Saturn ) They are just finishing up the third tower with a new pool and swim up bar. If you have kids and want to to have a good time make this one of your stops. Even without children you will love it. My wife and I had such a good time we bought a three bedroom timeshare. Maybe one of these days we will go by ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Experience”
Reviews.Author: hawaiifam
Reviews.Content: From the moment we drove onto the property we were awed by the beauty of the grounds. The staff greeted us immediately and directed us to where we needed to go to check in. We had arrived a little early so our room was not quite ready but they stored our luggage and brought it to our room later. Our 1 and half year old son absolutely loved the childrens pool and all the open area to run around. Needless to say that our 1 bedroom villa had exceeded our expectations and was spotless.
