Even though there was construction going on it did not interfere at all with the tranquility of the property. This is definitely a fabulous place to come with children because of all the activities and it is just kid friendly. The cabanas on the beach are fabulous and are extremely reasonable. My husband and son loved to play in the lagoon while I relaxed in the sun. We are looking forward to going back soon.

Reviews.Title: “An Amazing Resort!”
Reviews.Author: HBteacher
Reviews.Content: The Ko Olina was wonderful! We went for our ten year anniversary and enjoyed every minute. We stayed in a one bedroom villa. The room was beautiful and clean. It is definitely a family resort and we didn't mind all the children in the pool and on the grounds. We will definitely bring our children back to visit. The restaurants were great, especially Chuck's. We also sat at the restaurant/bar a few nights and enjoyed that. The entertainment was superb. There is even an adult jacuzzi right by the entertainment. We enjoyed sitting in the jacuzzi with our drinks while listening to the live music. Very romantic! Although this is a family resort, it is very peaceful, relaxing, and worth every penny. The snorkeling in the lagoons is not the greatest, but we found amazing fish and turtles in the water at Shark's Cove in the north shore. Hanauma Bay is also great snorkeling. Great for first timers. We also paid for the Fia Fia Laua on Tuesday night. It was rained out, but they rescheduled for the next evening. It was so entertaining. I have seen a few laua's and this one was my favorite. We loved everything about this resort and we will definitely be back with our family. Can't Wait!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: To'ere
Reviews.Content: The Good- This is a timeshare condo style property that's managed by Marriott. The resort is new and the furnishings top notch. Now that we've gotten the "4 Seasons/Ritz Carlton" itch scratched (see previous reviews), we've found that our travel style really meshes nicely with a semi resort/semi condo style facility. We absolutely loved the full kitchen and washer/dryer in our extremely spacious unit. There is nothing like making a leisurely breakfast for the kids while we eased into our day. It's away from the hustle and bustle of downtown Honolulu/Waikiki, but seriously, it's less than a half hour drive to get to that part of town. We prefer to commute in to visit those areas and relax in our little paradise at Ko'Olina. The staff was not up to par with Four Seasons staff, but that's to be expected given this price point. None the less, almost every staff person we interacted with was very nice and helpful. We liked the kids pool, and now with Phase III of constuction under way, we understand that the water slide and lazy river is not too far off. As for dining, it's walking distance to some world class restaurants (Roys, Azul, etc.) but the price point for these is not for the faint of heart. For those who'd rather save their money for activities, there is a neighborhood strip mall about 3 miles away that has everything from fast food to some decent restaurants that cater more to the locals than to tourists. But the prices are great (1/4 what you'd pay at the resorts), and the food was seriously good. There's also a supermarket so that you can stock up your kitchen with the essentials (think beer, water, snack foods, fruits, etc.) Parking is very convenient. Self parking is very near and they also do valet if you are so inclined. We've been coming to the Ko'Olina resort area for years because of the wonderful lagoons. If you have small children, this is a "must visit" location on Oahu. We're talking perfect lagoons without waves! If your kids are a little older, there are some good beaches to visit that are just a short drive away. The Bad- The restaurants directly on property still need a little work. The little grill by Lagoon 3 is good, but the prices are a little steep for what you get. Not bad for lunch. We didn't go to Chuck's steak and seafood so I can't comment on that. Pool service also needs a little work. After watching the scene for some time, I came to realize that because there are so many families, there tends to be very little heavy drinking going on. So if you're far away from the bar, it does take some time for the server to get to you, if at all. This was easily remedied with a nice tip after our first round. After that, we saw the server quite frequently. The Ugly- I think I still need to get used to the Condo style of chamber service/housekeeping. Our housekeeping service was very late in coming on two days so we passed (kids were sleeping). We could have complained, but we were so happy with everything else that I was mellowed out anyway so no big deal. She took out our garbage and gave us fresh towels. Conclusion - We've been doing the lavish vacations for about 6 years now and are starting to scale back a little. We still like luxery and fine appointments, but we could do without the snobbery and stratospheric restaurant prices. We'll gladly pay high prices for high value (e.g., superb dining experience, fantastic foods, etc.), but not for something that's simply a hotel cafe (as we found in some of the more expensive resorts.) We found that the Marriott has created something here that hit us just right. We had tons of space for our growing family (1 bedroom villa), still had some "wow" factor in the room appointments and resort amenities, and had a kitchen and washer/dryer. We will definitely be back in the years to come. I think this is now my favorite vacation destination hands down.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Family Resort”
Reviews.Author: ma2va2fl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Ko'Olina resort in in June of 2008 and absolutely loved it! My parents are owners there and they gave us their week to enjoy. It was so beautiful. The rooms were large, clean and luxurious. I loved being greeted at the door during check in. We were asked to go to the Welcome center where we were greeted with Lei's and information on things to do at the resort. The resort has every activity you would want to do in Hawaii. The resort also has some nice restaurants. We walked down to the JW Marriott near the Lagoon and ate at the Seafood Buffett that they have each Saturday night. It was wonderful. We have 3 children ranging from 6-13. All of them just loved this vacation. We would definetly recommend families staying here. I'll post some pictures - check them out if you get the chance. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Will Definitely Go Back!!!”
Reviews.Author: Troyp28
Reviews.Content: As a Marriott Vacation Club International Resort owner, we were very happy to have booked at Ko Olina Beach Club. I can't say enough about how awesome this place is. It was just my wife and I celebrating our 10 year anniversary. The room, grounds, beach/lagoon area, and total resort ammenities are great. We loved getting a good lunch and a number of Mai Tai's at Kolohe's bar and grill which is right on the beach. Chucks Seafood and Steaks is also very good and prices were not bad. I like the walkway that goes around all four lagoons in Ko Olina. One way is a mile and a half walk, and was perfect for walking off dinner, or going to explore one of the other lagoons. The JW Marriott is at the other end of the walkway and has several great restaurants. If you like sushi, then Ushio Tei at the JW is a must. There was still some construction going on, but we barely even noticed it. The staff at the resort was great, and you cannot miss the "luau" on Tuesdays called Fia Fia. I say "luau" but it's more of an education show/dinner about Hawaii, and was different than any other kind of luau I'd witnessed. It started at 4:30 and didn't end until 9:30pm. That may seem long, but the time flew by. You will definitely be entertained, and will laugh a lot. I enjoyed this resort so much, we considering going again next year. This may become a tradition with us.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay Despite Rain”
Reviews.Author: cherylkm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ko Olina in December 2007 (Sorry for the late review). Unfortunately we had three days of rain and clouds so we could not fully enjoy the resort and all it had to offer. Ko Olina was very far from Honolulu and Waikiki but that was one of the reasons that we chose it. We wanted to experience Oahu but without the hustle and bustle of the city. Because of the rain, there was little to do around the resort so we did do a far bit of driving into the city to keep us busy. If it would have been sunny we would have taken advantage of the beautiful pool and lagoons on the property and probably would not have left much. We stayed in a mountain view penthouse which was a very nice room and large bathroom. There was a small welcome gift box that offerred a variety of items including popcorn, sample detergent, etc. We did eat at the pool side restaurant, Kolohe's, for the breakfast buffet and once for dinner. The breakfast buffet was pricy but the omelet station was delicious and we ate enough that we did need to eat lunch. We also ate at the steakhouse which was also expensive but good. The small marketplace at the resort also had a variety of snacks and drinks as well anything you may have forgotten at home. The property was well maintained but I was a bit disappointed with some of the ponds. Maybe once all the construction is completed they will fill them with Koi. The construction was not an issue during our stay. We did not hear it or really see it but it was just days after Christmas and rained the entire stay. The pool was nice although too cold during our stay to use. We did use the hot tubs several times. The JW is the neighbor property and a nice stroll down a beach side path. They had sting rays and beautiful fish in their ponds and were worth the walk to see. Overall, a great property! We would have liked it more if our weather was better. Oahu was not our favorite Hawaiian island but if we return in the future we would choose this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Time Share Promotion Worth It! Great time!”
Reviews.Author: ARyan28
Reviews.Content: We are couple in our late 20's and just returned from a 6 day/ 5 night stay at Ko Olina. We were traveling for the purposes of relaxation and were less interested with night life and sightseeing, although we did make it to a few places. Overall, we were very impressed with Ko Olina, I'm hoping this review will be helpful Rooms: We stayed in the guest room which is the lock off portion of a time share unit. We were traveling on a time share promotion and while it is sometimes possible to upgrade to the one bedroom unit, we were unable to do this. The lock of portion of the unit was just fine. It was spacious, with a queen size bed, seating area wtih couch, end tables, coffee table, chair and TV. There was also a balcony. While you probably won't get an ocean view with this promotion, ask for a room facing some greenery, because "mountain view" may mean you overlook a parking lot. The beds have a plush down comforter, decent sheets and plenty of pillows. Very comfy. There is also a small kitchen type area with a refridgerator, microwave, toaster, coffee maker and silverware,bottle opener, etc. There are also glass plates, paper towels, etc. The bathroom is a nice size with a curved shower rod for more space in the shower. Food: Everything is VERY expensive in Hawaii. There is a very limited selection of dining options at Ko Olina. There is a beach side grill (Kolohes), a steak and seafood restaurant (Chucks), a Roy's across the other side of the resort near the golfing, and Azul, fancy/upscale pricy restaurant at the Marriott Ilihani down the way. Our best meal was by far the breakfast buffett offered at Kolohes each morning from 7-10am or so. Its all you can eat for 17.50 and has made to order omelettes, oatmeal, fresh fruit, granola, yogurt, waffles with fruit toppings, scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage patties, pastries, bagels, you name it. This was delicious. We also tried the standard Kolohes dinner food and it was okay. Kolohes has an all you can eat buffett on Fri/Sat evenings with crab legs, prime rib, pork tenderloin, lobster pasta, desserts, etc. This was 37 dollars a person, and it was good, but we enjoyed the breakfast more. After our few meals, we went to the local Safeway and stocked up with groceries for the room. We had plenty of room in our fridge for groceries and there are cabinets to store food. This is a great way to travel on a budget b/c dining out at Ko Olina is not cheap. We also tried Duke's in Waikiki - this was delicious, and you must go to Leonard's Bakery in Waikiki to try the Malasadas (a donut), out of this world! Beach/Pool: Ko Olina has several ocean lagoons (4), we spent most of our time at number 3 as this is where the most activity is. There are beach toys for rental such as snorkel equipment, boogie boards, peddle boats, etc. The beach is well maintained and very pretty. Compared to the Caribbean, it is not nearly as pretty, but the water was clear, sand soft, and its very scenic with the rock piles out at sea. Great place for kids to swim as it is roped off before you get out too far into the ocean and the waters are very calm, no waves. There were always plenty of chairs but no shade. If you walk to lagoon 2 nearer the Ilihani, there are some standing umbrella type things on their beach for shade. You can use any of the four lagoons so I recommended checking them all out as some are more quiet than others. The water was just right. As for the pool, the kids seemed to love it. No slides or anything yet, but I hear that is in the plans. Service: The staff at Ko Olina are friendly and the service was well above average, it was super. Everyone was kind and willing tto help. The concierges went above and beyond to give you directions and assist with planning activities. Activities: On Monday night the hotel held a Mai Tai party on the lawn (tickets were given for free at check it), this was great. A time for the guests to mingle, good drinks, and they had BBQ pork sandwhiches and snacks. We also visited the North Shore (I was not impressed) and the Dole Plantation. If you are a pineapple fan, you must visit. This was unique and fun. We went into Waikiki for a day, the beach is crystal blue, and looks quite different from the waters at Ko Olina, very big waves, lots of surfers and sight seeing. Its crowded, but worth a visit to the beach and restaurants on the strip. Once you park, you can walk to just about everything. Overall, we had a great time. Ko Olina is secluded and not much going on at night, but a short drive to Waikiki will offer more to do if that's what you are looking for. The sales presentation was low pressure and didn't hurt our trip one bit, no big deal. The grounds are beautiful and I liked this hotel much better than the Ilhani (we just visited it for a bit while walking), but ours felt newer and the pool was much nicer for kids. Take walk to the Ilihani and check out the huge sting rays in their waters inside the resort, very cool. As for the construction, we did not notice it. I'd be happy to answer questions. Enjoy your trip!

Reviews.Title: “Had a nice time at Ko Olina”
Reviews.Author: campbejuSacramento
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ko Olina for one week in May. We enjoyed our stayed. The villas were clean, spacious, and very updated. The view from our 2 bedroom was of the ocean and the construction noise you could barely hear. The food at the resort wasn't as good as what we've had at the Maui Ocean Club, it was overpriced but edible. The staff at times was friendly and at other times noticed guests arguing with the staff and we had some issues as well. Please note there are lagoons by this property and not tons of beach and ocean. As well, you are a little isolated. There is the hotel next door with a great restaurant and a Roys, but if you don't want to eat there, you'll need a car. We did both. Overall, I would reccommend staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Ko Olina Beach Club”
Reviews.Author: jajl
Reviews.Content: We exchanged our timeshare for a week there and were treated so well!! We only had a lockout, so for 2 adults, a 7 yr old & 1 yr old it was tight, but, we only were in the room for naps or sleep. Our first few nights the people next to us knocked on the wall b/c our kids woke up at 4am Hawaiian time...oops, time zone adjustment. Beautiful grounds, clean, nice staff, restaurants a bit pricey but good food, fabulous location if you want peace & quiet from Honolulu. Everything on the island was easily accessible. Would love to exchange for a week there again. Truly paradise!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: close2homer
Reviews.Content: We took our 18 mth old out there for 5 days- we had a 1 bedroom condo with kitchen- was excellent! prices were a little high for kids meals- but overall was great- the pools were wonderful for relaxing and for little kids- much of the pool is wide levels- some very shallow- great for little ones to wade in. there were kids activities daily by the pool with the beach.... the golf pro shop was incredible, as was roys- the walk to the Spa next door was beautiful with the lagoons- loved it. one of the lagoons was where that hawaiian hotel show (North Shore) was filmed a few yrs back- the place is just peaceful and there's plenty of places to walk- staff was very very nice- and it was wonderful for my daughter as well. one night i wasnt feeling well- they opened up the store downstairs for my husband so he could get whatever it was he needed for me- I will def. go back.

Reviews.Title: “Still a great place to stay...”
Reviews.Author: CharlieD3
Reviews.Content: I have read the recent reviews posted by others. While I agree that the key situation (door and parking access is problematic) it is hardly a reason not to stay here. Regarding construction, yes, there is construction going on but that fact is well communicated and they do the best they can to keep it to reasonable hours. The third building will open in January of 2009 and construction will start on the fourth one shortly thereafter. There are other properties (not owned by Marriott) where construction will soon strat this and may in fact lessen the view from some units. But the real view is at the beach and not in a room. Regardng children, it's a timeshare resort so one should expect children. If they are "out of line" call the front desk. That has always worked for me. And yes, it's in the boonies about an hour and 15 minutes to downtown. That's another think I like about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch family resort...not so great location”
Reviews.Author: kitty55
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 1BR master suite on a 5-day preview package and it was well worth the cost. The unit was large, well maintained and clean, the resort grounds & pools are very nice, and the lagoons (although man-made) are beautiful and uncrowded. The service was excellent, from the first time we were greeted by the attendant who parked our car while we checked in, to the employee who printed out our boarding passes on our last night because I was having trouble with the online print service. My main complaint is that they charge you for parking ($20/day), and a car is necessary due to the remote location. It's not like you're in the middle of a city and space/parking is at a premium. My second complaint is the lack of restaurants in the area. There are two onsite: Chucks which was horrible, and Kolohe's which was fine. There is a Roys at the golf course (which we didn't try) and some more upscale choices at the JW Marriott (walking distance along the lagoon path). The only places we could find in the nearby town of Kapolei were chains or fast food. There is also a Safeway and Longs which are good to stock up on supplies, especially if you want to cook. A timeshare presentation was required for our package but it was very professional and lasted less than an hour. Our sales person did say that there is a plan for a shopping village with restaurants to be built at some point in the future. The new Disney property will offer alternatives as well, but ground has not even been broken yet. It will also create more crowds, but hopefully it won't ruin the atmosphere!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: nhinnen
Reviews.Content: This is a nice place to stay. The view is not perfect and there is a lot of construction going on, but it was still comfortable. The bay areas were nice and the snorkling there was also pretty good. Walking along the beach during sunset was the best.

Reviews.Title: “Love It!!”
Reviews.Author: LeiOlina
Reviews.Content: Ko Olina is absolutely topnotch! I originally went in 2006, back again December 2006, took my son's family in 2007, and back again in March 2008 with my best friend. Each and every time we experienced excellent service and loved the amenities. It is also a timeshare resort for Marriott and I bought in 2006 and again in 2008. I worked with Sean O'Reilly and he is really the best. If you go, be sure to do the timeshare presentation with him (ask for him) and get a really neat gift/activity. Tell him Loris sent you! There are 4 protected lagoons on the entire complex with a lovely walking trail winding along the shoreline. It's a very easy walk on a wide paved path--wheel chair accessible. The entire complex is gated and you feel very secure. The lagoons provide good snorkling and swimming. The pools are gorgeous, much nicer than the photo on the website showed in March. There are wonderful hibiscus everywhere, orchids in the palms, plumeria, and so much more. One of the pools has a nifty sandy area at one end that is very shallow and good for even the smallest tots. There are some great activities for kids and a wonderful show called Fia Fia you will love. Early in the week there is a juice punch/mai tai/snacks evening activity to get you familiarized with the resort and give you a taste of the Fia Fia show. This is free and a must go. Another new building with an incredible pool for kids and kids at heart opens in 2008. I can hardly wait to take my grandkids back! The six of us fit very nicely in the main unit with a fold out couch in the living room, a king bedroom and the two little ones in an enclosed lanai type area. It was very spacious and the large kitchen/laundry area was great with the youngsters. We barbequed outside at the gas grills several times and ate at the picnic area. The weather is better at this end of the island than it is in Honolulu. Not so cloudy when there are clouds in Honolulu and gentle evening breezes. There is nightly live music at the beachside grill and even a few dancers on some nights. It is not a long drive into Honolulu if you want to sample the nightlife or go to a restaurant there. But, there is plenty right there at the resort with Ko Olina and the Ihilani just down the trail. I much prefer Ko Olina to the JW Marriott Ihilani (or is it Ilihana?). There is a much better "ohana" (family) at Ko Olina. The JW is a little hotsie totsie for me but great for a nice walk or a fancy night out. Ko Olina just has a friendlier feel and most people are ready to chat for a while or joke around in the elevator or at the grill. The flea market at the stadium is easy to get to and much more fun than the International Marketplace in Honolulu. It just isn't as neat anymore and prices are much better at the flea market. Freeways to all points of the island are easy to get to. It is really the best location. Hope you go and say Hi to Sean for me! Loris

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: KatySeattleWA
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to get a room at the Ko Olina through a mail offer. We paid extra and ungraded in advance to a room with a full kitchen. It was actually like a very nice condo. Full kitchen, fridge, dishwasher, dishes, washer and dryer, dining room, front room, separate king bed in bedroom, and bathtub and shower. Did I mention the awesome deck with table and chairs. We were in the tower with the main lobby and store. Our room looked out at the pool areas. We did not even use the pools. The kids spent all the time at the wonderful lagoons. There are a few lagoons and they were never full. We went over Easter and the resort never seemed full. If you are looking for an awesome place on Oahu, this is it. We found a Safeway just a mile or so down the road and did a lot of our cooking on our own. I read many complained that the evenings lacked options for entertainment. This is not Waikiki, but that was not what we were looking for. It was so incredible, if you are looking for a peaceful, stressfree holiday, book this one now. I highly suggest you upgrade to the full condo unit. The kids loved the shave ice available daily, the hottub and of course the awesome , clean beach.

Reviews.Title: “Remote, not the "real" Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: cookswithpassion
Reviews.Content: I visited this property as part of a timeshare presentation. It's apparently nice for families with kids because of the variety of pools, but it is "remote" and not in a lush, green environment like one would expect in the Hawaiian islands. I was travelling by myself, and was bored here. It was dangerous to spend more than 3 hrs in the sun due to it's intensity, and after that, there's not much to do. The location does seem commercialized, and in my opinion, it lacked the character and personality of the other Hawaiian islands. I went to Kauai for two days after this trip, and totally felt then like I was in the "real" Hawaii.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort!!!”
Reviews.Author: sithdent
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at the MVCI Ko Olina. We own in Aruba and were able to trade for the exact time we needed! The resort is about 20 miles from Waikiki and about 15 miles from the airport. It's pretty much a straight shot down H1 to get there - anyone can handle it. Yeah, there's some traffic in Honolulu, but we managed ok. It was just my wife, me and my 21 month old daughter on this trip. We had a one bedroom, which was plenty of space to spread out. In fact, there was a small room off of the master bedroom which also had access to the living room that served as an excellent place to put the crib for my daughter! It was perfect so that once she went to bed, we could be in the bedroom, living room, or both/either and not disturb her. The room was furnished very nicely. I think the resort is about 5 years old and we stayed in the oldest tower. Either the room was recently renovated or there is no wear to speak of. We asked and were lucky enough to be moved from a third floor room right above the designated smoker's area to the 6th floor (of 14) at the end. We could see the sunrise AND sunset. Awesome! The pools were nice (a bit cold perhaps?) and there is a zero entry kids pool with a sand like substance that many kids loved (mine didn't). We stayed March 8-16, the week before Easter week and we never had to look for more than a few minutes for a good spot under an umbrella at either of the pools. Same story at the Lagoon. There are also 4 hot tubs at the resort, one for adults only, one for younger kids, and 2 where both kids and adults are allowed. We only ate at the poolside restaurant, which was typical resort: limited choices, expensive, but good enough food. We are vegetarians and the choices were limited for us. We're used to that, though. The lagoons near the resort and surrounding areas are nice - but very man made. If you love nature, this will seemed contrived and "Americanized". But to get an area where one can swim, snorkel, etc on this part of the island, it was necessary. I didn't spend much time there as my daughter preferred the pool. There is a 3-4 mile paved walking path near this lagoon, though, that was excellent. Walking, strollers, jogging are all easily done. It feels safe, secure and very very pleasant as the grounds are well maintained and the ocean is within shouting distance. It was one of the best parts of the resort, in my opinion. There was construction during our stay, but it honestly did not affect us one bit. When we bought our timeshare in Aruba in late 2006, there was construction there. It was not a problem but was more intrusive in Aruba than Ko Olina. There was also a shopping center about 3 miles away where there was everything you'd need from a small selection of restaurants, pharmacy and a grocery store. Bottom line, this is a very comfortable, Americanized, "safe" resort. If you like the Marriott properties and the things they do best, you'll like this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort out in the boonies”
Reviews.Author: ksassy
Reviews.Content: The Ko'Olina is a nice resort with man-made lagoons for swimming and OK snorkelling. Smallish pools but lots of chairs at the pools and by the ocean. Also a nice walkway along the beach. We were aware of the construction but it really wasn't too noisy when we visited but did drown out the lovely sound of the ocean. The neighboring refinery also diminishes the ambiance. The rooms are very nice and spacious and although I generally don't like to cook when I am on vacation, the kitchen is very user friendly. It is a good resort if you mainly want to stay where you are and enjoy the sun. Dining options are quite limited including the surrounding towns and it is 20-30 minutes to the airport and much longer to Waikiki depending on traffic, which seems to be worse every year. I would not stay at this resort again mainly because of the location. It is just too far from the great restaurants and sites downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation at the Ko Olina”
Reviews.Author: boysmom2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ko Olina from 2/9 through 2/16. We had a great time. Exchanged through Interval to stay there. I'm a little confused reading the negative reviews. We found the room(s) spacious, clean, beautiful and we loved the sitting area off of the master bedroom. Who cares what the purpose is, it's great! I actually used it to read a little while my husband was still sleeping and the kids were sleeping in the living room (in-laws took the 2nd bedroom). I was able to close the doors to the sitting area shutting off the living room and the master and had the little room to myself to curl up on the huge seat and read in peace. The resort was a good size. It was at 100% capacity, but it didn't feel like it. There was plenty of room at the pool and the beach. The beach is beautiful. The lagoons keep the waves away and it's easy for the kids to splash around without worrying. As for restaurants, this is where I feel it lacks. There are only 2 on the grounds, unless you walk up the beach walk 1.5 miles to the hotel, they have 4 or 5. The 2 restaurants are Koelho's (good breakfast buffet), the Fri & Sat Prime Rib & Seafood buffet can't be missed...great crab legs and lots of other dishes to choose from. Chuck's Steak House is the other. This was just OK. Nothing to write home about. With the construction going, they will be adding more restaurants and some shopping. The construction was not distracting at all to us during the day. You hear in the background some beeping and the hum of the machines, but there's no loud banging or anything like that. It pretty much becomes like white noise in the background. This is a great resort definitely worth staying at. We had no problems at all and will hopefully be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: glmullar
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ko Olina Beach Club 2/5-2/11 2008. For some reason we were upgraded to a penthouse room. It was beautiful - full kitchen, granite counter tops, plenty of room for lounging around. The resort is about 20 minutes from the airport, so we advise renting a car. Plus, Ko Olina is about 20-30 minutes from Waikiki, so if you have a desire to drive down there, a car is needed. Back to the resort - the 4 lagoons that are carved into the beaches are wonderful for snorkeling and were never crowded. You can freely use any of the 4 lagoons, although, the one to the East is a public lagoon, with a few more patrons. All of the restaurants at the hotel were delicious and you MUST have the seafood buffet (Fri / Sat nights) at Kolohe's, their beachfront restaurant. Overall, the service and quality at the resort was excellent. All of the employees are nice and very responsive to your needs, although, we had no issues that needed to be addressed. The gym was OK, lots of cardio equipment, with TVs but limited weights / machines. My only complaint was that there was no music playing, so it was kind of quiet / awkward in there. The Ko Olina was a great place to stay, we'd go back there in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: CCSmith
Reviews.Content: I generally like Marriott hotels...but this one was really disappointing. The rooms are a nice size with all the comforts and amenities that the Marriott chain advertises, but it is run extremely poorly. I am staying here for a week and four days in, my key would not work 3 times. Every night I return to my room, I'd slide my key into the reader and rather than registering a green light and let me in, I would get a flashing red and yellow light. To make matters worse, there are two buildings to this property and it just so happens that the building I am staying in, is not the one with the front desk. They generally have a bellhop stationed at the door, but not always. Also...the self-parking situation is a bit of a joke. It's fine during the weekdays, but on the weekends when the hotel fills up, the garage fills up quickly So the overflow parking tends to end up in the roundabout driveway or along the rim of driveway. I found myself parking along the driveway like everyone else on Thursday and Friday because the garage was full. When I returned tonight, I parked in the overflow area and was told by the bellhop minding the front that I had to find parking around the back. He had the nerve to make me move even though other people had parked in the general area where I was trying to park. I am thoroughly disappointed with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't go back.”
Reviews.Author: fpgirl
Reviews.Content: We traded in to this 'resort'...wouldn't go back. Front desk staff was pleasant enough but had requested a high floor, ocean view room....got a 4th floor, children's play area/barbeque view. When we asked about an upgrade, didn't really receive an answer. Our room key repeatedly wouldn't open the self-park entrance gate, which was a minor inconvenience...the response to that was 'the card reader is probably dirty'. Our 1 bedroom unit was large but not laid out very well, IMO. The bathroom (off the entry) had a sink, toilet & shower, in the next area was another sink & a bathtub with louvered doors in between the tub & the bedroom....not sure what the purpose of that was. Off the other side of the bedroom was a sitting room (?) with sliding doors to separate it from the bedroom...it had a loveseat & a small table...don't really know the purpose of this area. The unit was in need of some good dusting & vacuuming (which I did mention to the Housekeeping Staff & never was done). Under one of the pedestals for the dining table was a kukui nut, which stayed there for the entire 5 days we were there. The dining table chairs (wood) had dried on food on the backs & around the seat cushions. From the reviews of the steak house I read on here, we avoided that but did eat at the beach-side restaurant twice. The food there was okay & priced at typical Marriott/Hawaii prices. The beaches & walkway to the JW were spotless & very nice...this was about the only positive we could find here. This 'resort' felt more like a hotel with its' inside corridors & the decor in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice overall.”
Reviews.Author: jabu1
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 5 nights at the Ko Olina Beach Club on Oahu. Our overall experience was very positive and we would definitely consider staying there again. The weather was great. It’s a beautiful property with helpful and friendly staff. The location provides for a private and safe experience. We were originally booked into a ground floor ocean side room but when we asked they moved us to the 6th floor with a beautiful view of the pools and the ocean…very nice. A few more comments: The rental rooms are a bit small but nicely appointed and very comfortable. There are limited restaurant choices on the property and what is available is of average quality with high prices. The location is remote which is probably good if you plan on spending most of you time on the grounds at the hotel. Parking is $20.00 a day, and you have no choice as there is nowhere else to park and you will need a car due its location. If you want to see Oahu including Honolulu, you are in for some driving. We were told ahead of time about the construction of an adjacent hotel. While efforts have been made to minimize the distraction, the backup beeper noise of heavy equipment is near constant during the day. Even with a few negatives, this is an upscale property with beautiful grounds and lagoons, and it is Hawaii.

Reviews.Title: “False advertising”
Reviews.Author: travisSFBayArea
Reviews.Content: Our 'Ocean View' room should have been called 'Construction View' - see pictures. Apparently, during the last six months they have erected a new building next door, eliminating whatever view existed for a large number of rooms. However, they are still selling these as 'Ocean View'. Beware. btw, otherwise the hotel is great. I was able to convince the manager to give me a discount rate. But you really can't get an ocean view unless you a timeshare owner (or someone there as part of a timeshare preview).

Reviews.Title: “Wait until the construction is finished”
Reviews.Author: LongingfortheBeach
Reviews.Content: We are owners at this resort and it was our first stay in a 1BR/1 BTH villa (not the lock-out). We were booked for a mountain view and when we checked in we asked not to be next to the construction. The room and view were great - unfortunately, while we were not placed next door to the Marriott construction we were next door to the neighbor property's construction which started daily around 7am :-( We agree with one of the reviewer's comments that this is not a place to visit for a couple looking to relax without children. This is a family resort and you can often hear kids running up and down the hallway (although for us this is not really normal). The pool area is a bit smaller than the Marriott clubs in Kauai and Maui so there is less space to spread out. We actually ended up buying cheap beach chairs from Kmart and went to the 2nd lagoon that was quieter and not so close to the construction (+ it had umbrellas while the one in front of the Marriott did not). All in all, the room and property is beautiful and we cannot wait until the construction is finished to see the final result. We will wait to plan our next visit when an end date for the construction is in sight.

Reviews.Title: “Family oriented”
Reviews.Author: spurg
Reviews.Content: Jant 1st-Jan 6th 2007 Room # 20506 Ocean view Kitchen and King bed (not the lock off room) We got a promotional rate of 795 + (100$ upgrade) for 1bed/+kitchen and living room fro 5 nights (car included). Attended a time share presentation and almost bought one(if we had kids, we probably would have). The Good: Free wifi internet Spacious design with washer and dryer. Kitchen comes well equiped with laundry soap, dishes, detergent. Everything is pretty new and newly designed. The lagoons are excellent for swimming. The pools are nicely designed for children with basketball nets and other games. Lots of activities for the whole family 5 jacuzzis -- one is adult only The walls and doors are thick so its very quiet inside. Roy's restuarant is on the golf course and excellent. The not so good: They charge non-owners 20/day to park The wifi went down for 12 hours during our stay. No room service Not great for honeymoon since it's all families. Lots of construction going on at this location presently and in the future. Breakfast closes at 10:30 so don't sleep in and miss it. Far away from waikiki and alot of island activities--isolated. On balance, it was a great deal for us. I would come back with kids only. Not on a romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Best Choice for Families on Oahu”
Reviews.Author: suburbanBAP
Reviews.Content: Just returned today from a week at the Ko Olina Beach Club(Dec 25-31) and I must say the Ko Olina is beautiful. Fourth trip to Hawaii. We had the 1 bedroom master suite (around 900 sq feet) which worked great for our 2 kids! Plenty of space and decorated by Ritz Carlton...and it shows! Lots of marble and granite finishes, 2 TV's, spa tubs and huge lanai...very luxurious. Don't overpack. Washer dryers made life a breeze! We packed a small bag with 6 oz plastic bottles of soft drinks , pancake mix, syrup, bagels, coffee, juice boxes, ramen mac.& cheese, and snacks for the kids.We saved on breakfast , and splurged lunch , dinner and drinks by the pool! They provide a welcome pack with D/W detergent, filters, paper towels, etc. We never had to go shopping. Just down to the marketplace for small things like butter and milk. Saved time and money this way, and had an extra empty bag to bring home which we filled with all the crap we bought! Our exit bill was only 815.00, and I figure I could have spent that at home bored over Christmas break. Don't get me wrong...I am not cheap,I LOVE the high end , I'm just frugal and I hate throwing money away. Don't waste your money on walking down to JW. Breakfast there was gross...flies EVERYWHERE!!! Our beach club grill was WAY better, with a casual vibe and killer view!! Kids loved the activities...lei making, tatoos, ukelele lessons, kayaks, etc. , while I enjoyed the HEATED volcano pools and beach lagoons . Chucks Steakhouse has pretty good food,(my husband thought his steak and lobster was Sizzler-ish...but overall great atmosphere and you can see the luau(not the best, not the worst) from there! Free shuttle to Roy's (YUMMY).The only caveat is that you are somewhat limited on restaurants..and no room service.(it is a timeshare). This didn't bother us. Starbucks, bagels, and grocery items can be found in the downstairs marketplace, or visit the Safeway around the corner. We spent our last night in Waikiki (18 miles on GPS). which was so much fun to visit, but hectic and crowded at the beach. Surf lessons are cheap and easy here...but it was so crowded that we could barely find a patch of sand to sit on. Waikiki is a shoppers paradise with ongoing outdoor malls that interconnect between the hotels. I think I counted like 4 COACH stores in one block! How many purses can one person have?(smile). Ko Olina feels like more like Maui or some other island. We will definately be back!! Have a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Facilities”
Reviews.Author: kiyom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent Christmas week in Hawaii at the Ko Olina Beach Club. Boy! We were so impressed with the facilities and all the amenities that came with it. We stayed in a one-bedroom villa which had a washer/dryer, refrigerator, microwave, stove, etc. All the conviences of your own home. There were even pots and pans, silverware, cups and saucers, etc., and they were not the cheap kind, but very nice ones. There was maid service, but the maid comes in to fix your bed and brings you new towels and just do the minimum - no vacuuming and no changing of sheets (unless you call the front desk and they will charge you for the change). The bathroom facilities were excellent. There was one tub in a room with a sink (pretty big size room) and another room with a shower, toilet and sink. There's even a ceiling fan in the bedroom (which you really don't have to use, since there is airconditioning). The grounds of the complex were very nice. There are several 'lagoons' for people to swim in and lots and lots of chairs/lounges for everyone. There's even a couple of hot tubs. All in all, it was a very nice experience for us and we intend to go back there every time we visit Hawaii.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort Hotel & Great Service”
Reviews.Author: psycchic12
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights for business, but wished I could have stayed much longer on a relaxing vacation! The hotel staff were tremendously friendly and welcoming. The rooms were clean, comfortable...and the bed was absolutely the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in! (That's saying a LOT because I have a high-end bed with all of the luxury trimmings on my bed at home, and the Ko Olina's bed equalled --and may have even surpassed it!) This hotel is out-of-the hustle and bustle of Waikiki, so if you are looking for a peaceful resort destination with many on-site activities and being a bit removed from "tourism-central' in Waikiki/Honolulu, this would be a great place to investigate for your next stay. I travel on business trips about 100-115 days per year. Mostly I stay at Hiltons or Marriotts, but this particular Marriott was exceptional. My favorite part? The staff. I really was treated with incredible professionalism without it being stuffy. I felt very welcomed and at-ease, even when checking in at 1:30am (by the time my flight arrived, etc. I didn't get to the hotel until late.) My only minor "complaint" was with regard to parking. At 1:30am, the spots were full and I had to park in the circular drive. It appeared many others had done the same, and I was not penalized in the AM for doing so. I suppose it must be a routine occurrance to run out of parking spots that late at night, perhaps. A great place and great service. I've attached photos for your reference. The details of this room, according to my reservation, were: ISLAND VIEW GUEST ROOM - AVG 360 SQUARE FEET *2 PPL* - GUEST BEDROOM WITH QUEEN BED,COLOR TV, FULL SIZE SOFA SLEEPER, KITCHENETTE W/SINK, MINI REFRIGERATOR, MICROWAVE, COFFEE MAKER AND SERVICE FOR TWO, A FULL BATH AND PRIVATE LANAI BALCONY. To be honest, the "Island View" was really a parking-structure view, but given that I was only staying for 2 nights, and working from dawn until dark off-site, I couldn't have cared less about the view I had from my window. This hotel was reportedly under construction when I stayed. Because I was off-site for work during daylight hours, I cannot speak to the noise or disruption levels that may have been present during my stay. It certainly did not bother me at night.

Reviews.Title: “We Love Ko Olina”
Reviews.Author: travlincouple50
Reviews.Content: We are Marriott Vacation Club owners and we own a week at the Ko Olina Vacation Club. Need less to say we love the property. It continues to expand with towers 3 and 4 due to come on line within 18 months. The extra towers will allow them to have towers 1 and 2 geared for families and then towers 3 and 4 for couples. Having the full Villa makes it idea to take friends and family. On our last trip we had a total of (8) people comfortable in the 2 bed room 2 bath full Villa. If you are into water sports the private lagoons make for good snorkeling swimming and sun bathing. The lagoons at the KW Marriott also have surf lessons and other water sports and aerobics. The golf at the Ko Olina Golf resort is good but expensive $150 a round w cart…several of the near by public courses are also good and less money We love the fact that Ko Olina is located away from Honolulu and the crowds. We rent a car at the airport upon arrival to drive to Ko Olina and then we go into Honolulu and surrounding cities when we want. We go to the nearby Costco and load up on food and dining to cook our own meal which helps to cut down on dining costs. You can cook your Villa or use one of the many gas grills outside for excellent grilled meals. When you want to go out the Roy’s Restaurant at the nearby Ko Olina Golf Club is EXCELLENT. The near by JW Marriott is also a dream. We have not eaten at the on property Steak House but the drinks are very good and reasonable. We are going back again in February of 2008 for another week in 2009 we might trade or rent our week. I highly recommend Ko Olina.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families”
Reviews.Author: radji
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ko Olina Beach club over Thanksgiving Nov 22 - Dec 2. Overall, it was a great stay. We have two small kids (5 and 17 mos) and the place is very family friendly. Each of the four nearby man made lagoons are great for swimming. Grounds are clean and green. Staff was very helpful and friendly. The room we had was a one bedroom condo type unit with full kitchen, which was perfect for a small family. Plus we hit the local Sam's Club when we landed to stock up on food. Don't go to the Safeway in Kapolei unless you want to part with most of your vacation money. The location is nice. Honolulu, North shore both within 40 or so minutes(traffic permitting). Kapolei is a few exits up with restaurants and such. I would highly recommend this place for families. The only gripes are the valet parking fee, with tax, it came out to a little over $26 per day. Self park was not much cheaper. Pools are good for little kids, but are on the small side. Would definitley stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation Resort”
Reviews.Author: jmelong
Reviews.Content: This is not the first time we have stayed here, and it continues to exceed our expectations. The staff is very helpful, the grounds are awesome, and the location, while close to attractions is away from the crowds. The accomodations are much better than normal and provide a wonderful atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “My 40th Birthday and It was Absolutely the Best!”
Reviews.Author: KSCoolBreeze
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Ko Olina is everything I hoped it would be! My husband and I are very picky about our hotel accommodations. The rooms are well maintained. The staff was very friendly and the concierge desk gave us wonderful suggestions for activities as well as restaurants. If you stay here, please rent a car because it is not close to island activities. However, this was not a problem for us. My husband and I like to do things on our own time so we drove to the places we wanted to see and stayed as long as we wanted without the expense of paying for the tours. Pearl Harbor really touched me and the exhibits are very informative. We also drove to the north shore and saw some sites along the way (Dole Plantantion, Haleiwa town, Polynesia Cultural Center and gorgeous beaches). Be sure to stop at Giovanni's along the way to the north shore. It's a little truck on the side of the road. Make sure you look for the name because there are several trucks in the general area. They sell shrimp with a side of rice. It was sooo good! The also sell fresh fruit smoothies. The strawberry/pineapple was delicious! And if you can make it, take the hike up Diamond Head. I would recommend you go early before the sun is at it's highest. The view from the top was gorgeous! I could go on and on about my vacation because I simply had the best time ever! I would certainly recommend the resort as well as the island.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Ko Olina Beach Resort”
Reviews.Author: nemserhall
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 1 week visit to our timeshare. This was our first visit since we wanted to wait for the second building to be completed. We requested a high floor which was honored and we had a lovely mountain view. We celebrated our 20th wedding anniversary and were welcomed with a nice card and chocolate covered macadamia nuts. There is construction continuing on the 3rd building which you could hear while sitting on the beach but the sound of the ocean helped to block out the noise. Our 2 bedroom unit was very spacious and tastefully furnished. Several bulbs burned out in the bathrooms but the problem was solved immediately. We had mid week tidy service. Activites were plentiful although most were not free. One could not possibley get bored. The Welcome Mai Tai party was fun and entertaining. I'm not sure if this was for owners only. The fitness center and locker rooms were clean. The restaurants (2) on the premises were good and the Ilihani was a 10 minute walk around the lagoons offering 4 more for variety. The only downside we saw was the pools - too small. I can't imagine during the summer at full occupancy that those 2 pools could accomodate the numbers. The upside - January 2008 - the third building will be finished with a huge pool with slide. I think that will attract most families and take the pressure off the 2 originals. The 4th building will not be finished unitl 2010 with an all adult pool with swim bar. Can't wait for that!!!!! The resort will provide transportation to the local grocery store (Safeway) so you don't have to spend alot of $ at the MarketPlace which isn't totally outrageous in price. We had the use of all the Marriott Ilihani's amenities. The Tennis Garden is located on the rooftop of their parking garage and was a bargain for $36.00/wk for unlimited play. One never has to leave the premises to have an enjoyable and relaxinfg vacation. We are so pleased that we purchased this property.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Marriott Experience”
Reviews.Author: michelle1225
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at the Ko Olina. As an owner at the Marriott's Aruba Surf Club, I had only high standards in mind for this property as well. We stayed in the larger side of the unit so we had kitchen and laundry facilites. The room was clean and well decorated. Our air conditioning was a problem but they attended to it quickly. I wa disappointed that when they did our weekly tidy service (the one you get for free) they did not change the linens as they do in Aruba. They would have for an extra chargeI later found out. They also took our dish towels and never replaced them and we had bad blender. However all of this was fixed quickly. The staff was extremely friendly. Some were not so knowledgeable though about the restaurants and what they serve. You truly are on a rather remote part of the island so you are limited to going back and forth between the JW and the Ko Olina to shop or eat unless you have a car. We did but found that venturing out for the two days we did was worth it but having to deal with the traffic was not. My fiance' plays golf and was in heaven playing many of the courses. I sat by the lagoon and did a few spa treatments at the JW. We highly reccomend that you go to Roy's for dinner. We also enjoyed theseafood buffet at the Kohele (sp?) it's the restauant at the Ko Olina that looks out onto the water. We had breakfast there as well one morning and also at the JW one morning. We heard great things about Azul's but didn't get to try it. I missed being able to just walk to different places outside the property like we can in Aruba. But did love the trail that runs between the two properties for exercising on or taking a walk on after dinner. We loved Hawaii, weren't too thrilled with Oahu. We didn't realize it lacked some of the lushness and exotic scenery that the other islands provide. It's there but you need to take a drive to the other side of the island to find it. We ended up buying a time share in Kauai because it has the above mentioned scenery and the ability to walk to things. But we also know that Marriott has great properties so we take trust in that. We are a couple in our early 40's without kids. There were families with little ones on board as well as older couples so a good mix. Construction was never an issue. It's happening all around not just at the Ko Olina. Overall if you are going to Oahu then you should definitely make the Ko Olina the place to stay at for your time there.

Reviews.Title: “Total getaway and relaxation”
Reviews.Author: localgal56
Reviews.Content: We are residents of Kapolei, Hawaii and this was our first time using our timeshare unit at the Marriott Ko'olina Beach Club. We live just 10 minutes away and honestly, I felt like we were on another island. It was definitely 5star quality!! The staff were so friendly and helpful. The beach was not crowded at all, and it was so inviting. The rooms were so well equipped and the decor was beautiful, elegant and well planned out. The landscaping was pristine and well planned. They had many activities for kids and adults. The restaurants were all within walking distance, including the famous "Roy's" restaurant and "AzuI's", just to name a few. I couldn't have asked for anything more. After our week was over, we felt refreshed and revived. If you're looking for a true getaway, I would highly recommend booking your next vacation at this 5star resort and spa.

Reviews.Title: “What a view!”
Reviews.Author: jacatro
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the newer tower, which at first seemed like a great idea- we had had a 7 hr flight delay at LAX, and showed up at the property after midnight- after a grueling transaction with Hertz rental-our car keys were taken and we were directed to a 6th floor room which we were assured had an ocean view- exhausted, we crashed- only to be woken at 7:45AM by the sound of construction. We had been stowed in the construction wing-one worker actually confided that they often put East coasters there because we tend to wake up earlier, due to the time difference, and dont notice the work as much. As soon as we were conscious, we managed a room change- we stayed in the older building, overlooking the pool and the ocean- much nicer. The property is truly gorgeous- private chair cabanas are available at the beach- VIP service is 55 dollars for the day- well worth it- includes bottled water, portable radios, sunscreen and unlimited towels-there is no waiter service on the beach, so we took our beverages from lunch down with us. We had planned on a trip to the Safeway to stock up on our own water and breakfast, as our unit came with a full, amply equipped kitchen-Room also have washer and dryers in room, which was a great convienience! Valet service goes for 26.00 a day, by the way- self park is 20 a day-So, we called for our keys, and after an hr of waiting, found that they had lost our car keys. We were furnished with a driver, however, and Cliff was really helpful, took us wherever we wanted to go until they found the keys-three days later. What can I say? The view is gorgeous, so one kind of gets the feeling that they just don't try as hard-loads of marketing going on-'Events' offering free coffee and raffles are thinly veiled attempts at data gathering- Marriott did comp us quite a bit due to our bad experiences- The catamaran trip out to Dolphin watch is not to be missed-3 hrs of fun! The lagoons are quite safe, and beach is clean. One thing they don't tell you however, is that there is a law in Hawaii that says all beaches are public, and the Cabana rentals are open to the public. One morning I reserved an end Cabana- over on a private side- a visiting family from another hotel requested it and was told that it was already reserved. They set out their blankets and baby toys all around the cabana, threw soda cans around and proclaimed that they were claiming the beach for 'Redneck Nation'. We were given another cabana and had a nice day anyway, but beware! All in all, it was a nice place, but a bit overrated in my opinion. We spent the rest of our vacation at Turtle Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for kids”
Reviews.Author: BayAreaResident
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mariott Ko Olina Beach club from August 22 to August 26, 2007. We received an invitation from Marriott which includes 5 night stay for a studio room, $50 voucher, and a rental car. We were not required to attend the time share presentation. We were asked to attend but said no and did not receive any followup calls for pressure to attend. We have two young kids (4 and 8 years). The loved the pools and lagoons. The studio size room was adequate for the 4 of us. It had a queen bed and a sofa bed. We ate on the property at lunch and went to Kapolei for dinner. You need a car if you are staying here. We went to Waikiki beach for dinner one night; the drive was about 25 minutes (remember to avoid traffic hours). The staff was friendly and helpful. The contruction noise did not bother us at all-we could barely hear it. The fitness center was great. We had a perfect stay and would definitely recommend this to families with young children.

Reviews.Title: “The Lagoons were wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: marty54
Reviews.Content: We are Marriott owners and traded a week elsewhere for a week here. We had a two bedroom unit and invited friends. Unlike most who write here, the four of us are 55-62. We had a wonderful time and would go back there in a minute! The lagoons were gorgeous to look at and lovely to swim in, and the food at the little bar and grill was great. My girl friend and i joined the "Wellness week" for $80 which gave us several yoga, tai chi, back and neck exercise classes, as well as water aerobics. Their staff was great. Our husbands played golf there and loved it. I was concerned about the construction noise, but it wasn't that bad, especially if you sat at the other pool or on a lagoon. We ate at Roy's two nights and had appetizers which were wonderful...we also walked about 15 minutes along the beach and lagoons to the hotel and had dinner there twice at the terrace which was lovely. We went to the little town nearby and bought breakfast food and wine, etc, so we had relaxing mornings in the condo. The last night we signed up for the Ko Olina Sunset Sail which was a memorable evening. About 18 of us went out there, two free drinks, and we saw so many spinner dolphins. it was totally amazing and stunning. They jumped right in front of us and along side the boat. With the sun setting, a glass of wine, and dolphins playing, it was a perfect end to a great week!

Reviews.Title: “Good resort - great for kids.”
Reviews.Author: sunnyvale_dude
Reviews.Content: We came across this property on an ad featuring their timeshare preview package. We could not get a 1BR unit for the dates we wanted, but we paid their Internet prices anyways since it seemed to have all that we wanted. We are a couple with two young children (under 3). Its the perfect place to stay in for kids that age group. Check-in was easy. They were supposed to have given us some kind of voucher for a gift/tickets to an event or such but apparently they forgot so we did not get the freebie. We had requested a high floor and a crib. Got neither. Did not mind or insist since running to the pool and back was quicker being on the 2nd floor (almost same level as pool). We had a parking lot view but that was OK too since we parked right by the fire door next door to us and entered and exited through that all the time. Also, we might have worried about the kids playing in the lanai if we were on a higher floor...so it was fine. The unit was spacious, well appointed and perfect for the family. The living room has a sofa-cum-bed, 2 large chairs, a dining table (6-seater) and a flat screen TV and DVD player (our kids watched their favorite videos on it everyday!) The bedroom had a nice comfortable (Queen?) bed, flatscreen TV and a (hot) tub and dressing area (mirror, sink etc). There is also a small sitting area adjacent to the bedroom between the living and sleeping area. The common bathroom accessible from both the bedroom and living area (kitchen?) has a stall shower, toilet and sink. There are towels aplenty, and they bring more if you need. The kitchen has a huge refirgerator, cooktop oven, stovetop microwave, sink, dishwasher, and some basic utensils (good quality stainless steel). There is dinnerware for 6. We utilized the kitchen optimally (eating out at the most once a day!) Housekeeping cleans everyday for renters, I understand that owners only get a tidy service midweek and cleaning at the end of the week or end of the stay? Never heard construction noise from our room, from the pools or the lagoon (we were on Lagoon 4 and never ventured out to the other lagoons or to Ihilani). There was a person at the end of the hallway (by the elevator) offering a snorkel trip for two aboard the Ko'Olina Cat if we sat thru the timeshare presentation. We did not think it was worth our time. Had we gotten the preview package (all stay at 50% price) we would have, but $200...naah! The marketplace had bagels and coffee and some pastry for breakfast. We ate there a couple of times. Their "starbucks" was way below average. When I returned my latte for a regular coffee, the lady who prepared my espresso drink was visibly upset and said maybe they make it differently where I usually get it..?! I saw everyone there with the $25 refillable mug...every single one! The store by the pool (salt water pool) is reasonably priced. We bought our kids' beachtoys, floatees and some other stuff there. Their shave ice is kinda OK too. We did not get to Matsumoto's so we can't compare, but we did try it at two other places, and this was wayyy better, and more flavor choices too (and clean may I add). The sandy area by the pool was perfect for kids to play in while parents relaxed. Even adults seemed to enjoy this pool! The other pool did not have young children, not sure if they were not allowed or this one was just easier/safer to get in and out of. There were volleyball and basketball nets in the pool. The locker room/restrooms (accessible only with your room keys) were super clean and always smelled good. (The room and property does look like it does in the photos) The folks you borrow towels from gave us a wristband on some days and not on others...not sure how that works...it was supposed to identify guests from outsiders. I saw people with bands and without. Everyone had as much fun. They give you a card with your room number on it which you can produce for any expense on the property and they will bill your room. Do not lose it! We did not eat at the restaurants or interact much with the staff (the guy at the fish feeding was boring and seemed more interested in getting us to fill out raffle ticket forms - data for timeshare sales database I'm sure, than letting us feed the fish.) but after having flown Hawaiian airlines coach class, any hospitality would seem wonderful. We rented the water hammock. Good fun. $10 for 30 mins. There is some fish in the lagoon so we did not venture out to the crowded (but oh-so-worth-it, I hear, Hanauma Bay). We could have gone to their Ho'Ike show, cheaper than Paradise Cove Luau, but we missed it and went to the latter. We are vegetarians so it was a damp squib. Also the very young kids don't have much to do. Our having been to the Polynesian Cultural center as well made it a repeat experience for us. The good thing was that it was right next door and it was on a lagoon so the kids just played in the sand - some more. As for getting around the island - if you plan to do that a lot and have young kids, stay in Waikiki or even I'd say on the south or east. We visited Koko Head for water activities (parasailing, bumper ride, banana boat), Kailua for swimming, PCC, Dole, North shore, and downtown HNL, all from 40-60 minutes away!! Its not much fun to keep driving with young kids, the ride back home with tired kids AND adults is NO fun. So if you want to do a lot of island-exploring with or without kids, this is not your place. But for more relaxing, swimming, sunning on the beach/lagoon/pool with a very nice accomodation and a few extra perks, this is GREAT! If you get the preview package - go for it!! ;)

Reviews.Title: “New Found Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Tarawa
Reviews.Content: If you're looking to be 30 minutes from anywhere but only a short walk to 4 different beaches, then this is the property for you. Excellent staff. Amazing property. Pay the extra $$ for the "suite upgrade" Worth every penny!!! Only short coming for the property is the hours of the beachside bar and grill. They close at 10'ish. We've read the other reviews about the construction so we went in ready for the worst. But all in all, it's not as bad as some made it out to be. Sure, there's condos going up next to the beach....that's a good thing, right? If you don't care to look or listen to that then take a 2 minute stroll to the north or the south and relax at another fairly empty lagoon. This place was so wonderful, you would be remiss not to visit it at least TWICE!!! Go into the town of Kapolei to do your shopping. Food can be expensive so stock up at the grocery store. Dinner can be had on property, at the marina next door, or at the golf course across the street....but bring plenty of $$ if you decide to do any of those.

Reviews.Title: “Ko Olina is spectacular”
Reviews.Author: DAH56
Reviews.Content: We just had the opportunity to stay at the Ko Olina and it is a wonderful resort. The accomodations are exceptional, the staff is incredible and the pools are spacious. We had no problem getting chairs {and we needed 3 of them} at either of the pools - there are 2 pools there. We heard NO construction sounds at all - it was amazing. The Fia Fia is great entertainment and worth the cost. We did not enjoy the other entertainment quite as much. The $25.00 drink mug is well worth it as you get unlimited refills on just about anything at the MarketPlace. The food is good - and the activities {free and those you have to pay for} were enjoyable. Melvin, the activities supervisor, is so pleasant and helpful. He'll go above and beyond for you - each person is treated as an individual. We love the Ko Olina and plan to purchase at this resort .

Reviews.Title: “I give it an 8.5 on a 1-10 scale”
Reviews.Author: melindaclare
Reviews.Content: The lagoons are beautiful and the grounds are super clean. We stayed in a guest room with a queen bed and a pull out sleper which was fine for 2 children. The room had a small refrigerator and microwave, toaster and different utencils and dinnerware. We had a view of the pool and were in the Kona building. We did go to Safeway in Kapolei and always had drinks in our refrigerator. We also barbequed outside at the grills. There was a washer /dryer on the floor which came in handy. The Marketplace was there if you wanted a snack or a quick breakfast. The pools were lovely and there was plenty to do with kids. We enjoyed the onsite dvd rental and watched them for 5.00 a movie. Self parking is 10.00 and is very tight if you come in late at night. We would come back, it was a very nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Work In Progress”
Reviews.Author: AJLM33
Reviews.Content: Our family enjoyed the Ko Olina Beach Club for an entire week. You do need a car to enjoy the area as there is not much to do around the hotel except to lounge by the pools, snorkle in the lagoons, and relax. We had a two bedroom island/golf course view unit on the fifth floor and did not hear much noise from the construction. I enjoyed sitting on the large balcony and watching the sun rise each morning. Once all the construction is finished, this will be a unbelievable resort. My only complaint was that the parking for our tower was terrible. If you weren't back from the day's activities by 9:00pm the lot was full and you had to park along the driveway of the parking lot area and not in a parking stall. Other than the parking, I highly recommend this resort and plan on returning again.

Reviews.Title: “By Far the Best in Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: TCUFrogs
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at almost every 4/5 star resort in Oahu--so, obviously, I go there quite often. Regardless, the staff is one of the best I've seen in the 1000+ hotels I've been to--some try and learn you by name, which is always wonderful. The facilities are amazing. The pools are wonderful. The view = wow. If there was a 6th star, Marriott Ko Olina would receive it.

Reviews.Title: “Not for honeymooners”
Reviews.Author: jmh78
Reviews.Content: I am very confused by the positive reviews for this hotel. There is major construction on all sides that can be heard from every room, the pool, and the beach. If you are on your honeymoon and want a quiet, romantic getaway, the JW Marriott is next door and is amazing. We did call ahead to confirm (several times) that we would have a quiet room and would not be disturbed by the noise. We were lied to and told that we had "the best room" in the hotel. We checked out after the first morning wake up call from the crane that was positioned directly in front of our balcony. The jack hammer and drilling can be heard even from the pool and the beach. Not exactly a relaxing time! I have been to many hotels over the years and have never been as disappointed as I was in the Ko Olina Marriott. Luckily, we were able to get a room at the JW Marriott next door and had the most amazing week ever. The staff was so nice and accommodating. The room was great and we could not hear any noise in our room at all. If you plan on going to the Ko Olina, I would reconsider immediately.

Reviews.Title: “Ko Olina Rocks!!”
Reviews.Author: meowser
Reviews.Content: Stayed a week at the Ko Olina Beach club as the son of an owner. It was awesome! There were 4 of us. It is about a 1/2 hour drive from Honolulu Itnl. Right when you walk into the lobby, you are blown away by the Hawaiian atmosphere. There was fresh juice in chilled dispensers and fresh flowers out. We were treated with respect at the front desk and placed in the Kona tower looking out towards the marina. Our room was imaculate. They have these "vacation essential" packs in the rooms, with samples of dishwasher detergent and things like a Gilette razor and Oil of Olay. It really is nice to have a washer and dryer in the room to put your swimming suits and sort in. We ate the first day at Kolohes on the beach. The entertainment was really impressive and it is the best atmosphere at night with all the torches lit. The lagoons are, I think, the best part of this resort. The sand is perfect and they have showers and foot washes everywhere. It is nice to have a grassy and shaded spot to get out of the sand. The beach cabanas were numerous on our trip and we never had a problem finding one to rent. The snorkeling was fair. I think the fish are still moving in. We liked going out on the Ko Olina Cat, catamaran. It was seriously the best. They take you just north of the resort to a pipeline teaming with fish. We saw turtles, dolphins, and all sorts of fish. Worth the money! The pools are nice when you want a break from the beach. There are BBQ' s with all the tools for you to cook your own steaks. It is sooo nice to smell the burgers and shrimp while you are laying out on a pool chair! This side of Oahu really is like being in the country. It is far from the rat race of Waikiki, but close enough to civilization. It is only a 10 minute drive to Kapolai to go to the Safeway to get things for your fridge. There is also a cineplex there for movies. A Walmart is only 15 minutes away, with everything else. The north shore can be reached in 40 minutes flat. Miliani Town was our favorite for restaurants. It is on the way north. Much has been written of the construction. It really was minimal during our stay. We were out exploring the island during the day, so we didn't notice it much. It would not deter me from coming here. They are mostly in the later phases of construction and there wasn't much heavy machinery sounds. Mostly welding. All construction stops at 5 o'clock. Besides, construction wont last forever, and this will be a prime spot when it is done. It is a perfect spot for families. We did not take our children, but spent the entire time wishing we had. (Well, maybe not the ENTIRE time :) ...) If you are with the party crowd, try closer to Waikiki. Much has been said about the time share aspect of Ko Olina. We were only asked twice to listen to a presentation. It IS part of the deal here, but it is not like going to an "Amway" or "Hoover Vacuum" convention or anything. Pressure was very light. After all, you can just say no, and they leave you alone. We had a killer time at Ko Olina. I will definately be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Ko Olina”
Reviews.Author: lesterbird
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 7 nights at the Ko Olina Beach Club (we used our owner week for the first time) and absolutely loved it. The lagoons are pretty busy with fish - especially lagoon #2 which is in between this resort and the JW down the road. The two bedroom/2 bath had a full kitchen, washer/dryer, and ocean view. Pleny of room to spread out with two families. Sofa sleepers are a little bumpy but fine for kids. King in master and queen in guest room are very comfortable. Shopped at the Safeway down the road and cooked a few meals in. Saves $$ and means you don't have to get out of your suit to have a glass of wine and watch the sunset. Very family oriented resort. Lunch at the outdoor grill was decent and not overpriced. Breakfast there is an expensive buffet and nothing to get excited about. Go to Roy's (across the street at the golf course) for a nice upscale fish (try the ahi) lunch or dinner. I cannot say enough good things about the lagoons. Lagoon #3 is about 200 yards from the lobby with beautiful, clean white sand - rent the water hammock. It's $10 an hour and tons of funs to jump on, hang out on in the lagoon. Two pools and four hot tubs open so far, all are great. Bigger pool with slide is due to open in the next year or two. Construction to the north and the south was not fun to look at from out balcony but oh well. Took a drive up to North Shore had divine shrimp lunch at world famous Giovanni's. Garlic shrimp are worth the trip. Friends stayed at the JW down the road and were quite pleased but it was a different experience from the Beach Club. Smallish pool for size of resort but did have cool hammer head shark and sting ray pond. More geared for couples. Couple of decent upscale restaurants. Small rooms but big bathrooms. Night life is zilch here except for Paradise Cove Luau - not bad if your heart is set on a luau. We're every other year owners and plan to go back in two years. I don't loooooove Oahu (Wakiki is not our style) but the Ko Olina is fabulous for families.

Reviews.Title: “Do not honeymoon here!”
Reviews.Author: jds272psu
Reviews.Content: I write merely to warn those who think this would be a nice place to honeymoon. Do not be fooled - it is not. We only ended up sleeping at this resort one night and after seeing our room, the property, and the construction, we switched to the JW Marriott's Ihilani Resort & Spa, which was fantastic and I highly recommend. We booked the room at the Marriott's Ko Olina Beach Club through Interval. Once the room was booked, I called the Marriott and Interval to confirm several things, as I was concerned about the construction. I was assured by the hotel staff that that my room was in the "best" tower and that the construction would not be a problem. Upon checking in, however, the lady at the desk informed me that my view was the construction (although if I strained the neck I could see the ocean, therefore I had an "ocean view" room). Upon seeing this, I asked to speak with a manager. The manager offered me another room which sat on top of the parking garage and on the main road leading into the hotel. I asked if people complain about the noise and she said, "we do not get as many complaints about the road as we do about the construction." This was not a comforting thought.
