Because of this, we got a room at the J.W. Marriott. Although the people at the Marriott Ko Olina Beach Club were nice, they were unaccommodating regarding our room situation and did not help us. I highly recommend you do NOT honeymoon here. I will say, it seemed like a great place to take young children, when you would not be concerned about the view, noise, or construction. However, it is not worth the money for a honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “perfect vacation”
Reviews.Author: travelindoc2007
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week as a trade on Interval International, 2 bedroom unit, with husband and 2 kids--9 & 11 yrs. Unit was beautiful, even though it did face the new construction going on. If the doors were closed, I didn't hear it. Was usually only out of the balconey early in am (time diifference has you geting up early) or in evening when nothing was going on. Beach and pools were lovely and uncrowded even though resort at 95+% occupancy (I asked). Beach side restaurant was good altho was disappointed with the steak house--over priced and medicore. Went into town to stock up kitchen with bfast and snacks. Enjoyed a trip to Pearl Harbor thru the coincerige, as well as a snorkling trip on the Ko Olina Cat. JW Marriot was a 5 minute walk (or 10 min shuttle) was elegant and had good restaurants--esp the seafood buffet (Sat night?). Enjoyed a wonderful beachside massage. We liked it so much we did purchase a unit. Kids had a good time--no lifeguards, though. Great kiddie pool area for little ones. Only particapated in the water color lesson on Wed. which my dtr really loved.

Reviews.Title: “The most beautiful place on Oahu”
Reviews.Author: pbuenau
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week on the island of Oahu. While there, we stayed at the Marriott Ko Olina Beach Club Resort. It was absolutely beautiful, and we had a wonderful time there. We were a party of seven; me, my husband and daughter, and my brother, his wife and their two daughters. My daughter and niece are 2007 high school graduates and this was their graduation trip. I think it was one they won't forget. We toured the North Shore, not our favorite thing, but very authentic Hawaiian. There was more poverty there than I had imagined. On the drive north on the H2, we stopped at the Dole Plantation. There was a very nice gift shop where we observed a pineapple cutting demonstration. The pineapple was scrumptious. Also while at the North Shore, we stopped in at Matsumoto's Store in Haleiwa and had their famous Shave Ice. It was one of the highlights of our trip. Also while in Haleiwa, against most of our group's wishes, we stopped at Giovanni's shrimp truck . The shrimp scampi was very good. We had a fun day, but after taking a look at most of the North Shore beaches, including Turtle Bay Resort, we all agreed that our very own Ko Olina Beach Club was the very best place to be, and the North Shore was a "been there, done that" sort of day. We attended the Paradise Cove Luau which is located very close to the Beach Club. We had a blast. It was fun, festive and very relaxing. If you decide to do a luau this was a great one. They have three packages to choose from, and we did the Royal Ali which gave us 4 drink coupons and allowed us to have great center seats and a server (as opposed to standing in a long buffet line). We loved it. This event was one of our top two picks after all was said and done. Most of one day was spent at Pearl Harbor which was a special day for all of us. Our uncle served in the Navy during World War II (he was not at Pearl Harbor on December 7, 1941), but because he served and he has shared his stories with us, we appreciated what we saw there. Later that day, we strolled through the International Market Place. This very charming shopping area is a great place to pick up souveniers at a reasonable price, and the Lava Flow drink at Coconut Willy's is to die for. Also the band there was very friendly and made it a point to get acquainted with the audience. They tried to sing songs that had something to do with the place their visitors were from. It was fun. Then later that evening, we had dinner reservations at Duke's Canoe Club at the Outrigger Hotel. Our table was "on the rail" with a great view of Waikiki beach. Reservations at this restaurant are advised. The food was good, with very friendly service, and strolling musicians. Great salad bar. Another day we had planned to snorkel at Hanauma Bay, but when we got there the parking lot was full. It is important to get there before 10:00am. We were disapponted, but it all turned out fine, because we found Sandy Beach Park instead. We had an absolute blast at Sandy Beach ... later we found out that this beach is known to be one of the most dangerous beaches on the island (lots of broken necks, backs, etc.) Our girls (all teenagers ... 17, 18, and 19) had an awesome time. They were the only girls surfing the waves with all the guys. This stop is at the very top of our list of fun things to do. If we ever are back in Oahu, we will definitely spend another day at Sandy Beach. After our day at the beach, we drove back through Hanauma Bay, but decided we were too tired to snorkel. This will have to wait till our next trip. The last two days of our trip were saved for the Beach Club and some rest and relaxation. We rented the cabanas (beach chairs with a tent over them) both days and I would highly recommend this if you are planning a day at Lagoon 3. Even with the sounds of construction in the background, I slept better on the beach there than I do in my own bed...ha! Seriously, for some the construction sounds might be annoying, but for our bunch it was not a problem. The girls loved the beautiful pool areas, hot tubs, excercise facility, sauna and steam room. They met friends and had a very good time at the Resort. Our condo was on the 4th floor of the Kona Building facing the pool. It was a 2 bedroom, 2 bath unit and was just beautifully decorated. We are Marriott owners in Branson, Missouri, and we love the facility in Branson, but it doesn't begin to compare to the elegance of the Ko Olina Beach Resort. It was a spacious unit with an extra-large balcony which we put to good use each and every morning and late evening. We previewed the property and received a certificate to Chuck's Steak House there on-site. There was no pressure by the sales agent, Tracy. She did a wonderful job explaining our options for purchasing at Ko Olina, and both my brother and his wife, and my husband and I actually considered buying. We did not buy, but would certainly entertain the idea of returning to this lovely resort. I could go on and on about our visit, because it was a memorable time for us all. Aloha to you, and mahalo for your patience with my rambling. If you are planning a trip to Oahu, you should definitely consider the Marriott Ko Olina Beach Club Resort for as your home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad At All”
Reviews.Author: bogieman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a week here last week. We were very impressed with the propertrty. We travel all over the world and this property has it all. The only drawback might be the fact that this resort is built for familys and there are lots of kids.They probably should have an adult only pool for those who want peace and quiet. We stayed at the Westin on Maui for a few days prior and this was a plus. The units were spacious and nicely appointed. we had a two bedroom and our trip companion had plenty of space and privacy. The pools were nice and the poolside service for lunch and drinks was adequate. Ther was plenty to do with activities that were announced with the morning delivery of you newspaper. Full kitchens allowed as much cooking as you would desire. The staff was VERY friendly and helpful. Chucks restaurant was just okay for food, but a great location. The grounds were beautiful and when the entire property is completed, it will be a great diversion for the Honolulu crowd. We stayed at the Hukelani for our Anniversary the last night and that is a different story.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay On Oahu”
Reviews.Author: travelramble
Reviews.Content: If you want to get out of Waikiki, but don't want the other extreme of the North Shore, this is the place to go. The Marriott is a timeshare resort, but we didn't get a lot of pressure (one request and one decline). We booked a one bedroom for a family of four. One master bedroom with a queen fold-out in the living room. We we told we couldn't get a roll-out bed, but in fact we ended up with two (for two young men 21 and 18 years old). Anyway, everyone at the resort was great. The concierge pointed out some great places to eat and park (in Waikiki) and were more than helpful. The private lagoons at the resort make your own private beach. The JW Marriott is a ten minute walk up the beach if you want something upscale. Now the really good part is that you don't have all the masses of Waikiki. At Ko Olina you are 20-30 minutes out of Waikiki so you can go to dinner and shopping. The town of Kapolei is two miles away with a Safeway, fast food and sitdown. So you are away from the crowds, without being isolated like on the North Shore. I drove to the North Shore in 55 mins, and Kailua on the east side in about an hour. And oh by the way, the Ko Olina golf course was really good. If we go back to Oahu soon, we'd probably stay here again. Only one negative, the resort area is building up so construction is going on - after a while it just becomes white noise (if you stay on-site during the day). I didn't even think of it until writing this review, so it didn't bother me. If you are sensitive to this, it could be a detractor.

Reviews.Title: “Family resort with lagoon and time share villa rooms”
Reviews.Author: ms_obvious
Reviews.Content: We just went to Hawaii for our anniversary and we stayed at 3 Marriotts on Oahu and Kauai. They each were very different and had a different prime prospect consumer but we enjoyed them all. We are late 30 somethings, DINKS. (double income no kids) We really liked this time share resort. The location has not much built up around it. The guy at the golf course told us that the Japanese investors had big plans and the market went bad so the real estate didn't get developed entirely years ago. Construction is underway next to the hotel but it did not bother us. Our room was quite expansive. I think there are differnt formats so be sure to read what you are getting. Our room had a kitchen, table with 6 chairs, a pull out couch, king size bed and the bath had a tub & a large shower. I think by the reviews there are two kinds of rooms. We did have a garden view of the golf course across the street but we didn't pay for the beach view. This place had a lot of Marriott owners and there was a cocktail party with prizes that we went to. It was sort of cheesy but we enjoyed our free mai tais. The guest servies/ concierge has free leis and post cards. Also they gave us a great map and good directions to the US Arizona. The check in was backed up when we arrived. They gave us a key to use at the locker rooms so we could go to the beach whilst the room was cleaned. They had good luggage attendants. We parked in the self park garage. I think it was around $7 a day. The front desk person was extremely friendly. We ate in a lot at this resort since we had a kitchen. There is a Safeway up an exit or two. We did eat at the pool bar and the salads were good. This Marriott is walking distance (a long walk) to the JW Marriott Ihilai resort. The feel of that resort is less family resort and more honeymooners and retirees, etc. It was a much pricer resort. We ate lunch at the Ihilani on day. It was a bit pricey for most folks but it was good. I made a special request for grill fresh fish and they made my food to order. We saw some Japanese weddings on the beach and the resort. There is also a chapel on the grounds at this resort. At the Ko Olina Beach Club they had excellent facilities for families. The buildings and grounds seem fairly new. The beach lagoon is safe for children to swim. (no big waves) They have a lagoon pool. A padded jungle gym. I worked out in the gym facilities everyday here. They were fairly nice and had a good selection of weights for a hotel. We had dinner at Charlie's steak house and it was good. They have a nice salad bar and in retrospect if I knew that I would had just gotten salad bar and soup. We ate here and were able to watch the luau show. I'm glad we didn't pay for the luau it was a bit cheesey. We have been to real luaus and hotel ones. This one had a MC that talked too much. You do get a discount on golf if you play at the Ko Olina golf club. My husband played and I rode along. There is a Roy's located at the golf club. We didn't eat there as I've been to Roy's before. We found out that there is a marina that is walking distance to the hotel and catamarans go out from there. We didn't do this because we had a boat trip planned in Kauai but it would be convient to go from the Marriott. We would stay here again and will likely go here when we have children. We recommend driving to Lanikai (get a map from the concierge) and going to the beach & park there. We had a picnic lunch. We brought our our cooler. It is a beautiful beach and it's not crowded like Hanauma Bay. We drove H3 then headed south. There is a Hawaiian ice place in a white and red checkered building around Waimanalo Beach Park on the way to/from Lanikai. The best Hawaiian ice we had the entire trip. It's a little dive but good. Apparently it's on lonely planet as they had a sticker on there window. Sorry I can't remember the name of it. I believe that road is 427 the 444 the 693, etc. and heads down the coast. It's a nice drive on the east side of the island. We also stopped and watched surfer's at Sandy Beach. (further south) There are many turn offs on this road to look at views.

Reviews.Title: “good time, sad to leave”
Reviews.Author: KatieDavis
Reviews.Content: Hawaii is paradise so it's always a bummer to leave. The beach club is a time share property, so just expect that they try to sell you a unit. Probably a great deal if you have a family. The villas are great. They are spacious with a kitchen stocked with the essential cooking gear. The bathroom was huge and all tile. BBQs outside. There are a few pools and hot tubs. The gym is very nice and there is a 3 mile running trail along the beach. There are multiple lagoons with no current or wave, so it is really easy snorkeling. Pros: pretty, clean, great units and spacious. You can easily fit a family whereas in a hotel room, that would be tight. Cons: lot's of kids (but maybe that is good for you), no poolside service. I'm used to hotels that come by the pool and hand you pinapple, clean your sunglasses, ask you if you need a drink etc. There isn't any of this here. Yoga, snorkel rental, any activity etc isn't included, which seems to be the theme these days unless you go to a super high end resort (and pay 3x as much). But, if you have a family, this really would be great. It's not too far outside Waikiki so you can still go there for the shopping, eating, etc. BUT it's 20x more relaxing/pretty than Waikiki. You have tons of space on the beach, and you can relax out here in Ko Olina. You can walk next store to the JW Marriott that has a few more food options and shops, or there is a shuttle. There is a lot of construction going on, but it didn't bother me. You might want to go here now before the construction ends and there are more hotels with crowds. They're building some fancy condo's and there is also going to be huge hotel, The Grand Ko Olina, (similar to the Grand Wailea). Or, you can wait - soon they'll have a ferry that goes between Ko Olina and Waikiki which will be awesome. Lovely place. If you want the kitchen facility instead of just a plane hotel room, then stay here. If you don't need that and want a little more classy, grown up atmosphere, the stay next store at the JW.

Reviews.Title: “Be forewarned. Expect time share mentality.”
Reviews.Author: proudnewdad
Reviews.Content: As a frequent Marriott customer and a frequent visitor to Oahu I decided to depart from my normal hotel (Turtle Bay) and try Ko Olina. I booked at the Beach Club, assuming that the level of service would be as a typical Marriott Hotel. Instead I discovered that the Beach Club caters to the Time Share user and gives the 'normal' traveler sub-standard service. I had to wait two hours for my room to get ready once I arrived. The room was half the size of a room at Turtle Bay. The shower is 2 ft 8 inches wide and has a shower curtain which translates to very cramped quarters. No room service offered and parking facilities are small to say the very least. It's back to Turtle Bay for me on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “A 3 Star Experience”
Reviews.Author: Bathtubbettie
Reviews.Content: Let me preface by saying a 5 star hotel to my husband and I would be a Ritz Carlton or a Four Seasons Hotel. This, in my opinion, is not a 5 star accommodation. The rooms are nice and fairly spacious but are really quite generic. The towels are not fluffy and soft but very thin and scratchy. The toiletries are not nice either. They have a strange scent. I recommend bringing your own shampoo and soap. The large tub is not a jacuzzi tub and you will have to bring your own bath salts or bubble bath. The rooms are not cleaned every day but the trash is emptied and your towels are replaced. Personally, I think the floors should be vacumed and cleaned every day and the bathtub should be cleaned daily as well. The room we had provided a beach front view but there is construction going on next door so you see the vacant lot and parking for the construction workers right out the window as well. The food is very average. We could not find a chicken sandwich anywhere on this property. You have to go to the neighboring Ihilani hotel if you want a nice lunch or breakfast. We ate at Chuck's Steak House one night and we did not like it. We went to Morton's at Ala Moana later on. They also have a Ruth's Chris Steak House at Restaurant Row. You might eat at Roy's which is at the Golf Club at Ko Olina. The food there is good but the ambience is not that nice inside. Sit outside instead. We drove into town everyday to eat and to go to all of our activities. The traffic in Honolulu has really increased in the last couple of years. It took us about an hour to get to Hanauma Bay at 7:00 AM. If you want to just stay at the resort and not venture out, this is a good place to stay for families as it is not very expensive but if you want luxury and want to be closer to the action, then I would stay at the Kahala Mandarin Oriental Hotel. Better yet, just go to Maui and book a room at the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, but the construction really is bad”
Reviews.Author: Jasherrr
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many marriott's and had great experiences - unfortunately this was not one of them. The good: 1 - Spacious two bedroom was perfect - high enough to get a water view which was nice 2 - Pools were nice, especially the Steam room and Sauna they have in the lockerrooms - very cool 3 - Lagoons were great for playing in - especially with Kids 4- Easy walk to the JW Marriott to see sharks and rays swimming in their hotel lagoons The Not so good: 1 - I can not overestimate how distracting and annoying the construction is. We were there over Mom's day weekend and the construction happened every day. Imagine being in the lagoon and hearing the "BeepBeepBeep" of a backing up truck all day long. Honestly - I will not go back to this property until construction is complete. 2 - It is kind of remote - we spent a lot of time in the car to see anything - but that would be the same almost anywhere in Oahu 3 - It really is sandwiched between a power plant and an electrical plant - and it really is visually unappealling as you drive up. You dont notice once you are on property. 4 - It is a timeshare so you get solicited often and thats not necessarily they most relaxing thing. Bottom line - dont even consider coming here unless you have small kids, and if you do - be prepared for construction on both sides of the property.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but little to do around the area”
Reviews.Author: aduran
Reviews.Content: My wife my 2 children and myself. The hotel is beautiful, the rooms are excellent. With so many extras in the room itself. Great activities through the week. The only problem is that it is so far away from everything unless you have a car you will not enjoy hawaii. I didnt rent a car and had little to do. Cars are expensive specially me being 24 and they wanted to charge me an extra fee eventhough my b-day is just a couple of days away. There is construction going around, little noisy but didnt notice only if i paid attention to it. They have activities in all 4 lagoons. Which are perfect for the little ones. Didnt see that many young couples, more older couples with no kids. The Luau on Tuesday is great i would recommend it, the Chief is very funny. Although you can watch the entire thing without paying for it. We paid for the first one but just sat by the pool on the second one. If you are looking for some action and many things to do, stay in Waikiki for sure. Young people will get bored. It is a nice place, but probably won't go back again, unless I rent a car.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Resort Yet”
Reviews.Author: nrichmond
Reviews.Content: We checked in on May 4 stayed thru the 11th and this resort is fabulous!!! It is the best timeshare resort we have stayed at yet, loved it and plan to return. We were in a lock off unit and it was more comfortable than a hotel suite, clean with no view. The bed was very comfortable. The maintence at this resort is awesome, and owners are getting their monies worth. The landscaping is beautiful and we loved the walking path along the beach. We only dined at the resort once at the beach side restraunt and it was good comparable to TGI Fridays or Applebee's at home. We had a rental car from Advantage and had no problems with their service. Since this was our second trip to the Island we didnt repeat and do all the tourist tours. We relaxed and took in the beauty of the Island. We did go to Kuola Ranch and do the movie set tour. It was nice but over priced for what you see. We visited the Honolulu Zoo and it was nice, would be great for kids.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! From NY.”
Reviews.Author: keepnposted
Reviews.Content: It was my first time to Oahu and really enjoyed staying off the beaten path. We really enjoyed our trip but there were a few things that we were told we just had to do and we were disappointed, so I'll share these with you as well. First the resort: Anyone staying here should rent a car, parking is easy and it makes for easy sightseeing and shopping. The front desk will give you quick directions to Kapolei if you need groceries, gas, etc. The property is beautiful and very well maintained. Although this is the dry side of the island, the resort is tropical. We ate at the steak house at the main building and enjoyed the food. The beach bar is good but we enjoyed lunch moreso from the pool grill that opens Thurs to the weekend and somewhere around noon, we loved their macaroni-potato salad. Everyone was very friendly. If your flight is long after check out, pack a bag with toiletries and change of clothes, hang out at the beach/pool and take advantage of the access to the locker room with shower and hairdryer. If you rent a convertible wear sunblock! We got comp tix to the Fia Fia Luau for attending the timeshare presentation. Kathie Rust was the person assigned to us - she was great. Very nice, really listened, no overkill. The luau was just ok. We didn't like the food and the show was mostly about tribes from different polynesian islands (their dress and dance). This came highly recommended by the girl at the welcome desk. She also highly recommended the drive to the north shore (ok, not great). It was a nice drive. We went to see the surfers and got lucky because it was a very windy day and waves were 17ft high and so they were out. Make sure you travel with a map. Signage is poor and I couldn't find the names of the beaches so guessed alot as to where we were. The North shore beaches do not appear to be conducive to swimming, and no one was in the water that day. The welcome desk girl highly recommended the Shrimp Truck (I read about it in books as well), we were not impressed. The real problem is you have to peel your own shrimp - which isn't easy when your shrimp is covered with sauce. Try it, if you like, just make sure you have lots of napkins! We drove through Haleiwa and, as directed, HAD to stop at Matsumotos ice shop. Not being great fans of the snow cone, we found the syrup to be extremely sweet and tossed ours. Again, if you're into that sort of thing you may love it! We felt like tourists in NY buying hot dogs from a street vendor, NY locals really don't do that. While we were up there we checked out the sacred site Puu O Mahuka Heiau, which was just interesting. Frommers listed it as having one of the best views - we found the view to be very limited. Highly recommend: When in the Honolulu area, definitely take the Tantalus drive to Puu Ualakaa State Park. You drive through a residential area and then a rain forest, which is beautiful. The state pk has a fantastic view of Diamond Head and Honolulu, it must be a secret because we were the only ones up there! We had it all to ourselves! It is VERY windy up there. When you leave the park you'll have to go back the way you came, as the road is closed ahead. Pearl Harbour is a must. We got there early (8:30am), as suggested, and the lines weren't bad at all. We got to look around for the 1 hour wait to take the boat across to the memorial. We also visited Mighty Mo and enjoyed that very much as well. We took the Ko Olina Cat Sunset Sail which I'm not sure I would recommend. The staff were very nice and attentive, but they take you along the shore, where there are power plants, so ahead the island looks nice but not most of it. What was fantastic - aside from the sunset - was that we were lucky to come upon a school of spinner dolphins. The captain immediately drove up to them and we had a wonderful time watching them. It was a great trip, but were it not for the dolphins.... I can't help but think that a sunset sail along Waikiki would have been nicer. All in all, if you plan to visit Oahu, and don't want to do the crowded city, overcrowded beach thing, by all means you will find a relaxing, comfortable vacation at Ko Olina!

Reviews.Title: “Don't belive people that say its quiet here - its not!”
Reviews.Author: Kevbosf
Reviews.Content: If you want to go to Hawaii for peace and quiet - DO NOT STAY HERE!. We stayed our 5 days for the package and then moved to the JW Marriott down the road - it was fantastic. The Lack of Peace - back to the vacation club - say you want to relax and read a book - and we were a couple with no kids. There are two pools - both are filled with screaming kids and believe it or not - many locals with their kids. Ok so then you decide to head to the beach. That is where the two new towers are going up and you will hear hammering, constant beeping, and the joy of having a backhoe 50 feet from your reading spot. Anyone that has ever been to a construction site knows it is anything but quiet. The fact that you would pay to have a massage within 100 feet of construction work is beyond me. What most people here did not mention is that there is ALSO construction on the other side of the resort - on some new condos going up. Our first day there we realized that the only way to get any peace and quiet at this resort was to leave. We went down the road to the lagoon by the JW - which was the only spot nearby that had any peace and quiet. So if quiet is what you want - this is NOT the place to be. Once the construciton is done years from now maybe.... Food - We found the beach bar and grill to be marginal at best. The only good thing on the menu was the pork quesidilla and the weekend buffett. Chuck's Steakhouse is the "nice" restaurant at the beach club. We found the steaks overpriced and not very good - and the staff wears sneakers so why even bother getting dressed up to eat there. It was not "nice" in our opinion. The Area - there is nothing in Ko Olina area except Ko Olina. We have been to Maui and Kuaui many times and we always enjoyed walking to other restuarants and shops. This resort is nowhere near finished and there is nothing outside of the hotels. The front desk lady told us if we wanted to see "nice" areas to go to the north shore. By the way - on the south side of the resort is a Marina next to a large power plant or industrial plant - for many people the plant is their view if not the parking garage. What was good? - We found the staff to be great - they were super helpful and friendly in every way. The bar and grill staff was funny and friendly and the shows were great. The rooms are also a highlight - huge wonderful suites with great finishes and plenty of room to relax. (which is important when the only quiet place in the resort is your bedroom) Marriott has done a nice job and when it is all done someday it may be a great place to hang out and relax. BUT BEWARE what other say here - it is NOT QUIET. We were upset that we wasted five days at this resort since we both work high stress jobs and wanted to relax. For the same money there are SO MANY OTHER PLACES you could go. The JW down the street was very nice and relaxing. Go to Maui or Kuai - and if you like the Vacation Clubs go to Wiaohai in Kuai - it is peaceful and you can walk to a ton of restuarants. Ko Olina is not ready for prime time and you should not waste your precious vacation time there or pay full price for an unfinished product.

Reviews.Title: “All Around Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: gvldiva
Reviews.Content: I am currently staying at the Marriott Ko Olina. We arrived Sunday, April 28, 2007. I am not going to discuss tourist attractions as I really want to concentrate on the resort for this review. This is a beautiful resort. It is a Timeshare Resort. It is on the website and you definitely know it when you get here. Not intrusive, but a timeshare just as well. We purchased our week from an owner here. Yes there is construction, but the noise from the construction is not intrusive. As a matter of fact, I sat outside at the bar and grill for lunch today and had to concentrate on the construction noise to notice. I noticed the fighter jet more than the construction noise. Remember this is an island and no matter where you are, you will more or less be in the flight path of commercial and/or military planes. Also, all of the construction is not Marriott Construction. Anyone who is sensitive to noise should stay up on the North Shore or another island. Whether one stays in Honolulu or at the Ko Olina, there is going to be some type of noise. We have a 1 bedroom villa in the Kona tower that is equipped with sitting and dining area, full kitchen, washer, dryer, etc. The furnishings are lovely and well maintained. I did upgrade (for $10) the tidy service to a full cleaning and added an additional full cleaning ($45) making a total of 2 full cleanings for the week. We left the staff a tip each day on the pillow in the bedroom when they did the full cleaning and we had no complaints I will say, if you expect to see the ocean from floors 4 and below, forget it. You will need to be on the 5th floor atleast. We are on the 4th floor with a Mountain view and I have to tip toe to see the ocean. Yes, there are cranes in the view, but hey I still see the mountains and when I really want to see the ocean, I just go down to it and get one of the many available chairs and just enjoy the view. Yes on one side of the resort is a chemical plant, but while on the resort, I didn't see it. I don't know if it was because our room wasn't on that side or what. I just know it is there because I saw it as we drove in. In reference to meals, I have not had a bad meal while on the property. Yes, it is pricey, but what hotel isn't. My husband had a fish dinner and I had a shrimp dinner for appx $50 (including tip) total. We pay more than that at Outback! Drinks run about $10 when it is not happy hour. By the way, I don't know why folks are saying the valet parking is so expensive. We valet parked for $5/day. My husband didn't want to, but I said it was worth it to me to be able to have someone have my car ready when I wanted it. We would just tip the valet. The staff upon check in was a little slower than I am use to, but I really think it was because they wanted to make sure everything was correct and because they have more information to give you than front counter reps with traditional hotels. All were very nice and were as accommodating as they were able to be. The concierge was exceptional. All directions were on the money and not one time did we get lost. The distance from Honolulu is not bad at all. There is traffic, but I drive in Atlanta on a regular basis, so it's all relative as far as I am concerned as traffic in ATL is a bear! We drove back this afternoon in about 30 minutes. I honestly don't understand some of the reviews of this resort being too far out. Going to the North Shore is a little further. We went to the Polynesian Cultural Center (very nice) and it took 90 minutes to go up there. Unless you want to do everything in Honolulu, you will have to venture out. But believe me, it is well worth it. All in all, we are having a fantastic time at this resort. It is not as happening as in Honolulu, but I wouldn't expect it to be. Here you will find people who want to enjoy a nice calm vacation. If you are so stressed that you can't stand noise, you can't stand to hear a child cry, and that you expect everyone to jump at your every command, not only is the Ko Olina not for you, but the whole island of Oahu is not for you. Folks are really laid back here and enjoy life. Look I am one of those type A personality people, but here I have learned to relax and to remember, I came to be on vacation! BTW...while you are here, try to get a message by the sea or use the very nice workout facility. And if you want to do something a little higher end, just head over to the JW Marriott next door. ENJOY!

Reviews.Title: “Nice quiet spot on a busy island”
Reviews.Author: BostonTravellers
Reviews.Content: We traded our time share for a unit here. The facility is like a high rise hotel. We had a great ocean view from the room, and the unit comfortable and well appointed. The location was good for us since we didn't want to be in the hustle of the city, but it does limit dining and nightlife options.

Reviews.Title: “Get a timeshare offer for a GREAT deal”
Reviews.Author: travelboundseattle
Reviews.Content: We booked a stay here through a vacation offer mailed to us. Paid less that $800 for 5 nights, with a rental car and $100 resort credit included. This was truly an outstanding deal given the prices in Hawaii. Kudos for Marriott for providing exactly what was promised - no huge tack on fees, rental car was ready and already arranged, and we were able to use the credit for a nice dinner at the other Marriott resort nearby. The resort is amazing. Lots to do, very mellow atmosphere. We did go snorkeling in the the lagoons near the hotel and saw lots of turtles and other fish. Studio room was on the smallish size, but was perfect for two. Nicely done and brand new, we had a nice pool/ocean view. Really considered buying a timeshare except for two reasons. 1. We ended up with a selling agent that just didn't know how to close the deal with us. She kept on focusing on the view outside the sales suite, and the great deal it was and we kept on asking to actually SEE a full unit which we never got around to. After asking twice, we gave up and asked for our additional dining credits and left. 2. This area is largely untouched and not too busy, however, with all the construction at this complex and the Four Seasons next door I fail to see how it will remain this way in years to come. They will be adding thousands of units to the four lagoons.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort, awful beds”
Reviews.Author: phxhenson1
Reviews.Content: This resort has it all. There are great beaches, great pools, and amazing grounds. The beds and pillows, however, were some of the worst I have had in a long time. After 5 days, every muscle hurt and I wanted to toss them off of the balcony. I have come to expect a very good product from Marriott and this was a disappointment. My guess is that the remodel cycle will fix this problem with time.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise, under construction.”
Reviews.Author: beachnut2
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 10 day spring break trip to Oahu and Maui with our two girls ages 10 and 7. We stayed 5 nights at Koolina using their timeshare sales promotion, which was a great deal. The rooms are beautiful and new, the two pools are great for kids. Make sure to get the $100 upgrade to a "master" suite, 1 br unit with a kitchen/washer & dryer, it's very spacious. Granite countertops, tumbled stone in the bathrooms, nicely furnished. The non-upgrade lock off hotel rooms are small in comparison, but still nicely furnished. Go for groceries in Kapolei at the Safeway which is just off the H1 freeway three miles from the resort. The resort has alot of BBQ's which are well maintained. There were lots of families enjoying all the amenities of the resort. The beach club facilities appear to be better than the JW Marriott Ilihani up the road. Go there for the morning fish feeding to get your souvenier laminated fish card. Be warned that there is major construction going on at this resort. There are five giant cranes on both sides of the property and the constant "beep, beep, beep" of the heavy construction vehicles. The area will be under construction until at least 2011. If you schedule your stay over the weekend, there is not much construction activity those two days, which is when you will want to use the lagoons, otherwise it is very noisy until around 5:00 pm when the construction stops. The noise is mostly blocked out in the pool area by the buildings, lots of kids and music. We had an "island view" on the 2nd floor, which wasn't horrible, but you could see cars going by. All our requests for upper level ocean view were impossible because they were fully booked. They reserve the bottom 4 floors for the sales promotions, if you are an owner or exchanging you have a much better chance for a high floor, ocean view. My in-laws had a lock off unit situated right over the parking garage with a view of the industrial area, think power plants, not Hawaii. Anyway if you can get past the construction and possibly poor views, the rooms and resort itself is very nice. Koolina is about a half hour from the airport and honolulu. Recommended stops: - Polynesian cultural center on the North Shore, about an hour and 15 minutes of straight drive time, which is an all day event.Get an entertainment book for Hawaii and save $40 at the PCC. - Dole plantation to check out the pineapples growing and get a Pineapple whip ice cream treat. - Arizona Memorial. We stopped in after 10:00 and got tickets for 1:30 I thought they might have been sold out by then, but it wasn't a problem. - Bishop's museum - planetarium show and the "Science on a Sphere" show were very good. Would have liked to have seen more. - Hanauma Bay on the East shore for snorkeling with turtles. - Train from Ewa beach nearby that runs through the Koolina property on Sundays. Take an early walk along the lagoons, do your touring (or relax by the pool) during the week days then enjoy the sunset and happy hour back at the lagoons after the construction workers go home. The area will be great in the future (2011?), but for now "paradise is under construction" at this end of Oahu.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort”
Reviews.Author: bdcil
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay at the property. We stayed at a one bedroom unit and it had plenty of room for a family of five. I agree with the other reviews that it gets quiet at night, but it was just perfect for us. We went there to relax, and that we did. We have 3 kids and they absolutely loved the lagoons and the pool area. We felt so safe-the waves aren't as strong as it would be if you're in an open ocean beach. We didn't even have to go far for snorkeling. We saw a lot of fish just around the lagoon. They swim side by side with you. (Hanauma Bay is another good site for snorkeling.) We had lunch one day at the beachside restaurant, and they served excellent lunch. At that time, they had the "Prime Rib Special with seafood" for $16.99. It was very good and an excellent deal for the price. Yummie!! We planned on visiting a lot of places in Oahu, but had to change our plans when we got to the property. We opted to relax rather than go out. We were able to get the Vacation Package of 6 days/5 nights with a car for $649. An excellent deal if you can get it. The catch is you have to attend a 90 minute time share presentation. We loved the property so much we decided to buy a time share. The neighboring town of Kapolei offers a lot of dining options, grocery stores, and source for other things you might need. It's only about 10 minutes away . We saved a lot of money by either dining there or buying take out foods and eating back at the hotel. There are also a lot of bbq grills you can use. After checking out, we spent a day at the Hilton Hawaiian Village in Waikiki and 5 more days at the Kaanapali Beach Club in Maui. These properties do not compare to the Marriott and even my 5 year old keeps telling me he wants to go back to "his old room at the Marriott."

Reviews.Title: “Awesome vacation!”
Reviews.Author: clmmbs
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful relaxing place to stay. I little bit of a drive to Honolulu, but well worth it in peace and quite. The city is very metropolitan, nice shops and restaurants, very little parking is available so be prepared to pay to park. Park in hotel parking and have a drink at their bar and they will validate your parking. We parked for a couple of hours and it cost about $24, could have had a couple drinks instead and saved the parking fee. The beach in Honolulu is crazy, and packed with people and a surfing dog or two. Pretty cute! It made going home to the Beach Club even more inviting with the beautiful beach walk, and gorgeous sunsets and occasional rainbow. There is construction, and with that a little noise, but not too noticable and certainly did not detract from a great resort. We are lucky to have friends who own at this resort, and that gave us the opportunity to experience the view from the 11th floor. We stayed in an emaculate two-bedroom suite, with exceptional decor and all the amenities we needed to stay forever. We enjoyed the buffet breakfast at the JW better than the Beach Club, but at $30 pp, we only did that a few times and had breakfast at the Beach Club a few times. It was more limited, but about 1/2 the cost. Restaurants are limited in the area, but it isn't difficult to find places, and very easy to cook on-site, either in room or at the bbq's near the pool. I can't think of anything to complain about, except that eventually we had to go home and back to work! Stay if you want a beautiful, relaxing holiday. Stay away if you want crowded beaches and a wild night life. For that stay in Honolulu. Loved it, can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Ko Olina's The Best!”
Reviews.Author: Rich S
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week at this great property. We are Marriott Vacation Club owners on Maui and love that property, but this property is head and shoulders over Maui. At the Maui Ocean club there are times when it feels very crowded and you can't get a lounge chair, the villias at Maui are also converted hotel rooms with a small kitchenette - at Ko Olina you get the purpose built villa with the full kitchen, soaking tub, etc. The only minor complaint is only one bath if you are renting the one bedroom, where Maui has two baths in the one bedroom - but that was really not a big deal for our small family of 3. The Villas at Ko Olina are beautiful with top of the line fixtures, and the most comfortable beds you will experience. Some have written here that Ko Olina is too quite, it's true there is not much night life but if you want a relaxing vacation with family, plenty to do, great dining options then this the resort for you. There are two medium size swimming pools that have plenty of shade, sun if wanted, and most important enough lounge chairs that you don't need to fight over them or arrive at 7 am! We were here over Easter week, the property was fully occupied and we never had trouble getting three lounge chairs together in sun or shade, the place never seemed crowded. A Nice thing about Ko Olina is that there are two restaurants on site, the pool restraint which serves B'fest, Lunc, and dinner - food pretty good, typical resort type prices. There is also a new steak place on site that just opened, we did not try on this trip. A lot of MVCI's don't have restaurants other then the Market Place, so this is a nice change. The JW Marriott is right next door and they also have several restaurants with charge privileges for Beach Club guests. The famous Roy's is also just across the street, so there are plenty of places to eat. Don't worry about the drive to Honolulu, 20 minutes tops - no big deal - but you will need a rental car. This is a great property for a family or couple that want a quieter vacation at a beautiful resort with typical friendly Marriott service and

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: HoustonSailor
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 7 night stay at KOBC. While there is some construction going on next door, the noise was pretty unobtrusive most of the time. You will need a car unless you are content to stay at the resort the whole time. We used ours to drive to the Safeway at Kapolei for breakfast and lunch supplies and just ate out for dinners. Even the efficiency units have microwave, mini-fridge, toaster and coffee maker. There are also very nice gas grills down by the pool where you can grill steaks, etc. Just by asking, we were given an ocean view on the 11th floor of the newer tower. All rooms in that tower have very comfy king size beds. The lanai is a bit small, but does have room for the smallish table and two chairs. There are two good size pools shared by the two towers. My only gripe was there was often excessive kid noise at both pools. I would prefer one pool be designated for adults only. We did attend a sales pitch for these pricey units but it was very professional with virtually no sales pressure. Seeing a model unit was helpful, since we were staying in the smaller "lock-off" unit. The staff was wonderful and very helpful with everything from driving directions to dinner reservations. The resort is very well run and kept clean and tidy. The one time we asked for fresh towels they arrived within minutes. The facilities seem to be sized correctly for the resort. Although occupancy seemed to be about 90% we never had trouble finding lounge chairs by the pool or a grill to use. Overall a very positive experience. Hope to return some day soon.

Reviews.Title: “Merry Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Bdbc
Reviews.Content: Our Marriott stay was fantastic. Front desk staff was very welcoming. We were on the 4th floor with a partial ocean view. Our suite was very large and had all the comforts of home. The bedroom was spacious, tv, warm colors, feather bed pillows and very comfortable bed and bedding. The bath and shower were very large and spotlessly clean as well as the rest of the suite. The living, dining and kitchen were very nice with a lanai and large picture windows and sliding door. Modern appliances and fully equip. kitchen. Two beautiful swimming pools, 4 jacuzzis, a beach lagoon with lounge chairs and unbelievable sunsets to enjoy. We enjoyed happy hour each day from 3-5 at the beachfront rest. and lounge. The food was very good as were the drinks. Try a Keylime Kolada fantastic! They also made virgin drinks for our teens that were very tasty. The landscaping was very lovely, lots of palm trees, waterfalls, walkways to enjoy. We would definitely stay here the next time we visit Oahu.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort!!!”
Reviews.Author: mdcrim
Reviews.Content: This was an incredible resort. The staff were wonderful, the grounds were beautiful. The rooms itself was spectacular! My only complaint was that we, literally, overlooked the parking garage. But I still give the Ko Olina an excellent review, as that was the only downside of our 5 nights there. The room itself was so nice, with a full kitchen, washer/ dryer and georgous granite. The bathroom was marble. I would love for my house to look so nice. The lagoons are beautiful. They are numbered 1-4, with 1 being by the JW Marriott and the Ko Olina Beach Club being by lagoon 3. Lagoon 1 is where they do the fish feeding at 7:30am every morning. Lagoon 2 is rumored to have visiting turtles-we didn't spend enough time at that lagoon to see any. Tip for future travelers-past lagoon 4 there is a marina that has a little store. The store has very basic breakfast for under $5 and the store prices are cheaper than the resort store-saves a little money. Also, the JW Marriott has outdoor pools that house sharks and sting-rays. Really cool for the kiddies to see. Personally I thought that the JW was very sterile and cold. Just my personal observation. Back to the beach club-the pools are great-sandy beach entry with fake lava for the younger crowd, basketball hoop for the tweenies and a separate pool that seemed to cater to the older crowd. Never had a problem finding pool lounges. There seemed to be entertainment every night we were there, from the Mai Tai party to musicians at the beach restaurant. This resort is quite a bit off the beaten path. The traffic to and from Waikiki during rush hour can rival metro DC traffic (my stomping ground), which was a little surprising. We stocked up on supplies at the closest stores, about 10 minutes drive away. The hotel provided us the info on where to find the closest stores and restaurants. Overall I think that this is one of the nicest resorts I've ever stayed at. I can overlook the horrible view in exchange for all of the wonderful amenities that this resort offers.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the resort”
Reviews.Author: BTrish
Reviews.Content: The resort was beautiful, clean, and the employees were helpful and kind. We booked part of our stay in a timeshare we purchased on Ebay and then booked another two days on our own through the resort. The staff was incredibly attentive. They even recognized the name on both of our reservations and booked us in the same room for our entire stay. We only ate at one of the restaurants at the resort because it was the only one that wasn't pricey. We enjoyed the grill down by the beach. The food was good and the view was fabulous. Most of the time we opted to cook on our own or eat out.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing”
Reviews.Author: micheledamico
Reviews.Content: We took advantage of a promotion that was supposed to be a deal. I wanted an ocean view and was told if I upgraded I would get one. Well I paid the money and when I got here I was given a room with a view of a parking lot. No apologies, no explanation. They didn't care. The resort is clean but charmless. It's OK for bringing the kids but otherwise is bland and dull. It's located between a power plant and and industrial park complete with billowing smokestacks. Really ugly! The man made lagoons make a nice beach to toddlers but that's basically all this resort has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Oahu Hands Down”
Reviews.Author: Hawaii1010
Reviews.Content: The Ko'olina is a fantastic resort. I was very hesitant after reading some reviews on the construction so I only booked the hotel for half the trip. I ended up canceling the next hotel so we could stay longer at the Ko'olina. The construction noise is very minimal. First off the service is amazing. Never been to a resort with friendlier more welcoming staff. They gave great snorkel tips around the area and kept us informed of fun events at the hotel. (You can feed the fish in the lagoons on the property in the morning. The staff gives out cards to identify the fish that come to the feeding.) If your goal is to just party in Hawaii this is not the resort for you. I would recommend Waikiki. However this resort is not dead. There is a seaside bar to enjoy a couple Hawaiian cocktails. It is simply a nice play to unwind and relax. The lagoons are beautiful and easy to swim in due to the wave breakers that are in place. We were also able to snorkel and see quite a few fish. There are three lagoons so if one is murky for a day you have two others to try. I plan on going back to the Ko'olina very soon. After visiting Hawaii many times I can honestly say this is the best resort in Oahu.

Reviews.Title: “pretty, but not for young couples w/out kids!”
Reviews.Author: Masha29
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ko Olina Beach Club 2/24 through 3/1, first impression was wonderful, nice views, pleasant service, but quickly found out that this place is geared towards older couples(much older) and families with children...pretty boring actually, the whole place closes down by about 9:30. I imagine if I we were older with kids we would have loved it, they really seem to go out of their way to cater to the little ankle biters. The kids were running around all over the place having a blast. Older folk seemed to be really enjoying themselves too, golf, very, very easy listening music at the beach bar..so mellow we practically went into a coma. They have a lot of rules too, no drinks on the beach, no smoking but on the beach, can't do this, can't do that....we quickly figured out we were the outcasts and we would have to start breaking the rules. got the occasional dirty look from the uptight but oh well, we paid just as much as they did to stay there!!! Since the resort was such a snore we rented a car and traveled all over the island, North Shore, Wakikii, Pearl Harbor, Diamond Head, Pele lookout, the bay, east, west, north, south, we pretty much did it all. Oahu is a beautiful spot, weather is perfect...only suggestion is if you're 30 and under without kids and like to have fun, do not stay at the Ko Olina Beach Club, there are plenty of other places to stay that will have a more lively atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “cheesey”
Reviews.Author: mamma0233
Reviews.Content: Let me first say that we are owners at another timeshare area. As with that one we responded to a great deal, this time $750 for 5 nights, rental car and resort credits. That being said, we were treated to a tiny room (evidently the studio side of a lock off ,tiny sink, only microwave worthless fridge) and a really glorious view of the parking garage complete with gas fumes on the Lani, which is so tiny the two of us have to dance around to get seated. No we did NOT do the tour! treated like second class citizens (who own MUCH BETTER) there was no way we were wasting time when we are on a beatutiful island. there is a great deal to see and do here, North Shore, Honolulu...Punchbowl etc IF you are prepared to drive. The one saving grace is that the staff here is wonderful, friendly, helpful and personable. We basically look at this as a cheap week to visit friends here before we head to Maui. No way would we buy.

Reviews.Title: “Ko Olina is the best place to stay on Oah'u!”
Reviews.Author: jbellon
Reviews.Content: This place is great. Rented an Ocean View 1Bd/1Ba villa for myself, wife and two kids (7 & 4) and I couldn't have been happier. The staff, the restaurant, the lagoons, the pools and grounds were perfect. We spent most of our time at the resort, its that good. At first, we were given a villa on the 4th floor with a not so good view of the ocean. After expressing my concerns to the Front Desk Manager, Yvette, we were moved to the 10th floor the next day and it was stupendous! The views are wonderful, the sunsets are beautiful and the room was perfect. Full kitchen for cooking and a great palce to relax. There was a little construction going on but isn't there always, didn't bother us at all. TIP - if you reserve an ocean view room, make sure its above the 8th floor or you don't get that good of a view. This place gets 5 stars from me!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Spot!”
Reviews.Author: matchtrader
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a two week vacation in Hawaii, a week of which was spent at the Ko'Olina Beach Club. We have three small children, ages 7, 5 and 1.5 so were looking for a facility that had kitchen-equipped suites, a nice calm beach and good pool facilities. After much looking, we decided on the Marriott Ko'Olina Beach Club and we are very glad we did. We have stayed in a number of Marriott vacation club properties in the past, including another in Hawaii, and found this one to be the best. Sure, it does not have certain amenitites such as room service, that full service hotels may offer, but then again, how many full service hotels provide a full kitchen and bar-b-cue facilities? So long as you know what to expect, I cannot see how anyone could be disappointed in this facility. The lagoons and the pools are very nice and large enough that they never seem overcrowded. When we were in Oahu, they were experiencing very significant winds which created very rough surf over just about the entire island. Despite this, however, we always were able to find a clam spot in one of the four lagoons (often the one right in front of the hotel) that was suitable for swimming. In addition, the pools were warm and offered a great deal of variety for our kids who had a great time. A lot has been written in the reviews about the remoteness of the location. This is for the most part true, but so long as you have a car (and I don't believe anyone who comes to this place would not have a car), you can find just about anything you need within a five or ten minute drive. The Marketplace store on site is also a decent place to pick up supplies, which we found to be reasonably priced (by Hawaii standards). If you want nightlife, you might have to drive in to Honolulu, but that was not a bad drive, particularly if you avoided peak business rush hour times. Unlike many hotels in the area, parking is included and if you want to upgrade to valet parking (we did and found it a wonderful convenience) the cost is quite cheap (I think about $5/day). There is certain some construction on the properties located on either side of the hotel, but apart from the visuals associated with a construction site (cranes and heavy equipment as seen from our balcony), we were not bothered at all by it. The staff was extremely helpful and without exception very friendly. They honestly seemed like they cared about how our stay was going and wanted to make sure we were happy. The on-site Luau option was a bit pricey (something like $70/adult and $50/child) but we found to be well worth it. The buffet supper was quite good and the entertainment varied and interactive enough to entertain our little guys for the entire time. Local attractions are mostly nearby, Hanuama bay is about a 1/2 hour drive as is the north shore. We really enjoyed the Swap meet at Aloha stadium, which was a fantastic place to go to pick up local souvenirs, etc., at sometimes ridiculosly low prices. The beach at Hanuama bay was a big surprise as we thought the place to be mostly focused on snorkeling but it turns out that this is one of the nicer beaches in all of Hawaii. The short hike up to Waimea falls was also a great thing to do, with a nice wide walking path suitable for small children and strollers. When you get to the falls, you can even go for a swim in the waterfall pool -- cold water, but very great experience. They even provide you with life jackets for the little ones. We would not recommend the Dole Pinnapple Plantation as we found it to be quite gimmicky. All in all, this was a great spot. We will most certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation Ever!”
Reviews.Author: lovinalmond
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ko Olina Beach Club for 6 days at the end of Jan 2007. I can say that it was the best vacation we have ever been on. The staff was amazing! The first day we were greeted by Melvin ~ who by the way was really fun to talk to. We did the timeshare presentation with Robyn and she was great. Unfortunately we decided not to purchase a timeshare due to other financial obligations. However, but we loved it so much that we are thinking about purchasing by the end of this year. The room was beautiful, the grounds were amazing and the views were astounding. I would definately stay there again. I have told everyone I know about how beautiful the Ko Olina Beach Club is!!! Thanks for a great vacation ~ and great hawaiian memories!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Marriott just knows how to do it right!”
Reviews.Author: bodyforlife
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the JW Marriott on our last trip, but were unable to get rooms there this year, so we tried the Beach Club. This entire property is just incredible. We had as good, if not better time at the Beach Club (and the stay last year at the JW was spectacular). It never ceases to amaze me why people want to stay in Waikiki. There are only two places I will stay now when going to Oahu...either Ko Olina or on the North Shore at Turtle Bay. These two resorts are by far the nicest if you want to get an Island experience. They're both very isolated and very relaxing, unlike the downtown Waikiki area which is just congested with people and shopping malls (why even go to the islands if you want to experience that). We arrived Saturday and returned on Tuesday and barely had any traffic getting into town (obviously we're smart enough not to drive during morning rush hour...hopefully you'll be sleeping during that also). The general commute to Waikiki was about 25 minutes (big whoop...don't let people scare you by saying it's a tough commute because it's not). The resort has a beautiful lagoon, spacious rooms (unlike the broom closests in the hotels at Waikiki), a golf course, and they even built a football field for the NFL stars that play in the Pro Bowl (that's why I was unable to book the JW on this trip). It was fun seeing many of the NFL players walking the grounds in the morning before practice. Give it a try, I guarantee you'll love the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Bliss”
Reviews.Author: qweenbee
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Ko Olina was the best ever! We decided to celebrate our 10 year anniversary here and it was a fabulous choice. The resort is on the Marriott grounds and you kind of feel like you're in a world away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki beach (which is only approx 25 mins away). The ocean-view villa was beautiful. It was like home away from home. The pools were clean and inviting. The ocean views and sunsets from our lanai were remarkable! There are restaurants, a convenience store and water activities right on site. This resort is right on the ocean, so you have access to the beach and protected cove, along with the option of using the pools or hot tubs. The food on site was pretty good, but a little pricey, so we also shopped at the Safeway and purchased groceries. They have themed nights at one of the restaurants, so that you can enjoy different cuisines. The service was outstanding and we never needed for anything. Everyone went out of their way to make sure we had a fabulous stay from the front desk to hostess staff. There's a spa on site and you can enjoy massages by the sea, and we also enjoyed the luau (Paradise Cove) that was right on the Marriott grounds and had a fabulous time. This resort would be good for families or couples. We've been to Jamaica, Bahamas, and Mexico, but this was by far the best! We will definitely return to this resort... we actually didn't want to leave. :)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort!”
Reviews.Author: eighmeagh
Reviews.Content: This resort is absolutely gorgeous! We stayed in a one bedroom villa and everything was immaculate. Beautiful lanais with nice view of property and ocean. Fantastic bathroom with huge walk-in tile shower and separate oversized tub. Full kitchen. Basically it was like an upscale furnished apartment. Yes, construction is going on at this resort. Honestly, I scarcely noticed it. I never heard any noise unless I stopped and listened for it. And yes, there were some cranes visible from our lanai, but given that 90% of the view was of palms, pools, and ocean, the 10% part that included a crane didn't bother me one bit. Resort itself faces west so the sunsets are fantastic! Another thing that we loved about this resort is that it seemed uncrowded. There were definitely lots of people around, but the resort space is well managed and proportioned such that we never felt crowded on the beach or by the pools. This resort is definitely off the beaten path. If you are interested in the nightlife scene of Waikiki this resort is not for you. Only one restaurant currently at Beach Club, a couple more at the Marriott next door. There are some chain restaurants that are about a 5 minute drive away. We absolutely loved this resort as we had no interest in being right in Honolulu. Only slight drawback was that dining options were somewhat limited. We are looking forward to returning very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Location Information Here--Is it too far away? No!”
Reviews.Author: cooldoctor1
Reviews.Content: Ko Olina Beach Club is superb, and I will give you info. It is located on the same property as, but is different from, the Ko Olina Ihilani—which is a hotel. See my report from that hotel dated Jan 2005. I will give you info here not on other reviews. First, the construction is never great to have around you, but as long as you don; face it, you’ll be fine. Ask for a room that does not face the construction. I disagree with the reviewer regarding facing the pool; the pool is wonderful, palm tree-lined, and grotto-like. It is a pleasure to look at, and is nicely tiki torched and lighted at night. Although lower floors do not see the ocean because the pool and palms are in the way, who cares—it’s gorgeous. And not at all noisy. No planes or kid noises to a great extent, and we had a second floor unit facing the pool. It was a great, happy and sunny place. The staff is impeccable. The ocena and lagoons, a one minute walk from your room, as clearly wonderful. A recent review mentions the deceiving photos of the "blue pool"---that's the hotel Ihilani, as featured in Blue Crush (a great movie, rent it!). You have complete access to that hotel (saw Glenn Frey of Eagles staying there last year, and Pro Bowl Footballers stay at Ihilani) The condo, Ko Olina Beach Club, is better tha the hotel for room size and less hustle bustle and a better, yes, better, swimming pool, and hot tubs (three). I will now get to some things people do not write about as much, but might concern you. Location: ideal. It is about 30 minute very pretty drive to Waikiki beach, and you must have a car at Ko Olina. BUT, I hate driving, esp. on vacation, so you avoid all “hard” driving by staying here. The roads in this manned and gated complex go around the golf course and hotel (Ihilani and Ko Olina Beach Club) and are 25 mph affairs. Even when you get off the ground, you drive on the least traveled part of H-1, which could whisk you right to Waikiki if you desire (traffic gets worse the closer you get to it), or you can pop off on Kunia Road exit (8 miles) to a very untravveld and pretty road through pineapple country to the North Shore, Banzaii Pipeline, Hailewa, surf shops, etc. This exit has Wal-Mart, small eateries, Denny’s, and tons of shops. It is very nice and about 10 minute drive from report to Kunia Road. Remember that name: Kuni Road. You'll use it a lot to eat and get all over the place. It's easy and cool. From Kunia Rd, you can get anywhere on the island. For instance, you can back route it to H-3, which take you to lovely Lanaki Beach and Kailua Beach—worthy stops, indeed. Remember, the entire road around the entire island is only 90 miles… so you can get anywhere from here. If you do not want a car at all, or cannot drive, do please stay at Waikiki Beach. Great for walkers, and the city bus in HI is wonderful, clean and takes you around the entire island for about $2 (4 hours plus to round the whole island though). But if you are looking for a nice condo, washer and dryer in bigger unit, with a parking charge of $10 daily but free access to your car in the garage and always spaces (no valet necessary), gated in every way so ultra-secure, then Ko Olina Beach Club is it. Plenty of cheap eats minutes away. Off the Beaten Track: Take a walk on the wild side, and drive north to Mahaka and Waianae, some of the poorest parts of the island. Great surfing beaches, but plenty of beach tents from homeless, but you must drive through Mahaka Valley to see two superb golf courses with condos, million dollar homes, and the prettiest view on the island between two mountains and ocean in distance. Check out true Hawaii at Waianae and Mahaka, north of Ko Olina on H-1. Finally, one tourist tip…the best, and I mean the very best, view of the entire island—one that makes Diamond Head Crater seem like a low shoe rack at Payless Shoes, is the road to Tantalus and the Pa’aku State Park at the top. Totally free, totally drivable and views are stupendous. Check out Punchbowl Cemetery also for free and fun sights in the "quiet" part of Oahu. Conceierge will give you info. Enjoy Ko Olina. It rocks. We are headed back in 2007. And we did not buy the time share.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort Amidst Growing Area”
Reviews.Author: DanChicago
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week beginning Dec. 29th. We were at the resort last year and bought the 2 bedroom timeshare so knew what to expect. I expected a two bedroom unit at a great location that has construction going on both sides of the property. I did not expect daily maid service, only a midweek towel change and light cleaning. If you want daily maid service and full cleaning you need to stay at a hotel. While there is construction on each side of the property M-F, I did not notice it unless I focused on it. Since there are many beautiful views at the property and the area surrounding the four lagoons this was very easy to do. The construction will be going on for years as this area develops. If the sight and sound of construction cranes will spoil your vacation you need to stay elsewhere. We are a gay couple and I was a bit concerned that the resort would be overrun with children given all of the reviews that describe what a wonderful place this is for kids. While there were many kids we still found the pool area and lagoons to be peaceful. There were plenty of chairs at the pool which surprised me given previous comments. I also recommend having a car if you stay at this resort since it is in a very remote location. We enjoyed our stay and are looking forward to returning next year.

Reviews.Title: “Pros and Cons”
Reviews.Author: jinhui
Reviews.Content: Pros: 1. the hotel ground and surroundings are beautiful and nicely landscaped. 2. the lagoons are perfectly safe for small children, you can rent a limited number of water toys at logoon #3 (the one directly in front of the beach club). 3. the rooms are new and nicely furnished, it feels more like an upscale apartment than a hotel room. 4. very friendly staff - restaraunts, front desk, bell, desk, concierge ... everyone is helpful. Especially the lovely lady Tina at concierge, she saved my days couple of times by suggesting tours that fit our need perferctly. 5. nice restaraunts at JW Marriott, which is about half a mile away on paved, lit ocean fron pathway. nothing special about the only restaraunt onsite, except that they made above-average pina colada :) 6. if you're a runner like me, you won't be able to resist suiting up and running along the path way along the lagoons, it's a bit short, but with everything so beautiful, you wouldn't mind making a couple of roundtrips. 7. Ko Olina marina is right next door, couple of excursions depart from there, again, the concierge desk can be very helpful there. My impression of the common forum complaints - 1. flight path - I found it fun to watch jets flying over the hotel, the noise is totally an non-issue to me (and I'm very sensitive type). 2. construction - it is being done on both sides of the existing buildings, the time is limited, I believe 8-5, and the noise is not that noticable with the ocean-waves, but I did find myself having to conciously avoid the cranes when I'm framing with my cameras. While it's something you can totally ignore and still have a great time, it's a bit annoying, especially if you expect a "perfect" vacation. cons - 1. location - the hotel's 25-30 minutes drive away from Wakiki, on a good day. If your itenary includes Hanauma bay, you're at a disadvantage competing with the big crowd 20 miles closer than you. 2. most tours/excursions leave from Wakiki, so definitely get a car. Hope this is helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Review”
Reviews.Author: bucklong
Reviews.Content: First off - this is a beautiful resort. The grounds are very nice, the beach lagoons are great, especially for those with children, and the rooms are beautifully appointed. We had a guest room which is basically kind of like a "guest quarters" that is attached to a larger suite but can be rented seperately. It was really nice and had an ample kitchenette for quick breakfasts or lunches in the room. There is a Safeway store 3 miles away in Kapolei so we got cereal and juice and sandwich stuff etc. The pools are really nice, although if you are a sun worshipper you will find them too shaded by all the lovely palms. The hotubs are WONDERFUL. I don't know if the rock is fake or real but they are made of some sort of "lava rock" and a nice departure from the typical hottub. The beach is nice and has lounge chairs. You are not allowed to take alcoholic beverages on the beach - which is not big deal unless you'd like to sip a cool one in the heat of the afternoon. Many people take drinks there anyway and the "enforcement" is selective. One of my friends went to get a beer and was asked where he was sitting and he said "the beach" and he was denied service! Yet many others had drinks on the beach. There are two big downfalls of this resort - although both of them may be temporary. One is the construction noise. I realize there is nothing they can do about this since additional buildings are still being built - but I'm just mentioning it if you are thinking of going there in the next few months. It's quite loud in the morning - although not as noticeable from the beach and pools as it is from your balcony if you are beachside. The other is the restraunts - although the food is really good - it seems quite overpriced. I'm not a cheapskate when on vacation, but you really can't get a meal for less than $20 or so per person for breakfast and closer to $40 or higher for dinner. Every couple days they have a luau or a buffet - $60 per person - although the Christmas buffet at the Naukoa Terrace WAS incredible!! They really need at least one "general purpose" family eaterie where you can get a decent breakfast, lunch or dinner for 10 - 15 bucks or so. Having said that ... the prices aren't really THAT out of line with the rest of the Honolulu area. We "gave up" one night and just went to a local Denny's and it was still $50 for three people. All in all this is a beautiful resort and a great place to unwind. The peacefullness was a stark contrast to the hectic busyness of Waikiki where we stayed the first two nights. There really isn't much to do at night unless you partake of the luau.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Marriott Ko Olina Beach Club”
Reviews.Author: lambertbunch
Reviews.Content: We stayed Dec 21-26th in a guest room with a mountain view. This was part of a Marriott Vacations Preview package. I will start by saying we attended a no pressure sales presentation and did not make a purchase at this property. We had a wonderful Christmas Holiday! We stayed on Waikiki Beach for a few days at the Hilton Hawaiian Village and then the Marriott Ko Olina property. A perfect combination of locations for us. Positives about Marriott Ko Olina: Tranquil location, the swimming coves, friendly staff, free onsite laundry, beautiful leis upon arrival, kitchenettes, great for preparing a few meal a day, 2 swimming pools, easy access to pool lounge chairs Negatives: lack of restaurant choices on site. Food is pricey for what you get. Easily solved by traveling 5 minutes to closeby restaurants or making food purchases at the Safeway grocery store. I would recommend this resort for families travelling to Oahu.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for young families”
Reviews.Author: s20mark
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at the Beach Club. It was fantastic -Absolutely perfect place for a family with young children. A full slate of kid’s activities will keep the little ones busy and occupied. The lagoon beach is perfect for little ones as the waves are broken up by the outer rocks and come in very small. Our youngest is 2 and he had a fantastic time play at both the beach and the beach pool. There is only one dining option currently that serves burgers, salads , and sandwiches. A nicer restaurant is slated to open the end of January 07. The rooms have kitchens and the property has great BBQ’s so a trip to Safeway (4 miles) and your set, also many restaurants and fast food near Safeway. If you have kids, take them over to the JW Marriott (short walk or shuttle) to look at the baby sharks and rays. There’s a great beach walk that runs just short of 2 miles in front of the property -Well light at night and very safe. There is construction on both sides of the property, but it didn’t bother us a bit. I will definitely recommend to friends and go back as soon as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time, beautiful resort, nothing to complain about”
Reviews.Author: LoriD555
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed with my inlaws in a 2 bdrm suite for 1 week and had a superb time. Construction noise minimal, saw planes but again minimal noise. The views, and crashing waves are enough to distract anything unpleasant. Enough activities on site for kids and adults, and if you have travelled anywhere in the world, you still need to drive to check out other attractions, so this was not a big issue either. Going into Waikiki is a day trip, not a quick couple of hours, but again not a big deal. Wonderful time had by all. Will definitely visit again. Lori Vancouver, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed a great deal, but...”
Reviews.Author: kingsandi
Reviews.Content: Beautiful private lagoons! I enjoyed most aspects of this property. If you're interested in relaxation, this is the place. Did I mention the lagoons? If you need action and shopping (other than an outlet 10 minutes away), this is NOT the place. It's about 30 minutes from most attractions. It could take 45 minutes to Waikiki.
