I stayed there during the 2006 Thanksgiving week. My entire family of 7 loved it. The check-in process needed serious help (too slow), and the parking structure was inadequate. Don't plan on early check-in or late check-out. This isn't a standard Marriott property, so your elite status means squat. They're quite inflexible on that end. On a positive note, the staff was generally positive and friendly as they told you to take a hike.

Reviews.Title: “Family friendly paradise but great for couples too”
Reviews.Author: norlaine
Reviews.Content: This resort was beautiful, welcoming, and away from the busyness of Waikiki. We were here on our honeymoon and had a great time. One thing lacking is selection of places to eat on site but the neighboring town has A Lot of selection. I would definetly come back especially if we had kids. We stayed on 11th floor newer of the 2 buildings and the 1 bedroom suite was clean, new, and comfortable. Construction did not bother us and there was an airplane flying once in awhile but, neither of these things were distracting or horrible.

Reviews.Title: “If you can't enjoy yourself here, JUST STAY HOME!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: villarancho
Reviews.Content: This is as good as it gets, and it is as simple as that. We booked a 2BD 2BA, and it was plentiful big. The condo itself is divided into thirds. The first third is the master suite, with seperate bath and shower. The second part is the living room and kitchen area. Most of the units have at least two DVD players. The final third is the guess suite (which can be locked off and is essentially its own hotel room). All the kitchen amenities you need are provided, including the ever so importnat wine and bottle opener. There are THREE pools. One does not have a sand bottom, and the other two do. Also, one of the sand bottom pools has a depth of no more than 2 feet. You can actually put your lounge chair in it and sit down. That is perfect if you have kids. Also, there are acitivites for kids and adults daily. Then, there are FOUR lagoons you can choose from. The Ko'Olina itself occupies #3. The JW Marriott occupies #1, and laggon #2 and #4 are not too far. The lagoons are all connected bu a jogging path, and I am going to say that they are about no more than 1/3 of a mile from each other. What is nice is that each lagoon has its own character. One will be more crowded than others, and then one will have busier water than another. Altogether, the sand is soft and views are spectacular. Bathrooms, showers, and even snorkel gear canoe rentals are available on-site. Oh, and each lagoon is preceded by a grass knoll. This may not seem like a big deal, but when you just want to stay away from sand for a day (it happens) or you are trying to get sand off you feet, guess what? The grassy knoll comes in handy. It is true that there are not very many places to eat on site, but construction is on the way (DEC 2006) for a Chuck's Steak House and full service restaurant. Or, the bar and grill is oustanding for being just a bar and grill. Also, there is usually some type of buffet going on in the late afternoon to early evening. If you can, take the VERY CLOSE hwy to Exit 1B and you will find Safeway, K-mart, McDonalds, Chili's, Burger King, Taco Bell and pretty much every other joint you want to eat at. This resort is 45 min. from Waikiki (remember weekday morning traffic rules--traffic is west to east in the morning and east to west in the late afternoon and can be VERY BUSY), but if you are going to Oahu to visit Waikiki for more than two days then ditch you rental care and stay at Waikiki for goodness sake. Really, you are better off at any one of the four lagoons at Ko'Olina than Waikiki beach, and I say that having stayed at least 7-days at both. The Ko'Olina Golf Course is a wonder. Take advantage of the twi-lite rate if you can, $95, but varies. Also, the Roy's restaurant there is outstanding, but not cheap. Overall, the resort it outstanding. The Ko-Olina area itself is really growing up. A 2-bedroom condo will set you back AT LEAST $995k. That is for an appx. 1200 sq. ft. area including car port. It is secluded, but with a car you are pretty much able to get anywhere you need on the whole island. The airport is about 30 minutes away. It amazed me that some people complian this resort is in the flight path. But, the entire island is in the flight path. Silly! That is how you get there!!! ps-please excuse any spelling error. I am an anxious typer-er.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Family Resort”
Reviews.Author: SNAFU23
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Ko' Olina at the end of October for 6 nights, and we thought the resort was fantastic. We went on a time-share presentation package, before I go futher about the resort, I want to say the presentation was very nice with no pressure sales. We did not buy, and was still treated surperbly during the rest of our stay. Check in was real nice and easy, and the front desk staff were all extremely nice and professional. We stayed in a one-bedroom ocean front suite. We found the room to be very nice and spacious. Full kitchen, dining room, large bedroom with king bed, one bathroom with a tub and sink, another with a shower/toilet/sink. There was a flat screen t.v. in each room with RCA jacks, and a DVD player in the living room. There was also a washer/dryer hidden in the kitchen. In some of the previous reviews I read about some housekeeping issues. Because the rooms are considered Condos, they only provide daily "tidy" service. But to be honest, I felt the room was serviced just was well as if I was staying at a JW. The beds were made, bathrooms cleans, and garbage dumped. They only thing I don't think they do is wash your dishes. I felt the maid service was excellent. If you forget to bring your own DVDs, they have a DVD Kiosk at the market place where you can rent them for $5, or you can go to the town of Kapolei, about 10 minutes away and rent them at the Block Buster. The resort grounds were beautiful. There were two chilren friendly pools with very shallow depths at the ends. There is a sea water lagoon directly in front of the hotel at the beach. The resort has activites for all age groups throughout the day. Some are free, some have a nominal cost. As for meals, the resort has a BBQ type grill that is open near the pool area during the day, and the Kolohe's Bar and Grill at the beach which is open all day/evening. I believe there is another buffet type restaurent (we never visited it.). The Kolohe's Bar & Grill was very good. The entire staff were very friendly and professional. The price is not cheap, but typical for such a nice resort. Dinner for two with drinks will cost about $50 w/tip. Cocktails on the resort cost about $9, but during happy hour they are $7. There is also the "Marketplace" on the resort which carries all your basic vacation needs, souvenirs, sandwhiches, and salads. Since all the rooms have a kitchen you can also drive to the City of Kapolei which is about 5-10 minutes away. There you will find every fast food restaurant you can think of, a couple of pizza joints, a grocery store, drug store, post office, and video rental store. You'll have to pass by the area on your way in/out of the resort each day. I read some previous negative reviews about the airliner and construction noise. I did see the airplanes overhead, but only head the jet noises if I focused on them. As for the construction, again I could see the cranes, but never really noticed them or heard any construction noise unless I focused on listening for such noises. For the most part I was having fun, and neither of them ever bothered me. My only two negative comments, and they are both very minor, is that you usually have to wait to check in till about 3-4pm, so if you arrive in Oahu early, do some sight seeing, go shopping, do something to burn some time. Or if you go to the hotel they will let you use lockers so that you can start enjoying the resort grounds and pool until you are able to check in. The only other minor complaint is that the A/C is a little loud in the bedroom, but that might have just been in our room. Overall, we considered this one of the nicest resorts we have visited. You will not be disappointed especially if you have children. The sunsets are incredible!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Too Crowded And Too Many Kids, Noisy Far Away From Everything!”
Reviews.Author: juliesh
Reviews.Content: We are 300 yards from the pool & 500 yards from the little store. I am 30 yards from the elevator. I am very disappointed they are building Phase 3 before they build the second pool. It is way too crowded!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Not what I bought!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, lots of families and kids”
Reviews.Author: Debits2000
Reviews.Content: I'll preface this by saying we were there during the earthquake!! The rooms definitely swayed a bit {we were on 9th floor]! They had auxiliary lights on in hallways and stairwells and 1 elevator was working in our tower. Power was out from just after the quake at 7:07 until almost 3pm, but that was not Marriott's fault. My one complaint about this event, was that while they were able to grill burgers and such for lunch...they were charging full price for food. Now I understand it is a business and the quake wasn't there fault, but hey-- you have a captive audience and the food is going to spoil if you don't use it...so how about a price break? Oh well, what are you going to do? I had found a great price online with a timeshare presentation and an economy sized car. DH and I talked it over and thought it was worth the 90 minutes for the price we got. The timeshare turned out to be okay, very low pressure and we got out in 90 minutes without buying. It almost seemed like a good idea, but after thinking about it and talking with my sister who has a timeshare, we decided because they were practically impossible to resell, we were glad we didn't buy one. They make is sound great, very tempting and like a great deal, but when you factor every cost in...it wasn't as cheap a vacation as they made it out to be when you factored in all aspects of buying in. We left saying we would think about it and they never even called us back about it. We checked in and got an upgrade to a penthouse room, but it faced the golf course -- not the ocean. As we had already learned in other stays, ocean view was nice, but not necessary. The room was beautiful with 12 foot ceilings! It had a microwaves, toaster, mini-fridge and came with dishes, glasses, silverware, a box of guest amenities [everything from granola bars to coffee to dish soap and laundry detergent], in room safe. The building we were in is only 9 months old, so everything was nice and fresh and new. The colors were soft, tropical and made you feel relaxed. We had a sleeper sofa a chair, end table and coffee table in the little sitting area. The room is actually the lock-off of the two and three bedroom timeshare villas. There was no resort fee, free chairs and umbrellas on beach, free self park. In the villas, which have full kitchens, there are washer and dryer unit. But for the rooms like ours, there were free washers and dryers available on a couple of different floors in each tower. That was great; since we were in need of laundry facilities by the time we reached Oahu. There is building going on, but it did not bother us at all. The 2 pools are small, more to come with the new towers. We got two $25 gift certificates which had to be used for food or at shops, could not be used at check out which was a bit of pain. We arrived mid- afternoon and grabbed some sandwiches from the Marketplace shop at Marriott which did the job and didn't break the bank. On our first night we had dinner at the Kolohe's Beach Bar & Grill at the Marriott as it was there and we hadn’t had time to explore the area as of yet. Had burger, salad and soup. Okay. A nice feature: barbeques that you could use near the pool allowed us to cook and eat in for 3 nights. We were so busy off and exploring,we never even made it into the lagoons! There were LOTS of kids [both preschool and school age] which we were surprised at...thought they'd be in school at this time of year. It made using the pool tough as they were throwing footballs and "horseplaying" in the pool. There is a town about 10 minutes away with Safeway, Long's Drug and a variety of average places to eat. While we wouldn't go back, it has more to do with our not really caring for Oahu as we did for the other islands we visited this trip. For what we paid, we got a really nice room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: JJLeadlay
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent resort. My parents are members of the Marriott but this is the nicest one that I have been to. The grounds were beautiful and clean. The rooms are very spacious and clean, well planned and fully stocked with kitchen supplies. There is a grocery store in the nearby town that I would definitely suggest going to, as there are not many places to dine on the resort property. The only problems that we had with the resort was the location, lack of activities and dining facilities. However, as far as location, I think that this part of the island gets the most sun so it probably is the best location for a resort. The drive to the North Shore and Honolulu (Waikiki Beach) is not far at all. It takes about half an hour to get to either of these places. I would definitely suggest renting a car if you go to this resort, as you probably will want to see the rest of the island. The east and north coasts are beautiful and you would definitely want to see them if you go to Hawaii. As for the lack of dining facilities, they are working on a new restaurant right on the property which I don't know when it will be done. The poolside eating location that is currently there is good, but not too extensive and not a good place for a nice diner. If this is what you want, there is Roy's down the road and you can also go to Azule which is located at the JW Marriott which is not very far away (10 minute walk down the nice lit path that goes along the lagoons). This didn't present a problem to myself and my husband but is something to beare of. The lack of entertainment was a bit disappointing to us, but if you are into doing something like that, I guess the only suggestion that I have for you is that Waikiki isn't very far away and you may as well go there for an evening of fun. It's always got lots to do. As well there is a luau at Paradise Cove which is maybe a 2 minute drive that apparently is fun. We were told that the one at the resort on Tuesday nights is better, but if that's the case I wouldn't spend the money on Paradise Cove because the one at the resort was a big disappointment - I would definitely not suggest going to it. Go to the Introduction Night on Monday and you'll basically see the same stuff without paying for it. Or, just watch it from the outside and cook your own meal. It is NOT worth the $80 to go to it. As far as our overall impression it was really great! The few things that we found wrong with it were easy to overlook because of the beauty of the water and the nice facilities. I would definitely recommend this resort to others!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Resort”
Reviews.Author: xthescream
Reviews.Content: One major thing for vactioners to be aware of is this resort is basically in the middle of nowhere. The resort is set next to a mountian range and industrial port. It's about a 25 minute drive to Waikiki (the island's most popular tourist spot) so even if you have a car, recognize it's not the kind of quick ride into the city from the hotel. H1 (the highway you must take) is often congested & backed up at all times of the day & evening, so be prepared for that as well. I'm 19 & live on the opposite end of the island. My parents came to visit for the week from the mainland & booked just the 1 bedroom villa for the week. I've been on many vacations with them since i was young but have never enjoyed the styling of our hotel as much as this one. Now this is not the hotel, its referred to as the Beach Club. The hotel is on the same compound but about a 2 minute drive/10 minute walk before the Beach Club. The "Hotel" looks noticibly older but still not bad. The open 2nd floor Lobby was very enjoyable at night with the cool breeze. One thing i disliked was the color choice inside the room with awkward use of green & yellow here and there, especially on the rails of the balcony. Also, during the day, there are airplanes flying quite low over the resort about every- 5-10 minutes. I couldn't imagine all of them coming from Kauai (the only Hawaiian island in the direction the planes come from) so they must mostly be from Asia and possibly Europe. Those were probobly the ONLY things i disliked about the resort, which is obviously quite petty. I like the idea of the sitting room for the master bedroom but found it too small to be useful. The design of both pools & even the ocean setup are great. The rocks further into the ocean allow gentle waves to break at the edge as opposed to some of the larger ones stopped at the rocks. The breakfast and lunch (which is the same menu as dinner) are very good and ALL the staff are extremly pleasant and friendly (as are most of the poeple native to this island). I highly recommend this resort to all types of vactioners. The pools are great for the children, even if they'd like to go into the ocean. the water is shallow, calm and relaxing. The grounds are perfect for a romantic getaway for a couple as well.

Reviews.Title: “Best Family Vacation Ever!!”
Reviews.Author: cdort
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful trip!!! We visited Ko Olina in July and stayed for 1 week. Very family friendly trip. Picture perfect sunsets. We loved the fact we could have alot of fun just hanging out at the resort. Our kids loved the fact that you could go back and forth between the pools and the lagoons. We even swam with the sea turtles on one of our swim days. We went into Waikiki for one afternoon and were very glad we were not staying in that area. Too crowded. A trip up to the North Shore is highly recommended. The snokeling was awesome and the drive there is wonderful. We loved Ko Olina so much we will be going back next summer.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: id72
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week from September 10 through September 17, 2006. The resort is beautiful and the tower that we stayed in was new. We were told it had opened 5 months earlier. We had an ocean view room. The room was a hotel type room, King size bed, sleeper sofa and limited kitchen. Nice large bathroom with ample storage and very nice toiletries provided. The elevators were quick and usually readily available. There is limited parking in the garage, at no extra charge, but additional parking available outside along the building sidewalk areas. The food was very good at both the Kolohoe Beach Grill and at the main dining terrace. We did have one issue with the dining terrace, we made a dinner reservation for Saturday night seafood dinner, and when only one person in our four person party arrived at the time, they seated him under the stair case to the main lobby even though there were several other appropriate tables empty without reservation cards on them. We he asked to move they told him since his entire party was not there, those tables were for people who were ready to eat right then. A little snobbishly. So we ate at the Beach grill again. It was fine. Snorkle equipment and other beach items are available for rental. The lagoons are nice and we got to swim with the sea turtles on Sunday . There was construction going on but it was barely noticeable and very little noise or any dust. All in all a very nice resort and we will certainly visit there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Family Resort”
Reviews.Author: sceneisle
Reviews.Content: Marriott's Ko Olina Beach Club is a secluded, beach-front resort located on the leeward side of Oahu, approximately 20 miles west of Honolulu. In addition to Ko Olina, the sprawling Marriott oasis is also home to the J.W. Marriott Ihilani Resort, the highly rated Ko Olina Golf Course and four beautiful man-made ocean lagoons. Ko Olina Beach Club amenities include two swimming pools, Jacuzzi, health club/fitness center, golf academy, children's/adult's activities, on-site shuttle/transportation company, spa services, tour desk, beach rentals, business services & internet (wireless and kiosk), game room, jogging trails, tennis (Ihilani Resort), BBQ grills, and ocean-front wedding chapel. Food/Beverage: Kolohe's Beach Bar & Grill is an open-air restaurant with a casual oceanfront setting. Open for breakfast, lunch and dinner, Kolohe's serves sandwiches, salads, appetizers and desserts. Several dinner specials are offerred after 5:30 P.M. and there is live entertainment nightly. We ate at Kolohe's twice and thought the food was average at best. The Marketplace is a combination deli, coffee shop, mini-grocery store and gift shop. Sandwiches, pastries, soda and Starbuck's coffee can be purchased at the deli. Grocery items are very expensive so we shopped at the local Safeway. The Marketplace does offer coffee/soda mugs for $25.00, which includes unlimited refills of those beverages for your entire stay. Ka 'Ulu Poolside Grill is open during lunch hours and serves hamburgers, sandwiches and salads to go. Komohana Terrace offers theme buffets Thursday through Sunday night. Currently, Ko Olina does not have a full service, sit-down restaurant. One is under construction with completion expected in December, 2006. Restaurants located at the J.W. Marriott Ihilani include Azul (Mediterranean), Ushio-Tei (Japanese) and Naupaka. Azul and Ushio-Tei are upscale while Naupaka offers informal dining for breakfast, lunch and dinner. There is also a Roy's Restaurant at the Ko Olina Golf Club, with free shuttle service provided. With the exception of Kolohe's, we did not dine anywhere else on site. Villas: The Ko Olina Beach Club features two and three bedroom units with "lock-off" capability. We stayed in the smaller side of a two bedroom lock-off; basically a studio with sitting area, L-shaped convertible sofa, small private lanai (patio) and efficiency kitchen (small refrigerator, micro-wave, dishes and utensils). Our unit was furnished with a queen-size bed, color T.V./D.V.D. player, radio, small wall safe, ceiling fan and hair dryer. The unit was fine, although our view of the ocean was blocked by the lanai of a larger unit next door. We did not tour the two and three bedroom units but saw them on Marriott's information channel. They appeared to be spacious, beautifully appointed and equipped with full kitchens and a clothes washer & dryer. Ocean Lagoons: The four man-made lagoons on the Marriott property extend from the J.W. Marriott Ihilani to just west of the Ko Olina Marina. One of the lagoons (#3) sits directly in front of the Ko Olina resort. All lagoons feature clean, gently sloped sandy beaches and afford safe swimming in the calm, protected waters. Snorkeling is very poor within the lagoons, however we did spot a few turtles in Lagoon #2. Tropical fish may be more prevelant in Lagoon #1, as the Ihilani staff conducts a fish-feeding there in the morning. Surrounding Area: The town of Kapolei is about 3 miles east of the resort. There you will find an abundance of fast-food restaurants, Chinese, Japanese and Italian restaurants, Chili's and Outback Steakhouse. Kapolei also has a Safeway and Long's Drug store. Hawaiian Waters Adventure Park is also within a five minute drive. The area west of the resort is an eye-sore. Although there are some nice beaches like Yokohama, the beach parking lots and areas between the main road and the beaches are inundated with people living in make-shift tents, camper shells and old vehicles. I did not feel comfortable leaving my vehicle unattended in these areas, so I didn't. I was also cautioned by a resort staff member to stay out of Waianae (8 miles west of the resort), as it was a "rough town". Haleiwa, on the North Shore, is about 25 miles from the resort. From there it's a short drive up to Turtle Bay, passing Waimea Bay, Sunset Beach and Shark's Cove along the way. Summary: The Ko Olina Beach Club Resort is well-maintained, has beautiful grounds and an exceptionally friendly staff. It's a little bit off the beaten path but a good choice, especially for a family who plans on spending most of their time enjoying the resort. I would consider returning to Ko Olina but with an upgrade to a larger unit. Additional photos of the resort are available upon request. Would also be willing to try and answer any questions. sceneisle48-loscabos@yahoo.com

Reviews.Title: “The sheets need to be thrown away”
Reviews.Author: graciep
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ko Olina 9/11/06 - 9/16/06. Lobby beautiful Quiet and peaceful/romantic when the construction workers leave and the kids go to bed. Room spacious and nice, however, the bed and especially the sheets were the worst I have ever experienced. I travel approximately 40 - 50 nights per year business and pleasure. We called the front desk after the first night - they changed the bed. The "new" sheets were worse - had more pills on them and a few brown stains - UGH. Called again and was told that the tower was working on getting the sheets replaced but could not do it now. They got some sheets from the new tower and they were OK - very thin and flimsy. The bottom sheet was not even tucked in. This does not even cover the "blanket" which looked as though it had been rolled into a ball before being placed on the bed. Several weeks ago the Wall Street Journal did a column about hotels that are paying attention to travellers comments about sheets/beds and upgrading. Perhaps this hotel needs to read this article. I was stunned to find that the motel near the airport that we stayed for the last night, had better sheets. Overall the room was dirty. When checking under the bed for any items that may have rolled under, we discovered another guest's trash. The restaurant by the ocean should have/could have been a lot better. The service was very lax - food so-so. I would NOT recommend this hotel to a couple looking for a relaxing/romantic vacation. Based upon the noise - I think it is more suited to families - BUT the sheets still need to be tossed. During this entire stay - we did not get one phone call from management - I do not think they cared. We did get two or three high pressure calls to get down to the sales center. We had strongly considered purchasing something like this but there were just too many things missing and I had absolutely no interest in hearing a high pressure sales pitch.

Reviews.Title: “a beautiful postcard”
Reviews.Author: blessedmomoffour
Reviews.Content: Here is a resort that will not disappoint! If you are looking for a family friendly, beautiful resort without the crowds of a city, this one is for you. The accomidations were very clean, and the staff very helpful. If you are looking for a big night life, this is not the place for you. I can't wait to go again!

Reviews.Title: “not for singles even dont have kids”
Reviews.Author: camden273
Reviews.Content: i spent time with my sis, her husband, her kids and my mom. it was my first time at ko olina and i found out that it is for mostly kids and family. of course i've been to maui and waikiki before. if you're single, i suggest you go to waikiki because alot of places like hotel, enteraintment and shopping. at ko olina hotel is one of the nicest place along with the beach and long walks but i'm not coming back because it's not for me, it's for most kids and familys. and some of the staff at the ko olina are helpful, nice and friendly. oh if you want to go on the shuttle bus to waikiki , airport or pearl harbor, then ask for sharon (very nice lady). oh again, if you go on honeymoon then go to maui or waikiki (up to you). remind you this ko olina is for familys and kids. oh i also suggest you go to the safeway grocery store get everything you need instead of buying at the marketplace downstair at ko olina. you have to drive to the safeway store from highway (freeway) not very far. they also have fast food resturant, at quizmos, excellent sandwiches and fresh!. that's it.

Reviews.Title: “The best family vacation ever!”
Reviews.Author: reemakhan
Reviews.Content: We went to the Ko Olina on a special "look at our timeshare" package. We have 2 kids age 4 and 5 and we loved every second of this place. We got a free upgrade to a one bedroom suite (after they mistakenly overcharged our card) and it was like heaven-- full kitchen, washer/drier, sitting room, living room, dining room, etc. the kids slept on the pull out couch. the pools are so shallow the kids sometimes went in without us! the food there is not the best and very overpriced so we went to safeway and bought enough food for one to two in room meals a day. We ate at Roy's , the Hapa Grill twice (3.99 all you can eat pancake breakfasts)- the Grass Skirt Grill on the North Shore - when we went to the Dole Plantation, and the Dixie Grill near Pearl Harbour-- (these are the only good places I feel are worth mentioning)--best of all, we went through a bonded agency called Babysitters Unlimited the last night and got a sitter named Renee- an older lady who came armed with crafts , games, toys, and cookies who turned off the TV and had the kids in bed at the right time--- this was the best money spent in hawaii, Since I wanted to vacation with my kids, but still wanted to have some grownup memories. No pressure on the timeshare sales!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not right for me”
Reviews.Author: Jordan321
Reviews.Content: I just returned from the Marriott. A few quick notes for anyone planning on visiting the hotel. 1. If you do not have kids, DO NOT go. The resort is full of families with kids under 12. That being said, this place is great if you have kids. The pools are very well suited for younger kids with lots of shallow areas and islands. The ocean is also very shallow with no waves, so kids like it. Along with the kids comes the expected noise. So if you are looking for a quiet time by the pool you are not going to get it. 2. The beach area is very small. Although there is a nice path to walk along that connects the beach club to the JW you cannot take long walks along the beach. That brings me to my only really serious problem with the hotel. 3. There is construction and lots of it! Any time you look either to the left or right of the resort all you see are cranes and large dump trucks. And yes the trucks are loud, the beeping sound of trucks reversing was a constant by the pool. As well the path connecting the beach club to the JW gives you a nice tour of the construction sites. It is too loud in many points to even hear yourself talk. 4. The big plus of the place is the rooms. They are fantastic, nice big TVs, new furniture, great beds. Only problem is that I didnt come to Hawaii to sit in my hotel room. 5. As far as food goes, there is not too much around. The beach resturant is exepensive, but not too bad. If you dont have a car while you are there you will be disappointed. We ended up driving to Wikikii a few time. 6. With regards to the traffic, we did not experience any. If you try and avoid rush hour it is only about a 25 min drive into town. Bottom line... If you are a family this is a great place... if you a honeymooner dont bother!

Reviews.Title: “Don't miss a tour”
Reviews.Author: passionatpenquin
Reviews.Content: This resort is truly paradise. It is very beautiful. The room my family had was adequate. I tried to upgrade but nothing was available. The reason I gave the resort only an above aqverage rating is because the staff is lacking in knowledge, customer service skills and effeciency. Check in time is 4:00 P M. We arrived promtly at 4:00. Our room still was not ready at 5:15. After much discussion with the staff about our groceries sitting in the car in 80 degree plus heat, we finally got a room. The best find of all though was the Ko Olina Tour Company run by Robert and Coni. We went on the Shrimp Shack Tour. It couldn't have been better. They are great guides. They take you to places most tours don't, so you get a feel of the real island. Coni was an employee at the Ko Olina Beach Club. The resort promotes a different tour company, which is a shame. Not only do they do a great tour, they give their clients a CD with pictures they take of you during the tour and of the historic landmarks, etc during the tour. They do several tours. When we asked about other sites not to miss on Oahu, like Pearl Harbor, they were willing to give us all the pertinant information, even though they offer a tour there. Be sure to book a tour with them. Overall, we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Not Exactly as Advertised or Reviewed”
Reviews.Author: Rickcinq
Reviews.Content: We received one of the Marriott mailings for a 5 night stay at this property and had heard good things about it, visited this website and read the reviews and decided to give it a try in May 2006. Others have commented on the lack of amenities and we would agree so I won't address that. When we checked our villa ended up being a very small room with a short double bed. The deck was so small that there was barely enough room for the table and chairs and no way for someone to get to the second chair without crawling over the table. The view from the deck, if there was one, was completely blocked by a palm tree that was right in from of the deck. There was a wall extending out a ways from the north side of the deck that completely blocked any view in that direction. The kitchen (mind you no eating facilities on the property--except the snack bar by the pool) consisted of a tiny microwave, a coffee maker and a small refrigerator. We stayed all of 20 minutes and went to check out and find another place. The reception people appeared surprised. They offered to refurn us $500 of the $700+ that we'd paid for the package--but we haven't seen that yet. But they told us we couldn't keep the car and had to turn it back in. We did that the next day after driving into Honolulu and getting a room on Waikiki (which I like much better than out there), and it only cost be $85 to have the car for one day. Some people seem to have a good time there by these glowing reviews that you read. I don't think that I would ever consider going back.

Reviews.Title: “Laid back and relaxing...would go back”
Reviews.Author: gvreilly
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I (both mid/late 20’s) stayed at the Ko Olina from August 2 – August 7. Currently, the resort consists of 2 towers, with 2 more towers being constructed. The resort is away from Waikiki, which can be a positive or negative depending on how you look at it. Because it’s a timeshare and it’s located away from Waikiki, the resort is primarily comprised of families. PROS: (1) Room. We received a 1 BR villa and it was extremely spacious. The 1 bedroom could have slept 4 since it included a pull out couch. The villa included a large bedroom, living room (with pull out couch), dining room, separate tub and shower, fully stocked kitchen, washer and dryer and balcony. If you are able to upgrade to the villa, it’s probably worth the cost. (2) Pool. The resort had 2 pools. We never had a problem getting a chair at the pool. In addition, there are a few jacuzzis around the pool, one of which is adults only. (3) Grocery store. There is a Safeway grocery store that is a 10 minute drive from the resort. There are also a couple chain restaurants in the same shopping center. So while there aren’t a lot of dining options at the resort, you can cook your own meals. There is also a convenience store on-site, which is useful if you forgot to pick up something at Safeway. (4) Fitness center. There is a nice fitness center on site. It includes cardio equipment, machines and free weights. (5) Activities. There are a variety of activities for kids (and adults) throughout the day. For the poker players, there is a Hold ‘Em tournament on Thursday nights. Also, the Ko Olina golf course (directly next to the resort) was a nice course, but pretty windy. (6) Timeshare presentation. We attended the Ko Olina through a special package from Marriott Vacations, even though we were under no obligation to attend the timeshare presentation. However, we ended up attending the presentation and we received 2 free tickets to go watch the dolphins and snorkel (a combined $200 value). At no time did I feel pressured into buying the timeshare. The sales person was not very pushy and the presentation was extremely informative. If you are offered a package to go to the Ko Olina, go ahead and take advantage of it. You get a great price on a vacation and a bonus gift if you decide to do the sales presentation. CONS: (1) Dining options. Since the resort is relatively new, they don’t have all the dining options of a more established resort. The resort hosts a buffet dinner during Thursday – Sunday. Other than that, the resort is limited to 1 restaurant that serves lunch and dinner and a few “take out” type food stands, all of which were reasonably priced. On the positive, immediately next to the resort is a JW Marriott and Roy’s. You can reach both places by walking or taking the resort shuttle (which runs every 30 minutes). As mentioned above, you can buy groceries at the grocery store and cook meals in your villa. The resort also has 8 grills that are available for guest use. (2) Views. Not that it’s a huge deal, but if you don’t get a pool/ocean view, you’re stuck staring at the parking lot and a refinery. (3) Windy. Once again, it’s not a huge deal, but the resort is pretty windy. Most of the week I was there, 4 of the grills were shut down due to high winds. Also, the wind makes the golf course pretty difficult. Overall, I was extremely pleased with my stay at the Ko Olina. If I were to come back to Oahu, I’d definitely return to the Ko Olina. Feel free to contact me with any questions. Prior to our stay at the Ko Olina, we stayed at the Hilton Hawaiian Village. See my separate write-up on that resort.

Reviews.Title: “We liked it!”
Reviews.Author: meandfrogboy
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Hawaii July 29, 2006. We were concerned after reading some of the posts regarding this hotel, but found these to be unfounded. We really enjoyed our stay. We were not able to upgrade, but found the guest room very comfortable and adequate for our needs. There is a microwave and a small refridgerator in the guest rooms. Toiletries and towels were replaced daily and the room was tidied. Maid service can be increased for a small fee if you require it (this is a time share resort) We found the level of service adequate. Dining offerings at the hotel are limited- but the JW Marriot next door has some great restaurants and Roy's at the golf course across the street was exceptional as well (shuttle service is available on the half hour to Roys). At no time were we "bored", or felt "isolated" at this location. There is a Safeway about 5 minutes from the hotel and several less expensive restaurants in that area to choose from as well. Speak to the concierge for directions - we found the person we spoke to very helpful. We participated in both the Sunday and Monday resort overview- a continental breakfast is served free at these events. There were lots of activities for adults and kids as well - including a texas hold em tournement and lei making classes. We also participated in the time share presentation and received $100 resort dollars (can be used at the marriot next door as well). At no time did we feel pressured into buying. We spent most of our time on the beach enjoying the lagoon and the sand. The pools were nice as well. Overall we had a great time and felt that the staff was very friendly and helpful. We had rented a small beach house for the last few days of our trip and it was nice as well, but we really were wishing we would have booked the Ko Olina for a few extra days instead.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Bel84No1
Reviews.Content: This place is beautiful. We spent a week there in May and we had a great time. The only complaint we had turned out to be minor. We booked an ocean view guest room. What we got was a pool view but could see the ocean if we went out on the balcony and stretched. Even so, we didn't spend much time in our room so it wasn't a big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Swam with the Turtles”
Reviews.Author: kahunabill
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Ko Olina Beach Club from july 21-26th. We we offered a time share presentation package and upgraded for $100 to the 1 bedroom suite that had the full kitchen, dining table and separate master bedroom. This is basically their villa minus the lockoff room. I have to say, if you ever get one of these presentation packages, that includes the car rental and the $50 gift certif's, take it! The accomodations were the best we've ever stayed in. They don't do "room service" at these places, but rather "tidy service" which was good enough for us. They put us on the 10th floor, that overlooked the construction but since we were there over the weekend, there was none for 2 whole days. Otherwise, yes, you could see the refinery, but everywhere else was blue ocean and lots to be seen from our floor advantage. As far as the resort, one word sums it all.... WOW. The 2 pools were a tough choice for our 6 year old, so we swam in both of them. On the first night, I just layed down in the first step of the pool, about 1/2 way submerged looking skyward towards dusk, with live music in the background. it couldn't get better than that. There are two places to eat pool side, one is sit down and one is "carry out" and both were not bad and prices were fair. of course, we used the gift certif's towards all purchases. They do have a sit down buffet, but $$$$ so didn't do it. On tuesdays they have "FIA FIA" you know, the polynesian show. Tix are again $$$$ about $70 per adult and $35?? for the children. But the show is really good. The building is right above lagoon # 3, and on the first day, we saw turtles towards the west side of the lagoon towards the rocks, every day, feeding about 3:30 pm. There were two there, during our stay, and I have to say that was the highlight for me personally. The lagoon had lots do rent, and some fishlife. Lagoon # 2 is supposed to have more to see if you want to snorkel. Since we had the full kitchen, we did head into Kapolei to the safeway to stock up and prepare a few meals ourselves. The drive is about 10 min. and open 24 hours, so very convenient. We ended up driving there almost every day however, to eat out. Hana Sushi, Korean BBQ were really good.

Reviews.Title: “Our family was very happy!”
Reviews.Author: CERC
Reviews.Content: Ko Olina was beautiful. The property was so clean and well kept. Our room was a mountain view and it was very nice. We had a 1 bedroom room. Nice and big. Loved the washer/dryer. Everything was there. The pools were wonderfuly thought out. Our kids could have played in them all day. The lagoons were great too. The staff was nice and friendly. We would love to stay at Ko Olina again and without hesitation would recommend it to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed it, but...”
Reviews.Author: amydd
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week's vacation at the Ko'Olina. We read all the reviews ahead of time so pretty much knew what to expect; we were also enticed by the 6-day, 5-night promo for $750. However, we asked to be upgraded when making the iniital reservation and told that was not possible, and that it was not possible to extend our reservation (for the regular rate) in the same room. So we decided to move to an ocean-view room for our last 3 nights and booked the reservation accordingly. Unlike the previous poster, we asked for an upgrade upon check-in but were told we could not upgrade with the package. When we moved to our "ocean view" room, after the hassle of packing everything up & out, we were disappointed to find that we were booked on the 4th floor, with a view of the pool and tree tops. No ocean view. We had specifically requested a high floor at check-in. We went back to the front desk and after some checking and explaining that the higher floors were reserved for "owners", the clerk had us look at another room in a different tower - still on the 4th floor, but we decided to be open-minded and checked that one out. That room was also NOT ocean-view - the view was of the hillside adjacent to the property and the large construction cranes. We went back to talk to the manager, who basically said there was nothing else he could do. He agreed to adjust our rate back to an island-view rate. So ... that is all to say BEWARE of the "ocean-view" designation - if you are on floors 3-5 it will not be an ocean view. Despite the disappointment in the views, the rooms were OK - we had a standard guest room - it was very small but nicely appointed. Having a small sink, microwave, and fridge was very handy, we had a simple breakfast in the room each day and saved a lot of $$. If you book a 1 or 2 bedroom condo, you will have a full kitchen, which would have been even better! The grounds are very nice - well maintained, nice pools (our two kids, ages 8 & 11, spent hours in them), nice beachwalk joining the marina and the two hotels. The kids enjoyed the "MAZE" activities each day (such as origami, hula lessons, PS2 tournament) and we even booked them into the Keiki Beach Club at the JW Marriott for a nice adult day, and they enjoyed that, too. I agree with all of the other reviews stating that it is a very nice place, but I doubt we will return. They have big plans for the area, but for now the food choices are very limited and the lagoons, while great for swimming and OK for snorkeling, do get a little boring after several days. We didn't mind driving around to other parts of the island, so the remote location wasn't a detriment (except for lack of dining options). The second tower just opened the day we arrived, so I think they are still adjusting to the larger numbers of guests - the beach cabanas and poolside chairs were full before 10am during the weekend days. I will say they did a good job of making up for some slight problems we experienced - our fridge petered out one day and they replaced it immediately and credited our account $25 for the groceries that spoiled, and offered us a free cabana rental when we came down early one morning and they were already booked up. Overall, a very nice stay, but I don't think I would rave about it. And, a final note: The beachside bar & grill makes a mean frozen mai tai!

Reviews.Title: “I loved my stay at the Ko Olina”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ko Olina from June 7th to June 12th, and loved the hotel. The staff went out of their way to be friendly, and my room was very nice. I don't quite understand why people are reviewing the site complaining about "nothing to do". There are plenty of places in Waikiki for those who want the hustle and bustle and nightlife. I enjoyed the pools, the beach, the hot tubs, and the relaxed atmosphere. I look forward to my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good for people with little ones! Missed the ocean sound...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We visited Ko Olina at the end of May. Rooms where beautiful and spacious, almost like an apartment. We had a view of the parking structure and people could see us in everytime they parked. We asked to be changed but we needed to check out at 10:00 a.m. and not check back in until 4:00 pm. We couldn't do it with kids. The place was clean and most of the staff was friendly. There is only one restaurant (Bar and Grill) and not too much to do. Very quiet, the pools are good for kids and the ocean (lagoons) good for a swim. Could not hear the waves from the Buildings and the views where not impressive. The traffic was awful... I did not feel on vacation at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for family time!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned home from a wonderful week at Ko Olina Beach Club. We also took our two children ages 3 and 7. It was a great place to travel with our kids. The man made lagoons were great for swimming although there are no fish if you are planning on snorkeling! Plan on renting a car to see the rest of the island! We took great drives around the island including a drive to the North Shore and Honolulu. Cab rides are very expensive. It cost us $80.00 for the cab ride from the Airport to the resort. Also, avoid the poolside grill. VERY EXPENSIVE with poor food. The view is great but not worth the price to feed a family! We went to the resorts Luua "Fia, Fia" and our kids loved it. It was easy and simple to take the kids to since it was right on the property. We thought the entertainment was great. My husband and I spent a day at the spa and took the kids to the Keiki club at the JW Marriott. Our kids loved the camp. They received great care and loved the activities. The spa at the JW was okay but pricey for the level of service. Overall, we had a great time!!!!

Reviews.Title: “You gotta be kidding!”
Reviews.Author: love2travel5454
Reviews.Content: I am highly suspicious of many of the "rave reviews" this property has been given. If you look at all the negative reviews-you get a true picture of this property. NO WHERE TO EAT ON SITE but a tiny shack with horrible food. NO ROOM SERVICE NO AMMENTIES, NOTHING TO DO..JUST A CRUDDY POOL & A WORKOUT ROOM. HOUSEKEEPING THAT IS SORELY LACKING. NO NIGHT LIFE WHATSOEVER. When the sun goes down, it feels like lights-out in the Walton household. All you hear is crickets. ISOLATED AS HELL! If you walk down the path at night, it's really dark and creepy. We made it a game to 'get to the other side' without getting jumped, ambushed by scary monsters etc. (The imagination really gets going when the winds pick up, the moon is out and you're in darkness.) If you prefer isolation, at least stay at one of the properties at the 'other side of the path'. There was a lively fun crowd, music, restaurants, shops, etc. It was depressing to have to trek back to OUR property with NOTHING to do! Marriot should design an attractive area near the beach for guests to congregate, eat, drink and talk after sundown. The few tables/chairs around the 'shack' just don't cut it. Sorry to be so harsh, but people NEED to know the truth!

Reviews.Title: “Third time and it's still wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Wootie
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week at the Ko Olina Marriott Beach Club June 2-9. Fabulous. We had a two bedroom/two bath unit with a full kitchen on the 11th floor of the Kona Tower. We asked for a harbor view because we like to watch the ships come in and out. We got a harbor view--but mostly it was an ocean view--fantastic!!!!! Our unit was great. The furniture looked new and everything was spotless. The beds were to die for. There were four of us and it was very spacious and roomy. This was the third time we have stayed there. We had a wonderful time. We snorkeled in our little lagoon out front--we saw so many different types of fish. We also saw a couple of turtles. This area of Oahu is pretty quiet. There's a Roy's nearby at the golf club and we ate there a couple of times. Mostly we cooked our meals and headed out to snorkel all around the island. Yes, these are time shares--but for the enjoyment we get out of being here each year, we feel it is worth it. If you want spa services or to eat a fancy meal, there is the JW Ihilani down the road. Valet parking was $3 a day--a cheap price when you've got a load of groceries or snorkel/diving gear. My only complaint--and since we didn't use the pool it wasn't much of a complaint--the resort doesn't stick by it's rules for the pool and spa. One night we found toddlers (without swim pants--in the adult spa at 10:00. Same with the pools. Overall, we had a terrific experience. We'll be back again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great Up and Coming resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I are frequent travelers to Hawaii, mostly to Maui but we just couldn't pass up the $600 package for 5 nights in Oahu. I'm not a fan of Oahu, I think its crowded and if I wanted to go to Waikiki I would go to downtown San Diego to get a glimpse closer to home. Ko"olina on the other hand is 30 minutes west of Honolulu and is a very quite sleepy little area with 4 man made lagoons which are extremely kid friendly. While my wife and I did not bring our 9 month old and 31/2 year old we almost wished we did because the lagoon's were like a lake. The only downside is there are not many options for food and the cafe on the beach next to the pool is very mediocre, we found ourselves walking next door to the Marriott hotel and eating at their poolside cafe where the grilled fish sandwhich was to die for. For dinner you can go to the Marriott hotel next door, which I don't advised since the restaurants are overpriced and above average but nothing spectacular. Although on the other hand walking to dinner our last night and whathing the sunseet was one of the highlights of our trip. We headed into Waikiki for later dinners around 8p.m. and found it no problem. We also went into the local town where the Safeway is and had Boston North End Pizza which rivaled great pizza I've had in Manhattan. All in all a beautiful resort, and if you're going to stay in Oahu the best option I've seen away from the hustle and bustle but close enough to get a glimpse if you want to.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place on Oahu to stay hands down!”
Reviews.Author: elcapoalto
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my first trip ever to Hawaii. I was expecting it to be fun, but this property turned this trip into the BEST vacation I have ever been on! I have worked in the hotel business for 5+ years and also had to travel for another job, so it takes a lot to impress me. The staff was top of the line. I was checked in by Sunshine (yes that's really her name) She was extraordinary pleasant and patiently answered all my questions. The bell staff was equally friendly and held our bags for us so that we could enjoy the day until we could check-in. All of the staff was helpful and did there very best to remember who you were. We ran into Sunshine later our first night at the Safeway, she immediately recognized us and said hello, she even let us use her Safeway card so that we didn't have to spend a small fortune on our groceries. Tracey at the hotel operator desk was always polite, friendly, professional, and friendly. They all did their best to make you feel like you were in your neighborhood back at home and surrounded by friends. The property itself was amazing. You walk into an open air lobby and can see the ocean and the pools. The breeze was very refreshing and the quiet Hawaiian music help set the stage for a very soothing vacation. There is a peacefulness at this property that you can't find in Waikiki or Honolulu. The rooms were nice and well appointed. We stayed the first part of our stay in the new tower (#2) and the last half in the original tower. Both were nicely furnished. The older tower doesn't have the newest Flat screen (not flat panel) TV's like the new tower, but other than that all of the other amenities are pretty much identical. As they have not completed the entire property there are something that aren't there yet. There are only two of the four or five pools that will be there, and where the marketplace (sundry shop) is right now there will eventually be another restaurant. The lagoons don't have the best array of fish to see yet, but in time they will be teaming with fish. The beaches are perfect for just sitting and watching the gorgeous sunsets or taking a swim. The entire property is kept very clean. We went to the JW Marriott Ihilani hotel to eat one night, the food was decent, the ambiance fare, but that property pales in comparison to the beach club. This was the only time in my life that when it came time for the vacation to be over I wasn't ready for it to end. I will definitely be back to this property, it is a good way to get away from it all and really enjoy your stay on Oahu. This property gets two enthusiastic thumbs up, five-star, a perfect 10. You can't go wrong with this property!

Reviews.Title: “Loved - loved - loved The Beach Club!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from 5 nights at the BEAUTIFUL Ko Olina Beach Club. (Don't confuse the Beach Club with the JW Marriott Hotel next door. The Beach Club is new and is a Timeshare.) I received an offer in the mail for a 5 night stay at the Beach Club and thought it sounded like a good deal, tho I had NO intention of going to Hawaii (I had been to Maui once a few yrs. ago.) but the more I looked into it the more I liked the sound of 5 days on the beach of Hawaii....so I booked it! I had read the reviews on this site, prior to going and most were positive, but I learned valuable info. from both. I did not know when I received the offer that it was for a Timeshare as it never mentioned that. I found out later that because I live in the state of Minnesota they can not say it's a Timeshare! So, I was a little leary about being pushed into a presentation and offer to purchase, but still thought it was too good of a good deal to pass up and I was RIGHT! A long time friend of mine went with me and we upgraded our room (for a mear $100.00 one time fee) and got a spectacular, finely decorated, clean, new room with a full kitchen including washer & dryer! I knew, from reading on this site, to stop at the Safeway for groceries on the way in, which we did. I also knew that the resort was a little way from the "action", but since I use to live & drive in L.A., the 30 minute drive into the "cities" was nothing! I did hang out one day/eveing at Dukes in Waikiki and found that I was really happy to NOT be staying in the cities and enjoyed the peace of the beach on the 4 lagoons at Ko Olina! it's true most of the people at Ko Olina are families or married couples, but I didn't mind and they also told us that the 4th building will be 25+ with it's own pool, jacuzzi's etc. We stayed in building 2, which is brand new (matter of fact they are still putting furniture in some of the rooms). Now, I can see where some ppl. could be turned off by the resort. The resort is SPECTACULAR in MANY ways, but if you do not understand that it's a new facility (and a timeshare) and because of this, some things aren't available YET, you could be disapointed by a few thing. Here are a few things to remember:: 1) The lagoons are beautiful and spacious with white sand beachs, palm trees, lounge chairs, bathrooms and cabanas to rent. But, if your expecting to go out to the rocks snorkeling and see beautiful hawaiian fish you will be disappointed. Reason being the lagoons are man-made and the rocks were placed there. There are fish there, but not many as I saw in Maui, but they are starting to live in the rocks and over time they will thrive. You can rent snorkel, paddle boats etc. from the hotel, which is nice. 2) The only restaurant at the Resort is the grill by the ocean. The menu is sparse, but does have salads, sandwiches, kids menu and good drinks. You can walk on the nice paved path, by the ocean, to the JW Marriott where they have other options. I also hear Roy's on the golf course is good, but we didn't make it there. The Marketplace at the Resort does carry many grocery items, including frozen pizzas, salads, ice cream and all beverages including a coffee bar. They do have dinner specials on several night that is buffet style. I didn't do this either, but it looked and smelled good. There is also the option to go to the Laua on Tues. eve. for a price. So again, stop at the Safeway on the way in as the Market place does have decent options but you will pay more. Oh, there is a Steak Dog cart outside the Marketplace that myfriend kept saying she wanted to try, but we never got there either! (There is just so much to do and see!) 3) It's a Timeshare, so do not expect full housekeeping services. They say that they will change towels, provide tolietries, load and unload the dishwasher, but to have the place vacumed or sheets changed it would cost . (I can't remember, but it was something like $6.00) Now, one time we left a few dishes in the sink and they were washed, but on another occasion we did a dishwasher load and they weren't put away. None of this bother me and I prefer to have my own space and not use the housekeeping unless needed. The room is like a very nice apt. so I felt like it was mine and therefore I could clean up after myself. So, if your expecting your sheets to be turned down at night with a chocolate left on the pillow you will be disappointed. 4) I saw that someone complained about the security and video survelience. I see this as a sign of the times. It is a 5 star resort and they want to keep it that way. I went to Maui and never went out at night except to other "tourist" hot spots because I din't feel safe. I can say I NEVER felt threatened at Ko Olina in anyway. You can walk around at night and feel at ease, which was a big plus for me being female. One night I ran into a young girl who had drank WAY to much and was hanging with 2 young guys she didn't know. Her brother got her drunk then left her by the pool with these 2 boys, at night! Well, my friend and I hung with her as she was in no way able to control herself. The staff at Ko Olina saw us and asked if we were ok. My friend explained the situation and they kept their distance, but went in surch of her parents. She was all worried she would be in trouble, but the staff handled it VERY well and even gave my friend and I tickets to the Laua to thank us. Now I'm not a parent but I would be happy to know that they just didn't turn their back on her thinking, "Oh it's Hawaii everyone is drunk"! which I what I have encontered at other places. So, you have to stop at the gate at the beginning of the propertyand tell them where your heading it's not that big of a deal. After day 2 the gate people knew who we were and they were always friendly. The property is gated, but this doesn't mean others can't get in, but it would deture ppl. who are up to no good from entering. They do allow ppl. not staying on the property to come and enjoy the lagoons etc. and I met 2 ppl. who were doing just that beacuse they heard the property was so nice. 5) We didn't encounter any construction problems, but you should ask when you book if it's going on as they have 2 more buildings to build. Here are the PLUSES and they outway the minuses by a LONG shot! BEAUTIFUL - BEAUTIFUL - BEAUTIFUL! The property is landscaped beautifully with a golf course across the street. So one side is the ocean and the other a golf course! The resort has 2 black bottom swimming pools, one that is sandy, 4 jacuzzis with one of them close to the beach. The fitness room is very nice and the locker room has a sauna and steam room. They provide towels for the gym and pool/beach. The staff is so nice! Everyone is welcoming and always happy to help you out. We even went the wrong way once in surch of something and when we flagged down a staff member driving a golf cart to ask for directions they gave us a ride to it! The staff rmembers you and asks how your stay is going and if you need anything without being pushy! Matter of fact I was VERY surprised that they wern't more pushier! After I found out it was a Timeshare I thought oh No we will have to hear them pitch us the entire time, but I was way wrong! They left a msg. upon our arrival telling us we had a welcome pkg. waiting for us. Again, since I thought I was going to have to hear them tell me that I needed to take a tour I waited to pick up the welcome pkg. till the next to the last night. This was a BIG mistake! By then I decided I did want to take a tour because I wanted to see what they had to offer and knew I had friends who would be interested. So when went down to get our welcome pkg. and signed up for a tour the next morning, before catching our plane. (Again, I thought this will be my way out! They can't push to hard when they know I have to catch a plane!) Come to find out our welcome pkg. included a $25.00 gift certificate each and beacuse we did sign up for a tour we also received $50.00 more each! Total of $150.00 to spend on our last night! We spent it on our meal and then shopped for souveniers at the Marketplace, but I wish I would have gotten them earlier, so my food for the stay would have been free! As they continue to build (total of 740 villas when completed) they will also be including more dining options, pools etc. So, I thought I was being sly to do the tour the next morning and then off to the plane! Little did I know that I realy did enjoy the tour and found the woman I dealt with to not be pushy in anyway and even asked what can I do for you, what do you wan to know? I have always liked Marriott's and learned about their partnerships with others and the travel options etc. Now, growing up in Florida when Timeshares first started I had a VERY NEGATIVE feeling towards them. I was always told....run as fast as you can...it's a SCAM! During our tour I found out that allot has changed and they answered all my questions and concerns. The more I learned the more Iliked the idea of being an "owner". so mush so that my friend and I ened up making the purchase! We did a split purchase on a 2 bdrm. mountain view every other yr. I could get into all the other great reasons to invest and what you get, but I think this review has been long enough! The long & the short of it is this. If you received the "special offer" and have any interest in going to Hawaii, DO IT! You will never again find such a great deal! Upgrade your room (for $10.00, it's well worth it) Oh, we also got a rental car in the deal, which I upgraded for $124.00 / 6 days for a convertible Mustang w/ a full tank of gas! If you have no intention of purchasing, STILL GO, you DON'T have to take the tour, they won't hold it over your head! But, I do reccommend you signup for the tour, get the gift certificates and see what they have to offer. Either way you stay in a wonderful place with a wonderful room and a wonderful staff! YOU CAN'T LOOSE! If you would like further info from me on my stay please send me an e-mail. ALOHA!

Reviews.Title: “A Little Piece of Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Rudy2_97
Reviews.Content: I just got back yesterday from the Ko Olina Beach Club. I have to say, this was by far the BEST vacation I've had. Ko Olina is very peaceful, and laid back. It is out of the city mainstream, but close enough to Honolulu and Waikiki that a half hour drive will get you there. This place has something for everybody. There are great tours for you to take, and transportation is accessible if you choose not to rent a car. I found the staff to be so hospitable, friendly, and caring. The 2 bedroom lockouts are spacious, clean, and decorated very nicely. There was every amenity there that you needed. I was welcomed every day by an "Aloha." I am a timeshare owner at another Marriott in Florida, and I will probably purchase another week here. This is a great place for anyone to stay. I will certainly come back here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: eisf
Reviews.Content: My husband and I styaed at the hotel side of the Ko Olina Beach Resort and were initially put in a room that was small and had a rooftop connected to our deck so there was absolutely no view! The bellboy even admitted that he was surprised the hotel desk had given us this room as he only sees it used as a "transition" room ie: people who need to take a shower after checking out. We were moved to another room this one over looking the front drive where cars pull up to let people out and check in. Room was a little bit better, brighter, a little bit bigger. But why put us in a dank, crummy room if a better one was open?? Staff was OK, didn't seem to really care one way or another, especially at the restaurant. The Japanese restaurant seemed to be owned & staffed independently so much better service & attitude. Consierge had NO CLUE! We asked her to book a trip to Shangra La and she gave us a date that the mansion was closed! Of course we didn't find that out until we drove into Honolulu! There really is nothing to do at this resort besides lay by the small pool which is chock full of kids or at the lagoon. Having snorkled at some of the most beautiful places in the world, this place was a joke! A few fish that made it into the man made lagoon and that is it! Pool bar closes at 8:00! and you better have a dinner reservation by 8:00 as almost every restaurant stops serving by 9:00. The hot tub was almost impossible to get into as there were always about 8-10 kids in there! It would be nice to have an area that was kid free to enjoy within the hotel. The Beach Club side wasn't much better in terms of activities and the pools & hot tubs crowded with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for families”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The bottom line is if you are taking children under 10 with you to Oahu, you wil like this place, if you aren't, you will find it too far away from any action. The 1- and 2-bedroom villas are spacious and nicely decorated in a tropical theme. Don't bother with the guest rooms--if you are not staying in a villa you might as well stay in a hotel and get hotel amenities. The villas are completely furnished with a kitchen, plates, microwaves, and so on. If you have kids they will appreciate the extra space. There are two pools, neither of which go over 4 feet. One has a sand bottom with a beach entry, perfect for toddlers. The other has a terraced floor that progresses from 6" to 4 feet and has an island in the middle. Older kids like this one better. They also have 4 jacuzzis that are tuned down so kids don't get cooked. Giant shaved ice cones are served for $4. Dining options are poor, therefore you should go stock up at the Safeway in Kapolei and do you own thing in the kitchen, which may more comfortable for you anyway with kids. The lagoons are great for kids. There is some snorkeling but it's not great. There are daily activities for kids, like arts & crafts, making root beer floats, ping pong tournaments, etc. Not really adult stuff. There is an emphasis on security at this place--I guess they want to make sure locals don't sneak in and use the facilities. Again, parents with kids may appreciate this, while others won't like the hassle. The housekeeping service is inconsistent and poor--they don't vacuum or sweep up sand unless you pay extra, and they don't always do even the minimums. This is one of the biggest negatives. If you like me don't think that Waikiki is good for young children with its small hotel rooms, crowds, long walks, adult activities, and undesirable elements, you may find Ko Olina Beach Club to be a place that caters to you.

Reviews.Title: “Great escape from the hustle & bustle of Waikiki”
Reviews.Author: StumpinCA
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 6 day / 5 night "preview" of the Ko Olina. We had been looking to purchase a timeshare week, and got the opportunity to visit on a $599 preview package that included a rental car. We were very impressed, and ended up puchasing. This is a great location for a relaxing Hawaiian vacation - away from the noisy and busy areas of Honolulu / Waikiki, but close enough to drive there for the day. The facilities are very new, and very nice. The 2 BR suite, which we shared with our in-laws, was very large and comfortable, even with our 2 kids (18 mos and 3 yrs). The kids loved the pool with the sand beach and shallow wading area. It was also great for us, as we didn't have to watch over them constantly, and were able to lounge poolside. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The only "downside" to this property is that there are not very many restaurant options, as only 2 of the 4 buildings are complete. There is only 1 real restaurant on site (poolside bar & grill), plus the Marketplace (mini-market), and a buffet for breakfast or dinner next to the ponds. Overall, Marriott has done another fine job with this resort. Plus, it will only get better as they complete the other buldings, and the rest of the resort area is built out over the next few years.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK; We’re probably not heading back.”
Reviews.Author: knitsafghans
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in March (me, my husband and our two boys 13 and 16.) This is my husband’s and my 9th trip to Hawaii and the boys’ 3rd. We had a one bedroom unit at a AAA rate, $287/night (note: they ask for the AAA card on check-in). Apartment was nicely furnished. View was truly horrible. We looked out at (1) a parking garage (2) an industrial area complete with several refineries. We’re from New Jersey and my older son made a joke about getting a “Garden State view” instead of a “Garden view” (though the hotel told me it was a mountain view). Hotel said that lots of guests had complained. They couldn’t move us but in the end credited us with $100 because of the awful view. The property and in fact the whole area around it is under construction. I suspect that even some of the better views will be in jeopardy. There was very little to do in terms of resort activities (as compared to other resorts where we’ve stayed) Perhaps one activity per age group per day? There are two pools, pretty, but nothing special, and a beach cove. Perhaps if you are a lie around the pool all day person it would be ok, but we’re only good for a few hours of that and otherwise like to do things. We went off property and did activities in Honolulu and spent one rainy PM at the movies. Note that getting to and from Honolulu around rush hour is a disaster. We had a tour of Shangri-La scheduled at 8:30am and needed to leave by 6:45am. We ate largely off property, occasionally in the room. One son had a hamburger at the grill. We had dinner at Roy’s, which was okay, but not nearly as good as the original Roy’s near Hanauma Bay. The tone of the resort is a bit weird. When you enter through the gate there are signs informing you that you will be under surveillance. At the timeshare presentation (we didn’t buy) they emphasized that you are under video and audio surveillance all the time including at the beach (via fiber optics) and that, while the beach is nominally public they limit access to outsiders by restricting beach parking. (This is actually pretty ridiculous because there is lots of parking available throughout the resort area.) Then, when we were at the beach (a nice cove, but no fish to be seen), my husband and the boys built a sand castle and one of the beach guards came over and said “Nice job, make sure to knock it down as soon as you leave to prevent beach erosion.” We have built sand castles all over the world and this is the first time anyone has ever said anything like this. There is no way a sand castle is contributing to beach erosion (although my husband did say it gave him a feeling of power :-). Even if it did, would knocking it down help? This guard was quite authoritarian. The extra space at the Marriott was nice, but we’ve achieved this in the past via a home rental for comparable or lower $’s. The pools and activities weren’t comparable to other resorts (e.g. the Hilton Waikoloa where we went next). The view was horrible, rendering the lanai pretty useless. The emphasis on surveillance and the rudeness of the beach guard left a bad taste in my mouth. We probably won’t be heading back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Ko Olina”
Reviews.Author: toto1234
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Ko Olina Beach Resort Feb 28-Mar 7, 2006. We had a 1 bedroom unit with an ocean view but really had more of a view of the parking and harbor and some type of industrial park/plant. Regardless of the view, our room was very nice. There were a few things that could have been improved on at such a deluxe property. The couch in our unit was horrible. It was very worn. The cushions were sinking into the frame of the couch making for very uncomfortable sitting. Also, although the kitchen was very nice, the coffee maker and toaster were cheap and worked as such and the utensils to cook with, ie pots and pans, etc. were much to be desired. Also, the fan vent over the stove did nothing. Such a nice kitchen should be stocked better and money should not have been cut short in equiping it. The grounds were beautiful. The lagoons were crystal clear and the beach areas were great. The path along the the lagoons was nice and led to the JW Marriott. We walked down to the JW and thought it was also a nice property with a really fabulous spa (still had a fee to use even if staying at the JW), but the pool was rather small. We were really glad we chose the Beach Club. The fitness center was very adequate with about 8 treadmills, 4 ellipticals, 5 exercise bikes, free weights, and many weight machines. This is a great fitness center compared to what is offered at a lot of properties. The pools are laid out very nicely. It is a bit noisy because of the ongoing construction but can be tolerated. The presentation was not pushy, which was a pleasant surprise. The clientele seems to range from the very young, ie newly weds, families with children, couples, and older folks. It seems to appeal to all. We really enjoyed our stay and are seriously comtemplating purchasing a time share. The area is great. Secluded yet only 30 miles from Honolulu. Adequate shopping nearby and some restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation of a lifetime at Ko Olina”
Reviews.Author: kops2da
Reviews.Content: Our vacation of a lifetime was to celebrate our 45th anniversary. We could not have picked a better place. We just returned from two weeks at Ko Olina. First week we stayed in a deluxe master guestroom. It was small but very nice and equipped fine for a couple with small refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker and dishes. We spent the first week by ourselves, looking around, sitting on the beach and near the pools, walking to JW Marriott (which is short walk and great place to eat) and one trip to Safeway for supplies. Second week we had friends join us from California and we moved to a one bedroom villa which we had traded our Orlando Timeshare for. It was on the eighth floor and wonderful view of pool, beach, ocean, mountain and golf course. We shared a rented car and drove to Ala Moana Mall at Waikiki (huge beautiful mall with the best food court I have ever seen), Pearl Harbor, North Shore to see surfers and shopping. Our friends enjoyed the hot tub at Ko Olina. We also enjoyed the Paradise Cove luau on the property - great experience! Although Ko Olina is great for families we also found it great for seniors. A highlight was the rootbeers floats in the afternoon. We ate at the Kolohe's Beach Bar & Grill several time and enjoyed it very much. Also, ate food from The Marketplace (deli type). If you don't have a car you can get transportation to anywhere on the island from LeoTrans co. Check out their website at ---- for more info. Mel and all were so great and fun to deal with. Also, Pam and Kirk at the activites desk were a great help in planning trips and getting tickets.
