Many thanks to all the very friendly employees - many who delivered oxygen for my husband, carried luggage, helped me in and out of vehicles, etc. Ko Olina is a very special place with special people. Aloha and Mahalo

Reviews.Title: “Ko Olina-a gift to those that want to get away!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a six day stay at the Ko Olina. A perfect place for those with kids! Our 9 and 5 year olds met many new friends at the pool. We met a lot of great families from all over. Although I said that this is a great place for families, it is by no means overran with kids. There was a separate pool that seemed to attract the adults. Great activities daily for the kids to participate in. Although we stayed poolside, there is a definite sense of security present. The sand pool, the must have shaved ice, and the kid meals from the bar made life so relaxing and simple. Definitely recommend the "show me the mango" adult beverage! This place is a gift. Enough said. Take the family. No need to pack heavy as the washer and dryer are a plus. The Safeway is located off of exit 1B. Stock up. The resort's Marketplace has everything from Starbucks coffee to DiGiornio pizza. Enjoy it all. You will love it! Aloha!!

Reviews.Title: “Died & went to Heaven - ended up in Ko Olina”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family of 11 spent a week at the Ko Olina Beach Club in January '06. What we liked: Friendly people, great view, great beach, clean rooms and property, good food, Great FOOD 20 minute walk to JW Marriott. Perfect place for kids, out of Honolulu hubub, Costco- K-Mart-McDonalds 20 minutes away, North shore 1 hour, Honolulu 30 minutes (depending on time of day) Aloha Statium flee market - fun, excellent valet parking. Glad I purchased a platinum week when I did - Price will only go up and stay up - construction - no problem - a great place to "kick back" with family for a week, no glitz - just relaxation - longer would be better if you have the money - nothing to complain about here - wish I had two weeks Ya otta go Duane from Utah

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing family vacation”
Reviews.Author: johnnyvic
Reviews.Content: Our family (parents, grandparents and children) had a very relaxing and fun 1 week vacation from December 17 to 24 at this resort. We were in a 2 bedroom room on the 6th floor of the new, second tower. It had just opened. The views of the pool and ocean were fanastic. The room quality was great. The pools and the beach kept everyone occupied for a week. The landscaping is magnificent. There is a great walk along the oceanfront to the JW Marriott about 10 minutes easy walk away. The resort is much better for children then Waikiki. Much more private, newer and clean. The children had freedom; the parents relaxed. The only possible downsides: there is constuction going on. Two more buildings are planned. The second wing of the second building is still being fitted out. The construction did not cause a problem. The view will not be so great from half of building 1 once construction starts on building 3. Also, all of the "mountain view" rooms in building two and most of the "mountain view" rooms in building 1 do not have a pretty view at all. You cannot see the pool or the ocean, and the mountains and highway are not very attractive. Go for an ocean view or don't go at all.

Reviews.Title: “Something for everybody”
Reviews.Author: washington_wahine
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 stayed at the Ko olina for 7 days. We have 3 kids, ages 6-13, and they enjoyed every aspect of the place. There are two pools, a beach-entry pool with a large sandy wading area which is perfect for toddlers, and a larger pool with a center island surrounded by deeper areas. The landscaping is beautiful, and the service without fault. The poolside service areas have plenty of towels, cold water, toys, and games. At the lagoon you can rent kayaks, cabanas, water bikes, etc. There are four lagoons in the develpment which are usually calm and clear, with a fish feeding in the morning which brings in many of the local fish for easy viewing. The rooms are the usual marriott condo size - 2 bdrm around 1200 sq ft, they're furnished with a beautiful hawaiian plantation style and are equipped with w/d, full kitchen, marble bathrooms, sitting area outside the master with floor to ceiling windows to take in the view. The downside - The location is about 20 minutes away from Honolulu, and about 45 minutes away from our favorite beaches on the Kailua side. Trips to honolulu and the airport have to be timed around rush hour, which is almost as bad as any large city. The tradeoff is in the peaceful atmosphere though - much better over Waikiki and kind of hard to find in Oahu these days. There are many casual restaurants, a Safeway, Longs, cinema and Kmart just a few miles away in Kapolei. Bottom line - it's a great place to relax and get away from it all, but not recommended for the first time tourist to hawaii as it's too far from all the sightseeing (except Pearl harbor). Go if you want to be pampered while sitting on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “One of Oahu's Best”
Reviews.Author: HapptravAZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights from Dec 27 to Jan 2, 2006. We had the master suite with 1 bath, a full kitchen and dining area with an oceanview. The room was very nicely decorated and tastefully done. The bed was extremely comfortable and even the pull out sofa was fine - Our 14 year son had no complaints. We found the service and staff to be top notch, they go out of their way to be friendly and helpfull. We were totally impressed that they had preprinted directions to a everything we were interested in going to from Costco to the Northshore to Hanama Bay to the Aquarium at Waikiki Beach. The logoons were interesting but due to extemely high wave action the water was not as clear as we had seen on a previous visit. Note: Jellyfish can be a problem in the lagoons due to a lunar cycle they are usually present from the full moon to 8 to 10 days after EVERY month. We did not experience any problems with jellyfish since the cycle had just completed. Lagoon 3 is where the resort is located and it had rentals for snorkal gear, kayaks, and even new learn to surf lessons. The beach has private two person cabanas for rent or free lounges. There usually were lounges available whenever we wanted them. They also feed the fish every morning in lagoon 1 at 7:30, it'w worth the walk down to try it out. The pools are very family friendly with two large pool areas they never felt crowed even over the prime holiday season. The workout room was excellent and never really crowded. The restaurant choices on-site are a little limited but the food was good in both. The JW Illini Marriot had more choices and down the road about 5 miles were a number or restaurants plus a Safeway. The property does have two gas grills and utensils to grill with so you can pick up some steaks or chicken at the grocery store and have a nice picnic at the resort. One of the highlights of our stay was on New Years Eve the JW Marriot has a fireworks show over Lagoon 1. It was far better than we anticipated or expected. They supposedly have the fireworks every New Years Eve and for those of you lucky enough to be there its worth the time to go see the show. All in all if you want to relax this is a great place to go, if you want a multitude of restaurants or evening activities then maybe Waikiki is a better choice for you. A rental car would be recommended but you can get different transportation options from the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Exists!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We are just finishing up a 9 day stay at the Ko'Olina and it has been a wonderful time. Starting with the room, 1 master/1 bath, full kitchen and dining area. The lanai provides us with an awesome sunset every evening. The staff is very warm and friendly, always available to answer questions. There is a shortage of places to eat, I would suggest renting a car, there are several great restaurants in the town of Kapolei. We had some wonderful island favorites at En Fuego's and Kapolei Chinese Restaurant, authentic food and great prices. The staff was very helpful in pointing out great palces to try new foods. If you have kids this is the place. The pools are terrfic as are the lagoons. My kids (8 and 14) favorite thing was getting the newspaper each morning. It included the schedule of events for the kids. Jewelry making, race car building, lei making, hula lessons, bingo, the list goes on. We visited a hotel in Waikiki and were so grateful to return to our peaceful island paradise. We plan on making this an annual trip.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Found”
Reviews.Author: ckoncurat
Reviews.Content: Marriott’s Ko Olina beach club is so beautiful no one at home will believe your photos are real. The palm-lined lagoons are quiet and gorgeous, and every evening at sunset live music and soft breezes turn the whole area magical. I would DEFINITELY book an ocean view, as the mountains on the other side are kind of brown and dull. We were able to watch the Luau from out balcony one night. The rooms are huge and very tastefully decorated- I would call the style "understated island". They don't overdo the Island theme. The lobby is open-air and inviting, and the pools are really unusual, with a mix or rock and tile and lots of little areas to explore. A short walk takes you to the other Marriot hotel, where they have more restaurants and some salt water pools full of sting rays, sharks and fish. All the staff was helpful and friendly, especially the people at the concierge desk, who bend over backwards to help you plan fun stuff to do. Since we were not owners here, we took the time-share tour, which was very low-key, and were rewarded with two tickets to the Dolphin Adventure at the marina next door. We got to snorkel off a boat and swim with sea turtles and dolphins. My only complaint about Ko Olina is the lack of reasonably priced restaurants, although there is a shopping center about a 15 minute drive away with Safeway, Kmart, Outback Steakhouse and some other options. Kmart has reasonably priced souvenirs, by the way. Also, our mid week tidy did not include sweeping, evidently. Everywhere else we went on OAHU was packed with tourists. We were always thrilled to escape back to Ko Olina- it felt like our own private Island. I would go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Going downhill as building go up”
Reviews.Author: hulahula
Reviews.Content: I purchased a week's annual timeshare at KoOlina in 2003. Fortunately for me--and Marriott--we were given the larger portion of the room during our first "visit"--otherwise I might not have been so impressed. I have since been back twice, the last time being June-July 2005. I knew that the isolation and quiet beauty of the area--which was the real attraction for me--would diminish as they continued to build. I was VERY disappointed in the general meltdown of upkeep--the room was dirty, the furniture beat-up, etc.--and this is for an OWNER! Most of the staff was extra courteous and friendly, but I felt for the inconvenience of all the construction mess and noise, more "perks" should be offered. I still think this is a great family resort and will improve as it grows. I personally don't plan to go back until the construction is over (10 years?) unless by some miracle grandchildren appear....

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from 5 nights (10/4-10/9) at the Ko Olina Beach Club. The place is awesome, especially for families with kids. We were in a 1 bedroom 1 bathroom villa with a full kitchen and dining area/living room with a separate master bedroom. The place was near empty Tuesday through Friday but finally picked up some on the weekend. We had the pools and lagoons nearly to ourselves all week with great weather. There are two big pools that are both tropically themed. Both have zero entry which is great for the kids and one has a little sandy beach at the entry point. There are also 4 large hot tubs in the pool area. Try a shaved ice down by the pool. $4.00 for the biggest shaved ice you'll ever see! There is also a great workout room by the pool area as well as a full sauna and steam room in the adjacent locker rooms. The hotel sits in the Ko Olina development which is a 640 acre resort which when finished (more hotel, housing, restaurant development) is going to be great but alot more crowded. The lagoons are great for swimming and kids. The hotel is next to lagoon 3. There are 4 lagoons with lagoon 1 being the biggest lagoon, but 3 has equipment rentals (kayaks, pedal boat etc.) We went to the Hawaiian Gardens Water park (exit 1B) one day and is was a blast. It is about 5 minutes driving from the hotel and had enough attractions for both adults and kids. It's about 25 acres so it's easy to navigate through. They had a kids area, big and small slides, wave pool, lazy river etc. In town (5 min exit 1A) they had everything you need (Safeway, Longs, Kmart, fast food, as well as the Outback Steakhouse, Hana Sushi, and lots of other restaurant choices. The drive over to Waikiki was easy (H-1 to the Nimitz Hwy) and took about 35 minutes (at 10am). With the crowds and congestion over in that area and Honolulu it was great to get back to the Ko Olina. If you're looking for nightlife and don't want to drive to and from every night, don't stay here. If you're looking for a tropical paradise, quiet, great pools, hot tubs, beach access stay here. Book at least a 1 bedroom, 1 bathroom so you get the full kitchen, dining/living room. From other postings there was concern about construction noise, but there wasn't any now. The second building appears to be almost completed (on the outside). All in all a fantastic place that we'll come back to again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: Coyoteusa
Reviews.Content: Just returned and had a great time. We traded our Aruba Mariott Vacation Club for KoOlina this year and would rate it very high. Grounds are beautiful and beaches great. No noise from the construction next door (building is almost completed). This resort is isolated but we knew that before we traded. However, it was nice to drive 25 minutes to Wakiiki and then leave the rat race back to KoOlina. This is a new resort so it is currently lacking enough restaurants. This will change rapidly over the next few years! Only complaint was the golf course. The course was beautiful but we were not told that the greens had just been areated and for $160 you expect manicured greens! Also, beleive it or not, you have to PAY FOR RANGE BALLS!!! $160 green fees and they nail you for range balls!!! I have never paid $100 + for green fees and then then had to pay for range balls (I play a lot of golf folks)! One final thing about the golf course which you may find hard to beleive. Around the 10th hole there was a large barrell of small water bottles. We assumed that like most good courses that they were there for the players (especially at $160 green fees) so we took a couple bottles and moved on. When we finished our round I put one of the bottles on our car while we loaded our clubs. A few minutes later this guy comes running out telling us that the "Pro" told him that we took water bottles from the tourney!!! What tourney? There was no sign by the barrell. The he asked us if we had more bottles in our bags (we're talking about small water bottles here folks)!!! I told him we not aware that they were for the tourney but he seemed upset that we took their water. We later called and complained to the Manager and he offered us a future discount. I told him we had no plans on returning to his course! Anyway, a sad experience to an otherwise great vacation. By the way, the KoOlina Golf Course is not affiliated with Marriott but I still told them about our experience! Highly recommend the Marriott KoOlina Beach Club!

Reviews.Title: “Positives outweigh the negatives”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week at the Ko Olina Beach Club, using a 2-bedroom full suite. The positive: 1) Great pools for adults and kids alike, 2) The lagoon fronting the resort is outstanding for families with young kids (with one exception-see below), 3) The units are well layed out with great kitchens and bathrooms, 4) away from overcrowded Honolulu/Waikiki but close enough if you want to go check it out, 5) Roy's restaurant 2 minutes from resort, 6) Onsite Marketplace is well stocked, 7) Nearby Kapolei has decent local eating establishments, as well as Safeway, Longs Drugs, and K-Mart. The negative: 1) Mediocre onsite dining options (although the view from the outdoor pool cafe---your only onsite dining choice---is great), 2) Crowds are very manageable right now but will get much worse when they open the new building---go now!, 3) If you are just going to be using the single bedroom lockout room, you will be disappointed---it's smaller than a normal hotel room with minimal cooking appliances, 4) Options for shade at the lagoon are pretty poor---no umbrellas allowed and shaded lounge chairs are $15/day. Overall, we had great time at the resort and would probably return if coming back to Oahu. We have also stayed at the Maui Marriott timeshare resort and prefer that one to the Beach Club due to its location and our preference for Maui over Oahu.

Reviews.Title: “Ko Olina was Great!!!”
Reviews.Author: Danice
Reviews.Content: We are owners at the Ko Olina and just returned from a fabulous 7 night stay. For those guests who gave the Ko Olina a "harsh" review, you should try staying at other time share resorts before you are so critical. First of all, the nature of timeshares is that you do not receive daily maid service unless you request it and then at additional cost. The Ko Olina is very secluded, however, if you have visited Waikiki and observed the "wall-to-wall" bodies lying on the beach, you might appreciate the beauty of Ko Olina and its manmade lagoons. The southwest coast of Oahu makes accessibility to Oahu's reknowned north shore a breeze. The north shore beaches are a great adventure. Turtle beach is exceptional for swimming with great sea turtles (FYI- no bathrooms or food/drink at this beach so be prepared). Sunset beach is also beautiful!! Ko Olina is also approx. 30 minutes away from the old surf town of Haleiwa. We recommend Haleiwa Joe's for eating. Reasonable prices, great service! Any documentation we received or read regarding the Ko Olina emphasizes that the resort is ONLY in phase 2 of four phases of construction. Construction noise is to be expected and was minimal during our stay. We thought Ko Olina's version of a luau which was called "Fia Fia night" was very good. If you've ever been to a more authentic luau you probably would enjoy this one much more! The food at Fia Fia was pretty good and the entertainment was enjoyable! Much better than eating poi or eating a roasted pig that you saw being removed from the ground! YUCK!! Ko Olina is a new resort but it certainly treats its owners well and eventually will be an even more magnificent resort upon completion! We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “In Heaven”
Reviews.Author: Utahmom6
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights Aug 3-8 at the Ko Olina Beach Club and loved every minute. From the quiet and relaxing beach lagoon to the new and fun pools to the extremely nicely furnished rooms, we were in paradise. Our family of 4 was up graded to the one bedroom suite and with a full kitchen with everything you could need, the washer and dryer, dining area and living area and master suite, it was great. The only draw back was the pull out sofa bed was a very thin mattress that creaked when you moved, but the kids still were able to sleep fine. We had the limited ocean view but could still see a slice of the ocean from our lanai. Everyone was helpful and friendly. It is a little drive out from sites such as Diamond Head, and the east shore but the traffic is so bad in the Honolulu area I doubt we spent more than an extra 10 minutes on the road. You do need a car unless you plan on staying on the property full time. There is a Safeway in the nearby town as well as many different places to eat. The food on the property is high priced so we opted to cook or eat in the nearby town. We were on a preview and the 90 minute presentation lasted only 60 and they were not a high pressure buy or else. They accepted our no and let us go to enjoy the rest of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the Ko Olina on a several week vacation. It started it off at the JW Le Merigot in Santa Monica, then the Ritz Carlton in Marina Del Rey. This is to perhaps validate the praise that i will be offering Ko Olina. We arrived to a lush tropical setting at the Ko Olina, yes it is a trek from the other side of the island, aprroximatley 18 exits. We were greeted by the valet, they took our luggage and car promptly($3 for valet). Our room was not ready so we went to the grocery store and beach. When we arrived back our bags were waiting for us in the room. The room was well appointed with Granite countertops and mahogoney furniture. Balconey overlooked pool and ocean. The people were amazingly friendly and honest. The small Tiki hut serves very simple, but fresh meals. Great drinks as well. Very nice health club and work out facility and nice breakest buffet at the tiki bar. I would recommned this to place to those who are accustomed to nice hotels, that have high expectations but beware that if you are renting the place from someone or bought a week somehow, house keeping is once a week. For non owners and people that pay on a daily basis, just like any other hotel, it is every day. If you prefer the hustle and bustle of the city go away, don't come here...Go back to new york or waikiki. Generally people go to the tropics to get away from humans..Stay here if you want that. Rent a car as well...it's quite helpfull....great surfing beach nearby...locals pretty much..called barber point... cheers

Reviews.Title: “Our Bit of Heaven”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We took our first family Hawaiian vacation in 2003. While there, we were lured to hear the sales pitch by the promise of free luau tickets for Paradise Cove. Turns out the luau was terrible but we bought our timeshare at Ko'Olina sight unseen. We are glad we did. In 2004 we used our first week. The hotel is beautiful, the grounds luscious. And the rooms! We have been in many hotel rooms before and even a few "suites" but our Ko'Olina suite was the best by far. The staff friendly and very helpful. At the end of our stay my son lost his wallet containing $40. The staff found it and sent the money and wallet to our home address. We originally bought this timeshare as a way to recoup some money from future frequent stays in Hawaii. I think we will keep it until we grow too old to fly.

Reviews.Title: “No amenities and understaffed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Ko Olina on a time share preview package, fully expecting that they would do everything possible to impress us and convince us to buy into their program. Boy, was that wrong! The property is nice looking, but it is very isolated, with half of the rooms having a view of the port and oil refinery nearby. Waikiki is over 40 minutes away by car, and even longer at rush hour. There is only one beach grill restaurant to serve the entire resort, with mediocre food and limited hours. The house keeping staff are few and far between, and it shows in the poor upkeep of the facility. The portion of the villas that they rent out as hotel rooms is very tiny, though the quality of the furnishings was better than I expected. Overall, this was the most disappointing resort that I have visited in many years.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't Wait to Leave & Switch and Bait!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Of all of my stays on the Hawaiian islands, this it the only time I couldn't wait to leave. When we first entered the lobby of the Ko Olina Beach club, it looked nice enough. When we checked in, the problems began. I paid top dollar for an ocean view room. What I got instead was an interior view of a building under construction. After I complained, I was 'upgraded' to another interior view with a peek of the ocean from the balcony. When I complained again, I was told "if you can see the ocean from any locale in your room..it's an ocean view". The manager told me that they reserve the better views for 'owners' only. I had already gone through the timeshare presentation and found it to be a total ripoff. Once you read the fine print, the maintenance fee's and all the other stuff they tack on - it's not a deal at all. You don't even get a full condo for all of your weeks if you purchase! We stayed in the full portion of the condo during our stay. (I can't see how anyone can stay in the tiny portion blocked off.) The condo is brand new and did have a nice decor and full kitchen. I bet in a few years, this place will start to degrade and look a bit ratty. Housekeeping left a lot to be desired. They wiped down some surfaces, but they didn't scrub toilets and showers. They didn't vacuum once in 10 days! They didn't change the sheets after the first week, I had to tear them off and put them in a pile by the door as a 'hint'. In the morning, we all stood outside the gift shop, styrafoam containers in hand - waiting in line for an omelet cooked on a hotplate. Truly tacky and tasteless. (There are no on-site restaurants for food.) There is a tiny beachside cafe/shack with horrible food. This is the ONLY place to have a drink. Not much room to sit, let alone eat and watch a sunset. There was a luau once a week held in a small grassy area. Another guest told me to skip it as the food was really bad, the entertainment weak. There are no activities, no room service, no spa, a so-so pool and really...you're in the middle of no where (save for the military base next door). Even with nothing to do, you can't relax because of all the loud construction noise/debris. If you want food, you have to drive several miles away to the nearest strip mall. Or you can go to the JW Marriot, which is a decent trek by foot. When taking evening strolls, you realize how isolated this place is. There is no upbeat activity, the lighting on the walking path is really dark and scary once you get past the property, it's almost eerily quiet. This place was terribly boring, totally isolated from shopping, entertainment, and food. You NEED some of these elements to enjoy a vacation. After sundown, it's lights out - nothing to do but sit on your balcony and watch people stroll the property. (which takes under 5 minutes.) We spent a majority of our time driving to other areas of the island to have a decent time. The man-made lagoons were nice for little kids, but really - it takes away from the beauty of a real beach. However, when you see the rough water outside the lagoons, you realize why they are there. I missed having beverage service by the pool/water. This isn't a place for those that expect 'resort' services. If you truly desire isolation-you will enjoy this property. You should at least wait until construction is completed, it is VERY LOUD all day long. I will not be staying at this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Expected - Happy We Purchased”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week at the Marriott Ko Olina - we had purchased pre-construction and had been concerned about having enough to do there. As others had written, the staff is very friendly and conscientous, especially the gals in the marketplace. They opened the remodeled lagoon pool the day we left - 7/2! They have done a wonderful job making the pools more tropical in feel with lava boulders and more palm trees. (we had previewed the property last fall and had been disappointed at that time with the look of the pools). Therefore, we were really pleased with the new look. Rooms were terrific and we had an incredible room with direct view of lagoon and pool. I did complain about the mid-week room clean; they term it "tidy service" which translates to no vacuuming and barely a wipe down of counters. We had plenty to do with tennis at Ihilani resort, activities at the Beach Club, and then traveling to Waikiki for a night or two of restaurants. Beware of people trying to claim pool chairs by throwing down towels and then leaving for several hours - they need to monitor this more as there were not enough chairs at peak times, but hopefully, the opening of the second pool will help alleviate this. Looking forward to our return.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: KJUW
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in late June, 2005 as part of a time share package. Friends of ours were getting married in the nearby Marriott Ihilani Hotel, so we figured the resort would be a convenient place to stay and the time share package made the trip affordable. I checked on the internet before I left and a room at either the Ko Olina Resort or Ihilani hotel went from about $380 and up. Parking costs extra at both properties, $7.50 per day at the Ko Olina to self park and I believe it was an extra $3 for valet. Self park space is limited and it was difficult finding a space when returning late in the evening. Spots are also very tight, so anything larger than a mid sized car might be a squeeze. Our stay started on a sour note immediately when we checked in. I received our room keys, parked the car, and was taking my luggage up to my room. As soon as I exited the elevator, the front desk clerk was waiting for me to tell me I was given the wrong room. There I ran into the man who was given my room by mistake and he told me he had been having problems with the front desk staff from the moment he checked in and was extremely upset with them. We were taken to our new room and were told a bellman would be sent up with our new keys within 10 minutes. A half hour later we had still not received our keys and my wife went down to the desk to get them. She returned with keys that didn't work and had to go back a third time to finally get it right. The rooms they rent as hotel rooms are only 1/3 of an entire condo. There is a connection door to the other 2/3 of the condo and you can hear just about everything going on in that room. We were woken up twice in the early morning by someone calling the empty room about six times over a half hour period. The noise from the hallway is also quite loud and the interior walls don't keep any noise out. These 1/3 rooms are smaller than a standard hotel room but do have a mini fridge and microwave as well as a balcony with a small table and chairs. The furniture and bathroom are also very nice. The housekeeping service was poor. Sand on the tile floor was not swept and the carpets were not vacuumed. Our fridge also stopped working and we were told that if you set it too cold it would automatically start to defrost itself. We set it lower, but the problem continued. It would be cold for part of the day, then warm when it defrosted itself. The property is nice, although much is still under construction. There are still two more buildings scheduled for the resort, plus a Ritz Carlton that will go up next door. Construction noise wasn't much of an issue, though. The beach areas are nice. There are five man-made lagoons that stetch between the Ihilani hotel and past this resort. All have calm water and a large beach area and there is a lighted walkway that connects them. Although all are public, there weren't crowd problems at any of them. Overall this is not a terrible place to stay, however for the money they charge this is not the level of service I would expect. I would not return here for $300+ and was certainly not impressed with their "5 Star Service".

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place, pretty room, nice staff, great for children”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well first I have to say that we picked this Mariott because we had 4 free nights to stay in a Marriott and we had already stayed in the Waikiki area. They were very open and up front about the construction. It didn't bother us at all. Also we chose this one over JW Marriott next door because we wanted the extra space for our two kids 5 and 8. The room is very tastefully decorated but is a a hotel room with a kitchen area not necessarily a "villa" but still very nice and we had room for 4 of us with just one bedroom. I agree with the folks that wrote about seeing this side of the island, north of Koolina - I wouldn't bother venturing out - it is run down for Hawaii. If you plan to visit Honolulu, I would stay over on that end and go east of the city which is lovely. We did not have a great experience with the restaurant at this Marriott but the JW Marriott next door had great restaurants and also the restaurant at the golf course, Roy's, was awesome (they will shuttle you there). Koolina is an area in Kapolei that is being built up - it is beautiful, great walking path, lush and tropical and a great calm swimming cove at the Marriott. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Now, Better When Completed”
Reviews.Author: sltonks
Reviews.Content: My family of five stayed three nights in the master bedroom section of the two bedroom unit. There is a full kitchen, dining room, living room with sofa sleeper, seperate master bedroom with jacuzzi tub, and large bathroom with huge shower. We had a rollaway for one of our daughters. The kitchen is fully stocked with dinnerware. We did laundry the last night in the room washer/dryer. Our daughters took a hula lesson one morning in the fitness center. We swam all day in lagoon #3, the closet lagoon to the hotel. We had free use of the water toys because we agreed to attend the timeshare sales meeting. We also received a $100 credit for use at the resort. I was not impressed with the restaurant but the marketplace store had lots of snacks and basic items. This place will be a wonderful destination resort when complete. Building #2 is nearing completion as is the second pool. Walk down to the JW Marriott and see the stingrays in the pools. Ko Olina is a beautiful place.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: MaunaKeaFan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ko Olina for 5 nights (May 7 - 13) and thoroughly enojoyed ourselves. Our room was extremely comfortable and clean - even had a small kitchenette with coffee maker, refrigerator, microwave, and a full set of dishes and flatware. We used the on site grocery once - a little higher priced than the Safeway down the street, but not unfairly so. Hey - it was incredibly convenient! This is a beautiful resort - even with the ongoing construction. They have done a nice job minimizing any disruptions. We never used the pool, but it looked nice. Upon completion of the new building, there will be an adult only pool - which we think will be a really nice addition. We loved the lagoons at the Ko Olina - fantastic snorkeling! The sunsets from the resort bar (Kolohe's) are unbeatable. We ate several times at Kolohe's - great food and super service; no need to go anywhere else! We had a couple of lunches at Roy's which were absolutely GREAT! It was a very easy walk from the resort to Roy's and the Marriott Ihilani - with also offers several nice dining options. The Paradise Cove Luau is also very close. We did not go, but heard some very favorable reviews. The setting of the resort was perfect for us! Far enough from Waikiki to be peaceful and relaxing - yet the rest of the island was very accessible. We took a charter (Wild Side Tours) out to see spinner dolphins and to snorkel. The trip was unbelievable - we saw so many fish, lots of turtles, and several large pods of dolphins. This is a great place to experience Oahu - - which is so much more than just Waikiki!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Getaway”
Reviews.Author: TravellingTracy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Marriott Ko'olina Beach Club May 14-18. We loved it! We had reserved a regular Guest Room which had 1 queen bed, full size pull out sofa, microwave, fridge, and iron and ironing board. This room was perfect for us. It was nicely decorated and very comfortable. The bathroom was average size and was decorated so beautiful. The resort only has 1 restaurant on property. I didn't eat there but it smelled good! The pool was very pretty. Its made to look like a lagoon. I can't wait to see what the new pools are going to look like. Construction was going on the whole time we were there but you don't really notice it. The beach was wonderful! There wasn't alot of people on the beach the days we were there so we almost had it all to ourselves. We snorkelled everyday (the best snorkelling is over by the rocks on the left hand side). We were having to stay in Waikiki the last night of our trip and we DID NOT want to leave this place. If you stay here you will need to rent a car. This is the only resort I will ever stay at while on Oahu.

Reviews.Title: “Timeshare Treasure - But Far From the Fun”
Reviews.Author: JLO
Reviews.Content: We were here for 5 nights in May 2005. Yes, there is ongoing construction with a new building and pool, but we did not find that to be particularly annoying. Having said that, we were gone most of the daytime and were we wanting to lay by the pool and listen to palm fronds swaying, then I suspect we would have been disappointed. The room (we were in a smaller "lockout" section) was new, clean, nice, but not great. It was basically a large hotel room, perhaps a nice step above a newer Courtyard. We ate on the patio every morning and I had to trip over my wife's chair to get myself back into my little corner to eat. There are mosquitoes on this part of the island, and this prevented us from opening the patio door at night to enjoy the breezes. Disappointing for an ocean front setting. We did see a full size room on our "tour" and were quite impressed. You might read an entirely different review from one who stayed in the bigger rooms. You must have a car if you expect to see any of Oahu while staying at this hotel. After breakfast and a very pleasant walking trail along the beach, we headed out to the north shore, the east shore, Waikiki - anywhere. There is simply not much to do or see near the resort other than the expected Marriott sponsored activities (pool, golf, beach). The beach "lagoons" are so buffered from the sea they almost seem to be wading pools. Perfect for families with children. Disappointing for those wanting to play in the surf (go to Sandy Beach). We never ate at the Resort. The food seemed overpriced for a captive audience. Our best find was "El Fuego" at the shopping center by Safeway. This is a fast food joint and we had an excellent seared Ahi that rivaled fine restaurant fare. Dinner for two was $18 - of course you eat on styrofoam. In short, we had an extremely pleasant stay at the Ko Olina. It might be better suited for families than couples. There sure were a ton of kids there during our stay. Do not expect to see much of anything outside the resort unless you rent a car. It is at least 45 minutes to Honolulu. We would stay here again, but not in one of the small rooms.

Reviews.Title: “World Class Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This Marriott property is world class. It is on the quiet side of the Island, but it is easy to get around with the shuttle service which took us to our snorkle trip and also into Waikiki. There is plenty to do at the resort for the whole family, and Roy's Restaurant at the golf course is a 5 star experience. We can't wait to return for another great family vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Getaway From It All”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Marriott's Ko Olina is a wonderful place to stay. The resort has everything - even down to barbecues by the pool. There is an excellent fitness club with steam and sauna rooms. The pool is large, but the real draw is the very large lagoon on the site. There are 4 buildings planned and construction is going on (March 2005) but it's really not too distracting. After a while you just ignore it. Located about 25 miles west of Waikiki. We ate at a beachside restaurant at moderate prices (for Hawaii), and ate at the very expensive JW Marriott Hotel on the same complex. It was worth the $100+ per person price. There's lots of alternatives in Waikiki so it's not a problem if you like to stay within a budget. A car is a necessity -- you'll want to see the sights - we did them on our own without any difficulties. This was the most relaxing vacation we've had in a long time. We're going back next year with friends. After a week at Ko Olina we're taking a cruise ship back to the mainland!

Reviews.Title: “Friendlier, Nicer, Cleaner, Newer, Better!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband, my three children and I stayed in a one bedroom suite for 2 days. From the moment we drove up, everything was nicer than that other Mariott down the road!!! The valets were genuinely nice, and the front desk staff were very hospitable. For you local people out there, who want to stay somewhere on the Leeward side for a few days, this is a good choice. Positives: Nice people, new hotel- must be 3 years old at the most. Rooms are very spacious and very affordable. Fully equipped kitchens, washer and dryer, seperate bathtub and shower, kid friendly. Pool is nice, and will be even nicer once the other 2 pools open up. Large fitness center located next to the pool, outside grill. 2 minutes from Kapolei restaraunts and grocery store, large private beach area. Negatives: They are completing an extension of the hotel, which is bad for now, but good for the future- all it means is a brand new place for everyone to enjoy! There is no room service. We loved it and will definitely come back again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Families”
Reviews.Author: boneswife
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort for 6 days with our 3 and 1 year olds. It was perfect. Everyone was very helpful. The beach was beautiful. What more could we want?! Our children loved the lagoons. They felt very safe playing in the water. The hotel itself was very nice with a big pool and beautiful changing rooms. Lots of things to do, but we never got the chance. We were always on the beach or in the pool. Our one complaint was not many options of restaurants for families. Over at the Marriotte was one fairly family friendly option and a bar and grill by the beach, but because the resort is so isolated, you really have to drive to find other places to eat. Really other than that, it was perfect. On the other hand, it is a timeshare. They had been open 2 years when we stayed, so everything is in great shape. The pool was never crowded and the beaches fairly empty, but I can see when in a couple of years, after they build the three other timeshare towers, it could get very crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Relax in Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was an amazing place! We were there for 5 days in Dec. '04. The 2 BR/2Ba villa was exceptional! We had 3 lanais on our 4th floor villa! The staff was the friendliest we have ever experienced at any Marriott! The grounds are beautiful and the environment is family friendly. The beach is awesome! Although there is construction going on it is unobtrusive; The live entertainment at the bar on the beach was fun! The restaurants at the nearby Ihilana JW Marriott Hotel were very good.

Reviews.Title: “Most Amazing Hotel We EVER Stayed At”
Reviews.Author: msaboca
Reviews.Content: This is the single most beautiful hotel we've ever stayed out. The hotel is casual, yet elegant and definitely beautiful! If you can afford it - and it can be pricey - upgrade to a deluxe oceanfront room. The view from the room and patio are amazing - panoramic ocean and moutains! We slept with the patio doors wide open (we were 4 stories up) and listened to the ocean all night long. Breakfast on the patio at sunrise will be a lasting memory. The hotel is about 30 minutes west of the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. Secluded and quiet, but close enough to travel to Oahu's many attractions. You will need a car. You can walk next door to the Paradise Cove Luau (highly recommended). The hotel staff was extremely friendly and helpful, esp the bell staff. Valet parking is reasonable and very efficient. Poolside food is good and reasonably priced - for Hawaii. There is a poolside tiki bar and nightly local entertainment. Breakfast buffet is very expensive - $70 for a family of four, but very good. We went to the Japanese restaurant on site - similarly good but expensive. The beach cove is great for swimming and snorkeling around the rocks. The grounds are immaculate and full of tropical trees and flowers. There are multiple fish ponds the create an ambiance of tropical luxury. We did not use the Spa (kids with us). We had the family vacation of a lifetime and do highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Escape from the conjested island”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed 10 days at the club during Xmas . Had a great room overlooking the ocean and mountains. Our one bedroon had a full kitchen and dining area. There is no food room service at this time share. We didn't mind finding that if you are traveling with children it made far better sense to eat your own prepared breakfast and lunch after a day on the beach and then if you prefer, out to dine for dinner. Local restaurants tend to be very expensive. Island itself not much of a cultural experience. The city of Honolulu 20 minutes away is very much like Miami or L.A. Lots of traffic. Plenty of sleezy areas. Stay away unless you like spending at malls. Pearl Harbor worth seeing. Get there early by 8:30AM as they sell out fast. No advance perchases. You can circle the entire Island in a couple of hours so we bagan to feel claustrafobic. The Marriot is a restful spacious escape. The beach is private as is the massive grounds it occupies. and very clean. The man made cove was easy to swim in as waves are kept away by distant large boulders. Grounds are beautiful. Staff very friendly and helpful. There are two very large pools. 4 feet depth is maximum. Nice restaurant by the pool and ocean. There is some construction going on in the next building as they espand. Noise can be heard from 9-5pm. It is really very minimal and we were not disturbed at all with it. It is a great place to stay if you must stay in Oahu. I think the next time I'LL go straight to Maui or the Big Island.

Reviews.Title: “Don't confuse it with the JW Marriott”
Reviews.Author: antontravel2004
Reviews.Content: We pulled into the beautiful covered bell area of the JW Marriott, thinking this is where our hotel was. They said, nope, you're not here, you're over there where the constuction is going on. The JW was decorated sumptuously, and we hoped the Beach Club would be equally beautiful and romantic. Fat Chance. It's a time-share building that sells rooms when they have extra inventory. Oh man, every morning we woke up to men pounding on cement, slamming stuff around on steel beams, and lots of dust in the air flowing into our balcony. We had to shut the door to balcony to keep out the racket and dust blowing in. It was not sumptuous like the JW. It was probably once beautifully decorated when they were trying to get people to buy time shares there, but, now they have their money and they weren't going out of their way to impress guests. This property is NOT the JW Marriott as other reviewers have mistakenly stated. This is the time share building. I won't be back to this property. I'll be much more cautious next time to book a stay at the JW Marriott at Ko Olina, not Marriott's Ko Olina Beach club. The time share building is way to expensive for what you get. There are only 4 handicap spots near the bell area. You have to know to go into the parking structure where you will find parking stalls right next to the elevators. The rooms are beautiful if you're looking for beautiful rooms. But if you're wanting to sit on the balcony and enjoy nature, you'll be furious.

Reviews.Title: “great overall resort”
Reviews.Author: winelover
Reviews.Content: The JW @ Ko Olina is a perfect getaway for Oahu travelers who want great weather and no trafic. There are only a couple of 4+ star resorts on the island. Turtle Bay has a worn down 70's feeling, and unpredictable weather, and the others are in the city. Hawaii should be about beaches and drinks, not about trafic and large crowded beaches. The Ko Olina was peaceful. the rooms are quite large, though I would not recommend the deluxe Ocean Front. You get the same view from the Ocen View rooms in the main building, and save yourself $100 a night. The staff was very nice. The bell hop took an hour to bring our luggage, but other than that, everyone was nice. The pool is small and filled with kids, which is great if you have them. However, there are 4 large bays, with quite beaches, which is really why you came. No alcohol allowed on the beach, which is unfortuneate. The food was fine and borderline "great" for hotel food. Whoever complained about the prices, has not traveled much. two burgers, fries and drinks were only $30, which is standard in Hawaii. There are typical fast food joints in the next town, about 5 minutes away. Roy's Resteraunt at the golf course was a typical country club place, but pretty good. this is one of the few places on Oahu where you can get away from the crowds, stay in luxury and have consistantly good weather.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort for now...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Ko Olina is a Marriott time share resort. Phase I of four phases is complete, with Phase II in progress next door. Ko Olina is located on the West Coast of Oahu fairly secluded from the rest of the island. The facility, rooms, swimming pools and 4 lagoon areas for swimming are all very nice. The beach front restaurant is average (for food) above average for location, fun and entertainment. The 1 bedroom rooms have a full kitchen, dining area, pull out sofa bed and nice balcony, the guest rooms that adjoin the 1 bedroom units (lock offs) have a refrigerator and bar area, small balcony, bed and sofa bed. The resort gets 4 stars primarily because it is a timeshare and NOT a fine class hotel (like the JW Marriott located on the opposite end of the property). It is new for now - but you get the feeling that over use and timeshare abuse is just around the corner. Also, the adjacent property will eventually have a (Marriott) Ritz Carlton and Four Seasons and, of course, three more time share buildings. So enjoy it while you can, within the next 5 years, what was once a nice off the beaten path, will transform into Waikiki West. Bottom line - Ko Olina is a nice condominium style property with all the conveniences of home (if you stay in a 1 bedroom unit or more). It is secluded with nice pools and interesting swimmable lagoon areas. The fitness facility is very good to excellent with a nice sauna and steam area. You won't be disappointed unless you are expecting a world class resort experience - I think for that it falls a little bit short.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week at this resort. Great, great experience. One of the best resorts we have ever experienced. Staff is very friendly and accomodations are first class....will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Tips for an affordable vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just spent a wonderful week at the Ko Olina Beach Club. Here are some tips to save some money while in Oahu and the Beach Club. The first thing I did was to order an Entertainment Book for Hawaii. It listed all the islands but there was plenty of Oahu restaurants and activities. There were discounts for Polynesian Cultural Center, Dole Whips at the Dole Plantations, and not to forget many of the restaurants that had buy one, get one free. We also stopped at the Kmart and bought a big cooler to keep in the rental car. Each morning, we would fill up the cooler with ice and drinks for the day. This saved so much money and we never had to stop and pay for drinks. Also, take advantage of the coupons in the airport brochures. Make sure you find Sean O'Reilly at the cabana stations. He will give you great ideas of what you need to do on the island. He has a special recommendation for a beach that is great for body surfing. We also grilled burgers on the outdoor grill one night which is near the towel station. The beach club is beautiful, as well as the rooms. Make sure you buy some laundry detergent while you're there and do a little wash. I was convinced that I wasn't going to do laundry on vacation but was glad I did when I came home and most of the clothes were clean. Remember that the washer is small, so the loads really need to be small. If you are traveling to the North Shore on your way to the Polynesian Cultural Center, make sure that you stop at Ted's Bakery. They have a wonderful selection of pies and cakes at reasonable prices. The lagoons are beautiful and quiet. This was absolutely one of the best vacations that our family has taken.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Durango_COBickersons
Reviews.Content: KoOlina is a beautiful and relaxing property, right on beach, away from the Waikiki crowds. We had a gorgeous, new 2 BR, 2 BA condo, with ocean & incredible sunset views! There's a Safeway & Big KMart to get your groceries. The Hawaiian locals are the kindest people & the KoOlina resort is first class in every way. Everyday there were organized activities available for any age group. Our three active teenagers (boys & girl) loved where we stayed. We were a 15 min drive from a more exciting beach scene, & 30 min from North Shore. Why go to Honolulu, where you sit in 2-hour traffic, or Waikiki, where there's no place to sit on the beach or swim without hundreds of other people & trash? We were at Maui, Kaanapali Alii two years ago, which was great, but I'd go back to KoOlina first choice. We discovered so many Oahu treasures. We were so pleased & surprised by the Island diversity.

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret on Oahu”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place is fantastic. As an annual traveler to Oahu - I think it is the best deal for your $ if you like high end properties. The rooms are gorgeous, with fabulous materials used like slate, marble etc. They have high ceilings with crown moulding and are designer decorated with a tropical/asian plantation aesthetic. The rooms are spacious and feel luxurious. It is not crowded by the three pools nor in the private lagoon and is clean. The grounds are beautifully manicured and the views are fabulous from every room. Even if you don't golf there is plenty to do. STAY HERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the Marriott's Ko Olina Beach Club Resort. We had an excellent experience. The accomodations are the BEST, the staff friendly and helpful and the food is very good. Their beaches are very nice (although man-made) sandy, no rocks and a beautiful view. The entire property is gorgeous. We have stayed on several of the islands and this experience has been our best! I would highly recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional facility, wonderful vacation, highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family (wife and two adult daughters) and I stayed at the Ko Olina Beach Club in late May, 2004, and thoroughly enjoyed everything about the facility. We occupied a 2-bedroom, 2-bath villa with an ocean view and were so impressed with the quality and beauty of our villa and the overall facility that we're already planning a return trip. Some advice: Book a villa facing north for the best views and get familiar with stores and restaurants in the nearby town of Kapolei in order to stock your kitchen with groceries and occasionally eat a reasonably priced meal at the local restaurants. I do considerable traveling and consider this facility one of the best at which I've ever stayed.

HotelInfo.Name: Marriott's Ko Olina Beach Club
HotelInfo.Address: 92 - 161 Waipahe Place, Kapolei, Oahu, HI 96707
